You will work at

About Northern Trust:
Northern Trust provides innovative financial services and guidance to corporations, institutions and affluent families and individuals globally. With 130 years of financial experience and nearly 20,000 partners, we serve the world’s most sophisticated clients using leading technology and exceptional service.
As a Northern Trust employee (Partner), you will be part of a flexible and collaborative work culture, which has a strong history of financial strength and stability. Movement within the organization is encouraged, senior leaders are accessible, and you can take pride in working for a company that is committed to strengthening the communities we serve.
We recognize the value of inclusion and diversity in culture, in thought, and in experience, which is why Forbes ranked us the top employer for Diversity in 2018.
Role/ Department:
Responsible for helping to shape and execute on Northern Trust’s brands, investment offerings, and sales efforts related to ESG Investments within all asset classes and distribution channels.

The key responsibilities of the role include:
Act as a trusted ESG Strategist to EMEA & APAC based asset management investors that seek to integrate ESG factors: - Focus on educating, research and sales support; and - Further develop the market for ESG and Responsible Investment within the distribution channelsIdentify, coordinate and participate in internal and external events, networking opportunities, and educational forums to increase ESG awareness and advocacy.Maintain and communicate quarterly market intelligence briefings as it relates to published research and studies, the competitive landscape, and industry trends.Provide support for the EMEA & APAC asset management businesses by supporting product development and innovation, attending client meetings, roadshows and responding to RFPs and other capabilities inquiries.Help manage relationships with key ESG focused entities in region and coordinate responses to industry surveys and research studies.Liaise with investment teams to remain abreast of existing products and help develop new products in conjunction with looking to enhance existing strategies.Provide ESG research that can be used internal and external.Work as a team member in the broader Sustainable Investing Team, local, regional and global.
Working with Us:
We’d love to learn more about how your interests and experience could be a fit with one of the world’s most admired and ethical companies. In return, we will support you with your personal and career goals in a number of ways:
Financial – Life Assurance, Disability Plan, Pension/ Gratuity, Annual Pay Review
Work Life Balance – Flexible Work Options, Incremental Annual Leave, Community Volunteer Days
Health & Wellbeing – Private Medical Insurance, Active Sports & Social clubs (lunchtime and after-work groups), Employee Assistance Program
Professional Development – Clear Career Path, Education Assistance, Recognition Programme, NT University (wide range of online, virtual & in-house training options) and employee-led Business Resource Councils dedicated to diversity and inclusion initiatives.
And Finally
We hope you’re excited about the role and the opportunity to work with us.
We value an inclusive workplace and understand flexibility means different things to different people.

Apply today and talk to us about your flexible working requirements and together we can achieve greater.

Additional Work Location(s) :None
Have you heard of JBL or Harman/Kardon, some of the world’s leading audio brands? The market we are leading in, is fast paced, fun and dynamic. Our Lifestyle division has seen continuous growth over the last 5 years and doesn't plan to stop there. For our marketing department within Harman Consumer Lifestyle, based in Amsterdam, we are looking to hire a:
Digital & Social Media Content Specialist
About the Role:
Content marketing is all about telling a story that engages. That’s why we’re looking for a Content Specialist who knows how to tell a story about our leading brand JBL. This role is within our integrated EMEA digital marketing team in Amsterdam. The role is a cross-divisional role between Consumer Audio (COA), and Professional Solutions (PRO), with emphasize on our Pro Solutions division and brands (e.g. JBL, AKG, Martin Lighting) situated in London, Apsley. Therefore, traveling on a frequent basis to London is an aspect of the role.
This role requires a high level of flexibility in terms of day-to-day and a motivational self-starter that spots opportunities everywhere: in every product, event and conversation. It’s important to bring a level of maturity, on how a story starts and where and how to best tell it. Therefore, you need to be a digital native that is channel and platform agnostic, as it shouldn’t matter if you’re telling a top funnel story on social media or a bottom funnel story on a product page with one of our retailers or resellers. Or you’re a fast learner, eager to learn new ways to engage audiences with our iconic brands. You have an eye for detail and never lose sight of the bigger picture in terms of divisions, campaigns and stakeholders.
What You Will Do:
You will be planning, driving and executing all digital activities of the Pro Solutions department and Consumer Audio digital campaigns.
You will be planning, maintaining, monitoring and reporting on our PRO and COA social media channels and planning and maintaining web content with the global content team.
You will be translating business and marketing objectives into calendars, campaigns and content.
Staying updated on digital developments in the landscape relevant for your expertise.
Making data-driven digital analyses that drive decisions (ROI and ROAS).
Making understandable native and non-native reports of our digital plans and campaigns.
What You Need:
A bachelor’s or master’s degree in Marketing & Communication.
At least 3 years of working experience in digital marketing.
Understanding the basics of digital marketing and Social Media.
A second nature in analyzing digital media and actually doing it.
Ability of telling a digital brand story is what you live and breathe.
What is Nice to Have:
Experience in building and driving digital brand campaigns and plans.
Speaking more than one language; fluent English is a must.
What We Offer:
HARMAN offers a great work environment, challenging career opportunities, professional training and competitive market base compensation plus a 13th month salary, 28 holidays per year. You will also receive a highly valued commuter travel package, an interesting collective health insurance scheme, pension and top-notch employee discounts on Harman’s Consumer Audio products.
A unique opportunity to contribute to drive revenue growth and nurture strategic trust-based relationships.
A friendly working atmosphere and good work-life-balance with a fine salary and secondary employment conditions.
The ability to work as a Digital & Social Media Content Specialist in a company that is driven by technology.
The chance to work with on complex problems and continues improvement.
An informal, enterprising and results-orientated culture.
And a few reasons you might love it:
At HARMAN we create useful, playful, beautiful things. Our many iconic brands including; JBL, Harman/Kardon and AKG are transforming the car, the workplace and everywhere in between. We work hard, look for brilliance from all our 30,000 employees and in return you can expect a career full of brilliant possibilities. If you want to be part of a business offering industry-first features, innovation, superior sound technology and the guarantee that you'll never have a dull day - HARMAN could be the place for you!
(www.harman.com)
Is this the challenge you’ve been looking for? Click to apply now! Don’t forget to add your resume.
We look forward to receiving your application! Send your application with your resume and letter of motivation. We will process the applications as we receive them. For more information about the position you can contact the Recruitment department by phone +31 (0)6 - 25374321) or by e-mail marc.duteweerd@harman.com.
#LI-MD1
HARMAN is an Equal Opportunity /Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or Protected Veterans status. HARMAN offers a great work environment, challenging career opportunities, professional training and competitive compensation. (www.harman.com)

Job Title: PH Europe - Category Specialist - Male Grooming
Job Description:
Job Title
PH Europe - Category Specialist - Male Grooming
Job Description
In this role, you have the opportunity to:
Develop and execute the Go To Market approach for the assigned portfolio, in alignment with the European Markets’ Business and overall Marketing strategy and works with the Clusters and Businesses to ensure perfect and flawless New Product Introductions and Launches. S/he supports the BMM Europe in the interactions with the Business, especially around the Marketing enablers and metrics. This role also supports and coaches the teams in the Market and ensures that the market marketing plan and BMC plans are aligned.
This position can be based in the Netherlands or Europe Market Remote
You are responsible for:
Supporting the Development of the BMC plans for Male Grooming
Executing the BMC Plans for an assigned category
Owning and leading the ONE EU product range, based on deep consumer and shopper understanding. Driving the development of relevant and unique Champion propositions for the European market.
Supporting the Head of Marketing in creating the Marketing Plan for the Market by providing audience and category specific insights and the portfolio and business specific strategy
Providing market, customer and consumer insights and trends to the Business
Performance management of the assigned portfolio, solutions and services
Supporting the Business by reviewing the value propositions and global plans in the product development phase and subsequently localizing them for the European markets.
Driving local product launches in line with the global strategy and the overall market's business and marketing strategy
Supporting trade shopper and sales teams with background knowledge, market insights, competitive insights and tools to maximize business opportunities.

You are part of:
The BMM team in the new market Europe Personal Health (PH) organization led by Marlies Gebetsberger. This team will be responsible for the transformation and innovation in the Personal Health business of market Europe. We will have a virtual, diverse network organization, with passionate colleagues who are energized to fulfil our purpose of improving people’s health and well-being through meaningful innovation, whilst always delighting consumers via outstanding consumer engagement and digital strategies.

To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience:
Master’s or Bachelor’s degree and 10+ years of industry experience
Profound level of experience in both local or global marketing roles, marketing activation and preferably also sales
Certified LEAN Advanced
Very strong business acumen and understanding of the P&L
Ability to build and nurture effective relationships within the matrix by developing strong cooperation with peers within the market, cross business, and cross function
Bringing people together and aligning them around common goals; leverages the power of Philips independent from organizational structures and reports
Consumer intimacy: driven by a strong external focus.
Problem Solving skills and able to find solutions to difficult or complex issues.

In return, we offer you
To grow your career in a company with a unique purpose to make the world healthier and more sustainable through innovation. You can join an innovative health company that values the interaction between technology and people, working in a multinational and multicultural environment. You will be surrounded by diverse colleagues who share your passion to create superior consumer experiences. Your work will be challenging and full of opportunities for growth. Variety and challenge will be part of your daily routine.

Why should you join Philips?
Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways.
To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there, you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions.
As an equal opportunity employer, Philips is committed to a diverse workforce. You will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, genetic information, creed, citizenship, disability, protected veteran or marital status.
Contact
If you forgot your password, you can click the Forgot Password button on the Sign In screen to reset it.
If you have any other questions regarding the recruitment process please refer to our FAQs. In case of technical difficulties with the website, please send an email to careersite@philips.com.
(Note: To ensure fairness and legal compliance in our recruitment processes, only technical issues will be monitored through the above inbox. Please do not submit resumes or applications to this email, as they will not be reviewed. Only applications received through the online application process will be considered.)

As pioneers in audio and video technology, we at Poly uniquely understand the power of human connection. We've seen it drive innovation, solve problems, inspire action and power productivity. We are bringing together our portfolio of high-quality, proven products and services to connect people to what matters most - whether it's their colleagues, customers, playlists or favorite games. Together, our technology will keep that connection strong and fuel a future collaboration and understanding, in spite of circumstances, distance or time zones.
We are Poly. We make technology that powers human connection that simply works, then steps out of the way. We’re changing how the world communicates and collaborates. And we need you.
As a Channel Operations Specialist you will focus on managing all of the Customer Service activities for our Business Partners, OEM’s and Retail customers, primarily for the French language region and (depending on language skills) for customers in other regions.
This role requires an active cooperation with other departments within the company.
What you'll do:
Order Management
Call Handling (inbound and outbound)
Complaints Handling
Handling of service and return requests as per defined processes
Reviewing current Customer Service processes and structures on cost and time effectiveness
Reporting
Supporting other departments when needed
Providing close cooperation with Sales, Logistics, Supply Chain and Finance.
Providing active sales support to the field sales team and Regional Operations Managers
Completing assigned projects
We would love to hear from you if you have:
Fluency in French and English
Previous experience in a customer support role
Previous experience in a technical support role is a plus but not required
Any familiarity with networking or telephony concepts is a plus but not required
Problem solving and troubleshooting skills
Customer Focus
People oriented and a team player attitude
Ability to manage own time
Ability to work remotely and with limited supervision
Strong commercial affinity
Strong communication skills, ability to build and maintain internal and external relationships
Ability to work and perform under pressure
Education
HBO degree or equivalent experience
Poly is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity or expression, race, age, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, ancestry, color, marital status, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, sexual assault or stalking, medical condition, genetic information, or any other protected class or category recognized by applicable equal employment opportunity or other similar laws.

We give you the opportunity to drive your career and development as you want it to. We will also offer a competitive salary and bonus scheme as well as a variety of flexible benefits to suit you that include annual leave, pension scheme, Life Assurance, Dental, and Medical etc.

Your application may be subject to a background check, in accordance with local legislation.

IQVIA™ is the leading human data science company focused on helping healthcare clients find unparalleled insights and better solutions for patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness the power of healthcare data, domain expertise, transformative technology, and advanced analytics to drive healthcare forward.
IQVIA is looking for experienced Key Account Managers or candidates with a Diagnostics background, to work in partnership with an international medical equipment company specializing in artificial heart valves and hemodynamic monitoring in the North and in the South of The Netherlands.

Main areas of responsibility:
The role will require you to educate hospital clinicians on the eligibility of aortic stenosis patients for TAVI treatment
It requires highly self-motivated, driven and autonomous professionals who can demonstrate a solid commercial track record of successful innovative launches of new products and therapies or expanded indications in new and/or existing markets
You will develop and implement innovative strategies to educate key stakeholders in order to demonstrate the value of the therapy and product portfolio within the centers of your territory
Engaging with relevant internal and external stakeholders you will secure broad patient access to the current therapy and products
You are able to influence decision-making with strong arguments in a convincing and persistent manner that changes stakeholder behavior towards positive referral activity
You will anticipate changes in the market and are able to analyze relevant territory/business information
You have experience in pathway re-design, putting the patient at the center of the conversation and looking at solution from the patient's and clinician's perspective
You are highly communicative, creative, persistent and able to quickly build impactful relationships with internal and external stakeholders
To be a Therapy Development Specialist you will need to have:
At least 2-5 years of experience in the hospital environment
Preferably a MSc degree in biomedical, health sciences
Preferably experienced with a network in cardiology and medical devices environment
Good knowledge of the Dutch healthcare system
Effectively build and manage strong relationships with both external and internal customers
Proven track-record of developing impactful business partnerships
Excellent communication & interpersonal skills
Strong analytical skills
Creative and innovative thinker  demonstrate creativity and innovation in overcoming challenges
Motivated and resilient in the face of obstacles
Team player
Fluent in Dutch and English
Join Us
Making a positive impact on human health takes insight, curiosity, and intellectual courage. It takes brave minds, pushing the boundaries to transform healthcare. Regardless of your role, you will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and ultimately improve outcomes for patients.
Forge a career with greater purpose, make an impact, and never stop learning.

Easee's vision is to shape the power grid of the future and also the future of business culture. In 2021 we aim to sell 500,000 charging units for electric cars. Our long-term target is 5 million units sold by 2025, and we expect to achieve a major market share in the global market.
We want Easee to be recognised as a world leader in charging and power management technology. This will be an eventful journey, and we want to share it.
In Easee all employees work actively to become the best version of themselves. We believe this is a recipe for creating a dream workplace with inspired employees who have an inner glow and are looking forward to getting to work. Not because they have to, but because they genuinely want to and because they realise that they are part of something bigger than themselves.
The Role:
As a Technical Support Specialist, you will be required to become the ‘go to’ product expert for Easee in the UK or Benelux, both for hardware and software. Therefore, to truly step into this role, you must be an organised person who is dedicated to ensuring that our customers receive the best possible care. You must also be someone who is focused on details and who really understands how to develop solutions to solve the challenges of the future.
Responsibilities:

Provide our clients with both proactive and reactive support through our online support ticket resolution platform.
Play an important role in the sales process by revealing how Easee technology can be best implemented.
Collaborate with design, production, engineering, research and development departments of the company to determine how products and services could be modified to suit the needs of the customer.
Become an expert with the Easee Cloud portal to remotely diagnose and resolve any issues.
Requirements:

Training will be offered both in-house and externally in order to fully support and develop existing skills. However you must already have:
A)An academic qualification within an Electrical or Electronics discipline
OR
B)Practical Electrical installation experience

OR
C)Electronics development and debugging experience

OR
D)All of the above
Experience within the sustainability or energy sector is desirable but not required.
You will be based in the Glasgow or Amsterdam office, however short duration trips to Easee sites throughout the UK and international travel may be required.
You will be fluent in Dutch with a good understanding of English which is spoken throughout the company (Benelux role specific).

The rewards for the right person:

The opportunity to advance your career in a booming market sector (Electric Vehicles) with the leading innovators of products from the leading country for Electric Vehicle adoption (Norway).
You will get to work alongside leading experts within the electric vehicle and power grid stability market.
A chance to develop and deliver your skills and experience in a fast-paced and rapidly growing new business.
Starting salary: This is a junior level role and pay shall be reflective of qualifications and experience to date.
We constantly review applications and try to give feedback within 14 days. Good Luck!

Job Title: Sales Development Representative - Dutch speaker- Amsterdam based
Job Description:
Do you challenge the status quo?
Do you like being challenged?
We should talk.
At Juniper Networks, our goal is to solve the unsolvable by challenging conventions to define what’s possible, not simply what’s next. Do you want to connect the world’s leading businesses such as telecoms, stock exchanges, commercial, and government agencies? Do you want to pursue bold aspirations? Do you want to make a difference to the way people work, play and live their lives? If yes, we want to talk to you and, if you want to know more, keep reading.
Kickstart your career with Juniper Networks
Juniper Networks offers you an opportunity to lay the foundation for your professional career.
If you want to…
Learn how to become a consultative sales executive that focuses on creating value and trust with (future) customers, exploring and identifying their needs.
Work at the Juniper Networks, in an energetic, global multinational team.
Grow business acumen and build your career in a professional corporate environment by developing the knowledge, mentality and quickness of understanding needed to have consultative relevant business conversations.
Become an industry specialist that has a deep understanding of the priorities of key decision makers within relevant industries and be able to have meaningful conversations with key decision makers.
Be a team player that is in the front line of your multidisciplinary sales team including account managers and sales engineers, significantly contributing to the team’s success….
then keep reading to learn more about this exciting opportunity!
We now have an opening for a Sales Development Representative with fluent Dutch to join our team in Amsterdam to focus on the Dutch speaking market.
Juniper Networks – Sales Development Representative (SDR)
The Sales Development Representative is responsible for identifying and qualifying sales opportunities and is a critical asset in securing new business with prospective and existing customers, building the sales pipeline and driving the company’s revenue goals.
You will have the opportunity to connect with relevant medium to large enterprises to discuss how Juniper Networks may be able to transform their network resulting in game-changing opportunities, productivity, and security.
In order to achieve your opportunity pipeline objectives you will closely collaborate with your Sales and Marketing teams to execute sales’ funnel building strategies.
Does this sound like you?
If you are a curious and ambitious team player, with an infectiously positive attitude, and if you are highly motivated to learn and grow, then this may be your starting point of a professional career in Juniper.
You will also need…
Education to graduate level or equivalent preferred
0-2 years’ experience
Excellent communication skills/written skills with fluent Dutch
Ability to succeed in the implementation and follow up of marketing efforts
Interest to grow your career in the high-tech industry (i.e. computers, software, networks)
Hunter mentality, self-starting
High energy level, dynamic personality, action oriented
Willingness to be coached
Open and honest communication skills
Strong organization and planning skills, strong in follow through
Results oriented/driven
Capacity to work under pressure and meet deadlines
Ability to communicate value propositions
To be independent yet a team player
To be able to establishes and maintain effective relationships with customers and gain their trust and respect
To be dedicated to meeting and exceeding expectations and requirements of internal and external customers
Have the ambition to work in a dynamic and fast-pace environment
To be able to adapt to accommodate changes in industry and company direction
You will receive continuous training and coaching to help you build your skills and lay the foundation for further career growth, such as a senior role within the SDR team or a position as inside territory (partner) account manager.
About Juniper
Juniper Networks challenges the status quo…
…with innovative products, solutions and services critical to businesses by transforming the economics of networking in the connected world. We are pushing the limits of silicon, systems and software for unified environments and open architectures in our routing, switching and security solutions.
We are a leader in network automation, performance and creation. We create highly scalable, secure and cost-effective networks for unprecedented choice, agility, efficiency and value. We empower customers to unlock new business models and capitalize on new growth opportunities. We do so by challenging conventions to define what’s possible, not simply what’s next. Every product, solution and person who works at Juniper is driving business transformation that underpins the connected world.
Welcome to the Juniper Way
Our mission to “connect everything, empower everyone” is built on the creativity and commitment of our people. We put Juniper on the map by being bold and acting as challengers, and we remain courageous as we evolve in our industry. The trusted relationships we build with our colleagues and customers are the cornerstone to our success. And through it all, we strive for excellence.
This foundation is embodied in three values – Be Bold, Build Trust and Deliver Excellence, along with a set of refined behaviors for each. The experience on these pages will be rich in learning resources and support tools. Make time for development – a great way to learn and to lead is to seek out a mentor.
Build Trust
The trusted relationships we build with our colleagues and customers is the cornerstone to Juniper’s success. Trust must be cultivated and earned by demonstrating a commitment to shared success, a care for the individual and the team, and through consistent and respectful actions over time. It can be difficult to acquire, and when broken, even harder to redeem.
Deliver Excellence
Excellence is an outcome. We must strive for it in everything we do. It means we commit to consistently high standards in all we do – innovating, driving quality and ensuring rapid time-to-market – and pursue these goals with purposeful determination. We do not back down, make excuses or take the easy way out when the going gets tough. We persist, and we deliver.
Be Bold
We exist to solve some of the world’s most complex problems. We put Juniper on the map and secured a leadership position by being bold and acting as challengers. To stay at the top of our game, we must be courageous and constantly persevere in our pursuit of groundbreaking solutions to address our customers’ most difficult challenges. It’s innovate – or die.
Where will you do your best work?
Wherever you are in the world…
…whether it’s downtown California, London, Massachusetts, Amsterdam or Bangalore, Juniper is a place that was founded on disruptive thinking – where colleague innovation is not only valued but expected. We believe that the great task of delivering a new network for the next decade is delivered through the creativity and commitment of our people. The Juniper Way is the commitment to all our colleagues that the culture and company inspire their best work—their life’s work.
At Juniper we believe this is more than a job - it’s an opportunity to help change the world.

Job description

G-Star strives to be the most hardcore denim brand in the world. To achieve this, we are looking for hardcore thinkers and do-ers, who dare to create the future of premium and purposeful denim with us.

We are looking for people with big dreams, while keeping their feet on the ground. Those who are not afraid to push the limits, because we believe there are no limits in what denim can do.

Are you up for the challenge?
Are you the perfect fit for our team?
Are you a bit of a rebellious spirit?
Then we would love to hear from you!

Would you like to combine your expertise of affiliate marketing with your passion for Denim? Then you might be our new Affiliate Specialist!

As G-Stars’ Affiliate Specialist you become part of Global Digital Marketing Team. This team consists of an enthusiastic and experienced group of digital specialists (for example: PPC, Paid Social, Display, SEO).

In the Digital Marketing Team we have big ambitions and lots of motivation to have maximum impact on the growth of G-Star Raw. And we have lots of fun as well! The Digital Marketing Team is responsible for creating the global digital marketing strategy for G-Star RAW and ensure a flawless execution. We do this in close collaboration with the different regional marketing teams, the Ecom team, our inhouse creative team and our data teams.

Tasks and Responsibilities

As Affiliate Specialist you develop and execute our global affiliate strategy, to ensure we get maximal results out of our affiliate channel. You use your platform data and customer insights to identify opportunities and scale collaborations with publishers both in the mid- and the lower part of the marketing funnel. You will use the latest technology that enables you to scale while keeping full control of the channel. By doing so, you have a significant impact on the growth of G-Star!

This role is a unique opportunity for someone who is looking for the next step in their career and who likes to take ownership while working in a fast-paced, international environment.

As our Affiliate Specialist, you:

Have a strong vision on how to best leverage the affiliate channel to support the growth of G-StarDevelop a best in class Affiliate program for G-Star Global including a solid commission structure, automation of processes and implementation of the right technologies.Work on the day to day execution of our affiliate channel, in close collaboration with our local marketing teams.Build strong relationships important with G-Star partners in our affiliate programSupport local initiatives and tests, in collaboration with local marketing teamsManage and partner with internal and external stakeholders, like agencies, publishers, affiliate platforms and technology partners.Report into Head of Digital Marketing

Profile

What you bring to the table:

A Bachelor’s or Master’s degreeA minimum of 3 years’ experience in affiliate marketing, with a proven track record on elaborating a strong vision on affiliate marketing and successfully implementing of affiliate programsDeep understanding of Affiliate platformsExperience with data feed management tooling and working with scripts is a plusExperience in working with influencers is a plusYou have experience in working in cross functional teams and multi-regional teamsYou have great written and verbal communication skills in English. An additional language (German, French) is a plusRelevant experience in Fashion and/or Retail industry

G-Star Skill Set:

Strong analytical, planning and problem-solving skillsYou have a hands-on mentalityYou are a team player with excellent communication skills,You are organized, detailed-oriented and able to manage multiple projects at one timeYou are able to learn quickly and enjoy working in a fast-paced environment. You know how to set priorities and turn challenges into a solution.You have an intrinsic curiosity to stay up to date on the latest digital marketing and Affiliate developmentsYou obviously are a denim lover

What does G-Star bring to the table:

Beyond a competitive salary, working at G-Star brings many other perks and exciting opportunities: an awesome and diverse team that collaborates to change the game; a work environment that offers room for fun, inspiration and innovation; a clothing budget; a healthy, fresh and delicious lunch and even discounts in various fitness clubs and last but not least, a discount on a new bicycle.

What will happen next:

We will thoroughly review your CV (English is our corporate language, so please apply in English)When we hopefully find what we are looking for, we will call you for a chat and if it’s a good fit, we’ll plan our first interviewBecause we’re very curious how you’d survive a mission impossible, we ask you to prepare a real-life business case in a follow-up interviewWhen we’re ready to commit to each other, we’ll finalize the terms we’ve discussed and we’ll explain to you how to order your first pair of jeans from the G-Star employee store. Good luck!

Now you can shape the path towards fossil free living. We’re searching for 20 talented individuals to join us on our journey towards fossil free living. Individuals that challenge the way we think, lead us down new paths and contribute to solving the biggest challenge of humankind – climate change. Is this you?

Become one of our 20 International Trainees at Vattenfall. Each of the trainee positions is unique, linked to a department within a specific business area and a working location. This means that each position has its own specific responsibilities, challenges and matching profile.

Next to your personal development in this unique position you will be enjoying one year of all we have to offer. Your trainee year will be filled with meet-ups with your international trainee team with likeminded individuals. You will be meeting up virtually to work on assignments and live during four seminar weeks where you will be visiting our power plants and growing your
superpowers with a variety of trainings.

Your role as a Trainee – Strategy & Business Development
As a Trainee – Strategy & Business Development you are responsible for translating information into commercial and financial analyses, interpret these and make use of data reporting tools so that it is easy for stakeholders to grasp the outputs.

With your clear, visible and courageous leadership capabilities and intelligence you are able to connect and deliver high qualified proposals of improvements for the department and our processes. If required, you will steer the implementation project concerning those improvements.

Your daily activities:
Market analysis and developing winning strategies
Driving improvements in our processes, which brings this department to a higher level
Product/solution definition, focussing on practical feasibility and scalability
Development of business case and business plan
Participation in our daily activities when needed
Who are you?
Whether you want a climate smarter career as an energy specialist, visionary manager or inspirational project lead in the energy sector, we offer you these possibilities within the Trainee Programme.

As a Trainee – Strategy & Business Development you recognize yourself in the following:
Academic degree preferably in Industrial Engineering, Energy Engineering, Business Economics
Knowledge of and interest in data-reporting tools to be able to present your findings with the right visualizations
Experience with data analysis, being able to use statistical techniques to build models
Result driven with ability to make priorities to reach deadlines
Independent working style with ability to create structure and deliverables within a given framework
Opportunity finder, problem solver and analytical thinker
Hands-on mentality
You are our ideal trainee if you are a recent graduate with an academic degree or you graduate before September 2021. You are fluent in Dutch and English. This is Adyen

We took an unobvious approach to starting a payments company, building a platform from scratch. Today, we're the payments platform of choice for the world's brightest companies. Our unobvious approach is a product of our diverse perspectives. This diversity, of backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives, is essential in helping us maintain our momentum. Our business challenges are unique, we need as many different voices as possible to join us in solving them - voices like yours. So no matter where you're from, who you love, or what you believe in, we welcome you to be your true self at Adyen.

Technical Account Specialist - Italian Speaker

You will operate as a first interface with Adyen's merchants across the globe. The cool thing is that you're directly working with the (technical) teams of our amazing merchant base. Changes you make for them have direct impact on their ability to take payments and further grow their – business. In order to do this, you will be working closely with multiple different teams, such as Sales, Account Management and Product Development.

Your team is extremely merchant-focused, highly motivated and thrives on shared success. You will be part of an international team with diverse backgrounds and skill sets. With Adyen being a 24/7 business we operate throughout time zones using a follow the sun principal. The extensive payments knowledge of the team is the most valuable aspect both to our merchants as our internal teams.

What you'll do

You are responsible for the merchants' full lifecycle (integration, expansion and operational excellence).
Be an internal product advocate, track product processes and contribute to the platform feeding back feedback and issues you get back from merchants.
Advising merchants regarding the best implementation practices and also address specific merchants' issues.
Be a key source of knowledge on the Adyen platform and APIs, the underlying technologies, and industry-standard integration methods and best practices.
Work on internal projects that will help scale the international support team within Adyen.
Who you are:
You are innovative, have strong problem-solving capabilities and able to adapt to new processes and procedures quickly, while dealing with many varied technical support requests and challenges.
You are self-driven, flexible, and have the ability to maintain high levels of productivity with minimal supervision.
You've had previous exposure to environments rich in uncertainty and you show a resulting track record of successfully dealing with ambiguity.
You make quick informed decisions under pressure and prioritize appropriately based on urgency, necessity and both internal and external requests.
You have affinity with internet technologies and knowledge of technical processes (think SQL / HTML / JavaScript / PHP / Java / Scripting).
You have native, bilingual or full professional proficiency (written and verbal) in English and Italian.

Who we are

Adyen is the payments platform of choice for the world's leading companies, delivering frictionless payments across online, mobile and in-store channels. It is the only provider of a modern end-to-end infrastructure, connecting directly to Visa, Mastercard, and consumers' globally preferred payment methods. With offices around the world, Adyen serves nine of the 10 largest U.S. internet companies and many worldwide retailers. Customers include Facebook, Uber, L'Oreal, Evernote, Cathay Pacific and Spotify.

We offer a competitive salary, knowledge sharing internal events, exchange program to other offices and great career opportunities. Become part of an international work environment and take your career to the next level!

Ready to meet us?

If this role looks like your next step, apply by clicking the link below. We can't wait to meet you.

Job Title: International Trainee - Project Delivery Onshore Wind
Job Description:
Now you can shape the path towards fossil free living. We’re searching for 20 talented individuals to join us on our journey towards fossil free living. Individuals that challenge the way we think, lead us down new paths and contribute to solving the biggest challenge of humankind – climate change. Is this you?

Become one of our 20 International Trainees at Vattenfall. Each of the trainee positions is unique, linked to a department within a specific business area and a working location. This means that each position has its own specific responsibilities, challenges and matching profile.

Next to your personal development in this unique position you will be enjoying one year of all we have to offer. Your trainee year will be filled with meet-ups with your international trainee team with likeminded individuals. You will be meeting up virtually to work on assignments and live during four seminar weeks where you will be visiting our power plants and growing your superpowers with a variety of trainings.

Your role as a Trainee – Project Delivery Onshore Wind
You will be working on Onshore Wind construction projects in (one of) the Vattenfall countries during the procurement and construction phases of these projects.

During the construction phase, the Project Delivery Trainee will support the Project Managers in our team in safely delivering a successfully constructed and efficiently operating wind farm project to the budget, timescales and quality standards that were determined at Final Investment Decision (FID). During the procurement phase, the Project Delivery Trainee will support the procurement process and the Development Manager in reaching the FID. The role will be to ensure that the main construction phase contracts (i.e. wind turbine package, civil works package and grid works package) are secured to a sufficient standard to enable seamless execution of the project during the construction phase.

On our Construction projects we have a large variety of different (project management) roles working together as a team to deliver to a high standard. The Project Delivery Trainee would have the opportunity to get acquainted with how we procure and build our projects by exploring these different roles and disciplines, start developing the competences and gain the experience required to work on our projects. We are flexible in shaping the roles and tasks for the trainee, based on demand from the projects, personal preference and background.

Your daily activities:
Assisting Project Managers or other members of the team in their day-to-day tasks running construction projects: from defining project goals to communicating with in- and external stakeholders, from monitoring progress or budget, to identifying and managing risks, to keeping the spirit up in the project team.
You support the projects &/or the Project Delivery organisation with specific projects or tasks, which can vary from running data analyses, to organizing an event, to managing an improvement initiative, or assessing a problem and coming up with- and implementing solutions.

Who are you?
Whether you want a climate smarter career as an energy specialist, visionary manager or inspirational project lead in the energy sector, we offer you these possibilities within the Trainee Programme.

As a Trainee – Project Delivery Onshore Wind, you recognize yourself in the following:
You have affinity with and/or are highly interested in (the construction phase of) renewable energy projects
You have a Master’s degree in a relevant field
You are results driven and you inspire and motivate others
You enjoy working in a team, you contribute to a positive team spirit and build strong relationships with the people you work with
You are curious and always eager to learn and develop yourself
You thrive in complex environments with high pressure and tight deadlines
Changing priorities do not scare you, identifying and (re)setting priorities in your work is your strength
You are a self-starter and have a fresh look on things, often coming up with creative and innovative solutions that others have not yet thought of and you are not afraid to ask the awkward questions
You are our ideal trainee if you are a recent graduate with an academic degree or you graduate before September 2021. You are fluent in English. Skills in other world languages can be a merit. You are willing to relocate for possible assignments throughout the organization. And of course, you identify yourself with our principles: active, open, positive and safe.

Location:
You will be working within the Construction Management and Project Support team in the Project Delivery department and the position is located in Amsterdam in the Netherlands.

What we offer you
Vattenfall International Trainee Programme is the kickstart of your career within Vattenfall. You will have the opportunity to develop your professional and personal skills over the course of a year. In the Trainee Programme you will take part in international workshops and site visits during the seminar weeks. You will have the opportunity to work abroad and get a good overview of our entire organization. Each position comes with a competitive salary and an excellent remuneration package.Read more about the elements of the Vattenfall International Trainee Programme here or check the FAQ page.

At Vattenfall you can free your superpowers! We are one of the European market leaders in the generation of renewable energy and are primarily active in Scandinavia, Germany, Denmark, UK and the Netherlands. For our Sales Bioprocess Solutions Team, we are seeking a Sales Representative (m|f|d) Food & Beverage homebased in Amsterdam. In this role, you will be responsible for sales of our filtration and fermentation technology to customers in the food and beverage industry. With your understanding of biotechnological processes, you will support our customers in their questions about the manufacturing process.
What you will accomplish together with us
You will support and advise existing customers in a very varied environment along the processes in food and beverage production
Actively drive sales and acquire completely new customers, especially in the field of food biotech
You are independently responsible for time management and planning customer visits
Take responsibility for customer acquisition, sales planning for your territory and reporting
Achieve your sales target along the agreed sales strategy
You will work closely with Sartorius application specialists to solve specific and technical customer inquiries
You will be involved in the conception and implementation of sales promotion measures (seminars, exhibitions, etc.)
What will convince us
Completed natural science studies in biology, biotechnology with focus on food technology or comparable education with corresponding work experience
You have first professional experience in the Life Science industry and you are comfortable to sell
You are routine in using biotechnological techniques like filtration, fermentation or chromatography
You are a proactive and communicative personality
You have very good written and verbal Dutch and English skills, French would be a plus
You are ready to travel (approx. 50%) within Netherlands, and you have the flexibility to travel to Denmark
What we offer
Sartorius’ ambition is to simplify progress in life science research and the biopharmaceutical industry to help translate scientific findings into new therapeutics faster and more efficiently. Our nearly 10,000 employees at more
than 60 sites are working together on achieving this goal: Better health for more people. And together, we have grown strongly over the past years. Enjoy the Advantages of working with a global player:
Great opportunity to grow the food & beverage market in the Netherlands for Sartorius
Attractive remuneration, Homeoffice, company car
Opportunity for international career development: a global network offering seminars and training sessions, expert and manager career paths
Open and highly collaborative culture: mutual support within teams and working as equals, team spirit and international collaboration
Ambitious goals: Sartorius plans to double its sales revenue approximately every five years and expects to grow its global team to approximately 15,000 people in 2025
We look for employees who would like to grow with us and move the innovative life sciences sector forward. In the process, we focus on agile project work, mutual support within teams and working as equals. Sartorius thrives as a company with people who give their very best every day and who are eager to develop personally and professionally.
Further insights into our world of work can be found here.

Req Number: KFINT16823

Location: Amsterdam, Noord-Holland

Posted: 1/28/2021

Category: Products

Job Type: Employee

About Us
Korn Ferry is a global organizational consulting firm. We help clients synchronize strategy and talent to drive superior performance. We work with organizations to design their structures, roles, and responsibilities. We help them hire the right people to bring their strategy to life. And we advise them on how to reward, develop, and motivate their people.

Our 8,600 colleagues serve clients in more than 50 countries. We offer five core solutions:

Organizational Strategy
Assessment and Succession
Talent Acquisition
Leadership Development
Rewards and Benefits

The Role
The purpose of the role is to manage specific client projects throughout the whole project lifecycle reporting to the Pay Delivery Leader, ensuring that the client and relevant colleagues are kept informed throughout and that deadlines are met. This role is about both building and maintaining client relationships delivering profitable renewal and yield business as well as ensuring coordination of all stages of set up, educate, data collection, reporting and actioning to deliver promise to clients. The job includes deep technical expertise, focusing on understanding the client needs and building knowledge of all products and services available in PAY and Work Measurement category.
Key Accountabilities
Managing delivery of Products and Services with high standards of knowledge and quality in Pay and Work measurement Category:
Ensure that client receives products and services to agreed standards of quality and on time by effectively managing the entire project team and taking corrective action including. escalation when necessary to guarantee client satisfaction and sustainable financial results.
Ensure quality of activities of the delivery team on the project according to the agreed timeframe.
Take responsibility for overall progress of project plan and initiate corrective action where required.
Liaise with all members of the project team to assure the overall direction and integrity of the projects.
Prepare any follow-on actions required and communicate to others where relevant.
Deliver training to clients on Products Portfolio.
Advise clients on reward and benefits topics.


Maintaining renewal business and growing yield business:
Maintains and grows revenue streams from assigned client accounts by developing and maintaining multiple relationships (including i.e. line managers, HR managers, C&B specialists, procurement) with the client and leveraging Korn Ferry internal resources to ensure maximum revenues generation over the long term.


Growing the database
Work together with national and international colleagues and clients to grow the base of our business: our organizational database.
Increase the quality and density of the data by working with the client to get best possible data and make the AI learn.

Skills & Experience
Degree in Business Administration or equivalent. Additional training in HR, Reward and Benefits will be considered.
2 – 4 years’ experience in consulting or account management, working on product delivery projects
Exposure to Pay & Reward products would be beneficial
Experience of managing large volumes of data
Develops an internal network of relationships to proactively share experience and learn
Can measure and monitor own performance and start to understand trends and success factors
Ensures understanding of deliverables and expectations
Known for delivering or coordinating high quality work that meets expectations for timeliness, accuracy and completeness - not only standardised but also non-standard products

Competencies

Striving for Excellence: ability to attend to the details necessary for success including planning and coordinating work and executing individual activities in a way that ensures the achievement of challenging goals
Impact & Influence: ability to persuade, convince, influence or impress others to go along with your agenda
Initiative: ability to identify opportunities and take current or future action to address opportunities
Relationship Building: ability to build, maintain and grow reciprocal and warm relationships or networks of contact with people
Ensuring Collaboration: working with others inside and outside of immediate team to achieve group and organizational/client goals
Customer Service Orientation: desire to help or serve others, to meet their needs
Interpersonal Understanding: ability to accurately hear and understand the spoken, unspoken or partially expressed thoughts, feelings and concerns of others.
Learning skills: eager to learn new methodologies and processes. Constant learning and development capabilities.

Other

Hewlett Packard Enterprise advances the way people live and work. We bring together the brightest minds to create breakthrough technology solutions, helping our customers make their mark on the world.
We now live in a consumption world; we consume music, TV shows, groceries, accommodation, air travel, and much, much more. According to IDC, “By 2020, consumption-based procurement in datacenters will have eclipsed tradition procurement through improved ‘as a service’ models, thus accounting for as much as 40% of enterprises’ IT infrastructure spending.” That goes for businesses too. Whether it’s real-time analytics, connecting devices at the edge, or protecting apps and data—your customers now widely prefer to consume the outcomes they want, when they want them, and pay only for what they consume.
At the core of HPE’s consumption based solutions strategy is the HPE Greenlake service portfolio. Now more than ever, corporations need to move faster and adapt quickly to change. HPE GreenLake brings the cloud experience to apps and data everywhere, enabling customers to adopt transformative technology faster and simplify their operations. HPE GreenLake delivers public cloud services and infrastructure as-a-service for your workloads – on premises, fully managed in a pay-per-use model at the edge, in colocations, and in your data center.
In a typical day as a Greenlake Sales Specialist you would:
Build and manage an ongoing pipeline of opportunities
Build your knowledge of competitors in account to strategically position HPEs solutions better and collaborate with both internal and external/industry experts to anticipate future customer needs and facilitate solutions development.
Establish a professional, working, and consultative, relationship with the client, by developing a core understanding of the unique business needs of the client within their industry.
Support the bid team to ensure a solid translation of customers’ needs into a fitting solution.
Work closely with the pursuit team in developing and substantiating a winning value proposition that meets the needs of the customer, including analyzing critical business drivers and risks.
Manage the end to end contracting process post signature including support to contract integration, change management, governance activities, up sells and re-negotiations.
Arrange the support of sales specialists, implementation resources, service resources and other sales and management resources as needed.
Once the deal is signed, work closely with delivery to ensure the right metrics are developed and implemented according to the Statement of Work (proper handover)
Your background:
Education. University or Bachelor’s degree.(Thinking level)
Experience. Proven selling experience at end-user global and local accounts in The Netherlands
Proven ability in managing complex solution sales cycles
Experience in influencing multi stakeholders up to CxO level.
Experience as successful account/business manager, selling to decision maker level.
Ability to hunt and develop new logos
Join us and make your mark!
We offer:A competitive salary and extensive social benefitsDiverse and dynamic work environmentWork-life balance and support for career developmentAn amazing life inside the element! Want to know more about it?
Then let’s stay connected!

https://twitter.com/HPE_Careers

We are committed to diversity and building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We do not discriminate and all decisions we make are made on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. Our goal is to be one global diverse team that is representative of our customers, in an inclusive environment where we can continue to innovate and grow together.

Duration: 3 Months
Location: Amsterdam

Challenge yourself and find the career path in Marketing that you’re passionate about while gaining real-world experience! Plan and execute marketing projects in collaboration with your team. Partner with an experienced mentor to determine your career goals and strengths. Collaborate with Cisco Marketing leaders and work in areas such as brand, product, public relations, social media, operations and/or market research. Learn the foundations of marketing and use those skills to help jump-start your career.

What You’ll Do
Utilize and expand your marketing and communications skills by completing a 12-week internship in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment.
Gain insight into how a large, global marketing organization functions.
Take part in a variety of development opportunities, networking events, volunteer and social activities throughout the summer.

The Lifecycle Marketing team plays a huge role in Miro's rapidly scaling growth, contributing to product adoption, monetization, retention, and resurrection of the continuously growing number of Miro users.

About the role

The role reports directly to the Lifecycle Marketing Lead and will work closely with Growth, Marketing, and Product teams.

This is a unique opportunity to join a fast-growing team and leave your mark as the team scales up. Your efforts will support the foundation for the Lifecycle Marketing team and will contribute to the company's growth.

What you'll do
Support and coordinate end-to-end process of lifecycle marketing strategies development and execution from idea to content creation, production, and analytics including working with business stakeholders, gathering references, creating lists, creating/updating email content, and delivering systematic reporting
Support other functions in Miro through the email creation process (surveys, launch emails, event invitations, etc.)

Help the Lifecycle Marketing team to perform quality control checks, documentation, and taxonomy best practices to produce accurate and transparent work processes

ANALYST EQUITY CAPITAL MARKETS AMSTERDAM
Position
ING Equity Capital Markets currently has a vacant Analyst position
ING Equity Capital Markets
Equity Capital Markets (ECM) is a joint venture between the Global Capital Markets (GCM) department and the Corporate Finance (CF) department of the Strategic Products Group within ING’s Wholesale Banking division, and advises companies on raising equity on international stock markets. Products covered by ECM include Initial Public Offerings (IPOs), follow-on equity issues and secondary offerings (rights issues or accelerated bookbuild offerings (ABBs)), capital return programmes including share buybacks, preference shares issuances and equity-linked transactions (convertible bonds). ECM, with support from FM Equity Markets, originates, structures and markets equity and equity-linked transactions to institutional investors (e.g. pension funds, insurance companies, asset managers, hedge funds) and retail investors.
What can we offer?
As an ECM Analyst you will work in a dynamic, enthusiastic, and highly motivated team on challenging Equity Capital Market transactions for high profile clients, mainly in Europe. You will be supporting the team in originating, structuring and executing ECM transactions. You will be part of transaction teams on high profile European ECM transactions (examples include the recent rights issue by Fugro, JDE Peet’s IPO, Just Eat Takeaway capital increase, Randstad preference shares transaction, Prosus listing, etc. Key development opportunities offered with the position:
Transaction driven, dynamic and energetic environment
Steep learning curve
Learning about and tracking capital markets dynamics
Preparing presentations, financial modelling, conducting research on industries, sectors and companies
Maintaining close ties with the departments within and outside the Strategic Products Group
Affinity with key databases (Bloomberg, CapitalIQ, Factset, etc.)
Both soft and hard skills; and pro-active coaching through buddy system
Exposure within the organisation to a.o. Financial Markets, Capital Structuring & Advisory, Corporate Clients and Corporate Investments
Equity Capital Markets transactions are complex and demanding and joining our team will therefore give you a head start in your future career
Who are we looking for?
Suitable candidates have affinity with the equity markets, obtained their master’s degree and relevant internship experience, as well as a high energy level and performance motivation, strong attention to detail, good communication and interpersonal skills and affinity with finance and financial markets. Candidates are required to have fluency in business English and to be proficient in the Dutch language and are expected to reside in the Netherlands.
Please include a cover letter containing your motivation, and your CV. Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis (first come first serve).
Apply or questions?
Do you have any questions about the position within the ECM department? Please contact the recruitment team via the contact details below. Please send your questions or application (covermail and CV) to:
More info on ING Corporate Finance
The Corporate Finance department is the primary point of contact for advisory relationships with corporates and institutional investors, leading the execution of high profile Equity Capital Markets and Mergers & Acquisitions transactions. In the Benelux, ING Corporate Finance is the absolute #1 in both ECM and M&A. ING Corporate Finance adopts a sector-based approach, putting together client teams across borders to reflect local relationships and product specialists and to ensure the highest standards of transaction execution.
The Amsterdam office of ING CF is responsible for the origination and execution of transactions in a Benelux domestic and cross-border context, as part of ING Wholesale Banking’s European Corporate Finance team. The CF team in Amsterdam consists of over 50 professionals.

Job Title: Application and Technical Support Manager - Bakery Key Accounts
Job Description:
Bunge (NYSE: BG) is a world leader in sourcing, processing and supplying oilseed and grain products and ingredients. Founded in 1818, Bunge’s expansive network feeds and fuels a growing world, creating sustainable products and opportunities for more than 70,000 farmers and the consumers they serve across the globe. The company is headquartered in St. Louis, Missouri and has 25,000 employees worldwide who stand behind more than 350 port terminals, oilseed processing plants, grain facilities, and food and ingredient production and packaging facilities around the world.

“Be the technical linking pin between our Key Accounts in Bakery Specialties and our company”

Manufacturing excellent bakery products, balancing indulgence and productivity, is challenging. Product value cycles are getting shorter and trends are evolving faster than ever. This ever-changing market demands a quick response if our customers in both artisanal as industrial baking want to win fast and smart.

Within Bunge Loders Croklaan (BLC) we dedicate our expertise to understand and identify our customers’ needs and collaborate with our channel to help them to choose the right fat / margarine to balance market demands with product innovation. In order to help our partners and customers, we provide our application and development expertise and capabilities.

In the role of Application and Technical Support Manager - Bakery Key Accounts you’ll be at the heart of this innovation!

As Application and Technical Support Manager Key Accounts you are working very closely with your Sales counterpart(s) and the customers R&D Innovation department. Through daily contact, as a partner of sales and account managers you understand and spot the demand of our customers and translate / negotiate this into understandable and realistic requirements and specifications towards our Research and Development specialists, or towards Product Management, Quality and Production.
This role is truly cross functional. About 60 to 80 % of your time you will be in contact with about 6 – 8 key accounts in the bakery segment. In ‘normal’ times you will be traveling regularly to visit customers for project and portfolio updates or to assist in line trials. As the technical counterpart of our sales crew, you are typically the person in contact with our internal R&D department and that of the customer, to make sure we develop the right products and samples for our customers.
The other part of your time would be spent as application lead, maintaining an internal community that is constantly sharing and creating knowledge and insights on our specialized bakery ingredients business, industry developments, specialized solutions such as Shea based margarine, and you will guide internal processes in the right direction. Being the expert on your product also means you organize customer workshops and trainings, represent Bunge Loders Croklaan at exhibitions and fairs, support building product USPs in application, drive application development and you build and maintain presence and visibility in the local technical community and network, e.g. by participating in expert groups, advisory boards to technical institutions.

What do you bring to the role?
As the description might have given away, for this role you will need to be a specialist in product development in oils & fats, mainly for the bakery industry and have over 5 years of experience in working with food (ingredients) companies. Your mindset is commercial, result oriented and most of all you are service minded, understanding the landscape where fast responses are required in order to optimize opportunities and customer satisfaction. To achieve this you’ll be a great team player and have developed sound project management skills. Fluency in English and German is required and other European languages are beneficial.

What we offer

A key role in an organization with colleagues around the world, who are dedicated to improving the global Agri-Food value chain, one day at a time. Together, we bring food from where it’s produced to where it’s needed. We do this in an informal culture where an entrepreneurial mindset is valued. Being a global company with a constant need for innovation, a broad variety of challenges and development opportunities can support your long term career at Bunge. We value and stimulate development through training, education and experience and offer effective and accredited tools and resources to support you in your journey.

If this description matches your profile and ambition, we’re looking forward to see your application and motivation in English by hitting apply!

BSc/MSc degree in marketing, business or an equivalent combination of education and experience
5-10 years of working experience in a consumer focused, matrixed, multinational environment. Preferably in consumer goods, online services, e-commerce or mobile applications
Cross-Functional Connector, able to build bridges across the organization to deeply understand the business and amplify the learnings to infuse the voice of the customer into a culture that thrives on consumer understanding
Track record as a strategic thought leader and contributing to the profitable top-line growth by uncovering behaviors and insights that result in breakthrough ideas
Agile with large amounts of data (qualitative, quantitative, behavioral, secondary, etc.), determining what is important and distilling it into actionable insights. Able to synthesize across multiple sources into a clear and visually impactful concise story
Broad and deep research experience across qualitative, quantitative and agile research methods. Ability to reframe synthesized data & learnings into new frameworks to bring customer insights to life
Straightforward communicator, you can organize, clarify and communicate complex ideas quickly, succinctly and accurately
Creative, demonstrated ability to think innovatively and connecting the dots where others cannot when it comes to consumers and customers (and payers where relevant) to create business building insight
Act as a role-model for our Philips behaviors: Customer first, Quality & Integrity always, Team up to Win, Take Ownership to deliver fast, Eager to improve and inspire
Business acumen and understanding in the broad spectrum of Philips

Are you ready to join a dynamic and diverse client-facing team of lending specialists who provide tailor-made financing solutions for our (international) FI clients? Do you want to share your knowledge and experience on finance and structured lending in the interests of our clients and the future of our bank?

Your job
We are looking for a FI Lending specialist to join the FI Lending product unit within Structured Finance & Portfolio Management (SF&PM) part of Corporate & Institutional Banking (CIB).

The FI Lending Specialist is responsible for the commercial proposition, structuring and execution of Structured Lending products to (inter)national FI clients. Together with other client coverage teams you take care of the origination of the client dialogue. Your work includes negotiating and preparing tailor made commercial client propositions, structuring loan products, drafting credit applications, executing imminent deals (including coordination with external advisors), negotiating financing documents with the client and monitoring of the existing portfolio of (debt) transactions.

The assessment of risks involved is based on your (credit structuring) experience and specific client-, product-, and FI-sector knowledge. Your challenge will be to find the right balance between commerce and risk taking into account the bank’s moderate risk profile, while keeping client interests and needs centre stage.

Working environment
Financial Institutions is a sector with a global footprint in CIB. Controlled growth and consolidation of international expansion - predominantly in North-West Europe - is an important theme for FI. Lending is a key product that enables international growth of FI. FI Specialised Lending (FISL) - currently consisting of 11 Lending Specialists in Amsterdam – is looking to reinforce the portfolio finance segment in the team.

FISL is organised along three niche lending activities; Fund finance, Insurance consolidation finance and Portfolio finance. The product specialism Portfolio finance delivers product services to (Large) Corporates and FI clients. The team develops financial structures, enabling a client to obtain financing using its own assets as a secured element. Assets usually deployed are portfolios of mortgage loans, consumer loans, auto leases, corporate receivables, etc. You are the arranging linking pin between your client and Risk Management and deploy a hands-on approach in tailoring and negotiating successful transactions for your client. Furthermore, you advise on and structure portfolio management transactions enabling a capital efficient business model.

FISL acts as a centre of (credit) expertise and is the first line of defence for FI clients The team is transaction-oriented, result-oriented and knowledge-driven with a great deal of teamwork and strong empowerment of individual responsibilities. We work closely together with other CIB teams such as Client Coverage, DCM, Loan Origination, Sustainability and Central Portfolio Management ensuring that clients needs are serviced best and our portfolio is sound and grows in a sustainable way. Our office is based in Amsterdam (Gustav Mahlerlaan) where we work in an open floor space and have all stakeholders in our vicinity. We have a flexible operating model that allows for working at home via VPN.

We are offering
ABN AMRO offers a challenging international work environment that provides ample opportunities for personal growth, knowledge development, and teamwork and that fosters taking responsibility. There is a strong and dynamic team of passionate professionals that seek the best lending solutions for their clients.

The benefits are:
The opportunity to be the best you can be, to work flexible hours and to have sufficient room to grow both personally and professionally
A very professional working environment with a very interesting and steep learning curve
A large responsibility and access to a career with multiple possibilities for growth
A Market-conform salary with a competitive benefits package and a substantial education budget
An annual public transportation pass or travel budget, depending on your travel preference
The opportunity to pro-actively work on your vitality and fitness
A solid pension plan
Your profile
We are looking for a professional with:
Minimal [6-8] years of credit experience to wholesale clients
Strong affiliation with structured lending -,(debt) capital markets or affiliated products
Good knowledge relevant developments of CRR, Securitisation Regulation, Basel IV, Solvency II, Accountancy guidelines
Analytical with advanced excel skills
Risk Management experience and affinity with portfolio management skills
Ability of managing an FI client credit portfolio
Strong communication and commercial skills

Next to this, we require:
WO / Master
Fluent in English (written / verbal) and preferably also in Dutch
Interested?

Competitive package

About Us

Beat is one of the most exciting companies to ever come out of the ride-hailing space. One city at a time, all across the globe we make transportation affordable, convenient, and safe for everyone. We also help hundreds of thousands of people earn extra income as drivers.

Today we are the fastest-growing ride-hailing service in Latin America. But serving millions of rides every day pales in comparison to what lies ahead. Our plans for expansion are limitless. Our stellar engineering team operates across a number of European capitals where, right now, some of the world’s most ambitious and talented engineers are changing how cities will move in the future.

Beat is currently available in Greece, Peru, Chile, Colombia, Mexico and Argentina.

About the role

We're looking for a CRM Specialist to help continue the current pace of growth by ensuring that we are effectively messaging our customers in a way that informs, delights and drives growth.

Being a CRM Specialist at Beat means you will be part of a cross-functional team. You will be working with operations, analytics, product and design teams to coordinate and deploy email campaigns around product launches, promotions and all other ad hoc communications relevant to our customers. You will be creating new paths together with a great team of hackers and hustlers in a fast paced, growth oriented environment.
