Do you have a passion for hospitality and events? Would you like to work in a dynamic and innovative environment? Are you creative and always looking for new opportunities? The Renaissance Amsterdam Hotel is looking for a Groups, Meetings & Events Specialist!

What are my responsibilities?
As a Groups, Meetings and Events Specialist you will be responsible for handling and managing enquiries for the Renaissance Amsterdam Hotel, for Corporate Groups (10 bedrooms or more), local catering (Meetings or Events without or up to 10 bedrooms) and Corporate Meetings (Meetings or Events with 10 or more bedrooms) from the enquiry stage to the execution.
You serve as contact person for clients, vendors, and meeting or event planners and communicate with them by phone and e-mail to respond to questions and requests, and optimize revenue & utilization of meeting and event space as well as Event Satisfaction. You are responsible for all details for a perfect execution of the event. You prepare all documentation and coordinate with all departments and customers to ensure consistent, high level service throughout pre-event, event and post event phases of the events. You deal with reservation requests, no shows, changes, additional services and cancellations.
You will ensure all hotel events have a seamless turnover to our operational departments and act as a key-contact person for both the clients, as internally towards all hotel disciplines. On the day of the event you hand all information over to our Event Operations department. You are responsible for the highest level of service by leading and executing the requirements of events, based on Renaissance Event Management Standards.

What are we looking for?
We are looking for an ambassador who is creative and brings personal style to every event experience. You are an ambitious and experienced in handling events and are looking for a new opportunity to develop further your skills. You live life to discover and you have a natural curiosity and a warm way with people. Is this exactly who you are and what you want to do? We’re looking for someone like you!

To be eligible for this position you…
Live Life to Discover.
Have a degree in Hospitality Management or similar.
Have experience in Events and a passion for Hospitality and Lifestyle.
Have strong communication skills (verbal, listening, writing) and strong organization skills.
Be fluent in Dutch and English.


What do you get in return?
Renaissance Amsterdam hotel is part of Marriott International and offers a competitive salary and a wide package of benefits. Each year you will have a performance appraisal. Dependent on your performance you are able to get a salary increase or a one-time bonus. In addition we offer you…
A professional and stimulating work environment.
An international and dynamic team.
Personal coaching to support you in your day-to-day job and lots of development and training opportunities.
Special Associate Rate discount available for Marriott products worldwide.
A TakeCare program, which means you can participate in boot camp, apply for a gym against a discounted rate, sport in our own health club, follow dancing classes against a discounted rate and much more.
Career possibilities within Marriott International.
As part of our culture we celebrate recognition and organize many social activities, such as our Associates Appreciation Week, yearly Staff party and Team outing.

Renaissance Amsterdam Hotel – “Live Life to Discover”
Just steps away from the historical Jordaan, the fashionable district ‘De Negen Straatjes’ and Dam Square, the Renaissance Amsterdam Hotel puts you in the middle of all the fabulous of Amsterdam. The hotel’s navigators can assist in discovering the well-known, as well as the hidden gems of the city. Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team
NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.
NIKE, Inc.'s storytellers, Marketing and Communication sets the brand tone. A creative force of specialists tell Nike’s stories of innovation and sport through advertising, brand strategy, digital engagement and product presentation. Using channels ranging from retail stores to social media, Marketing & Communication teams connect the science and art of Nike innovations to the hearts and minds of athletes around the world.
Based in the European Headquarters in Hilversum, you will be part of the Consumer Direct Marketing team in EMEA. This team sees the merger of both Nike Partner Marketing and Nike Direct. It has been designed to provide functional excellence across One Nike Marketplace. Consumer Direct Acceleration (CDA) leads Nike to a more centralised operating model, where EMEA HQ (Geo) will be 100% responsible for the P&L and the seasonal adaptation as well as execution of our brand strategy and architecture. This is why our core functions and business critical Marketplace Units will be based here, whereas the city teams are tasked with humanising the brand and connecting with HVMs on a daily basis.
Who are we looking for?
We are looking for a talented brand marketeer who is looking to accelerate your career and learning in one of the most progressive areas of Nike marketing. One must be attuned to the needs of the consumer in a modern sense, eager to push new ways of thinking about and mapping their diverse sporting lives through the lens of the Nike member funnel and engagement model. The Specialist's focus is to identify and create a communication plan by channel/notification. We need you to be curious, open to interrogate your own as well as others plans in a constructive way, with always an eye on the KPIs we are accountable for delivering.
You will focus on application and execution of advanced operational work in support of marketing goals and seek to deepen your knowledge and experience. Manage multiple stakeholders and be able demonstrate independent thinking while at the obsessing the last mile to ensure success. Your experiences should ideally be across multiple areas across marketing.
Who will you work with?
Cross-functional collaboration involving other the marketing functions such as CDM, Creative, Influencer, NDDC, Membership, Comms & Sports Marketing and other relevant functions such as product marketing and MPU’S. You will also work closely with APLA, Territories across EMEA and the Global team.
What will you work on?
As the EMEA CD Marketing Specialist (Platforms) you will be responsible for the execution and co-ordination of the overall strategy as defined by the Nike Direct Digital Commerce (NDDC) team. This means you must have a deep appreciation for consumer behaviour, digital marketing, data, operational systems and strong commercial acumen. You will report directly to the EMEA CD Marketing Director (Nike App / .com). As always, future thinking should be complimented by the requirement to manage your sub function day-to-day in an integrated and collaborative way.
Further details of what you will be responsible for are:
Establish the best blend of engagement and creative execution, applying a rigorous testing methodology
Future planning and modelling, based on strong data understanding, is imperative in this role/sub-function
You should deeply appreciate and understand the importance of planning consumer journeys O2O
You must leverage operational systems, as well as digital product and MarTech to amplify best practises
Obsess the channel cadence of how we engage consumer and members to the 13ww. Personal at scale always.
Own KPI’s which define your success metrics and deliver against them by owning the read & respond process
Oversee the timely and effective delivery of seasonal/daily Marketing Plan through extensive cross-functional collaboration involving other the marketing functions such as CDM, Creative, Influencer, Comms & Sports Marketing and other relevant Functions such as product marketing and MPU’S. In addition, be accountable for corresponding P&L expectations as defined in goal setting. Leads multidisciplinary projects/ initiatives
Influence the strategy to address internal or external business and regulatory issues. Influence senior management decisions that have an impact on business direction

What you bring to Nike:
A successful candidate will be expected to clearly demonstrate and articulate experience of the below essential requirements in order to be considered:
A minimum of 2 years’ experience in brand and/or brand functional management
Ideally a strong focus on cross functional marketing and experience of industry defining integrated plans
Communicates vision & purpose by building energy and optimism in others for the organization’s vision
Proven ability to think strategically and beyond the day to day, taking a long term, big picture view of the business. Leads the team to pursue possibilities that will create sustainable value.
Digital Mindset - Work closely with the team to execute the brand plan to drive member KPI’s, learning agenda, brand and business growth to be defined through goal setting.
Modern Consumerist - Ensure the member & product innovation is at the forefront of all planning & execution. Strong understanding of the sport performance/lifestyle dimension consumers and ability to connect with them through a sport and cultural lens and knowledge of and/or worked in EMEA marketplaces and cities

NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world.
NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.

As the Senior Specialist Total Reward, you will manage the full portfolio of compensation & benefits activities for your region acting as the first point of contact from any total reward related topics. As a key member of the team you will support the assessment and drive the development of total reward programs across Irdeto as we continue to build a best-in-class Total Rewards function to support the growth & success of Irdeto.
Our global team provides operational and strategic internal services to the company, focused on business partnerships, strategically leveraged HR services, innovative talent program design and implementation, and design and maintenance of work culture that support and inspire our innovative technology business.
What will you be working on:
Drive the implementation & support the design of best-in-class Total Reward programs in our EMEA, APAC & AMERS regions
Management of regional benefit programs, global broker coordination & execution of Benefit Renewal
Partner with internal stakeholders to ensure the effective execution of our annual Compensation Management Cycle (annual merit & short-term incentive plans)
Lead the execution and analysis of gender pay reporting activities within your region
Execution of compensation benchmarking, market data analysis & critical skill determination.
Accountable for the delivery of salary survey data & participation in other market surveys
Support in the ongoing effectiveness assessment, redesign & implementation of our various incentive programs
Support the maintence & compliance of our long-term incentive programs
Manage the determination of quarterly payout calculations for our commission-based incentive plans
Manage our various recognition & wellbeing programs within your region
Lead Total Reward harmonization activities for mergers & acquisitions in your region
Effectively partner with internal & external stakeholders to deliver key Total Reward initiatives & projects
Maintence of Total Reward tools such as cost & return on investment modelling, gross/net calculators, & total reward statements
What can you bring to the team?
Minimum of 3 years’ Total Reward experience within an international organization
Bachelor or Master degree in Human Resources/ Reward Management/ Finance, or equivalent experience in a relative field
Exceptional Excel skills
Analytical mind-set & strong data presentation skills
Highly organized, thorough and self-motivated professional
HRIS Experience, Successfactors or Oracle preferred
Fluent in English, any other languages a plus
An enthusiasm to learn & a passion for building a best-in-class Total Reward function
Why join Irdeto?
We are on a mission to build a secure future, where people can embrace connectivity without fear. Our lives are increasingly connected. At Irdeto, we enable people and companies to experience connectivity effortlessly by protecting them from cyber attacks. Security is the enabler of the connected world we live in. Our solutions and services ensure that you can enjoy the latest video games, the best blockbuster movies and your favorite live events. And it does not stop there; our technology also secures connected transport and IoT connected industries – just to name a few. With 50 years of expertise in security, we protect over 5 billion devices and applications for some of the world’s best-known brands.
What do we offer you?
Irdeto is a people first organisation where you can secure your future. Our values of Trust, Accountability, Agility and Innovation inform our culture. Amsterdam | Quality Specialist| CAPAs | Change Control | Deviations | Six Sigma | QA | Dutch

Your new role

As Quality Specialist you will provide front line technical support for the technical supporting departments at Kite. You will ensure successful Facility & Engineering operational activities by assessing risk, implementing preventative measures, investigating, and troubleshooting equipment and calibration issues. In conjunction with various internal and external stakeholders you will investigate writes and coordinate the resolution of deviations through comprehensive Root Cause Analysis tools and product impact assessments. Implementation of CAPAs to address root cause and ensure effectiveness. You will collaborate with technical and operational stakeholders, write and/or revise SOPs and other operational related documents. You will also participate & represent F&E department during audits/inspections. You will also represent F&E operations in change control, CAPA and deviation meetings. You will also conduct compliance related training and cGMP guidelines to the technical staff.

What you'll need to succeed

A BSc in a technical related field with minimum of 5 years’ experience in a GMP environment. Fluency in Dutch is required. You must have a broad knowledge of cGMP compliance and experience with leading investigations, writing, deviation reports, change controls and corrective actions. Knowledge of technical installations, equipment and maintenance. Proficiency in Quality Systems and ability to utilise technical writing strategies to ensure content is clear and concise. Preferably previous experience working in a technical department such as Facility, Maintenance or Engineering. Preferably Six Sigma Green/Black Belt, Certified Quality Engineer or similar. Excellent communication skills with the ability to function efficiently and independently in a changing environment. We are looking for someone who is self-motivated, detail-orientated and willing to accept temporary responsibilities outside of initial job description.

Your new company

Kite, a Gilead company, is dedicated to achieving one of the most ambitious goals of 21st century medicine: curing cancer. This mission is at the heart of everything they do, from early research to product development. Kite has been at the forefront of cancer immunotherapy and today are a leader in engineered T cell therapy, changing the paradigm of cancer treatment with what is potentially the biggest breakthrough since the introduction of combination chemotherapy more than 60 years ago. With an unrelenting drive and a singular focus on cell therapy, our team is executing on our strategy to bring life-saving therapies to patients. With their brand-new production site in Hoofddorp and the R&D laboratories in Amsterdam, Kite is dreaming big. Now you can get the chance to be a part of this journey.

What you'll get in return

Hays Detachering | This is a project that will start with a contract for 12 months through Hays. Extension to stay within the department is anticipated. At this position, you will get a competitive salary and your travel expenses are covered.

What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.
If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career. #1041257

Mackinnon Bruce is currently partnered with a Global Leading Manufacturer and Supplier of Medical Devices used to treat Cardiac Arrhythmias. The client has asked us to identify suitable candidates for a Clinical Specialist opening within their electrophysiology division to cover the Randstad region in the Netherlands.

The candidate will need to provide Clinical Support for Surgeons using the EP products in the Cath Lab. The successful candidate will also promote Electrophysiology products (Catheter Ablation, Heart Mapping etc.) across current customer base and also identify new sales opportunities for the product portfolio. Be present within the Cath Lab during cases when surgeons are performing procedures and act as a consultant when needed to ensure the product is used effectively and demonstrate product features to meet customers unmet needs.

REQUIREMENT
Experience within an operating room environment, it is essential that the candidate has an understanding of electrophysiology – candidates will also be considered that are currently working for the hospitals within the Cath Lab with a good understanding of the surgical techniques and Electrophysiology/Atrial Fibrillation products and are interested in moving into a more commercial role. Will need to have the ability to develop and maintain professional relationships with KOL’s, must be degree Educated in a related field and have the ability to work independently within a territory with a large number of clients.

This is an ideal opportunity for an experienced Clinical Specialist to move into a truly global leading Medical Device organisation which puts strong emphasis on career development. The company is offering a competitive salary with additional benefits including a company car. Job Title: EMEA Consumer Direct Marketing Operations Specialist (MarTech)
Job Description:
Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team
NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.
NIKE, Inc.'s storytellers, Marketing and Communication sets the brand tone. A creative force of specialists tell Nike’s stories of innovation and sport through advertising, brand strategy, digital engagement and product presentation. Using channels ranging from retail stores to social media, Marketing & Communication teams connect the science and art of Nike innovations to the hearts and minds of athletes around the world.
Based in the European Headquarters in Hilversum, the Specialist will be part of the Consumer Direct Marketing team in EMEA. This team sees the merger of both Nike Partner Marketing and Nike Direct. It has been designed to provide functional excellence across One Nike Marketplace. Consumer Direct Acceleration leads Nike to a more centralised operating model, where EMEA HQ (Geo) will be 100% responsible for the P&L and the seasonal adaptation as well as execution of our brand strategy and architecture. This is why our core functions and business critical MPUs will be based here, whereas the city teams are tasked with humanising the brand and connecting with HVMs on a daily basis.
Who are we looking for?
We are looking for a talented marketing operations specialist who is looking to accelerate in their career and learning, in one of the most progressive areas of Nike marketing. You must be attuned to the technological needs of the marketing organization in a modern sense, eager to push new ways of thinking when it comes to marketing technology solutions and how they serve a digitally automated marketing process at scale. The Specialist’s focus is to think in-depth about a specific set of marketing tools and how they can be optimized to power strategic objectives for our channels and platforms and expanding into physical experiences in the most personal ways. Someone who is passionate to improve our ways of working through technology solutions, integration and automation of our cross-functional toolset and help our marketing organization understand its purpose and adopt its benefits. We need you to be curious, open to interrogate your own as well as others plans in a constructive way, with always an eye on the KPIs we are accountable for delivering.
You will act as a Subject Matter Expert to the marketing organization for a specific set of marketing tools. Gather and translate strategical and tactical capability asks into business cases and inform marketing on progress, planning and prioritization of capability investment and development. Manage multiple stakeholders and be able demonstrate independent thinking while obsessing all aspect of the toolset. You must thrive under pressure and be positively engaged at all times, ready to be agile in your working day and application of knowledge and ideas.
Who will you work with?
Cross-functional collaboration involving other marketing functions such as the EMEA Consumer Direct Marketing, EMEA Nike Direct Digital Commerce, EMEA Brand Marketing, EMEA Gender Marketing, Global Marketing Operations, EMEA Marketing Technology and Global Marketing Technology. This role will be reporting into the EMEA CD Marketing Manager (MarTech Ops).
What will you work on?
As the EMEA CD Marketing Specialist (MarTech Ops Enablement) you will be responsible for the operational enablement of the planning, co-ordination and execution of the overall CD Marketing team strategy through Marketing Technology. This means you must have a deep appreciation for digital best practises, processes, digital platforms, and operational systems. This is an agile role, intended to create the flexibility required in the organization and ever-evolving consumer landscape. This gives you the flexibility to be proactive and reactive to the opportunities that arise in our marketplace and consumer daily lives.
Further details of what you will be responsible for are:
Be the guardian for ensuring our integrated MarTech portfolio delivers maximum value to our marketeers
Align and lead to ensure our MarTech requirements and priorities are mapped, partner with Digital Product and MarTech Program Management on new rollouts and implementation
Funnel MarTech related ideas and requirements through our global intake and prioritization process; act as Subject Matter Expert (SME) on MarTech tools solutions deployed within EMEA
Ensure Marketing teams are trained and informed on the latest MarTech developments within your SME toolset
Act as the daily POC for MarTech related questions, access requests and issues within your SME scope
Future planning and modeling, based on strong data understanding, is imperative in this role/sub-function
Continuously strive to simplify, automate, and remove friction and process duplication through technology, own KPI’s which define your success metrics and deliver against them by owning the read & respond process
Ensure Nike’s Marketing Technology solutions represent the priorities of our EMEA Brand Marketing team by gathering feedback and business needs, and in partnership with Tech translate them into business cases for change

What you bring to Nike?
A successful candidate will be expected to clearly demonstrate and articulate experience of the below essential requirements in order to be considered.
A minimum of 2 years’ experience in brand and/or brand functional management or marketing technology
Ideally a strong focus on cross functional marketing and experience of industry defining Martech tooling
Communicates vision & purpose by building energy and optimism in others for the organization’s vision
Ability to think strategically and beyond the day to day, taking a long term, big picture view of the business. Leads the team to pursue possibilities that will create sustainable value
Familiarity with AGILE and SCUM is a plus

This job opening will be posted until 17th February.

NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world.
NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.

Quality Management System Specialist

Kyowa Kirin Pharma B.V. Hoofddorp

Netherlands


Job Purpose:

To participate in the implementation, execution, delivery and maintenance of the Kyowa Kirin Holdings B.V. (KKH) GxP Quality Management Systems and be the subject matter expert in the KKH QMS.


RESPONSIBILITIES:

Ensure all aspect of KKH's GxP Quality Management Systems (QMS) are fully documented and its effectiveness monitored.
Lead, participate in continuous improvement of the established QMS in order to support:

Continuous compliance with KKH's regulatory licenses (MIA/WDA/CDL) requirements.
Continuous compliance with KKK's MA requirements.
Batch certification and release of commercial products in the EU in accordance with EU GMP Annex 16.
Distribution of pharmaceutical products in the EMEA region in accordance with GDP 2013/C343/01.

Implement all Kyowa Kirin QA Global Policies and Global/Regional Procedures relevant to the KKHs activities.
Facilitate prompt and professional communication of key issues to KKH management as required to ensure effective collaboration towards compliant resolution of issues relating to licence compliance, manufacture, supply and distribution of product.
Activity support on oversight of the established Quality System via

Planning of regular management review meetings and monitoring of defined actions.
Provide regular reports of key performance indicators to senior management (local/regional), as part of the QMS, so that the appropriate resources can be allocated and corrective actions implemented, as necessary.

Influence project management meetings in order to assure ongoing activities, identify and address any gaps relating to KKH QMS GxP compliance.
Ensure training programs (induction and refresher) are in place and trainings are performed for all personnel involved in GMP/GDP to ensure compliance with both EU/local cGMDP requirements and Kyowa Kirin QA Policies/Procedures.
Train temporary contractors/consultants in applicable Kyowa Kirin QA Global Policies and Global/Regional Procedures and maintain oversight of their activities in line with these.
Facilitate internal & external audits to assess adherence to EU/local cGMDP requirements and Kyowa Kirin QA Policies/Procedures.
Prepare and maintain Technical (Quality) Agreements with third party organisations involved in the QMS so that roles and responsibilities between the contracted parties are clearly defined and implemented.
Ensure appropriate change control system is in place and lead change controls following quality risk management principles in order to ensure the is change be proportionate and effective.
Lead investigation of deviations, ensure appropriate CAPAs and all is properly documented.
Ensure appropriate corrective and preventive actions (CAPA) process is in place in order to correct deviations and prevent them in line with the principles of quality risk management.
Closely liaise with local and international internal (e.g. KKS) and external stakeholders.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Degree in life science or equivalent with preference of a minimum of 3 to 5 years' experience.
Specialist knowledge and experience of pharmaceutical QMS processes and practices.
Firm knowledge of GDP and GMP
Experience of working within the pharmaceutical industry operating in a Quality Assurance position at a manufacturing/distribution site.
Good working knowledge of GxPs and international QMS GxPs, especially in the interpretation of EU and FDA requirements, for the manufacture, control and distribution of commercial product and clinical trial materials
Effectively working with cross-functional teams at local/international level.
Dutch and English language - both verbal and written.


BENEFITS:

In return for your talent, we will provide support through smart working, adopting best practice, deploying the latest technology and ongoing personal development. Plus:

Competitive salary
Bonus
Pension scheme

At Boston Scientific, you will find a collaborative culture driven by a passion for innovation that keeps us connected on the most essential level. With determination, imagination and a deep caring for human life, we’re solving some of the most important healthcare industry challenges. Together, we’re one global team committed to making a difference in people’s lives around the world. This is a place where you can find a career with meaningful purpose—improving lives through your life’s work.
Boston Scientific Electrophysiology (EP)
Electrophysiology is a fastgrowing specialization in Cardiology with many new technologies and treatment options being introduced. The Boston Scientific EP portfolio exists of EP recording and pacing systems (LabSystemPro & MicroPace), cathethers (Bard & Blazer), Advanced 3D mapping Ultra-High-Density system and cathethers (Rhythmia), and Cryoablation system (POLARx). The portfolio continues to expand. In order to meet the need for our growing business in The Netherlands, we are looking for a Field Clinical Specialist Electrophysiology to complement our team of Account Managers and other Field Clinical Specialists
Purpose Statement:
The FCS EP will provide expert clinical product and technical assistance and training to physicians, EP Lab Staff, and sales representatives on the effective and safe use of the Rhythmia System during case procedures within an assigned geography, and in a manner that leads to meeting and exceeding business goals.
Key Responsibilities:
Serves as primary resource for clinical support in the areas of case coverage, basic troubleshooting, system/software development for Boston Scientific EP systems and catheters.
Educates customers and internal BSC employees on the merits and proper clinical usage of Rhythmia by giving presentations and demonstrations using a wide variety of formats and platforms (e.g., slides, transparencies, manuals) to keep all abreast of the latest product and technology developments for Rhythmia system.
Attends cases in labs of hospital accounts for case support and development efforts of Rhythmia system and it's components.
Providing initial and continuous, as needed, training and feedback for development team and sales representatives (as appropriate) on Rhythmia system, development process, products and features, and procedures involving those products and features.
Meets with existing and potential clients (e.g., physicians, physician office groups at hospitals) by traveling (in an automobile or airplane) to identify their clinical needs, goals, and constraints related to patient care and to discuss and demonstrate how company products can help them to achieve their goals.
Develops relationships with hospital personnel (e.g. through meaningful conversation, meetings, participation in conferences) to make new contacts in other departments within hospital and to identify key decision makers in order to facilitate future sales.
Responds to customer needs and complaints regarding products and service by developing creative and feasible solutions or working with other related personnel (e.g., sales, clinical research, marketing, technical support) to develop optimal solutions.
Will be required to maintain advanced clinical knowledge of cardiac ablation, cardiac ablation components, technical knowledge of EP technology, advancements, and business landscape.
With the portfolio expanding we typically assign each FCS with a Expert-A role for a specific system or product line or activity, while achieving full working experience on the whole portfolio.
This role will require significant travel in the Netherlands
Position Requirements:
Mapping experience:
2-5 years of independent usage of existing 3D cardiac mapping/EP recording system or
3-5 years of competitive EP clinical experience or
6-10 years in cardiac related clinical field
Knowledge of CRM/EP market preferred
Strong communication skills
Ability to understand and communicate complex technical and clinical details
Fluent in English.
Able to rapidly adapt to a very dynamic marketplace
Strong team player, collaborative, ability to build relationships and work cross-functionally
Self-motivated and able to influence others
Flexible, adaptable but focused and persistent
Willing and able to perform significant day travel in the Netherlands by workload
About us
As a global medical technology leader for more than 35 years, our mission at Boston Scientific (NYSE: BSX) is to transform lives through innovative medical solutions that improve the health of patients. If you’re looking to truly make a difference to people both around the world and around the corner, there’s no better place to make it happen.

We are looking for a Business Development Manager for our Formed Fiber business unit. You will be working in the Packaging Solutions Division and you will report to the Sales & Marketing Director of Formed Fiber. Location: Sweden, Germany, the Netherlands, Belgium or Luxembourg.

At Stora Enso's we believe that "Everything that’s made with fossil-based materials today can be made from a tree tomorrow". This vision applies in full to Stora Enso's new business unit Formed Fiber.

At Formed Fiber we produce ready-made formed fiber products and packages from wood pulp. With the production technology we use we can achieve most 3d shapes and many of the same mechanical and functional properties as for plastics. In the last two years alone, formed fiber has substituted hundreds of millions of plastic components in the consumer electronics and food service markets. We now see the interest in formed fiber spread to a much wider field of applications where the market potential is counted in billions of units. The goals of the Formed Fiber team at Stora Enso is to capitalize on this opportunity by quickly scaling up capacity, research new technologies and commercialize new applications to become a leader in this market.

As Business Development Manager you will have an important role for us to succeed with our goal.

The Role

Your main responsibility will be to generate rapid sales growth with new and large clients in Europe, and according to Formed Fiber strategy. Your main tasks will be to:
Initiate and manage meetings and long-term relationships with brand owners, packaging producers and distributors, often on C-level managementEvaluate technical and commercial feasibility of new business development projectsWork closely with Project Manager and to manage the commercial interface with clients from initial contact, throughout the project and until closureCo-ordinate and align projects with other functions in the teamPromote Stora Enso and Formed Fiber at webinars, seminars and exhibitions

What We Offer

As Business Development Manager at Formed Fiber you will work in a fast-paced startup environment with the backing and infrastructure of a large global corporation. Today we are around twenty dedicated employees and in Hylte, Sweden, we have built and started production of ready-made products and packages in formed fiber. End of last year we launched our first and new to the world packaging in the food service segment. With tight communication, co-operation and lots of fun we work together to succeed with a rapid growth plan and to become a leader in the market of formed fiber based products. Come join us leading this development!

Qualifications

In order to succeed in this role, you have a MSc in Engineering and/or Business, combined with 3-5 years of relevant experience. You are used to leading a consultative sales process with larger accounts and have a successful track-record of initiating and closing new business. You have excellent relationship building skills towards colleagues and customers. You enjoy working in a fast pace environment, meeting tight dead-lines, and are good at managing your own time. You have the ability to work independently as well as in close collaboration with a team. To succeed you need an entrepreneurial spirit, a great eye for quality, a sense of humour and a curious mind. You have excellent English written and oral communication skills in both technical and business environments. Additional languages are an advantage. The role requires travelling.

 Customer needs: We are passionate about supporting our customers to meet their targets by understanding the customer needs and developing our team based on customer awareness. Business acumen: We are committed to executing our strategy and lead based on facts. We continuously improve by turning ideas into value and support new business opportunities.Do what’s right: We stand up for our values and treat all fairly and respectfully. We are active in taking responsibility and hold all accountable for ensuring that our operations are socially and ethically responsible. Inspire & motivate: We trust and empower each other. We develop ambitious and inspiring high performing teams. We set clear targets, communicate openly and give constructive feedback and recognition.People management: We promote diverse teams with clear roles and responsibilities. We create a learning organization by helping each other to grow.

Your new job and office
 As Loyalty Program Manager, you have excellent program management and reporting skills to implement loyalty initiatives successfully across all Ahold Delhaize brands.
As Loyalty Program Manager, you will be leading the rollout of regional loyalty initiatives based on the global next-gen loyalty strategy of Ahold Delhaize. In more detail: based on our strategic global loyalty framework, you will drive and lead the implementation of our loyalty initiatives across all our brands. You will be working on implementing KPIs, measuring success and managing various stakeholders within our brands and externally. You are a hands-on leader with experience in a large and complex organization and you have the enthusiasm to manage and accelerate various loyalty initiatives across all our local brands. You will be in direct daily contact with the loyalty teams of all our brands who are responsible for the loyalty programs at the local brand and at the market level.
As Loyalty Program Manager,you will make an impact at Ahold Delhaize by:
leading and driving local Loyalty teams through their strategic transformations and set out clear goals for the development of loyalty capabilities.
managing the entire implementation of innovative, multidisciplinary and cross-regional projects or programs from discovery to kick-off to launch and monitoring and supporting the performance on the loyalty implementations across our brands in accordance with the agreed upon KPIs.
supporting the introduction of a regional loyalty blueprint across our brands based on a single, scalable, white-label and multi-functional platform for web and app.
developing trusted, long-term relationships with key strategic vendors and stakeholders within our brand’s Loyalty teams. You become their go-to resource by asking the right questions, sharing insights, connecting them with required resources and being a visible and influential presence.
continuously exploring innovative ideas and trends to enhance your outside-in perspectives, but also to keep spotting opportunities to learn, do things better and to grow.
What do we offer?
As Loyalty Program Manager, you will be working at Ahold Delhaize. Approximately 370,000 employees worldwide serve over 50 million customers a week. On a somewhat smaller scale, you will be working with 1,500 colleagues in Zaandam, the Netherlands. By working together to improve every day and through innovation, we reinforce our role as a leader in retail and e-commerce. This is also how we build on trusted local brands. Strong brands that offer a great deal of knowledge, experience, and impact.
You will find your new workplace at our bustling head office, next to Zaandam train station. More specifically, on the 8th floor of the Global Support Office (GSO) in the Digital Engagement department. This department is responsible for digital marketing, personalization, loyalty and monetization at Ahold Delhaize and across all our brands. However, due to COVID-19, we currently still work from home as much as possible.
Everything you do with your colleagues is directly visible in our stores and for people at home. Curious who you will be working with? You will be part of the Loyalty team and you will report to the Loyalty Director. Together with your colleagues, you deliver value-driving and rewarding customer experiences to our loyal customers across all our global brands. Most of our brands already have loyalty programs. However, these need to be optimized to keep up with ever-changing customer expectations and competing offers from competitors. To get the job done you will work hand-in-hand with local Brand Loyalty teams and several internal departments such as Global and European expert teams in Digital Experience, Data & Analytics, IT, Security, Legal, Communications and Finance, and also with external vendors such as IT solution partners.
What we offer.
Here at Ahold Delhaize, we aim to grow. This is only possible if you grow along with us. That’s why we help you take your career and personal development in the direction you want to go. As we work together to build on our brand as well as your career, you can count on (based on 40 hours per week):
a gross monthly salary of up to €6000,-
flexible working hours and the option to work from home.
an excellent pension plan with an employee contribution of 6.2%.
reimbursement for travel expenses to and from Zaandam.
twenty vacation days.
a personal budget for you to decide whether to spend it on extra vacation days, discounts or a payout.
a bonus on top of your salary.
attractive discounts on various insurance policies.
a laptop and phone.
a 10%-discount on your groceries at our Albert Heijn stores up to €300 per year.
regular fun events, and delectable samplings with free products.
Requirements
At Ahold Delhaize, you’ll be working for one of the biggest retailers in the world. You are bursting with ambition to keep up with us. And specifically for this vacancy as a Loyalty Program Manager, you are a thought leader on rolling out global customer loyalty initiatives and you have excellent program management and reporting skills. You supplement these skills with:
a master's or MBA degree in a relevant field such as digital marketing.
between 8 and 10 years of work experience in retail, loyalty or any other relevant service within a global environment. Native experience within Europe is considered a plus.
program management experience and delivering best in class globally scalable customer loyalty initiatives.
experience implementing loyalty programs across different countries, cultures, regions and customer demands.
extensive experience setting up loyalty and personalization strategies and initiatives from scratch, then driving them to conclusion with multiple stakeholders to deliver consistent and relevant offers to loyal customers.
the ability to notice and adapt quickly to fast changing customer needs and technology.
the ability to create and continuously improve integral roadmaps of loyalty initiatives consisting of go-to markets, key enablers and measurement technologies.

LIFE AT IMC AS MARKETING MANAGER (LOCAL)
WHO WE ARE AND WHAT WE DO
IMC is a leading global market maker, using algorithmic trading and advanced technology to buy and sell securities on multiple trading venues worldwide. We provide liquidity to the financial markets, driving efficiencies for buyers and sellers.
Founded in 1989, we are an ambitious, innovative company and identified early on the importance technology would play in the fast-paced evolution of trading. This entrepreneurial spirit still drives us today and can be found in all of our offices around the world.
OUR TEAM
We now operate globally from offices in Europe, the US and Asia Pacific. Our employees work closely together in multidisciplinary teams, making our success possible.
Technology - At IMC, technology is not a department, it is at the heart of everything we do. Our technologists push the limits of possibility, and then look beyond. In our fast-paced environment, short feedback loops mean projects worked on in the morning can enter production the next day.
Trading – Although our traders come from many backgrounds they all have one thing in common: they are at their best solving complex problems. Their insight into global events, market shifts and pricing ensure we are trading in the right place, at the right time.
Business Support - Around the world, IMC’s business support teams are essential for sustaining our success. In our dynamic environment, we have many exciting challenges and multidisciplinary opportunities to shape our operations and make a real impact.
OUR CULTURE
Our employees are our greatest asset so we give them lots of responsibility and the support they need to make a difference. Our flat structure fosters a culture of openness and collaboration, encouraging the sharing of ideas and knowledge. It makes no difference if you have been with us for three days or three years, the best idea wins.
While we work hard, we also have a lot of fun; whether solving complex challenges or in team building, leisure and sporting activities. IMC also enables its employees to contribute towards a better society through our foundation.
WHAT YOU WILL DO:
As the Marketing Manager you will primarily help grow brand awareness and familiarity among potential new recruits, attracting qualified leads worldwide. You will make sure that the absolute top talents in Tech and Trading know who we are and why IMC is a great place to work. Always ready to take the next step, you’ll get lots of responsibility, support and freedom to make an impact, in a culture where you can dare to imagine how things could be and make it happen.
Partnering with the HR/ Recruitment team, Digital Marketing Specialist, Marketing Managers from others IMC offices and Global Head of Marketing, you will manage all local marketing initiatives. Your main focus will be recruitment marketing; you will be in the lead for all campus and experienced-hire recruitment including events (in-house, campus, online), EDMs, careers site upkeep and merchandising management. Besides that, you will be taking on internal marketing projects as well as marketing around our sales activities and team.


This role is both strategic as well as operational, some specific tasks and responsibilities:

You will be the guardian of the IMC brand, ensuring it is used in all our marketing activities, both internal and external;
You will work closely with our recruitment team and external parties to develop and execute online (and other) lead generating brand & recruitment campaigns as well as other marketing communication activities to increase brand awareness;
You will create the yearly and quarterly (strategic) marketing plan, manage the campaign budget and lead the analysis of KPIs and ROIs;
Social media strategy, creating, curating and communicating content across all IMC platforms (Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn etc.)
IMC merchandising coordination, driving and upholding branding guidelines
Creation and management of all digital and physical campus hiring collateral.
Improving online applicant and click-through quality
Investigation of new platforms and hidden talent pools
Internal communication equipping management and our recruiters with a view of campaign success and candidate reach
Creation of campaigns, events and collateral that supports our Options Trading Desk
WHO YOU ARE:
7+ years of working experience in (partly) similar role.
A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree preferably in Communications, Digital Communication, or Marketing.
Experience with development of recruitment campaigns
A proven ability to pivot between hands-on creation and managing long-term projects
A versatile collaboration and relationship-building toolkit
A strong communicator; you’ll be talking to some of society’s smartest people through conversation, event invitations, EDMs, internal comms and social posts
Mixing it up with competing deadlines and campaigns, in an environment where things move and improve very quickly.
Experience with using best practices to manage digital platforms and measuring the success of social media, website and marketing activities (analytical).
Fluency in both written and spoken English.
Get things done mentality
Willingness to travel
OUR HIRING PROCESS
To set you up for success, you can find our hiring process including tips on applying and interviewing with us on our website . Now it’s up to you! Apply today to start an amazing journey with IMC.

About Dexcom
Dexcom, Inc. empowers people to take control of diabetes through innovative continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) systems. Headquartered in San Diego, California, Dexcom has emerged as a leader of diabetes care technology. By listening to the needs of users, caregivers, and providers, Dexcom simplifies and improves diabetes management around the world.
Summary
We’re on a mission to bring the benefits of our life-changing CGM systems to even more patients around the world. That is why we’re looking for a Market Access Manager to help us open up new markets across the EMEA region.
What is involved?
The EMEA market access team drives activities for strategic plans and opportunities to open markets for new products as well as expanding into new market segments and geographies. They lead research and analysis of the market in terms of coverage and reimbursement, existing and emerging payer policies, competitive landscape, trends, pricing, contracting strategies, potential barriers to provider and patient access. They provide information and support to engage with key opinion leaders, pertaining to improved outcomes and public policy matters.
As a Lead market access specialist, you will be an integral part of the EMEA market access team and participate in EMEA wide strategy development and projects. You will also be responsible for developing, and overseeing implementation of market access strategies and tactics for dedicated geographies within EMEA, including stakeholder engagement strategies and tactics to drive the funding and uptake of Dexcom products, HTA submissions, value based contracting strategies etc as applicable. You will be working closely with the Global and International Access teams to establish appropriate evidence and documentation including health economic data and arguments to be used for reimbursement and product positioning, and communication to and with third party payers, government entities and other market access partners, e.g. Government Affairs.
This role is a great opportunity make a profound difference to the lives of people living with diabetes, by helping us make Dexcom products available to the millions of people who could benefit from our CGM technology.
What you’ll need
Education and experience in a relevant field, e.g. health economics, health policy, public health
Knowledge of market access for diabetes products or related medical devices
Experience of the medical device industry
Experience with HTA submission in larger European markets is useful
Business/marketing or sales experience and the ability to link this insight to funding and reimbursement in-market
Fluency in English. Fluence in another European language is a plus
Experience of working and contributing within in a matrix organisation, including global and national MA teams
Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of organization
Functional Description: Professional Individual Contributor
Supports activities for strategic plans and opportunities to open markets for new products. Researches and conducts analysis of the market in terms of coverage and reimbursement, existing and emerging payer policies, competitive landscape, trends, pricing, contracting strategies, potential barriers to provider and patient access. Provides information and support to influence key opinion leaders, pertaining to improved outcomes and public policy matters.
Experience and Education Requirements
Typically requires a Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 8-12 years of related experience. At this level a graduate degree may be desirable with 4 years of related experience.
Travel Required
25 to 50%
Functional/Business Knowledge
Having wide-ranging experience and uses professional concepts and knowledge of company objectives to resolve complex issues in creative and effective ways.
Possesses knowledge of advanced concepts, techniques, and standards.
Viewed as expert in the field within the Function.

Are you an experienced supply chain coordinator and do you want to make a difference to people’s life?
For our location Haarlem we are looking for a
Specialist Demand Management & Fulfillment
for the Core team
Welcome in our team
Our Supply Chain team ensures inventory is consistently available to meet customer demand. We coordinate all aspects of supply through supply planning, sourcing, making, inventory management, packaging and delivery. We partner across the Marketing, Finance and Manufacturing organizations to build a robust demand and supply plan and ensure we get products to the right customer, at the place, at the right time.
International Services is part of the EMEA Supply Chain Hub, managing Fulfilment and Demand Management in the sub-regions, Europe, B2B, Middle East and Africa.
The position
Reporting to the Associate Director or Manager Demand Management & Fulfillment, the DM&F Specialist is primarily responsible to monitor and enable compliant, continuous and timely supply to internal and external customers. In addition, the DM&F Specialist is responsible for certain tasks that are typically beyond market/customer.
The DM&F Specialist builds and maintains relationships with the assigned customers and with the relevant internal stakeholders such as Site Planning, Site Logistics, E2E Planning, Global Logistics, Finance and Quality.
The DM&F Specialist acts as primary contact for the customer. He/she takes care of forecast and order management, coordinates supply of product and related services and looks after inventory management. This is all done with the objective to reach maximum customer satisfaction, at optimal cost, ensuring the best possible supply chain performance in compliance with established guidelines and procedures.
In addition, the DM&F Specialist, based on solid SCM process and system expertise, plays a role in activities that go beyond market/customer level, such as supply constraint resolution, data analysis, continuous improvement, projects and some training and coaching.
Main responsibilities
Primary activities include, but are not necessarily limited to:
Acting as primary contact of internal customer(s) or external B2B customer(s) in regards of demand from and supply to this/these customer(s) and ensure adequate communication with them.
Ensuring timely receipt and correct processing of forecast & orders from customers.
Coordinating regular supply-related activities to enable compliant and timely supply and detecting and mitigating supply risk and identifying and resolving supply issues for your accounts.
Monitoring inventory levels.
Taking care of and improving standard reporting (e.g. metrics regarding demand, supply, master data and inventory)
Acting as subject matter expert in own area, participating in Community of Practice.
Contributing to continuous improvement of own tasks, for own accounts and/or for department.
Regularly, actively contributing to projects and initiatives. Leading projects of relatively low complexity and size.
Training and coaching of other DM&F (Associate) Specialists.
Qualifications
Preferably a Bachelor’s degree or proven equivalent work experience in a related business area (Supply Chain, Customer Service, Project Management, Logistics, Planning, Procurement or equivalent)
At least 5 years of experience in supply chain in the pharmaceutical industry
Solid analytical skills for independent problem solving of relatively straightforward issues and more complex problems with support.
Proactive, taking initiative and speaking up regarding own market/account management and regarding how own area operates.
Communication fluency in English, both verbal and in writing, at all levels. Presentation skills for smaller groups predominantly in own area.
Advanced understanding of DM&F systems and process such as COMET and Rapid Response.; basic understanding of processes and systems in adjacent areas.
Solid understanding of working in a GxP environment.
Stakeholder management, teamwork and collaboration: Adequate skills, applied at various levels and across functional areas.
Leadership Behaviors: Good understanding of these behaviors and ability to apply them for own market/accounts and in own team (and occasionally also to adjacent areas). Strong customer focus.
Ways of Working: Good and developing understanding of WoW mindsets and behaviors, ability to demonstrated some of them regularly.
Diversity and Inclusion: Good understanding of and ability to apply our inclusive behaviors.
Business and Finance acumen: Understand impact of own area's activities within SCM and impact on adjacent functional groups. Good understanding of financial supply chains and product cost.
Attention to details and accuracy, while keeping an eye on the bigger picture.

Ekata provides global identity verification via enterprise-grade APIs and a SaaS solution. Our product suite is powered by Ekata Identity Engine, the first and only cross-border identity engine of its kind. It uses complex machine learning algorithms across the five consumer attributes of email, phone, name, physical address, and IP to derive unique data links and features from billions of real-time transactions within our customer network and the globally sourced data of our graph. Businesses around the world including Alipay, Stripe, Airbnb, and Microsoft leverage our solutions to approve more good transactions, reduce friction, and find fraud.

As an Infrastructure Vulnerability Specialist you will work as a member of the vulnerability management team responsible for reducing Booking.com’s attack surface.

Vulnerability Management being under Security Operations umbrella, The Security Operations track covers a range of security disciplines from vulnerability management, access control, alert and response management through to measurement and reporting of the organisation's security posture. As a member of this team you will participate in the defence of one of the world's leading e-commerce organisations and have the opportunity to learn and develop skills in a truly world leading security practice.

B.responsible

Support identification of vulnerabilities by enhancing vulnerability identification at process and technology level.
Own and manage infrastructure vulnerability scanning process and tools and align with vulnerability identification KPIs.
Support identification, triaging, assignment and remediation of vulnerabilities ensuring that vulnerability management lifecycle is followed.
Timely respond to security threats by collaboration with other security teams and provide effective remediation solution complemented by compensatory controls.
Perform validation of moderately to highly complex security reports.
Provide data driven insights into improvement opportunities for infrastructure vulnerability management process.
Prepare reports for technical teams, compliance deliverables and executive management highlighting current status of infrastructure from vulnerability management perspective.
Work with engineering teams for effective patch management by providing highly customised reports and vulnerability metrics.
Provide support for infrastructure penetration testing.
Drive the remediation process to ensure vulnerable assets are patched or remediated within agreed SLAs
Proactively research new methods, tools, and strategies to effectively identify vulnerabilities

B.skilled

5+ years working in security practices
Advanced level of understanding regarding systems hardening , security configuration baselines at both technical and procedural level
Advanced level of understanding of infrastructure vulnerability scanning tools e.g network, cloud, container and image scanning solutions
Demonstrate a strong interest and understanding of cloud security concepts.
Experience with implementing a cloud-based container vulnerability scanning tool
Experience with Docker and Kubernetes environment with good understanding of container and image vulnerability remediation processes
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills in order to share knowledge and to communicate effectively with different stakeholders (IT and business partners)
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience
Relevant industry certification i.e SANS
Excellent communication skills, good analytical and negotiation skills, close attention to detail required.
Demonstrated adaptability to change, customer focus, continuous learning, and problem solving required

B.offered

Living and working in Amsterdam, one of the most cosmopolitan cities in Europe
Contributing to a high scale, complex, world renowned product and seeing real-time impact of your work on millions of travellers worldwide
Working in a fast-paced and performance driven culture
Opportunity to utilize technical expertise, leadership capabilities and entrepreneurial spirit
Promote and drive impactful and innovative engineering solutions
Technical, behavioural and interpersonal competence advancement via on-the-job opportunities, experimental projects, hackathons, conferences and active community participation
Competitive compensation and benefits package and some great added perks of working in the home city of Booking.com

Het restaurant Bridges richt zich voornamelijk op gerechten met vis en biedt een verrassend, internationaal à la carte menu en Chef’s menu. Chef de Cuisine Raoul Meuwese omschrijft zijn gerechten als “klassieke Franse creaties, met internationale invloeden en een moderne twist”.

Een bijzonder aspect van Bridges is de Chef’s Table. Met een groep van maximaal 6 personen kunt u in het hart van de keuken van dichtbij genieten van alle kunsten van de keukenbrigade.

Daarnaast beschikt Bridges over een prachtige private dining ruimte achterin het restaurant. Hier kunt u genieten van een intiem privé diner met een eigen cocktailstation, sigarenkabinet en een selectie speciale whisky’s. De private dining is geschikt voor groepen tot 12 personen.

Naast Bridges is er ook nog onze Oriole Garden Bistro. Oriole is een informele, ontspannen bistro dat een van de meest geliefde en erkende keukens ter wereld viert; de mediterrane keuken. Het seizoensgebonden menu bevat herkenbare mediterrane gerechten die gekenmerkt worden door eenvoud, karakter en smaak.

Geniet van een heerlijke aperitivo op het terras, een snelle lunch of een uitgebreid mediterraan diner met een grote groep vrienden in het relaxte en uitnodigende interieur, dat u meevoert naar de mediterrane kust met haar weelderig groene omgeving.

This is Adyen

We took an unobvious approach to starting a payments company, building a platform from scratch. Today, we're the payments platform of choice for the world's brightest companies. Our unobvious approach is a product of our diverse perspectives. This diversity, of backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives, is essential in helping us maintain our momentum. Our business challenges are unique, we need as many different voices as possible to join us in solving them - voices like yours. So no matter where you're from, who you love, or what you believe in, we welcome you to be your true self at Adyen.

Technical Account Specialist - German Speaker

You will operate as a first interface with Adyen's merchants across the globe. The cool thing is that you're directly working with the (technical) teams of our amazing merchant base. Changes you make for them have direct impact on their ability to take payments and further grow their – business. In order to do this, you will be working closely with multiple different teams, such as Sales, Account Management and Product Development.

Your team is extremely merchant-focused, highly motivated and thrives on shared success. You will be part of an international team with diverse backgrounds and skill sets. With Adyen being a 24/7 business we operate throughout time zones using a follow the sun principal. The extensive payments knowledge of the team is the most valuable aspect both to our merchants as our internal teams.

What you'll do

You are responsible for the merchants' full lifecycle (integration, expansion and operational excellence).
Be an internal product advocate, track product processes and contribute to the platform feeding back feedback and issues you get back from merchants.
Advising merchants regarding the best implementation practices and also address specific merchants' issues.
Be a key source of knowledge on the Adyen platform and APIs, the underlying technologies, and industry-standard integration methods and best practices.
Work on internal projects that will help scale the international support team within Adyen.
Who you are:
You are innovative, have strong problem-solving capabilities and able to adapt to new processes and procedures quickly, while dealing with many varied technical support requests and challenges.
You are self-driven, flexible, and have the ability to maintain high levels of productivity with minimal supervision.
You've had previous exposure to environments rich in uncertainty and you show a resulting track record of successfully dealing with ambiguity.
You make quick informed decisions under pressure and prioritize appropriately based on urgency, necessity and both internal and external requests.
You have affinity with internet technologies and knowledge of technical processes (think SQL / HTML / JavaScript / PHP / Java / Scripting).
You have native, bilingual or full professional proficiency (written and verbal) in English and German.

Who we are

Adyen is the payments platform of choice for the world's leading companies, delivering frictionless payments across online, mobile and in-store channels. It is the only provider of a modern end-to-end infrastructure, connecting directly to Visa, Mastercard, and consumers' globally preferred payment methods. With offices around the world, Adyen serves nine of the 10 largest U.S. internet companies and many worldwide retailers. Customers include Facebook, Uber, L'Oreal, Evernote, Cathay Pacific and Spotify.

We offer a competitive salary, knowledge sharing internal events, exchange program to other offices and great career opportunities. Become part of an international work environment and take your career to the next level!

Job Title: Organon – Senior Pharmacovigilance & Regulatory Affairs Specialist
Job Description:
We have an exciting opportunity for a
Senior Pharmacovigilance & Regulatory Affairs Specialist based in Haarlem
Job Description
As a Senior Pharmacovigilance (PV) and Regulatory Affairs (RA) Specialist you will be responsible for all PV and RA requirements and overseeing PV activities for the entire product portfolio as applicable. You will collaborate with colleagues to ensure compliance with local laws and regulationswhich may include but are not limited to: review and provide input for local PV and RA agreements, local due diligence activities, participation in audits and inspections and related readiness activities, review of local initiatives for compliance with PV requirements streamline and improve processes, training, communication of safety issues, developing product registration plans and strategies. You will report directly to the PV and RA Country Lead.
Main responsibilities but not limited to;
Develop local product registration plans and keep oversight of the local ongoing maintenance activities.
Build and maintain the departments infrastructure to ensure compliance to Global Pharmacovigilance and Regulatory Affairs procedures and country regulations.
Strategise (annually) and execute local literature review in close cooperation with medical department
Ensure compliance to all Pharmacovigilance obligations deriving from local agreements with Business Partners and Vendors
Responsible for execution of local PV and RA processes and activities in alignment with PV and RA systems and their associated Quality Management System, following department SOPs, company Policies and Procedures and country legislation
Plan and Lead submission of new Marketing Authorization Applications to local Health Authorities, maintenance of authorized products through timely submission of post-market regulatory dossiers, including but not limited to variations, renewal applications and supplemental marketing authorizations in accordance with local regulations and global standards
Provides support for Patient Support Programs (PSP) and/or Market Research vendor(s) related activities, as applicable
Files, stores and archives safety-related and regulatory data and documentation in accordance with department and company policies and local requirements.
Acts in full compliance with global and local SOPs and reports any deviations or compliance concerns immediately and assists in preparing necessary corrective actions and preventative actions (CAPAs) locally for non-compliance issues.
Supports local PV audits and inspections including readiness activities and supports other audits/inspections including the development of CAPAs in response to findings/observations.
Supports training of the local company staff, distributors, vendors, business partners including training documentation.
Backing up colleagues and adjusting time schedule in such that there is no cap in adverse event reporting
Your profile
Health, life science, or medical science degree or equivalent by education
Minimum of 3-5 years of industry experience in pharmacovigilance and regulatory affairs
Must have a general knowledge of both PV/RA regulations within his/her assigned country and be an expert in PV & RA processes/activities.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to influence decision making.
Good time management skills
Fluent in English and Dutch (written and spoken)
For questions about this vacancy
Please send an email including the vacancy number and job title to the following email address: RecruitmentNL@MSD.com.
You can send your application including motivation letter in English via our website.
We offer
We welcome you to a truly global, dynamic and challenging environment with great opportunities for personal development. Our benefits are very competitive and the summary below will give you an idea of what you can expect.
Competitive salary and a 3% year-end bonus;
35,5 days of leave;
Attractive collective health care insurance package with considerable reduction rates;
Solid Pension Plan;
AIP Plan;
Travel allowance
Numerous training, coaching and e-learning modules for long term job opportunities and development.
Who we are
We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.
What we look for
In a world of rapid innovation, we seek brave Inventors who want to make an Impact in all aspects of our business, enabling breakthroughs that will affect generations to come. We encourage you to bring your disruptive thinking, collaborative spirit and diverse perspective to our organization. Together we will continue Inventing For Life, Impacting Lives while Inspiring Your Career Growth.
INVENT.
IMPACT.
INSPIRE.

Collaborates with a variety of local and global functions within our company and with external partners.

Main responsibilities but not limited to;
Reporting to the Commercial Operations & Digital AD, the CRM/IT/Digital Infrastructure Specialist will:
Develop and deliver on the CRM vision and roadmap, focussing on CRM initiatives to drive customer centricity
Work in collaboration with regional and global Veeva Centres of Excellence to ensure Benelux cluster alignment with our CRM/Veeva strategy and implementation
Provide support to the business to ensure all CRM initiatives are implemented effectively/efficiently to achieve objectives
As first point of contact for end-users, lead the day-to-day management, maintenance and optimisation of the value of CRM/Veeva system and content, including use of Veeva modules, maintenance of customer data and standard or ad hoc reporting
Ensure all technical and process requirements and structure changes are implemented and up to date within the CRM system
Work in collaboration with Digital Operations colleagues, Digital Consumer Activation Manager and BCM’s to support the capture and analysis of Multi-Channel interactions and respond to the changing environment by providing the latest technologies available
Liaise with suppliers of relevant systems and provide feedback to the cross-functional teams in order to keep track of digital evolutions and stay in tune with customer and CRM requirements
Deliver training and engagement plan to ensure all users can effectively use the system
Manage CRM Digital and Data Processing to support analytics, tracking of KPI’s and reporting
Build strong relationships with internal stakeholders to maintain understanding of business priorities and customer requirements, including specifics for each Benelux cluster market, and customer updates focussed on evolving target audiences
Understand CRM compliance with Data Protection and Privacy Laws (GDPR) and act in accordance with these when conducting CRM activities
Understand our Benelux product and service portfolio and stay abreast of current strategic priorities that may need to be supported within the CRM system
Understand the broader health landscape and customer environment, ensure capture of relevant customers and their details in the CRM system.
 Your profile

Panda International - A job with a purpose!
There are only a few sectors that are currently in the same spotlight as the Life Sciences Sector is. Panda International offers you an opportunity to make an impact on both your own career and the lives of billions of people. Quite a statement, right?!
Panda International works with both biotech companies that are currently working non-stop in the race against time to deliver the COVID-19 vaccine, the global pharmaceutical & medical device companies, and growth companies that are working on the greatest innovations within the market!
“Human Capital” is the biggest challenge in the world's fastest growing industry, and this is where you make a difference: you help recruit recruiters who place professionals at the pharmaceutical, biotechnology or medical device companies to help them at every stage of the process and to help them achieve their goals! We expect to double in size in the next 12 months, so if you want to make an impact, now is the time!
Panda International is the Life Science Recruitment specialist in the Benelux but is also growing strongly in other European countries. The USA is also in sight! You will work in a fast-growing, ambitious organization in which your development and growth are central.
A company in which you are responsible for your own market, in which clear goals are set and you have the flexibility to achieve them through our flexible working hours and you choose whether you work (partly) from the office or from home.
Your Role
As a Talent Acquisition Specialist, you make a difference by attracting top talent - you enable yourself to look beyond just a resume but finding the right 'attitude' and 'mindset' determines the long-term success of Panda International. You do a combination of headhunting, marketing and networking.

Going through the entire recruitment cycle: a mix of - warm – headhunting passive candidates and networking to identify the best candidates.

Think strategically with the organization.

Visiting and organizing (online)events.

You strive to excel.

Monthly incentives.
A job where you are encouraged to get the best out of yourself.
Fantastic office in the centre of Amsterdam.
Paid Gym, Blinkist & Headspace
Shares in the business for our top performers.
