Company Description

Our Mission
At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission:
Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life.
We have the vision of a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. These aren’t easy goals to accomplish – but we’re not here for easy. We’re here for better. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity and our organisation as we are.

Job Description

Your Career
We are looking for a Sr HR Tech & Reporting Specialist to join our EMEA People Operations Team and be part of our growth trajectory. As a People Team, we are responsible for fostering an amazing workplace and culture that empowers everyone to do their best work. You will work closely with different teams and support different initiatives of the business with special focus on HR operations related data analysis, reporting and systems related projects. We believe in the importance of supporting our employees throughout their employee journey with Palo Alto Networks. Especially in today's world of changing demands and needs, we are looking for a new colleague who understands the value of employee focused and tailored technology solutions.

Your Impact
Collect, compile and analyse a variety of employee information and reports to gather meaningful insights. Present these findings and offer recommendations to leadership.
Make data based recommendations regarding policies, system enhancement and employee & business initiatives to improve current processes, the organizational set up and culture and to maintain compliance with data privacy regulations and best practices.
Assess current system utilization; identify and recommend improvements such as people team, stakeholder and employee training, customization, and enhancements to maximize value and efficiency of Workday and Service Now.
Identify and utilise functions such as automated queries, filters, macros, and reports.
Drive planning, modifying, and customization of Workday and Service Now (other systems), establishing test design in close collaboration with stakeholders and HRIS and guide new application testing.
Prepare training material, guides, and documentation to provide user training and hands-on support.
Maintain knowledge of trends and developments for data analysis & system set ups.
Ensure system compliance with data security and privacy requirements.
Oversee and support multiple and concurrent ad hoc requests, projects, or other duties as assigned
Being part of the HR Operations team, contribute to the decrease in backlog of employee inquiries to both identify process opportunities and to ensure quick resolution for employees
Drive the optimisation and improvement of operational processes and systems
Work closely with HR Operations Manager to provide the business with insights based on inquiry volume
Partner with other HR teams to coordinate workflow, processes, and communication with key stakeholders; ensure seamless hand-off of processes and deliverables and establish best practices
Act as thought partner and expert problem solver for stakeholders within the People team utilising your conceptual approach, project management skills and expertise with systems, reporting tools and data.
Collaborate with People Business Partners and other HR functions to deliver end-to-end business projects from operational perspective
Build strong relationships with People Business Partners and Centres of Excellence (COEs) to execute the delivery of cyclical HR processes
Completes all other HR data & transaction requests as needed
Maintain and protect confidential data with great discretion

Qualifications

Your Experience
BA/BS degree or equivalent and 8+ years of progressive experience with HR Operations, HR Business systems and HR reporting in a technology organization or technology-related business, preferably with a multinational company (MNC)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Thorough understanding of all areas of information systems and systems design with special focus on Workday and ServiceNow and proven track record of successfully implemented projects.
Experience in analyzing organizational needs and suggesting process set ups by utilising your expertise in data analysis, reporting and a strong business acumen.
Ability to set priorities, stay focused, and manage time in a fast-paced, developing environment
Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to establish strong relationships at all levels and across functions within the EMEA and global organization
Ability to demonstrate integrity and maintain confidentiality
High level of accuracy and excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to manage multiple priorities in a global, dynamic environment. Must be able to operate with limited direction
Ability to address immediate needs while maintaining a view to long term goals and the organization’s vision and objectives with a continuous improvement mindset
Commitment to continuous learning and study of your craft
Ability to self-direct work and comfortable dealing with ambiguity
Additional Information

Your Team
Our People team at Palo Alto Networks works throughout the organization to enable...you guessed it, people. Every team within the organization has a huge impact on our mission statement. We’re one team – driven to one mission statement. Each piece matters, and within the people team, you are focused on enabling our teams to resolve the world’s most aggressive cybersecurity risks.

Our Commitment
We’re trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together.
We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com.
Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics.

The Amsterdam IP&T team is an ambitious fast growing team of enthusiastic specialists in intellectual property, technology, media and advertising, and data privacy. As part of the IP&T practice group, the Privacy & IT team is currently seeking to recruit an Associate specialized in Privacy Law.
Requirements
Dutch law degree with approximately 4-7 years of working experience at a law firm or in-house
in-depth knowledge of and experience with privacy law
experience with IT and contracting is highly desirable
fluent in Dutch and English
strategic and pragmatic advisor, able to translate legal challenges into actionable advice
ambitious and eager to learn
Key responsibilities
You are part of our Privacy practice and will provide strategic advice on privacy and cybersecurity matters to our Firm’s global clients. We offer realistic, high quality, bespoke solutions. Multinationals seek our expertise because of our pragmatic approach to complex issues, and our strong international reach. We stand by our clients when they build their global privacy framework, or face cross-border security incidents or enforcement actions.
Our team covers a broad range of sectors and works closely together with other specialists within Dentons globally. The young and ambitious team consists of eight professionals who are passionate about what they do, enjoy asking investigative questions and providing strategic yet pragmatic advice to our clients. Within this team you will have immediate responsibility for projects and will be in close contact with our clients directly. You will have the opportunity to develop yourself, identify opportunities and follow up on your own initiatives.
Benefits
the opportunity to join a growing global practice, working on cutting-edge international privacy and cybersecurity matters for our global clients
joining a young, diverse and eager team
career advancement opportunities and the possibility to further specialize as a privacy expert
a progressive, innovative and challenging work environment
working at the Amsterdam office of the world’s largest law firm

Why Dentons is different
The legal profession is changing rapidly and Dentons is leading the way in advancing change for the benefit of clients. We are driven to challenge the status quo, delivering consistent and uncompromising quality and value to our clients in new and innovative ways. With over 17,000 individuals in more than 179 offices the opportunity is huge. Dentons continues to receive external awards and recognition, including for our continued international expansion over the last 12 months; for ground-breaking innovation through the development of Nextlaw Labs and Nextlaw Regional Referral Network; and for success in advising clients across multiple regions. Dentons is also a leader on the Acritas Regional Elite Brand Index and a BTI Client Service 30 Award winner.
Diversity & Inclusion
Dentons is committed to providing equal opportunities for all. Essential to our success as a global law firm is our ability to attract and retain the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds. We want a work environment where everyone can reach their potential and we have an inclusive culture that respects individual differences. We undertake and support a number of internal and external initiatives aimed at increasing diversity within the profession and we encourage all our partners and staff to get involved.
If you are seeking to enhance your career in a progressive and challenging work environment, please send your CV with supporting documents, detailing why you are the right candidate for this position. If you would like to ask any specific questions beforehand, please contact Kitty Martens at kitty.martens@dentons.com

Description
Senior Recruitment Consultant
Based Amsterdam
Templeton and Partners:
We are a growing global niche IT Recruitment Consultancy that specialises in the fast developing area of Enterprise Digital Transformation.
The Templeton and Partners vision is to demonstrate how a focus on 'service oriented teamwork' makes us the favourite and most productive Recruitment Partner to IT Leaders of Global Enterprises and to the most valuable niche tech experts in each of the countries we operate in, creating a true 3-way partnership.
Templeton and Partners is a 20+ year established recruitment organisation with a strong brand, client portfolio with a strategic growth methodology. We are a successful team of niche market specialists who consistently deliver the very best tech talent around the world, in the following niche technologies - Artificial Intelligence, IoT, Big Data & Analytics, Cloud, ERP, CRM, Cyber Security, Software Development, Financial Services Applications and Telecoms.
At Templeton and Partners, we believe in working as a team where every individual is in a role that matches their strengths and preferences and in parallel compliments the other roles.
Purpose:
As a Senior Recruitment Consultant with Templeton and Partners you will be responsible for winning new clients, along with sourcing technical contractors using a variety of tools. You will be working on finding candidates for your new clients and then taking more responsibility and action to manage and expand these clients. You will be actively developing and growing your own personal rolling contractor base, and will receive training in how to acquire your own brand new clients.
Role and responsibilities:

Identifying, mapping and engaging new clients within your agreed niche area.
Qualify and develop a full understanding of all client contract roles.
Sourcing for suitable candidates via advertising, networking and social media, leveraging suitable searches to fully maximise the extensive Templeton database in the first instance.
Effectively managing the candidates through the interview process and closing offers.
Develop an in-depth understanding and market knowledge of a technical niche, building a network of suitable candidates and talent pipelining to ensure speed of response.
Maintaining and developing the in-house CRM to ensure effective client management, candidate networks and speed of response.
Develop and build long term strategic client relationships, gain a full understanding of client hiring requirements. Plan and execute account development strategies.
Develop a specialist and “go to” reputation amongst clients.
Identify opportunities to cross sell Templeton solutions through referrals, lead generation and candidate networks.

Skills required:

Living our 5 values of Respect, Transparency, Teamwork, Proactivity and Reliability
Communication, the ability to communicate with candidates, clients and colleagues in an articulate, credible, professional and persuasive manner.
Time management and organisation, our clients rely on us to deliver, with speed and accuracy.
Resilience, natural ability to working in a tenacious manner, flexible to multi task and prioritise own time to achieve targets and client SLA’s.
Previous experience in IT contract recruitment industry
Fluency in English and Dutch.

Career Development:
Templeton invest in our employees to build a brighter future. We create individual career development plans to enable you to progress within the organisation though the most appropriate channel for you, this could be Principal Consultant or the next generation of Team Managers and Directors.

Job Title: Director, PE Operational Due Diligence (Private Equity Performance Improvement)

Job Description:
The HR Business Partner supports Directors and Manager in his/her dedicated region on strategical and tactical HR matters. He/She leverages people management tools and resources to align with business goals and its associated HR strategic priorities. You'll work directly with regional business leadership to understand their business and needs, focusing on Key HR processes, implementing and /or customizing HR Polices and Programs, talent management, leadership development and facilitating alignment of HR initiatives through partnership with the entire European HR group. You will translate business needs into the right HR interventions, drive and embed EU wide or Global HR processes and standards in the business. Effective meeting facilitation and communications skills will be critical to your success in this role.
Responsibilities:
Act as an advisor to regional management and key stakeholders on full spectrum of HR (how to engage and enable employees to perform), excluding HR payroll and administrative matters
Execute CHR People strategy, plan, initiate and provide for specific local HR needs
Drive and execute regional HR initiatives
Be employees 'confidant' supporting employees in the region to ensure their well-being and address any concerns
Drive and facilitate performance management, talent management, employee development and succession planning
Redirect managers and employees to right HR specialists according to business needs. Drive efficient use of HR services.
Translate local employment market trends into advice and actions
Consult with leaders on current state of the organization and its people and development needs. Help leaders identify desired future state and appropriate solution to take action
Provide day to day performance management guidance to line management (coaching, counseling, career development, disciplinary actions)
Coach leadership on people management skills and responsibilities, challenge them and act as their sounding board
Develop and propose regional policies and practices, fitting overall HR strategy
Drives regional acquisitions, reorganizations and restructuring, opening/closing of offices
Gives Compensation guidance in the region; Understands local pay market. Support EU wide Benchmark projects
Lead cross country relocations process: partner with COEs to assist international employees with expatriate assignments and related global mobility items
Advise leaders and line management on the more complex individual HR related topics such as terminations, onboarding, health and safety, performance, relocation, integrity, compliance, disciplinary, talents, promotions, long term illness case-guidance
Understand or research local benefits, contracts with vendors, negotiating costs and signing contracts
Partner closely with all HR functions to leverage specialists on business needs (Talent Acquisition, L&D, SSC and other HR Business Partners)
Drive Employee Engagement through management involvement (improve working relationships, morale, decrease retention...); Supports regional action planning following employee surveys
Drive and facilitate CHR culture. Draft and issues regional HR communications
Partner with legal department as needed/required
Ensure regional Health & Safety compliance and drive local H&S well-being initiative
May lead or participate in cross-functional HR Project teams
Required Qualifications:
Proficient in Dutch and English (nice to have: one other European language, preferably German, Spanish or Italian)

Job Title: Senior Financial Account Manager : Real Estate – Fund Services
Job Description:
Would you like to have a challenging international career where your skills are of great contribution to clients?

Would you like to work in a professional, hands-on, independent and informal environment? For our rapidly

expanding office in Amsterdam we are currently looking for a qualified & enthusiastic:

Then you are the SENIOR FINANCIAL ACCOUNT MANAGER- REAL ESTATE we are looking for!
What you will do?


The SFAM is part of the Fund Services team and will work closely with Financial and Legal Account Managers and

Fund Specialists in order to continuously exceed our clients’ expectations. The Senior Financial Account Manager

will be responsible for managing the financial activities concerning a portfolio of predominantly Real Estate clients

and will oversee a wide range of administrative and financial responsibilities of our growing portfolio of Real Estate

SPVs. The SFAM is expected to continuously develop both personally as well as professionally and deliver added

value to our Fund Services discipline and contribute to the further growth of our office.


Other responsibilities are:
Managing a client portfolio and be the first point of contact towards clients, client’s accountants and
(tax) advisers regarding all financial and tax responsibilities;
Client Relationship Management by maintaining senior relationships with client’s operational staff
and participating in and support preparation of client meetings;
Administration of real estate vehicles including but not limited to preparation and review of monthly
and quarterly reports, including analysis on variances, cash flows and working capital reports;
Responsible for closing of accounts including reviewing accounts prepared by the property managers
before completion of SPV level closing;
Preparation of VAT and CIT fillings in collaboration with external advisers;
Preparation and review of statutory annual financial statements (Dutch GAAP/ IFRS);
Managing local audit process and resolving audit queries to ensure that audits are completed on time
and within budget;

Management of bank accounts and execution of client payments;
Maintaining an organized planning of work to ensure timely and accurate filing of administrative
records;

Mentor, train and motivate Junior & Medior Financial Account Managers and act as sounding board;
Hold client SPV directorship mandates and pro-active participate in board meetings (i.e. presentation
and clarification of annual accounts);

Perform miscellaneous finance and administrative tasks appropriate to the role and business
requirements; and

Actively sharing financial and accounting knowledge (cross border: Curaçao and Bulgaria).

Where will you be working?


Working at Trustmoore means working in a dynamic company with great colleagues and an international

environment. At Trustmoore, we score as a team and our colleagues are on top of their game. Trustmoore is a

boutique-style corporate service provider with four lines of business Fund Services, Structured Finance & Capital

Markets, Multi Family Office Services and Corporate Expansion Services. We pride ourselves of working with

well-known law offices, notaries, tax advisors and banks. We want to excel in what we do, nothing more, nothing

less. Word of mouth marketing is the best form of advertisement for us.


You will be working in one of the most beautiful areas of Amsterdam. Our office is easily accessible by both

private and public transport. You will receive a competitive salary, holiday allowance, 25 vacation days and

international career opportunities in our other offices. You can also benefit and participate in:

TM Academy with soft skills, knowledge and leadership development trainings;
Regular BBQ, social and sport events with your colleagues;
Our annual ski trip;
Interaction with more than 50 international colleagues in Amsterdam and more than 170 colleagues
worldwide;

How do you fit in the team?

As a Senior Financial Account Manager, you need to manage ad-hoc activities, next to your intensive client contact

and daily work. In this position, you need to prioritize what is important, have a hands-on and independent work

mentality and be able to deal with stress. A helicopter view is required, since you are responsible for all financial

related processes, requirements and deadlines of your client companies. You are proactive, know what you are

capable of, possess good communication skills and not afraid of asking questions.


Other relevant qualifications for this profile:
§ Bachelor or master’s degree in Business Administration, Accounting or an equivalent;

§ A minimum of 7 years relevant work experience of which at least 3 years in the Real Estate industry;

§ Interest in Real Estate Fund structures;

§ Knowledge of generally accepted accounting principles (Dutch GAAP/ IFRS);

§ Outstanding organizational, analytical and leadership skills;

§ Excellent interpersonal and communication skills;

§ Self-motivated and aptitude in decision-making and problem-solving;

§ Fluent in English (both orally and in writing);

§ Able to work independently and as a part of a team; and

§ Experience with Real Estate Accounting software preferred.

Do you recognize yourself in this profile? We can’t wait to meet you!

If you have any questions about the position or about Trustmoore, please contact Pauline Wolf (email:

pauline.wolf@trustmoore.com).


About us


We make success possible. Success for our clients by providing high-quality services, however also success for

our colleagues by providing you with personal and professional growth opportunities to help you reach your full

potential. Just as we help our clients reach their goals.

The foundation of our success is delivering true value through long term relations. That applies to our clients and

colleagues. We’re in it for the long run, that creates value for us and for you.

This results in a very personal and informal company culture with a healthy work-life balance.

We are proud of that and we call it being professional in a non-corporate way.


By sending in your personal details for this job application, you give your consent that those details will be saved in our

database for application purposes. After the termination of your application procedure, we will delete your details from our

database. Obviously, we will treat your details with care, with confidentiality and we will not share those with third parties.

Ref R-88910
Location Amsterdam, North Holland
Senior Finance Manager (Insurance EU), Amsterdam
About Assurant:
Assurant is one of the leading providers of automotive warranty and mobile device protection in Europe and serves over 11 million customers. Its businesses develop, underwrite, market and administer specialty insurance including mobile phone insurance, gadget insurance and extended service contracts through collaborative relationships with mobile network operators, dealerships, retail banks, electronic goods and household appliance manufacturers and retailers. As a partner, we provide solutions which assist our corporate clients to support their customer engagement, growth and loyalty aspirations.
Assurant Inc. (AIZ) is a Fortune 500 company, listed on the New York Stock Exchange. Its 15,000 employees serve over 300 million customers globally. Assurant supports diversity in the workplace and is a strong believer of the strategic value of inclusion.
About you:
You’ll be working with a team of very like-minded colleagues; you’ll be a decision maker, problem solver and innovator. Most importantly you’ll be at the start of an ambitious growth period for Assurant across our European businesses. You might be from a large organisation but are looking for the next challenge. A hands on approach and attitude is essential as you will be working in a small Finance team within a growing European organisation.
Role specifics:
The purpose of the Senior Finance Manager role is to support the financial & regulatory governance and reporting in the (EU) business and oversee the intra-group outsourcing relationships for the Netherlands based General and Life insurance entities.
The role reports into the Amsterdam based CFO and is part of a small team of Amsterdam based colleagues that work together with large shared service centres in the UK and the US. Besides legal entity driven responsibilities the role will also be engaged in regional commercial activities (business partnering for regional heads).
Other responsibilities include, but are not limited to;
Ensure accurate and timely reporting (UK GAAP, Dutch GAAP, Solvency 2) for the Dutch entities, either by direct involvement or by guiding colleagues in shared service centers.
Provide Dutch (and EU) financial and regulatory (Solvency 2) knowledge and/or act as liaison to external Dutch specialists including regulators, auditors and tax authorities, for shared service center colleagues.
Establish, develop and enforce and adequate internal administrative organization and system of internal control.
Challenge Actuarial and Underwriting functions and ensure alignment of these functions with Finance & Tax.
Support asset management activity and investment guidelines.
Proactively participate in continuous process improvements.
Support the Budget & Control cycle from a location and regional perspective.
The ideal candidate will have the following skills, knowledge and expertise;
The role works together with European and US shared service teams daily and requires fluent English. It will be a benefit to speak another language such as Italian, French, Spanish or German but this is not a requirement.
The role needs to accomplish a wide variety of objectives but is part of a larger organization with competing priorities. This requires cultural versatility and adequate stakeholder management.
Can combine a top down view with the ability to understand detail and achieve short-term goals and long-term objectives in parallel.
Inquisitive and challenging to drive business performance.
Very hands-on in initial phase and moving to oversight as the role progresses.
Experienced in Solvency 2. Has implemented or reported in more than one organization (either in business or in Big 4).
Familiar with Non-Life and Life & Health. Actuarial knowledge is desirable.
Experienced in the use of MS Office products, especially Microsoft Excel.
Has track record of delivery and career development within insurance businesses.
Relevant accountancy qualification. HBO/WO level.
Minimum 10 years post qualification experience.
Will consider candidates that do not speak Dutch but have a matching skillset.
This role is to be based in the Amsterdam office.
The call to action:
At Assurant, we’re very big on supporting you to be the best you can be. If you’d like to talk about our opportunities within Finance, apply today via the application link:
If you have any questions about the role or would like further details, please e-mail helen.kennedy@assurant.com. We look forward to your application.

Outpost24 is a leading cyber assessment company focused on enabling its customers to achieve maximum value from their evolving technology investments. By leveraging our full stack security insights to reduce attack surface for any architecture, Outpost24 customers continuously improve their security posture with the least effort.





Position:


We are looking to expand our team of highly skilled hackers! Are you a Guru on Hack the box, top earner on your bounty hunting platform of choice, greatest hardware hacker and #BadgeLife collector ever made, the next best social engineer or none of the above but just highly motivated to break stuff? Sounds like you will fit just right in!
We are currently looking for many new talents to join our team all of over the EU region, so if you feel this role is for you or any of the other roles we have available on our career page don’t hesitate to apply. We look forward speaking with you.
Position
You will become part of Outpost24’s Ghost Labs team: Outpost24’s ethical hacking team, technically rooted and the core of Outpost24’s hacking activities. We perform all penetration tests, conduct security research, and contribute to the security community through responsible disclosure and proof-of-concepts. Do you think that you’ve got what it takes, and would you like to join the Ghosts? Read on!
As Security Specialist in the Ghost Labs OffSec team, you are key in delivering our Offensive security and Red teaming services. Your daily activities involve:
Performing traditional web, network, mobile and API penetration tests and writing a technical report that links your findings to the relevant (business) impact for the customer.
Executing and managing smaller and larger Adversarial attack simulation assessments, from remote digital footprint assessment to full on-site Red team engagements that can run from weeks to months. Including, but not limited to phishing, physical pentests and network exploitation.
Working on scoping requests from customers, planning larger assessments and assisting with quality assurance of team deliverables.
Perform research projects on subjects that match your personal interests.
Continuous knowledge sharing to the team and mentoring/coaching your peers to allow them to learn and grow individually and as a team.
Work on the strategic growth of the team in close collaboration with the Head of OffSec and continuously improving internal processes where you see opportunities for improvement.

Requirements:


Passionate for technology and security, with a proven track-record and a focus on certain areas (e.g. Adversarial emulation, endpoint protection, malware development, web application exploitation) and knowledge of industry standards and methodologies such as CREST/CBEST, TIBER, Mitre (pre-)ATT&CK and OSSTMM.
At least five years of relevant professional IT Security experience, for example in the function of Security researcher, principal security consultant, Jr. Manager Security).
Completed relevant University (of applied sciences) degree, or experience that exceeds that. Honestly, we care equally for the CVEs you discovered than a paper degree, either will do.
At least two applicable professional certifications (e.g. OSEE, CCSAM, eCXD, eCRE, eMAPT, eCPTX)
A true team player and self-claimed computer nerd.
Programming/scripting and network engineering skills.
Professional English communications skills, where ‘detail’ and ‘quality’ come naturally, and you don’t mind writing a report and presenting the results to either technical staff or C-level executives.
Willingness to travel, given normal circumstances.
Located in either Amsterdam – NL, Brussels – BE, Karlskrona – SE, Plymouth – UK, or anywhere else within the EU/UK but remote working from home. We would love to have you around in our key-offices, so living in the vicinity of one of our offices is a benefit.

As Security Specialist, we expect you to be a self-propelled rocket with deep technical knowledge on offensive security topics and a drive to share your knowledge and help others. Overall, you are a passionate omnipotent hacker that knows how to translate technical issues into business language. You can apply your technical skills independently, but you are also a true team player. We expect a strong drive to excel in what you like best, whether it is bypassing anti-virus, picking locks, phishing people, or breaking web applications. By having a team of people that do what they are passionate about, we believe to add the most value to our customers and find the coolest things while doing so.

Other information:


In return for your efforts we provide you with a great team, flexibility in planning your working hours, training throughout your career, fun team-events, a buddy to help you achieve your personal goals and of course a competitive salary.

Like what you see and want to know more? Apply now!
As part of the recruitment process you must be able to pass a background check in order to qualify for this position.
Outpost24’s values – Knowledge, Innovation and Team – define our corporate culture and our commitment to customers. They influence every aspect of our business and guide us in our ambition to provide maximum value for our customers. By being at the forefront of cyber security through knowledge sharing, training and research, providing innovative and state of the art solutions as well as creating a collaborative environment with customers and partners, we can continue to be an attractive company that strives for the highest potential and to ensure customer success.

Are you super-skilled and motivated, do you have technical insight, and are you looking to join a young, dynamic company specializing in the development and production of patented fender systems for maritime transport?

Then we are looking for you.

Since its start in 2012, Fender Innovations has gained an excellent reputation for developing and producing super strong, lightweight fender systems of the highest quality. Fender Innovations has seen tremendous growth ever since and built up a large and diverse international customer base, ranging from superyacht manufacturers to the largest shipbuilders in the world, often with specialist and specific requests. Our fender systems are seamless and tailor-made, do not absorb any water, and can withstand temperatures from minus 30 to 130 degrees Celsius.

Our company has two large, innovative five-axis CNC milling machines. These allow us to produce fenders up to a maximum length of 18.5 metres in one piece. We can create almost any shape, size and dimension, and we relish a challenge. Our fender systems are used on a wide range of vessels, including lifeboats, fast crew suppliers, superyacht tenders, RIBs, patrol boats, interceptors, water taxis, amphibious craft, firefighting vessels and various kinds of workboats. We produce fenders for both new and existing vessels. Our fenders are used in over 28 countries worldwide.

Apart from developing and producing fender systems, we also install them and carry out any maintenance and repair work required. Our energetic and efficient service department was set up for this purpose.

We are looking for an enthusiastic, accurate and driven general operative who is very good with his/her hands to join our workshop team.

Job description

As a general operative, you work on the shop floor to produce templates and fender systems. You carry out interim checks on the produced fenders.
You can read working drawings and interpret these correctly. You may also be asked to mount or dismount fenders on site. This is done in the Netherlands and abroad.

Your duties include
Producing templates and marine fender systems
Carrying out interim checks on the produced fenders systems
Mounting and dismounting marine fenders on site
Requirements:
Senior vocational education in shipbuilding, mechanical engineering, construction or similar demonstrable experience
Experience in marine engineering is preferred
Correctly reading/interpreting working drawings on the shop floor
Great precision and dimensional accuracy
Holding at least a category B driving licence, preferably also category E
Good command of spoken and written Dutch and/or English.
Living within 40 km of the workshop
No 9-to-5 mentality

As a general operative, you need to be flexible, critical, a team player and have very good problem-solving skills. You also need to be hard-working, capable of working under pressure, proactive, commercially aware, responsible, motivating, service-minded, and have good social and communication skills.

We offer:
A friendly working environment
In-house training in fender building
An enthusiastic team of colleagues
Career opportunities within the company, which is constantly evolving
Varied work possible at various locations
Salary in accordance with the collective agreement for light engineering/industry ("CAO kleinmetaal/nijverheid")
Professional development opportunities
Employment of 38 hours per week


If you are the person we are looking for, please email your covering letter and CV to:

Sylvia Ruizendaal
Chief Officer Operations
sr@fenderinnovations.nl

Role: Customer Success Manager EMEA - Salesforce.org (German OR Spanish OR Swedish speaker)

Locations: Amsterdam, Berlin, Paris, Munich, Frankfurt, Düsseldorf, Dublin, Stockholm, Helsinki, Copenhagen


Salesforce.org, the social impact centre of Salesforce, is seeking a talented Portfolio Success Manager to join our EMEA team. The Portfolio Success Manager will be responsible for driving adoption and success across Salesforce.org customers in the nonprofit and education sectors. This role requires strong consulting and advising ability, nonprofit/higher education domain experience, and exceptional relationship development skills.


YOUR IMPACT/Responsibilities:
Proactively help customers achieve the maximum possible value they can with Salesforce, ensuring that they utilize all of their licenses and achieve their business objectives while minimizing attrition risk, identifying new growth opportunities, and collaborating with Sales/Renewal teams to ensure full renewal and continued success
Help customers map their vision and strategies to Salesforce capabilities across all of our Clouds (Nonprofit, Education, Sales, Service, Experience, Analytics, Marketing, Platform)
Develop a comprehensive understanding of common objectives and typical business challenges faced by customers in order to appropriately recommend Salesforce features, solutions and resources, that address their needs with associated business benefits
Listen and coach customers on how to establish and drive change management programs that address the people, process, and technology components of digital transformation
Identify risks to the customer achieving their stated business goals and work with the account team to build a risk mitigation plan or escalate as needed
Prescribe the right Cloud Services Resources (Premier Success, Accelerators/Specialists, Advisory Services and more) to be successful in addressing issues related to functional/technical requirements, architecture, design and enablement etc
Curate learning paths to ensure customers are aware of and leveraging all available self-service Salesforce Success Resources such as knowledge articles in Help & Training portal, user groups in the Power of Us Hub and Trailblazer Communities, and registering for events and webinars that foster community, peer-to-peer learning, adoption and innovation
Serve as a customer advocate in driving industry best practices and informing the evolution of Salesforce product and platform functionality, courses, and administrative services integral to the customer's success
Assist with development and execution of scaled customer success programs to drive engagement and adoption; such as delivering 1:Many webinar presentations or facilitating roundtable discussions
Estimated 40% customer-facing virtual engagements; due to COVID (post-COVID may include up to to 20% travel)
Organize Quarterly Success Reviews (QSRs) with Regional Vice Presidents (RVPs) to review portfolio activity and determine areas of opportunity
Cross-collaborate with teams and individuals in: Sales, Solution Engineers, Marketing, Industry Solutions, Technical Support, Independent Software Vendors (ISVs) and System Integrators (SI) Partners, and Customer Success counterparts in our AMER and APAC regions, in an effort to drive holistic customer support
Create reports to track and monitor customer engagements, customers who may be at-risk or unengaged, and take initiative on outreach efforts, across a portfolio that could span anywhere between 100-500 accounts.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS/Experience or Skills Required:
BA/BS degree
Minimum 4 years relevant work experience
Advanced language skills in German and English are highly preferred
Experience in nonprofit and/or education industry verticals
Executive-level communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to prioritize, multi-task, and perform effectively under pressure
Strong knowledge of business processes (Sales, Marketing, Service, Support), business applications, streamlining and automation practices
Expertise facilitating customer meetings and presenting to an executive level audience in a concise, inspirational and convincing manner
Collaborative and consultative work style, ability to thrive in a high-velocity, highly-dynamic work environment
Deep understanding of customer success principles, approaches and best practice considerations for vision and strategy development, business value, change management, adoption, and governance frameworks
Experience with maintaining trust during complex or escalated customer situations, with ability to navigate organization challenges and gain executive level buy-in.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Advanced language skills in Spanish OR Swedish AND English are preferred
Programs or Project Management skills are an asset
Knowledge of Salesforce.com product and platform features, capabilities, and best use

Proficient with tools such as Zoom, Google Product Suite (Hangouts/Meet, Calendar, Slides, Sheets, Sites), Slack
‘Lifelong learner’ attitude, with ability to stay at pace with industry innovation and volume of product enablement information.

This year we celebrated our 25th year anniversary. In these 25 years we have become a thought leader in financial risk management. With a strong focus on innovation and entrepreneurship, we aim to deliver high quality consulting services and exceed expectations. Your role

As a Zanders Risk Manager you will join our ‘Financial Institutions’ team, a team of 60 Financial Risk Management Consultants. Most of the consultants (95%) have a quantitative background. Freedom, fun and flexibility play an important role in this team. The colleagues could be described as self-starters who are eager to push their boundaries and constantly challenge themselves.

Together with the team, you will focus on financial risk related projects for banks, insurers and asset managers. You are able to support the Chief Risk Officer and his/her team from risk strategy to implementation. This requires a broad perspective and an entrepreneurial spirit. You advise our clients surrounding developing, designing and performing the quantification of risks.

An average week has four working days on-site at the client and one working day at the office in Bussum. On Friday it is time to catch up with your Zanders colleagues and join knowledge and training sessions. We believe that deveoping our people by investing in them and by sharing knowledge and experiences is our differentiator and key to success.

Responsibilities
Capture the needs, concerns and perspectives of the client and translate these into workable forward thinking solutions.
Advise clients surrounding the development of statistical techniques, financial risk related complexities and technology advancements
Advise our clients about their financial risk governance and policies
Identify the financial risks and advice how to measure and manage these
Translate (new) rules and regulations into business processes
Take project responsibility on the client’s site and coach the team around you
Identify and create business opportunities for existing and/or potential clients
Contribute to the coaching and mentoring of less experienced colleagues

Master’s degree in Econometrics or a similar quantitative study
Minimum of 5 years working experience in the financial risk management field
Experience with advising on a broad range of quantitative risk aspects
Broad knowledge of experience in risk management within the financial sector
Aspiration to work in a dynamic niche consultancy
Pro-active and entrepreneurial spirit, with a focus on team work
Fluent in English and Dutch
Open to travel, mainly within the Netherlands

Work alongside a variety of clients and consultants to build new skills quickly
Inspiring and international work environment

We have an exciting opportunity based in Haarlem for a
Regional Cost Accounting Specialist

Job Description
Our Finance team brings together our financial perspectives into our overall strategic and tactical decision making. We use state-of-the-art techniques for financial analysis, planning, accounting, reporting and performance evaluation. This allows the organization to continue advancing medical innovation and improve lives.
Welcome in our team
This position is part of the COSI matrix organization, which performs end to end activities from actual occurrence of a financial result till consolidation level in HQ. Main tasks will be maintaining, reviewing, reporting and analyzing of sales, inventory, intercompany profit, production and product cost data in supporting the monthly accounting close and management cycles for one or multiple branches.
This position is part of the COSI NL Inventory team supporting all regions globally. The team is responsible for accurately performing accounting activities in relationship to our Inventory in Human Heath & Vaccines, with a main focus on IQV (Inventory of Questionable Value) & Discards. And informing business partners of actual Inventory results from an End-to-End perspective. Hereby the financial results are provided with integrity and treated with sensitivity. Further, the COSI organization is continuously looking for synergies and process changes with business partners to optimize and improve systems & processes in line with our internal policies and procedures but also external, US GAAP & IFRS.
Support Functions
Our Support Functions deliver services and makes recommendations about ways to enhance our workplace and the experience of working at our organization. Our Support Functions include HR, Finance, Information Technology, Legal, Procurement, Administration, Facilities and Security.

Main responsibilities but not limited to;
Complete the monthly close functions with respect to IQV which ensures inventory reserves are recorded in an accurate and timely manner within the close deadlines.
Responsible for performing accounting activities for IQV, from and in line with US GAAP and according to our internal reporting design from End-to-End perspective. Ensure IQV inventory reserves are created and maintained, both routine and ad hoc.
Review of accounting of Discards and accurate reporting within our internal reporting design for the controlled regions and budgets
Responsible for alignment of Discard’s P&L accounts with the relevant FSA (Financial Sharing Area) metrics on Country and Divisional level.
Monitor discards levels and generate appropriate actions with our division stakeholders to avoid inventory risks and discards within Comet SAP (or other standardized systems).
Ensuring that appropriate and adequate internal controls are in place in accordance with corporate procedures – including liaising with internal- and external audit teams. Acting as a first point of contact for external and internal auditors in relation to IQV & Discard.
Participate in regional Governance meeting and provide pro-active feedback to stakeholders.
Maintaining and reporting performance metrics and perform ad-hoc consolidation analysis to support business decisions.
Maintaining and reconciling inventory account balances related to COSI processes between the General Ledger and SAP to ensure alignment for your region(s).
Participate/manage IQV disputes process and work closely with other finance and SCM teams for timely resolution of disputes.
Participate in special and ad hoc projects to support management analysis and provide ad-hoc quality support to business partners and business development projects.
Openly share and mentor experience with peers to broaden knowledge and increase efficiency.
Back-up of other senior specialists or specialists as needed.
Identifies opportunities and drives system and process improvements for process bottlenecks within COSI Inventory activities. This to maintain, harmonize, and ensure global standardization of processes.
Your profile
BSc or MSc degree, accounting/finance background preferred.
Minimum of 3-5 years of relevant experience in finance.
Knowledge and experience with Lean Six Sigma (minimum Yellow/ Green belt).
Previous practical experience of preparing accounts in accordance with US GAAP.
Good SAP knowledge, advanced Excel knowledge.
Fluency in written and spoken English.
Able to explain complex financial concepts to non-financial stakeholders.
Able to see the wider picture and how decisions could affect the site, region and entities.
Able to work under pressure and meet deadlines, whilst delivering high-quality work.
Intercultural experience and enjoys working in a multi-cultural organization.
Willingness to take on responsibility, goal-orientated, and capable of making decisions.
Initiative, adaptive, open to change, customer-orientated.
Organized with excellent analytical skills.
Flexible in work hours, willingness to work in shifts, and willingness to travel.

Catalyze is the international market leader in obtaining funding and offering strategic consulting for biomedical and healthcare-related companies, researcher and non-profit organizations. We collaborate with our clients through the development chain of products and services in the healthcare and life science industry; from early-stage proof of concept up to market introduction. At Catalyze, we are distinguished by the motto, "by intrapreneurs for entrepreneurs" and value team players who are not afraid to show initiative, creativity and responsibility. We have a “can-do” culture where fun and professional development go hand in hand.
We have a strong passion for the latest technological innovations and support a variety of Life Science developments including, diagnostics, pharmaceuticals, medical devices and healthcare solutions. Our consultants work with the best clients and projects worldwide. We are expanding our strategic business development team in our Amsterdam office and therefore we are looking for a Strategic Business Developer.

Strategic Business Developer

You will join a growing international team in Amsterdam bursting with energy. As our new Strategic Business Developer, you can make a difference in our professional and dynamic scale-up organization who offers room for independence and professional development. You will be reporting to the head of strategic business development.

What are you going to do?
 Responsible for sales of strategic services; e.g. Gap analysis, actionplans, advisory reports
 Prepare tailor made client presentations
 Prepare tailor made client proposals
 Negiotiate and close contracts at C-Level
 Achieve sales targets
 Build and maintain close relationships with your stakeholders
 Form relevant strategic alliances with multiple stakeholders
 Visit conferences, seminars and related networking events
 Support in the development of the department, be critical, analyse the market and share opportunities for growth of the strategic service portfolio.


What are we looking for?
Ideally you have experience in a sales position. Your PhD. degree in Life Sciences gives you an advantage in understanding our customers when it comes to advising and guiding them through their challenges. You have a passion for innovation, you’ve got a commercial mindset and already have a network in the Life Sciences industry.

Furthermore:
 Minimum of 3 years' experience in a sales/consultancy position.
 Relevant work experience in the Life Sciences and/or healthcare industries. (Medical device companies, Pharma-medical etc.)
 A PhD degree in Life Sciences, Health Sciences or Biomedical.
 Goal oriented and solution-oriented thinker.
 Excellent communication skills.
 Energetic self-starter with strong persistence.
 Excellent language skills in English (written and spoken).
 Fast learner, with some humor and creativity.


Nice to have:
 Knowledge of grant applications.
 Knowledge of Value Based Healthcare, Strategy Consulting.
 Market insights in the health and life sciences sector.
 Experience in contract negotiations and closing deals.


We offer:
 A competitive salary with good employment conditions.
 A good bonus system.
 A personal training budget.
 A phone, laptop and a lease car.
 Loads of fun activities like Yoga, Catalyze Football team and Kick Boxing.

Who We Are
RTB House is a global company operating in the Digital Marketing sector that provides state-of-the-art marketing technologies for top brands worldwide.
Founded in 2012, RTB House applied Artificial Intelligence technologies to develop display advertising buying engine (DSP, demand-side platform) based on Machine Learning algorithms. Since 2017, we have successfully implemented our proprietary engine based on the Deep Learning algorithms, the next generation of the AI. As of now, RTB House is the first and only AdTech company in the world to be powered entirely by the Deep Learning algorithms. This enables our clients to generate outstanding results and reach their short, mid and long-term goals.
RTB House is a recognised fast-growing innovative company, listed among the 1000 Europe's Fastest Growing Companies by the Financial Times and in the Technology Fast 50® by Deloitte.
750+ specialists, 70+ markets, 1,600+ clients across across the globe: New York, London, Tokyo, Singapore, São Paulo, Berlin, Amsterdam, Moscow, Istanbul, Dubai and Warsaw. We serve 2,000+ campaigns for 1,600+ clients across EMEA, APAC and the Americas regions.
Growing rapidly, RTB House searches for talented sales people specialized in digital advertising to make the Benelux market one of the largest ones within RTB House in EMEA. Do you want to become a part of the most exciting success stories in the Ad Tech industry? Join the team of excited and passionate colleagues and start a new great career opportunity.

RTB House in the Benelux
RTB House started business in the Netherlands in 2017 and runs operations from the office in Amsterdam. Our clients include top-notch e-commerce brands in the Fashion, Travel and Classifieds verticals.
The successful candidate will join the team during a period of exceptional growth of our business in the Benelux region.

About the Sales team
The Sales team is a key contributor of growth and culture at RTB House. Every member of the team embodies our core values and strives to excel within a top-notch sales organization. Our team’s mission is to be known internally and externally for helping to boost our clients’ business by delivering best-in-class solutions enhanced with unparalleled professionalism, integrity, and passion for Digital. RTB House develops a range of new products and our Sales team will be among those who bring these innovative solutions to the market.

The Sales Director will directly report to the Country Manager Benelux.
What You'll Do And How You'll Make An Impact:
Contribute to the strategy and footprint of the next digital market leader in Benelux
Design strategies on how to fulfil client’s needs and acquire new business
Deal with C-level officers on the client side directly
Develop strategies for introducing new products and penetrating target verticals
Generate sales by handling all aspects of the sales cycle from prospecting to closing
Develop professional technical knowledge related to the solutions offered by RTB House and overall developments in the digital marketing domain
Work closely with technical and account management teams within the company to ensure superior performance of the campaigns

Creativity and ability to build a vision with prospects

In fast changing markets, customers worldwide rely on Thales. Thales is a business where brilliant people from all over the world come together to share ideas and inspire each other. In aerospace, transportation, defence, security and space, our architects design innovative solutions that make our tomorrow's possible.
Legal Counsel/Contract Manager
based in Huizen
The Legal & Contracts team of Thales in the Netherlands consists of about 20 people based in Hengelo and Huizen: legal counsel, contract managers and trade compliance professionals. Dedicated to their jobs and the organization.
We work in the office as well as from home. Many of us frequently travel all over the world. We established ‘self organizing’ teams which caters for continuous learning and improving, and much responsibility to each individual in the team.
The Legal & Contracts team deals with complex legal issues. Main part of the activities exists of assisting the capture team with the drafting, negotiation and closure of (international) contracts and the subsequent execution of those contracts in the project team. Contracts in an often culturally and politically challenging environment.

About the job
Your activities will focus on the capturing and the subsequent execution of sales contracts. This means that you’re involved from the drafting and negotiation until the closing of a contract when all obligations from Thales’ and the customer have been fulfilled.
As our counterparties are all over the world, travelling will be part of the job.
Above, you may be the specialist within the team on certain legal topics, such as for example intellectual property, GDPR, purchasing, compliance or environmental regulations.
You’ll plan and organize your activities yourself. Often driven by the customer’s time schedule, which may change on a daily basis. Being flexible and able to continuously monitor and adapt your priorities is therefore of utmost importance. Within the Thales organization our colleagues in the sales and projects departments will be the ones to team with.
About you
You have a Master Degree in law and look forward to a second or third step in your career. You’ve experience in a law firm or as a legal counsel, contracting specialist, in a multinational company. You avail of up-to-date legal knowledge. You have an interest to work in an international and challenging environment where you, besides the legal aspects, will need to also understand the technical, financial and commercial aspects of a contract .
Furthermore, you have a strong and independent personality, are solution-focused, excellent in team work, able to manage different stakeholders and can set priorities. You are client-focused, have outstanding negotiating skills and good command of, both oral and written, Dutch and English. A Dutch passport is a prerequisite due to contracts with the Dutch Government that are ‘Dutch eyes only’.
What's in it for you
Become part of a great team in a high tech, innovative international organization
(International) opportunities for growth in tech-, management- and commercial roles
Attention for personal development and own initiative
40 leave days per year, travel expenses and a flexible benefits à la carte package with options like purchase/sale of leave hours, internet costs, bicycle plan, company fitness, trade union contribution or relocation costs

With Thales employing 80,000 employees in 68 countries our mobility policy enables thousands of employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad, in their existing areas of expertise or by branching out into new fields. Together we believe that embracing flexibility is a smarter way of working. Great journeys start here, apply now!

Job Title: Sr Director or Dir Scientific Due Diligence (Abs, AAVs, RNAs, Neuro, Neuro-Pharmacology), (code NL 260620)
Job Description:
Job Description
Sr Director or Dir Scientific Due Diligence (Abs, AAVs, RNAs, Neuro, Neuro-Pharmacology)

This role is for a highly networked Director or Senior Director with a proven experience of Drug Discovery & Research and Partnering in the field of Neurology and that primarily will scout with external institutions include external assets / programs and align these with the company strategic vision for development and overall portfolio direction including incorporation of new IP acquisition and strategic / Research alliances for existing and new modalities, so gene and cell therapies including AAVs.

Relocation: My client will hire you locally during Covid if necessary and offers post-Covid full relocation and digital hiring process in between.

About My Client
My client is a successful, expanding Biotech organization with a proven portfolio of small and large molecules and are currently preparing NDA/BLA/MAA for the next generation of products. This role will be part of the core team which brings new assets into translational medicines by identifying, screening, and reviewing BD&L as the Scientific Lead:-

The organization has stated their objective to rapidly discover, develop and commercialize new drugs including those for new modalities in rare diseases, neurology, immunology and hematology, including RNAs and Viral Vectors.
Also my client is HQ’d in Europe meaning you will have better visibility and find it easier to engage and collaborate with your peers and the senior stakeholders (no late night calls to the USA).
The senior leadership team has given the green light and backing to make a significant investment into new modalities, especially rAAVs which means that in 2021 will see their first Ph. I studies in this area.
Why I find this role highly exciting is you will be part of the core team which pioneers the Viral Vector platform de novo! Also you will be working with an expert team, some developed within the company, some joined recently, all are highly educated and experienced mostly to Ph.D. level and have a great deal of Biotech expertise to share and learn with each other from.
You will be able to build a long-term career in this Biotech organization, the core leadership team have examples of both steady job promotion and skills progression.
In the meantime, working from your current location is allowed and my client has committed to do the hiring interviews and the On-Boarding process remotely to minimize risks.
Note this role is supported by legal and financial experts, you will provide the networking and scientific input to bring Discovery and Research opportunities into perspective, and will support handover in some cases to translation meds. It is not a role for an investment or financial BD&L analyst!

You Skills & The Role:

This team impacts directly on the pipeline development interacting with the R&D platform internally and externally, with Biotech and Academia, scouting for novel programs following the company interests in order to increase and progress the internal pipeline by delivering new assets.

The successful candidate will screen the Research and Discovery space for Neurology, contributing to bringing in new opportunities for areas such as Neuro-degeneration and Neuro-inflammation, taking the necessary steps to develop these alliances and partnerships which will yield assets for scientific review and potential clinical development.

As an experienced Neuro Discovery Lead, or, maybe you have already moved into Industry in a similar role, it is likely you will have a PhD and a background as a Neuro-Pharmacologist or Neurologist Discovery and / or Research leader, with a solid network built over time with connections in Industry and in Academia.

You will search, evaluate and assess results of in-vivo or in-vitro experiments and provide recommendation for innovative assets based on scientific review, as well as provide support and conducting some parts of the negotiations, always establishing a basis for go / no go on Research programs and handling early stages of collaborations with your partnered institutions and internal stakeholders.

Package & Benefits

This role can be an upper Director or Senior Director and the salaries match the grade. The role comes with a high end stock plan and bonus scheme. The company will wait or hire you locally if Covid reoccurs.

The role is based in Brussels and my client will provide a temporary high quality apartment with disturbance allowances included, a very competitive base salary, car with petrol card for European coverage, 48 days off a year, tax ruling if applicable (for non-Belgium citizens) and private schooling if your children do not speak French or Dutch.

To Apply!

To apply for this role, please press the red “Apply for position” button, or contact Javier Monfort or Matt Greig on +44 (0)207 801 3385 or +44 (0)207 801 3386 in full confidence to receive more details on this role or to hear about other available opportunities.

We provide a high level of service because we believe this matters. Our people place individuals at the Specialist, Expert, Regional and Global Head levels, so if you want some advice on when or how to make your next step, or to understand what that next step might look like, let’s collaborate and explore these ideas with each other. ADV Talent Partners only advertise around 30% of our active roles, so for us to really help you, please Register or call us. We provide permanent and contract roles in the following areas, across the USA, Europe and Asia Pacific. General switchboard number +44 (0)207 801 3380.

GDPR & Data Protection: Your information is safeguarded for GDPR, and you will have the right to edit, amend or delete and ’’be forgotten’’ at any time after your initial registration.

The future of mobility is electric. In this transition towards sustainable transportation, electric vehicles play an important role in merging the mobility and the energy landscapes.


As Senior Sales Engineer you will become our technical sales expert when it comes to our Everon Platform: a next-generation global, scalable and multi-tenant eMobility cloud platform which enables businesses to manage and operate EV-charging infrastructure. In this dynamic, fast-paced work environment, you will be combining technical and sales knowledge and applying this in a new industry where everything still has to be built and where standards are still to be set. We are paving the way to enable a seamless EV charging experience worldwide, and you will be an instrumental part of it.


This is an incredibly exciting time to join our organisation as a Sales Engineer. We are going public by the end of March, with views to aggressively accelerate our growth in the industry, which we look to you to help realize. The value of our software platform is enormous and plays a highly strategic role in the overall value of our organisation. The bigger our organisation gets, the greater positive impact we will have on the environment by reducing carbon emissions in the air through enabling electric transportation.


As part of a small Sales Engineering team, you will bridge the gap between technical understanding of our platform features and presenting a commercial offering to our future and existing customers. In doing so you will build relationships with other sales colleagues and with the product, development and professional services teams. You will be given the freedom and trust to organize your day to execute your activities in the best possible way. In addition there will be opportunities to run side projects to improve the sales cycle overall. As we continue to grow, we expect you to support the onboarding of new team members, acting as a mentor. In doing so we will provide you the opportunity to grow your career with us whether that is technically or through leadership.


Responsibilities include:

Become an expert of our platform and services, with regular training to keep your knowledge up to date
Capture customers/prospects requirements regarding all aspects of Everon
Investigate and find the best fitted solutions for our prospects/customers requests
Coordinate the internal research and negotiation with prospects/customers on technical solutions and possible alternatives
Prepare and deliver clear and convincing demos and solutions presentations to prospects/customers (improving them along the way)
Optimize speed and efficiency of technical assessments performed on new opportunities
Perform regular alignment with sales & customer success teams on new opportunities, prospects/customers requests and strategy
Perform regular alignment with product and services teams on capabilities and specific solutions that can be offered
Contribute to scaling the team by documenting findings and solutions and by regularly sharing knowledge and providing feedback


Experience we're looking for:

Completed Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Electronics or a similar field
At least 4+ years professional experience working in a technical (pre)sales position or similar (i.e. Technical Product Owner, Technical Consultant)
Experience working with cloud platforms (google cloud is advantageous)
Good understanding of API design
Some experience with selling Software as a Service (SaaS) or even Platform as a Service (PaaS)
Strong (English) communication and presentation skills
Comfortable with communicating technical information to a non-technical audience
Comfortable interacting with all levels of internal and external customers in varying regions and timezones
You have a lot of self-drive to proactively find solutions when solutions don't exist
You are analytical and are able to summarize complex topics in a simple manner


Our offer to you:

In addition to collaborating with a dynamic group of top industry and subject matter experts, we will provide you a competitive salary (with relocation assistance / visa support if applicable) and the following benefits: option to work from home partially, high-end laptop + related equipment, contribution to private pension fund, discounted health insurance, 25 days holiday (unpaid leave possible) and home-office travel compensation.
Our well-connected modern offices (Rotterdam City Centre – with a fantastic view of the Erasmus bridge; Amsterdam Oud-Zuid in a super sustainable building) always have free fruit and great coffee available. We will actively encourage your growth in the business and will support you (mentoring, training budgets) to realize your goals whilst you make your mark on this evolving industry.


About us:

We're building a team of problem solvers and makers. People with a proactive attitude and the drive to change the future of mobility. From developers to designers, managers and specialists; our office welcomes professionals from different backgrounds and values diversity as a strength. We currently have over 140 people working with us from 33 different nationalities. Together we make a global platform, powered by data-driven services.


Are you ready to join our mission? Build a platform, cut emissions, change the future.

Prologis is the global leader in logistics real estate. We own, manage and develop high-quality properties in the world’s most vibrant centers of commerce, approximately 72 million square meters in 19 countries. Some of the world’s largest brands (e.g., Amazon, BMW, DHL, FedEx, Pepsi) turn to us because they know an efficient supply chain will make their businesses run better, and a strategic relationship with Prologis will create competitive advantage. As the top ranked U.S. company and sixth overall among the Global 100 Most Sustainable Corporations in the World, we take our global footprint seriously.
Job Title:
Tax & Compliance Manager
Company:
Prologis
The Prologis organization in Europe is structured with a vast number of legal entities; there are over 850 legal entities across multiple jurisdictions and countries including ~500 entities for UK & NE. The corporate purpose of these entities is various but together they are all established to serve our one business purpose, i.e. owning and leasing of warehouse facilities. Most of these entities are obliged to file statutory accounts, corporate income tax returns, and other local filings like net worth tax, withholding tax, etc. These European filings are referred to as ‘compliance’.
Prologis is looking to appoint a Compliance Manager who will ensure delivery based in the European Headquarters in Amsterdam, The Netherlands. The manager will show a continuous focus on process improvements and their execution together with the internal stakeholders and 3rd party service providers. This role reports directly into the Compliance Manager UK & Northern Europe.
What’s needed in order to do that:
Coordinate and organize the Statutory Accounts and CIT return compliance activities
Manage, coordinate, and review output from third-party providers to ensure accurate filing of annual accounts, corporate income tax and other local filings
Provide legal documentation, reviewed accounting schedules and other relevant information to enable the finalization of the compliance work
Manage the local statutory audits with the Amsterdam and Local audit teams
Function as local compliance (GAAP and Tax) specialist and provide guidance to the accountants in various accounting teams
Ensure alignment with internal and external policies and regulations and timely reporting
Coordinate with external and internal parties, such as the Legal, Tax and Treasury departments, to ensure all deadlines are met and cross-functional activities such as re-financing and corporate simplifications are effectively performed
Ensure that all statutory adjustments are provided to the general ledger accountants for posting in the accounting system
Review tax calculation packages
Review and approve tax assessments, prepayments, and final payments in conjunction with filed CIT returns
Tell us if you’re ready.
Education on at least Bachelor level in accounting, additional tax expertise is an advantage
A minimum of 5+ year work experience in financial accounting at an international environment with management experience
Fluent in English (spoken and written), other languages (e.g. German, Dutch, French) are an advantage
Strong Excel skills are a must and affinity with data analytics and automating processes is a plus
Excellent leadership, interpersonal, communication, analytical and problem-solving skills:
Influencing skills: ability to build a strong and positive relationship with your colleagues resulting in buy-in and effective collaboration
Cultural sensitivity: ability to work in a multi-cultural and matrix-structured environment, act and respond appropriately in a diverse environment, properly handle confidential information and work in a constructive way with other staff groups
Proactive behavior: ability to proactively support the business
Hands-on mentality: ability to manage ad hoc requests proactively and practically from the business
Collaborate to optimize performance/impact
Ability to inspire confidence in your work colleagues
Self-development: ability to continuously develop yourself to become more effective, reflect on your own behavior and take time to receive/give feedback from/to your manager, team, peers, and other relevant stakeholder
#LI-LMP
People First
Each of us working at Prologis plays an essential role in the enduring success of our company. We value people who are decisive, courageous and adaptable. While we are one company, locations and departments operate with autonomy and accountability. Individuals take the initiative here.
When you join Prologis, you work shoulder to shoulder with some of the top talent in the industry to do the best work of your career. Every employee belongs. Every employee contributes. Employees advance their careers here.
