Job Title: International Trainee - Project Delivery Onshore Wind
Job Description:
Now you can shape the path towards fossil free living. We’re searching for 20 talented individuals to join us on our journey towards fossil free living. Individuals that challenge the way we think, lead us down new paths and contribute to solving the biggest challenge of humankind – climate change. Is this you?

Become one of our 20 International Trainees at Vattenfall. Each of the trainee positions is unique, linked to a department within a specific business area and a working location. This means that each position has its own specific responsibilities, challenges and matching profile.

Next to your personal development in this unique position you will be enjoying one year of all we have to offer. Your trainee year will be filled with meet-ups with your international trainee team with likeminded individuals. You will be meeting up virtually to work on assignments and live during four seminar weeks where you will be visiting our power plants and growing your superpowers with a variety of trainings.

Your role as a Trainee – Project Delivery Onshore Wind
You will be working on Onshore Wind construction projects in (one of) the Vattenfall countries during the procurement and construction phases of these projects.

During the construction phase, the Project Delivery Trainee will support the Project Managers in our team in safely delivering a successfully constructed and efficiently operating wind farm project to the budget, timescales and quality standards that were determined at Final Investment Decision (FID). During the procurement phase, the Project Delivery Trainee will support the procurement process and the Development Manager in reaching the FID. The role will be to ensure that the main construction phase contracts (i.e. wind turbine package, civil works package and grid works package) are secured to a sufficient standard to enable seamless execution of the project during the construction phase.

On our Construction projects we have a large variety of different (project management) roles working together as a team to deliver to a high standard. The Project Delivery Trainee would have the opportunity to get acquainted with how we procure and build our projects by exploring these different roles and disciplines, start developing the competences and gain the experience required to work on our projects. We are flexible in shaping the roles and tasks for the trainee, based on demand from the projects, personal preference and background.

Your daily activities:
Assisting Project Managers or other members of the team in their day-to-day tasks running construction projects: from defining project goals to communicating with in- and external stakeholders, from monitoring progress or budget, to identifying and managing risks, to keeping the spirit up in the project team.
You support the projects &/or the Project Delivery organisation with specific projects or tasks, which can vary from running data analyses, to organizing an event, to managing an improvement initiative, or assessing a problem and coming up with- and implementing solutions.

Who are you?
Whether you want a climate smarter career as an energy specialist, visionary manager or inspirational project lead in the energy sector, we offer you these possibilities within the Trainee Programme.

As a Trainee – Project Delivery Onshore Wind, you recognize yourself in the following:
You have affinity with and/or are highly interested in (the construction phase of) renewable energy projects
You have a Master’s degree in a relevant field
You are results driven and you inspire and motivate others
You enjoy working in a team, you contribute to a positive team spirit and build strong relationships with the people you work with
You are curious and always eager to learn and develop yourself
You thrive in complex environments with high pressure and tight deadlines
Changing priorities do not scare you, identifying and (re)setting priorities in your work is your strength
You are a self-starter and have a fresh look on things, often coming up with creative and innovative solutions that others have not yet thought of and you are not afraid to ask the awkward questions
You are our ideal trainee if you are a recent graduate with an academic degree or you graduate before September 2021. You are fluent in English. Skills in other world languages can be a merit. You are willing to relocate for possible assignments throughout the organization. And of course, you identify yourself with our principles: active, open, positive and safe.

Location:
You will be working within the Construction Management and Project Support team in the Project Delivery department and the position is located in Amsterdam in the Netherlands.

What we offer you
Vattenfall International Trainee Programme is the kickstart of your career within Vattenfall. You will have the opportunity to develop your professional and personal skills over the course of a year. In the Trainee Programme you will take part in international workshops and site visits during the seminar weeks. You will have the opportunity to work abroad and get a good overview of our entire organization. Each position comes with a competitive salary and an excellent remuneration package.Read more about the elements of the Vattenfall International Trainee Programme here or check the FAQ page.

For our Sales Bioprocess Solutions Team, we are seeking a Sales Representative (m|f|d) Food & Beverage homebased in Amsterdam. In this role, you will be responsible for sales of our filtration and fermentation technology to customers in the food and beverage industry. With your understanding of biotechnological processes, you will support our customers in their questions about the manufacturing process.
What you will accomplish together with us
You will support and advise existing customers in a very varied environment along the processes in food and beverage production
Actively drive sales and acquire completely new customers, especially in the field of food biotech
You are independently responsible for time management and planning customer visits
Take responsibility for customer acquisition, sales planning for your territory and reporting
Achieve your sales target along the agreed sales strategy
You will work closely with Sartorius application specialists to solve specific and technical customer inquiries
You will be involved in the conception and implementation of sales promotion measures (seminars, exhibitions, etc.)
What will convince us
Completed natural science studies in biology, biotechnology with focus on food technology or comparable education with corresponding work experience
You have first professional experience in the Life Science industry and you are comfortable to sell
You are routine in using biotechnological techniques like filtration, fermentation or chromatography
You are a proactive and communicative personality
You have very good written and verbal Dutch and English skills, French would be a plus
You are ready to travel (approx. 50%) within Netherlands, and you have the flexibility to travel to Denmark
What we offer
Sartorius’ ambition is to simplify progress in life science research and the biopharmaceutical industry to help translate scientific findings into new therapeutics faster and more efficiently. Our nearly 10,000 employees at more
than 60 sites are working together on achieving this goal: Better health for more people. And together, we have grown strongly over the past years. Enjoy the Advantages of working with a global player:
Great opportunity to grow the food & beverage market in the Netherlands for Sartorius
Attractive remuneration, Homeoffice, company car
Opportunity for international career development: a global network offering seminars and training sessions, expert and manager career paths
Open and highly collaborative culture: mutual support within teams and working as equals, team spirit and international collaboration
Ambitious goals: Sartorius plans to double its sales revenue approximately every five years and expects to grow its global team to approximately 15,000 people in 2025
We look for employees who would like to grow with us and move the innovative life sciences sector forward. In the process, we focus on agile project work, mutual support within teams and working as equals. Sartorius thrives as a company with people who give their very best every day and who are eager to develop personally and professionally.
Further insights into our world of work can be found here.

Req Number: KFINT16823

Location: Amsterdam, Noord-Holland

Posted: 1/28/2021

Category: Products

Job Type: Employee

About Us
Korn Ferry is a global organizational consulting firm. We help clients synchronize strategy and talent to drive superior performance. We work with organizations to design their structures, roles, and responsibilities. We help them hire the right people to bring their strategy to life. And we advise them on how to reward, develop, and motivate their people.

Our 8,600 colleagues serve clients in more than 50 countries. We offer five core solutions:

Organizational Strategy
Assessment and Succession
Talent Acquisition
Leadership Development
Rewards and Benefits

The Role
The purpose of the role is to manage specific client projects throughout the whole project lifecycle reporting to the Pay Delivery Leader, ensuring that the client and relevant colleagues are kept informed throughout and that deadlines are met. This role is about both building and maintaining client relationships delivering profitable renewal and yield business as well as ensuring coordination of all stages of set up, educate, data collection, reporting and actioning to deliver promise to clients. The job includes deep technical expertise, focusing on understanding the client needs and building knowledge of all products and services available in PAY and Work Measurement category.
Key Accountabilities
Managing delivery of Products and Services with high standards of knowledge and quality in Pay and Work measurement Category:
Ensure that client receives products and services to agreed standards of quality and on time by effectively managing the entire project team and taking corrective action including. escalation when necessary to guarantee client satisfaction and sustainable financial results.
Ensure quality of activities of the delivery team on the project according to the agreed timeframe.
Take responsibility for overall progress of project plan and initiate corrective action where required.
Liaise with all members of the project team to assure the overall direction and integrity of the projects.
Prepare any follow-on actions required and communicate to others where relevant.
Deliver training to clients on Products Portfolio.
Advise clients on reward and benefits topics.


Maintaining renewal business and growing yield business:
Maintains and grows revenue streams from assigned client accounts by developing and maintaining multiple relationships (including i.e. line managers, HR managers, C&B specialists, procurement) with the client and leveraging Korn Ferry internal resources to ensure maximum revenues generation over the long term.


Growing the database
Work together with national and international colleagues and clients to grow the base of our business: our organizational database.
Increase the quality and density of the data by working with the client to get best possible data and make the AI learn.

Skills & Experience
Degree in Business Administration or equivalent. Additional training in HR, Reward and Benefits will be considered.
2 – 4 years’ experience in consulting or account management, working on product delivery projects
Exposure to Pay & Reward products would be beneficial
Experience of managing large volumes of data
Develops an internal network of relationships to proactively share experience and learn
Can measure and monitor own performance and start to understand trends and success factors
Ensures understanding of deliverables and expectations
Known for delivering or coordinating high quality work that meets expectations for timeliness, accuracy and completeness - not only standardised but also non-standard products

About the team

The Lifecycle Marketing team plays a huge role in Miro's rapidly scaling growth, contributing to product adoption, monetization, retention, and resurrection of the continuously growing number of Miro users.

Lifecycle Marketing is part of the overarching Growth Marketing function and partners very closely with other teams within the organization, such as Product and Enterprise Marketing, Product Growth, and Performance Marketing. Additionally, the team collaborates closely with other functions such as Brand and Content Marketing, Analytics, Customer Experience, and Sales, resulting in a collaborative and cross-functional role.

About the role

In this role, you will help to build, launch, and analyze user lifecycle campaigns, newsletters, triggered, and transactional emails that help to drive Miro business growth.

We are looking for someone to join our Growth Marketing team who is passionate about email marketing and who will support the development and execution of highly targeted email campaigns for Miro users, and help us keep our email calendar, lists, segments, and analytics up-to-date.

The role reports directly to the Lifecycle Marketing Lead and will work closely with Growth, Marketing, and Product teams.

This is a unique opportunity to join a fast-growing team and leave your mark as the team scales up. Your efforts will support the foundation for the Lifecycle Marketing team and will contribute to the company's growth.

What you'll do
Support and coordinate end-to-end process of lifecycle marketing strategies development and execution from idea to content creation, production, and analytics including working with business stakeholders, gathering references, creating lists, creating/updating email content, and delivering systematic reporting
Support other functions in Miro through the email creation process (surveys, launch emails, event invitations, etc.)
Regularly communicate upcoming email campaigns, keep email calendar, lists, segments, and knowledge base up-to-date
Ensure all emails are on-brand and maintain below average unsubscribe rates, spam or bounce rates, and other negative indicators
Help the Lifecycle Marketing team to perform quality control checks, documentation, and taxonomy best practices to produce accurate and transparent work processes
What you'll need
2+ years of experience in CRM, email, or lifecycle marketing
Experience with email, CRM, and automation tools
Strong project management skills
Advanced collaboration skills, ability to communicate and drive processes with a wide range of stakeholders
Strong empathy and customer-centric approach
Autonomy, orientation to details, and a strong commitment to results
Analytical skills, ability to collect and aggregate data from multiple sources, formulate research questions and hypotheses, and make data-informed decisions
Nice to have
You have worked in a similar role in a SaaS B2B company
You can operate pretty autonomously on a copywriting and content creation side
What's in it for you
Stock Option Grant
Medical Insurance coverage
Travel allowance for your commute
Lunch, snacks and drinks provided
Allowance to facilitate remote working during WFH period
Weekly team activities (even virtually) to keep the spirits high
Opportunity to work for a truly global team
Inspiring workplace in the heart of Amsterdam
About Miro

Miro is an online collaborative whiteboard platform that enables distributed teams to work effectively together, from running brainstorming sessions and workshops to planning projects, from designing new products and services to facilitating agile ceremonies. With over 10 million users, Miro is trusted by Dell, Cisco, Salesforce, PWC, EY, Deloitte and many more global companies of all sizes.

At Miro, we are a team of dreamers. We look for individuals who dream big, work hard and above all stay humble. Collaboration is at the heart of what we do and through our work together we hope to create a supportive, welcoming, and innovative environment. We strive to play as a team to win the world and create a better version of ourselves everyday. If this sounds like something that excites you, we want to hear from you!

Check out our career page for all our open roles or hop onto this Miro board to learn more about us!

ANALYST EQUITY CAPITAL MARKETS AMSTERDAM
Position
ING Equity Capital Markets currently has a vacant Analyst position
ING Equity Capital Markets
Equity Capital Markets (ECM) is a joint venture between the Global Capital Markets (GCM) department and the Corporate Finance (CF) department of the Strategic Products Group within ING’s Wholesale Banking division, and advises companies on raising equity on international stock markets. Products covered by ECM include Initial Public Offerings (IPOs), follow-on equity issues and secondary offerings (rights issues or accelerated bookbuild offerings (ABBs)), capital return programmes including share buybacks, preference shares issuances and equity-linked transactions (convertible bonds). ECM, with support from FM Equity Markets, originates, structures and markets equity and equity-linked transactions to institutional investors (e.g. pension funds, insurance companies, asset managers, hedge funds) and retail investors.
What can we offer?
As an ECM Analyst you will work in a dynamic, enthusiastic, and highly motivated team on challenging Equity Capital Market transactions for high profile clients, mainly in Europe. You will be supporting the team in originating, structuring and executing ECM transactions. You will be part of transaction teams on high profile European ECM transactions (examples include the recent rights issue by Fugro, JDE Peet’s IPO, Just Eat Takeaway capital increase, Randstad preference shares transaction, Prosus listing, etc. Key development opportunities offered with the position:
Transaction driven, dynamic and energetic environment
Steep learning curve
Learning about and tracking capital markets dynamics
Preparing presentations, financial modelling, conducting research on industries, sectors and companies
Maintaining close ties with the departments within and outside the Strategic Products Group
Affinity with key databases (Bloomberg, CapitalIQ, Factset, etc.)
Both soft and hard skills; and pro-active coaching through buddy system
Exposure within the organisation to a.o. Financial Markets, Capital Structuring & Advisory, Corporate Clients and Corporate Investments
Equity Capital Markets transactions are complex and demanding and joining our team will therefore give you a head start in your future career
Who are we looking for?
Suitable candidates have affinity with the equity markets, obtained their master’s degree and relevant internship experience, as well as a high energy level and performance motivation, strong attention to detail, good communication and interpersonal skills and affinity with finance and financial markets. Candidates are required to have fluency in business English and to be proficient in the Dutch language and are expected to reside in the Netherlands.
Please include a cover letter containing your motivation, and your CV. Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis (first come first serve).
Apply or questions?
Do you have any questions about the position within the ECM department? Please contact the recruitment team via the contact details below. Please send your questions or application (covermail and CV) to:
More info on ING Corporate Finance
The Corporate Finance department is the primary point of contact for advisory relationships with corporates and institutional investors, leading the execution of high profile Equity Capital Markets and Mergers & Acquisitions transactions. In the Benelux, ING Corporate Finance is the absolute #1 in both ECM and M&A. ING Corporate Finance adopts a sector-based approach, putting together client teams across borders to reflect local relationships and product specialists and to ensure the highest standards of transaction execution.
The Amsterdam office of ING CF is responsible for the origination and execution of transactions in a Benelux domestic and cross-border context, as part of ING Wholesale Banking’s European Corporate Finance team. The CF team in Amsterdam consists of over 50 professionals.
What we offer
A job from 36 to 40 hours and a unique offer that fits in with the times of today. We take into account your home situation and your ambitions and help you to balance work and private life. Discover yourself our employment conditions.;
A salary tailored to your qualities and experience;
Flexible working hours and the possibility to work at home;
Reimbursement for travel expenses;
24 vacation days with a 36-hour working week. If you work 40 hours a week, you will receive 27 vacation days;
Pension scheme;
13th month salary;
Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary;
8% Holiday payment;
Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities to realize your ambitions;
An informal working environment with innovative colleagues who strive for the very best.

Job Title: Application and Technical Support Manager - Bakery Key Accounts
Job Description:
Bunge (NYSE: BG) is a world leader in sourcing, processing and supplying oilseed and grain products and ingredients. Founded in 1818, Bunge’s expansive network feeds and fuels a growing world, creating sustainable products and opportunities for more than 70,000 farmers and the consumers they serve across the globe. The company is headquartered in St. Louis, Missouri and has 25,000 employees worldwide who stand behind more than 350 port terminals, oilseed processing plants, grain facilities, and food and ingredient production and packaging facilities around the world.

“Be the technical linking pin between our Key Accounts in Bakery Specialties and our company”

Manufacturing excellent bakery products, balancing indulgence and productivity, is challenging. Product value cycles are getting shorter and trends are evolving faster than ever. This ever-changing market demands a quick response if our customers in both artisanal as industrial baking want to win fast and smart.

Within Bunge Loders Croklaan (BLC) we dedicate our expertise to understand and identify our customers’ needs and collaborate with our channel to help them to choose the right fat / margarine to balance market demands with product innovation. In order to help our partners and customers, we provide our application and development expertise and capabilities.

In the role of Application and Technical Support Manager - Bakery Key Accounts you’ll be at the heart of this innovation!

As Application and Technical Support Manager Key Accounts you are working very closely with your Sales counterpart(s) and the customers R&D Innovation department. Through daily contact, as a partner of sales and account managers you understand and spot the demand of our customers and translate / negotiate this into understandable and realistic requirements and specifications towards our Research and Development specialists, or towards Product Management, Quality and Production.
This role is truly cross functional. About 60 to 80 % of your time you will be in contact with about 6 – 8 key accounts in the bakery segment. In ‘normal’ times you will be traveling regularly to visit customers for project and portfolio updates or to assist in line trials. As the technical counterpart of our sales crew, you are typically the person in contact with our internal R&D department and that of the customer, to make sure we develop the right products and samples for our customers.
The other part of your time would be spent as application lead, maintaining an internal community that is constantly sharing and creating knowledge and insights on our specialized bakery ingredients business, industry developments, specialized solutions such as Shea based margarine, and you will guide internal processes in the right direction. Being the expert on your product also means you organize customer workshops and trainings, represent Bunge Loders Croklaan at exhibitions and fairs, support building product USPs in application, drive application development and you build and maintain presence and visibility in the local technical community and network, e.g. by participating in expert groups, advisory boards to technical institutions.

What do you bring to the role?
As the description might have given away, for this role you will need to be a specialist in product development in oils & fats, mainly for the bakery industry and have over 5 years of experience in working with food (ingredients) companies. Your mindset is commercial, result oriented and most of all you are service minded, understanding the landscape where fast responses are required in order to optimize opportunities and customer satisfaction. To achieve this you’ll be a great team player and have developed sound project management skills. Fluency in English and German is required and other European languages are beneficial.

What we offer

A key role in an organization with colleagues around the world, who are dedicated to improving the global Agri-Food value chain, one day at a time. Together, we bring food from where it’s produced to where it’s needed. We do this in an informal culture where an entrepreneurial mindset is valued. Being a global company with a constant need for innovation, a broad variety of challenges and development opportunities can support your long term career at Bunge. We value and stimulate development through training, education and experience and offer effective and accredited tools and resources to support you in your journey.

If this description matches your profile and ambition, we’re looking forward to see your application and motivation in English by hitting apply!

Are you ready to join a dynamic and diverse client-facing team of lending specialists who provide tailor-made financing solutions for our (international) FI clients? Do you want to share your knowledge and experience on finance and structured lending in the interests of our clients and the future of our bank?

Your job
We are looking for a FI Lending specialist to join the FI Lending product unit within Structured Finance & Portfolio Management (SF&PM) part of Corporate & Institutional Banking (CIB).

The FI Lending Specialist is responsible for the commercial proposition, structuring and execution of Structured Lending products to (inter)national FI clients. Together with other client coverage teams you take care of the origination of the client dialogue. Your work includes negotiating and preparing tailor made commercial client propositions, structuring loan products, drafting credit applications, executing imminent deals (including coordination with external advisors), negotiating financing documents with the client and monitoring of the existing portfolio of (debt) transactions.

The assessment of risks involved is based on your (credit structuring) experience and specific client-, product-, and FI-sector knowledge. Your challenge will be to find the right balance between commerce and risk taking into account the bank’s moderate risk profile, while keeping client interests and needs centre stage.

Working environment
Financial Institutions is a sector with a global footprint in CIB. Controlled growth and consolidation of international expansion - predominantly in North-West Europe - is an important theme for FI. Lending is a key product that enables international growth of FI. FI Specialised Lending (FISL) - currently consisting of 11 Lending Specialists in Amsterdam – is looking to reinforce the portfolio finance segment in the team.

FISL is organised along three niche lending activities; Fund finance, Insurance consolidation finance and Portfolio finance. The product specialism Portfolio finance delivers product services to (Large) Corporates and FI clients. The team develops financial structures, enabling a client to obtain financing using its own assets as a secured element. Assets usually deployed are portfolios of mortgage loans, consumer loans, auto leases, corporate receivables, etc. You are the arranging linking pin between your client and Risk Management and deploy a hands-on approach in tailoring and negotiating successful transactions for your client. Furthermore, you advise on and structure portfolio management transactions enabling a capital efficient business model.

FISL acts as a centre of (credit) expertise and is the first line of defence for FI clients The team is transaction-oriented, result-oriented and knowledge-driven with a great deal of teamwork and strong empowerment of individual responsibilities. We work closely together with other CIB teams such as Client Coverage, DCM, Loan Origination, Sustainability and Central Portfolio Management ensuring that clients needs are serviced best and our portfolio is sound and grows in a sustainable way. Our office is based in Amsterdam (Gustav Mahlerlaan) where we work in an open floor space and have all stakeholders in our vicinity. We have a flexible operating model that allows for working at home via VPN.

We are offering
ABN AMRO offers a challenging international work environment that provides ample opportunities for personal growth, knowledge development, and teamwork and that fosters taking responsibility. There is a strong and dynamic team of passionate professionals that seek the best lending solutions for their clients.

The benefits are:
The opportunity to be the best you can be, to work flexible hours and to have sufficient room to grow both personally and professionally
A very professional working environment with a very interesting and steep learning curve
A large responsibility and access to a career with multiple possibilities for growth
A Market-conform salary with a competitive benefits package and a substantial education budget
An annual public transportation pass or travel budget, depending on your travel preference
The opportunity to pro-actively work on your vitality and fitness
A solid pension plan
Your profile
We are looking for a professional with:
Minimal [6-8] years of credit experience to wholesale clients
Strong affiliation with structured lending -,(debt) capital markets or affiliated products
Good knowledge relevant developments of CRR, Securitisation Regulation, Basel IV, Solvency II, Accountancy guidelines
Analytical with advanced excel skills
Risk Management experience and affinity with portfolio management skills
Ability of managing an FI client credit portfolio
Strong communication and commercial skills

Next to this, we require:
WO / Master
Fluent in English (written / verbal) and preferably also in Dutch
Interested?
For additional information you may contact Martijn Bakker, Head FI Specialised Lending, 06-30422010, martijn.bakker@nl.abnamro.com.

What's in it for you?
Competitive package
Employee Performance Bonus
Free gym on Site, Travel allowance, Pension provider, Healthy lunch.
What is required?
Strong interpersonal skills
Stakeholder management
Strength in presenting and communicating information
Why Interxion?
The opportunity to make an impact
Highly collaborative teams that build relationships with world-class customers
A high-performing international business at the heart of the digital economy
The Technical Pre-Sales Consultant supports International Sales, International Bid-Management as well as Local Sales and Bid-Management for large strategic country deals with various activities including technical presentations, consulting, site visits, technical bid & RFP support. Moreover you conduct communication with top level customers. You have comprehensive technical knowledge and are sales orientated. You understand the role of data centres within the digital value chains and will be supporting the International Sales and Bid-Management team in this area. The Technical Pre-Sales Consultant is an important role in the achievement of the company’s focus on business development and winning strategic customers. About Us

Beat is one of the most exciting companies to ever come out of the ride-hailing space. One city at a time, all across the globe we make transportation affordable, convenient, and safe for everyone. We also help hundreds of thousands of people earn extra income as drivers.

Today we are the fastest-growing ride-hailing service in Latin America. But serving millions of rides every day pales in comparison to what lies ahead. Our plans for expansion are limitless. Our stellar engineering team operates across a number of European capitals where, right now, some of the world’s most ambitious and talented engineers are changing how cities will move in the future.

Beat is currently available in Greece, Peru, Chile, Colombia, Mexico and Argentina.

About the role

We're looking for a CRM Specialist to help continue the current pace of growth by ensuring that we are effectively messaging our customers in a way that informs, delights and drives growth.

Being a CRM Specialist at Beat means you will be part of a cross-functional team. You will be working with operations, analytics, product and design teams to coordinate and deploy email campaigns around product launches, promotions and all other ad hoc communications relevant to our customers. You will be creating new paths together with a great team of hackers and hustlers in a fast paced, growth oriented environment.

What you'll be doing:

Setup and execute CRM strategies to engage and retain users throughout all Lifecycle stages
Leverage CRM channels (email, SMS, push notifications and in-app messaging) to plan informational & promotional campaigns for both sides of the marketplace: drivers & passengers
Monitor the performance of our campaigns and our users’ behaviour to optimise target groups and relevant content
Run Customer base segmentation and perform A/B testing
Own the reporting and optimisation of all campaigns and communications
Collaborate with business intelligence team to understand user behaviour and leverage it in the CRM campaigns
Playbooking. Document everything. The learnings from today will pave the way for growth in the region and other markets around the world.

What you need to have:

Relevant working experience in a high paced / start up environment, strong data mining acumen
Strong familiarity and passion for customer relationship management and marketing
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
Strong familiarity with email and in-app marketing best practices, requirements and creative process
Experience with A/B testing
Experience in analysing engagement campaigns and developing cohesive conclusions based on data
Skilled at driving decisions in ambiguous environments
Excellent command of English, both spoken and written
An entrepreneurial spirit/attitude —ready to seize opportunities to make an impact without needing to be told
Experience with CRM strategy and tools for mobile apps

What’s nice to have:

HTML knowledge
SQL knowledge
Tableau
Spanish language

What's in it for you:

Competitive full-time salary
Private Health Coverage on the Company’s group program
Beat rides-travel in our city for free, at the tap of a button
Breakfast, high-quality daily lunch at a very low cost, fruit and snacks all day long
Flexible working hours, Spanish Lessons
Working in a hyper-growth environment, you will enjoy numerous learning and career development opportunities
A great opportunity to grow and work with the most amazing people in the industry
Being part of an environment that offers challenging goals, autonomy and mentoring, which creates incredible opportunities, both for you and the company


As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, Beat is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion.

Your new job and office
Passionate about IAM? Then you cannot pass on the opportunity to work for a global IAM team, working on global innovation and change projects.
As our Business Consultant IAM, you help us define IAM requirements and to roll out global initiatives on a local scale. Your ultimate challenge is to ensure that, despite the complexity, the user experience for your local stakeholders (offices, stores, HQ's and distribution centers) is a smooth and innovative one.
We hope you like a good challenge because we are currently transitioning from IBM identity stack to Azure Active Directory and Saviynt. And as you can imagine, this entails many exciting projects where you will act as a delegator. That means that you will need to be knowledgeable on a technical level, but your focus is on coordinating the technical implementation by others.
In that capacity, you cover IAM initiatives for the Netherlands as well as the rest of our global portfolio. You work closely with your peers in Belgium and the United States. You will also work to coordinate with IAM architects, engineers, and project managers. Together you play an essential role in optimizing our domains and information security.
As an IAM Specialist, make an impact at Ahold Delhaize by:
driving the Identity and Access Management (IAM) service portfolio for The Netherlands, including the IAM governance model and identity roadmap delivery.
supporting, delivering, and maintaining the IAM roadmap, acting as a security ambassador, and providing direction and IAM expertise for business enablement (stores, brands, distribution centers, and headquarters).
supporting, delivering, and maintaining the access management roadmap, focusing on enterprise single sign-on, overall access management, privileged user management, and multifactor authentication.
identity operations management: establishing, managing, and maintaining IAM operations, focusing on consolidation of provisioning methods, integration of identity stores, work towards role-based access, centralization of the authentication methods, and managing high privileged accounts and associated solutions.
ensuring close communication with stakeholders like Cyber Defense, Architects, and the business.
Your new office
Working as a Business Consultant IAM, you do at and with Ahold Delhaize. With around 370,000 employees worldwide for more than 50 million customers per week. By doing better together and innovating every day, we strengthen our pioneering role. This way, we build trusted local brands. You will find your new workplace at the vibrant office of Ahold Delhaize in Zaandam, with the GSO (Global Support Office), to be precise. GSO sets global strategic frameworks, facilitates sharing best practices, and encourages economies of scale for the entire organization.
What do we offer?
Here at Ahold Delhaize, we aim to grow. This is only possible if you grow along with us. That’s why we help you take your career and personal development in the direction you want to go. As we work together to build on our brand as well as your career, you can count on (based on 40 hours per week):
A competitive salary up to 80K gross annually
Access to best-in-class guidance and inspiring training to shape your development and career.
20 vacation days, and Personal Budget for you to decide whether to spend it on 12,5 extra vacation days, discounts, or a pay-out.
Flexible working hours.
A laptop and telephone.
An excellent pension plan with a personal contribution of 6.2%
A travel allowance for traveling to and from Zaandam.
A bonus on top of your salary.
Attractive discounts on various insurance policies.
10% discount on your grocery shopping in our Albert Heijn stores, up to €300 per year.
Covid-19
Our main priority continues to be the health and safety of our employees and customers. Due to the Covid-19 pandemic, this position will be remote until further notice. We will continue to monitor the circumstances, and when we feel comfortable, this position will return to our Headquarters in Zaandam. There you will have the opportunity to collaborate face-to-face with a talented and diverse group of colleagues. This also means that all job interviews for this position will take place through video calls.
Requirements
At Ahold Delhaize, you work for one of the largest retailers in the world. To keep up with us, you are bursting with ambition. For this vacancy of Business Consultant IAM, you possess the ability to build effective relationships with colleagues and stakeholders to get the job done. You thrive in a dynamic and international work environment where planning and setting priorities are challenging. You complete this with:
a bachelor's degree from a relevant education such as computer science or IT.
3-5 years of experience within an Identity and Access Management domain.
A track record of coordinating changes in the IAM domain on a large scale.
Knowledge of Azure Active Directory, CyberArk PAM, and Saviynt.
Knowledge of IBM identity stack is a plus.
Nice-to-have:
CISSP, CISM, or Microsoft Certified: Azure Security Engineer Associate.

Now you can shape the path towards fossil free living. We’re searching for 20 talented individuals to join us on our journey towards fossil free living. Individuals that challenge the way we think, lead us down new paths and contribute to solving the biggest challenge of humankind – climate change. Is this you?
Become one of our 20 International Trainees at Vattenfall. Each of the trainee positions is unique, linked to a department within a specific business area and a working location. This means that each position has its own specific responsibilities, challenges and matching profile.
Next to your personal development in this unique position you will be enjoying one year of all we have to offer. Your trainee year will be filled with meet-ups with your international trainee team with likeminded individuals. Develop knowledge of our Procurement processes as well as managing a Service Provider
Develop SAP knowledge (module MM)
Support relationship management with internal stakeholders and the service provider
Assist with coordinating daily work distribution and hand-offs from the internal Procurement / Business organization to the service provider
Conduct performance checks and suggest corrective measures
Create reports and support with optimization of reporting and analysis
Contribute to the continuous improvement
Bring in new ideas and challenge the existing organization
Take an active role in the team meetings
Support with ad-hoc operational activities
Who are you?
Whether you want a climate smarter career as an energy specialist, visionary manager or inspirational project lead in the energy sector, we offer you these possibilities within the Trainee Programme.
As a Trainee – Procurement Excellence you recognize yourself in the following:
Master’s degree in economics, business informatics, industrial management (including the field of supply chain management or procurement) or any other comparable degree
Highly interested in Procurement and the energy industry
Strong analytical skills, communication and presentation skills
Business awareness / commercial mindset
Team player who actively engages with people by asking, sharing, helping or asking for help
Strong networking skills and ability to communicate with different stakeholders
Organized, proactive and results oriented
Good MS Excel and PowerPoint skills, basic SAP knowledge is beneficial
Fluent in English and German
You are our ideal trainee if you are a recent graduate with an academic degree or you graduate before September 2021. You are fluent in English. Skills in other world languages can be a merit. You are willing to relocate for possible assignments throughout the organization. And of course, you identify yourself with our principles: active, open, positive and safe.
Location
You will be working in the department of Procurement Excellence and the location for this position is flexible (preferred: Berlin).
What we offer you
Vattenfall International Trainee Programme is the kickstart of your career within Vattenfall. You will have the opportunity to develop your professional and personal skills over the course of a year. In the Trainee Programme you will take part in international workshops and site visits during the seminar weeks. You will have the opportunity to work abroad and get a good overview of our entire organization. Each position comes with a competitive salary and an excellent remuneration package.
Read more about the elements of the Vattenfall International Trainee Programme here or check our FAQ page.
Our organization
At Vattenfall you can free your superpowers! We are one of the European market leaders in the generation of renewable energy and are primarily active in Scandinavia, Germany, Denmark, UK and the Netherlands. We take our responsibility seriously and together we are making the change towards fossil freedom. Our goal is to enable a fossil-free living within one generation. We are a dynamic company with an international focus and a social face at the heart of society. Diversity and inclusion is in everything we do, read more about D&I within Vattenfall.

Application process
We welcome your application in English, including resume and cover letter via the application button on this page. Last day to apply is February 21st 2021. Selection period starts in February, followed by online tests and interviews in March. An assessment is also part of the recruitment process and will take place in April. The recruitment process will be finalized around the end of April. The last step will be a pre-employment screening. Starting date of the Vattenfall International Trainee Programme will be September 1st 2021.
Due to COVID-19 all steps of the recruitment process will take place virtual. At Vattenfall we are committed to acting responsibly in response to the challenges posed by COVID-19 and we are taking all necessary measures to protect employees and job applicants. For more questions about COVID-19, please visit our generic FAQ page.
We look forward to your application! If you have any questions regarding the Trainee Programme in general or the specific trainee position, please check our: FAQ page. Is your question not answered, please contact your responsible recruiter Bina Deutschendorf, +49 40 79022 2289.
Since Vattenfall is a part of the Swedish critical infrastructure, many of our services are security classed. If this position is security classed the final candidates might be subjected to a security vetting process, according to the Swedish legislation.

You – together with a team of 1-5 colleagues from different professional backgrounds – will support our international clients with sector-specific knowledge and strategic advice: enabling them to co-create new strategies, services and products. You will translate complex commercial, organisational, and technical information into concrete advice, reports and specifications. Besides project responsibilities, you will have the opportunity to help write proposals for clients and build propositions on key themes (e.g. Open Banking, Data Sharing, Cybersecurity, Advanced Analytics, Internet of Things).


WE OFFER an agile organisation structure and culture that is characterised by entrepreneurship, forward-thinking, collaboration and ownership. We believe in - and will offer you - personal(ised) growth rather than a fixed career path through career coaching and a personal development plan. We offer you a flexible and open working environment where you will be part of innovation projects with true impact.


Also, we rank fun very high, which is reflected by our weekly Friday evening drinks, our annual ski trip, our offsite weekends, sporting events, Christmas party and more!


For more information regarding INNOPAY or this role, please contact us via recruitment@innopay.com

Your new job and office
Will you help enable us to offer the best-in-class customer experience across our global digital channels? Apply now for the role of Digital Product Manager at Ahold Delhaize.

Our Digital Product Managers are responsible for the evolution of our digital products – mobile and web – used by customers in-store, and online to order for delivery or pickup. Also, Digital Product Managers are responsible for the evolution of our digital capabilities – such as, payments and loyalty. They are responsible for understanding customer needs (consumer and brand customers), prioritizing solutions based on value in the product roadmap, and delivering product requirements (in the form of features and epics) and product design (in collaboration with the design team) to development teams. If you are a product manager with expertise in these areas, that this role is for you.
You will develop the product strategy and be responsible for the realization, in partnership with our design and development teams to deliver digital products and/or capabilities to our great local brands. You will help our customers make their online purchases quickly, easily and securely, and enable them to use our digital product to make their store visits more convenient.

As Digital Product Manager, you will make an impact at Ahold Delhaize by:
enabling best-in-class customer experiences across our channels (online and in-store)
defining, implementing and communicating our strategy across our business
defining the roadmap that delivers on the strategy, in collaboration with stakeholders
working with design, brands, IT, and other stakeholders to define the desired customer experience and to implement new capabilities and experiences
managing and working with our partners in the realization of the strategy
What do we offer?
Working as a Digital Product Manager you do at and with Ahold Delhaize. With around 370,000 employees worldwide for more than 50 million customers per week. On a slightly smaller scale you work with 1,500 colleagues from the Netherlands. By doing better together and innovating every day, we strengthen our pioneering role. And this way we also build trusted local brands. Strong brands where you will find a lot of knowledge, experience and effectiveness.
You will find your new workplace at our vibrant head office, right next to the Zaandam station. On the fifth floor within the Digital Experience Team, to be precise. Everything you do together with your colleagues is immediately visible in our stores and at people's homes. Curious about the people you work with directly? As Digital Product Manager you are part of the European Digital Organization responsible for all European brands of Ahold Delhaize in their respective countries like Albert, Mega Image and Maxi. Our Digital Organization designs digital products and services. Here you will work together with Product Managers, Program Managers and Designers to deliver the best customer experiences.

Covid-19
Our main priority continues to be the health and safety of our employees and customers. Due to the Covid-19 pandemic, this position will be remote until further notice. We will continue monitor the circumstances and when we feel comfortable, this position will return to our bustling Headquarters in Zaandam, where you will have the opportunity to collaborate face-to-face with a talented and diverse group of colleagues.

At Ahold Delhaize we want to grow. That is only possible if you grow with us. That is why you can go in all directions with us career-wise and in your personal development. While we work together to build our brand and your career, you can count on (based on 40 hours a week):
 a gross montly salary up to €7100,-
flexible working hours and the possibility to work from home.
a very good pension plan with a personal contribution of 6.2%.
reimbursement of your travel expenses to and from Zaandam.
20 vacation days.
a personal budget, which you can decide to spend on extra vacation days, discounts or pay-outs.
the possibility to attend training courses at our expense.
a bonus on top of your salary.
attractive discounts on various insurance policies.
a laptop and telephone.
a 10% discount on your grocery shopping in our Albert Heijn stores, up to € 300 per year.
regularly fun promotions and delicious tastings with free products.
Requirements
You have a real passion and a clear vision for the future of digital grocery customer experience, the ambition to bring that vision to life and the ability to drive initiatives, with minimal supervision. You will combine your relentless customer-focus with a strong sense of user experience, technical fluency and business acumen. You also have the ability to effectively operate in a large matrix organization and to work effectively with stakeholders and partners across the organization.
a Bachelor’s degree in Design, Technology or Business Studies
fluent and strong English communication skills (writing and speaking).
at least 7 years of experience working in e-commerce and digital.
experience in leading and running complex projects and/or programs.
a genuine passion for improving customer experiences.
a strong technical foundation and business acumen.
strong leadership and interpersonal skills.
efficient decision making skills
the ability to prioritize well.
the ability to anticipate and resolve problems.
a proven record of creative and critical thinking capabilities.
self-motivation and a clear dedication to your profession.
the ability to work well independently.

Apply now
Seeing is experiencing. This applies to our stores and certainly to our head office in Zaandam. Perhaps your new workplace where you as Digital Product Manager have an influence on the most famous Dutch retail brands. Apply now.

Why would you like to work for Ahold Delhaize?

Job Description

The Global Tax Team provides tax advice and input to the JDE organization and is responsible for executing the Group’s tax & transfer pricing policy and ensuring tax efficiency. The primary responsibility of the Global Transfer Pricing Specialist is to advise on and manage all aspects of Transfer Pricing compliance, support and advice on and implementation of cross border transactions, prepare and review Transfer Pricing documentation and ensure Transfer Pricing requirements and filings are fulfilled.
Responsibilities:
Contribute to the implementation of the Group Tax Strategy;Provide support in developing, implementing, updating, maintaining and documenting Transfer Pricing policies;Manage various transfer pricing formalities and monitor group guidelines, policies and directives in the transfer pricing area;Coordinate the preparation and update of globally consistent transfer pricing documentation and review of the draft transfer pricing documentation produced to ensure correct treatment of intra-group transactions and determine whether further information is required.Provide support in the implementation of a great variety of projects from a transfer pricing perspective, which amongst others may include the integration of acquisitions, cross-border financing arrangements and changes in cross-border goods flow and footprint changes;(Pro)actively monitor all international (e.g. OECD, EU) and local transfer pricing developments;Review contracts from a transfer pricing perspective and assist in drafting contracts that are in line with structuring decisions.Provide expertise and guidance to respective internal counterparts on transfer pricing related matters and be an active team member;Cooperate and work with many internal and external stakeholders and build up a strong international network of contacts in finance and business functions within JDE;Support in the continuous improvement of operational transfer pricing processes.Support in and prepare for tax audits and questions from tax authorities, as required;Support in producing extensive financial and economic analysis/models to support restructuring/pricing decisions and transfer pricing compliance;Perform research and prepare transfer pricing analyses and draft position papers, unilateral and/or bilateral advance pricing agreement requests, presentations etc.

Qualifications

If you’re brimming with entrepreneurial spirit and a drive to succeed, you’ll fit right in at JDE. Working globally and locally, our Associates have been positively influencing the world of coffee for over 265 years. We love people who are not afraid to try, and who try until they get it right. We value strong convictions and encourage debate. And all this in an open, friendly environment where you can approach anyone and grow any way you like.
For this role as Global Transfer Pricing Specialist, we’re looking for someone who has the following skills and experience:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Tax Law, Fiscal Economics or a relevant Financial education, with understanding of accountingApproximately 4 - 6 years of relevant international tax experience obtained in an international tax advisory practice;Highly motivated, outgoing and good communication and interpersonal skills;Hands-on, pro-active, dedicated, solution-oriented, accurate, structured, responsible and independen ;Verbal and written fluency in English, any additional European language is a plus.Excellent knowledge of Excel and numbers, experience with Alteryx and/or Power BI is a plus.
Your application at JDE
If you are interested in this career opportunity at JDE, hit the “I’m interested” button and upload your application. After receiving your application we will do our utmost to give you quick feedback. Part of the recruitment procedure at JDE will be an online assessment, followed by interviews. A pre-employment check can be part of the recruitment process.

Job Title: Clinical Specialist, North of the Netherlands
Job Description:
CLINICAL SPECIALIST

North of the Netherlands


Masimo (NASDAQ: MASI) is a fast-growing and award-winning international medical technology and device company with operations spanning the globe. We develop innovative noninvasive monitoring technologies that save, extend and improve the lives of people of all ages, in all walks of life. These revolutionary technologies are helping to solve "unsolvable" problems that have plagued the healthcare industry, while taking the pain and discomfort out of blood monitoring. For 30 years, innovation has been and will continue to be our passion.


The position:
In this high-profile role as Clinical Specialist (CS) North of The Netherlands you will have the unique fortune to shape, foster and develop strategic relationships with a variety of clinical leaders in targeted hospitals and other healthcare markets. Responsible for clinical targets, plus responsible to support our (OEM) partners with Clinical Evaluation and Research Support, you will be a proactive member of a dynamic team and enjoy securing new business and developing and increasing clinical sales in your territory. Your clinical expertise will be rewarded with opportunities for career growth and advancement in a company that makes a difference in people’s lives!


Responsibilities:

You will be seen as an expert in pulse oximetry, pulse CO-Oximetry, brain function monitoring, wearables, connectivity as well as an authority on the clinical impact of various patient monitoring solutions.
Responsible for clinical support of all Masimo products in the assigned territory.
Plan, execute, and direct overall clinical specialist and research support, including development of account strategies, implementation of strategies, and coordination of resources necessary to optimize markets.
Engage in qualification, demonstration, clinical evaluation, closure, installation, education and follow-up.
Partner with appropriate OEM sales staffs and partner companies in providing key clinical education and support for key account whole-house conversions.
Position Masimo SET as the new standard for pulse oximetry and Masimo Rainbow as the new standard of care for Pulse Co-Oxymetry. Participate in programs to build and maintain end-user awareness (e.g., trade show, regional symposium, competitive analysis, advertising, etc.).
You will be a highly regarded and sought after source of clinically trustworthy information by customers, (OEM) partners and Masimo team members alike.
Coordinate Clinical trainings and lectures with speakers over the region.
The Clinical Specialist will work with the field in developing research accounts and conduct and follow-up on clinical evaluations involving Masimo technology.
Provide marketing input to Regional and Distribution Manager, including clinical market trends and competitive activity.
Interface with Regional Manager to maintain mutual understanding of product design needs, regulatory, and production requirements.
Participate in clinical education efforts for Group Purchasing and Government initiatives.
Maintain thorough product knowledge including ability to demonstrate products, position products vs. competitive products and train end-users. PowerPoint presentation skills will be necessary to communicate Masimo’s vision and value proposition.
Exceed goals within the expense budgets for all required activities.
Requirements:

Registered Nurse with a specialty in other medical/clinical discipline above this level.
2-3 years of experience in direct critical care, NICU, PICU, O.R, ED (Neonatal and Pediatrics highly advantageous).
Proven track record of Clinical Support and the ability to communicate value based solutions.
Experience in Medical Device Clinical Support and Patient Monitoring systems highly advantageous.
Demonstrated conceptual, analytical, problem-solving and organizational skills.
Dutch and English verbal and written communication skills (required).
Experience in customer interactions, training and presentations.
Educational or research experience required highly advantageous.
Ability and willingness to travel throughout your territory.
Results oriented with a positive "can do" attitude and a sense of urgency to get things done.
Direct experience in educating/training in competitive, strategy-intensive markets within hospital and/or other healthcare markets.
Experience working with OEM and distributors sales forces.
Experience calling on C level customers.
Comfortable in high visibility situations and exhibits strong self-confidence.
Superior written and verbal communication skills with an exceptional ability to lead group presentations.
Demonstrated self-starter; a "hands-on" individual who enjoys challenge and is dedicated to getting the job done with minimal support and direction. Accustomed to a heavy travel schedule.
Advanced software, presentation and project management skills.
Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. We wish to have your application no later than February 15th. Please send your CV in English through our Masimo website https://www.masimo.com/company/opportunities/careers/ – we look forward to your application!

Job Title: Business Intelligence Specialist for Digital and Marketing
Job Description:
Business Intelligence Specialist for Digital and Marketing-REG02543

Description

Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 155,000 employees who are committed to safe, responsible and sustainable ways to nourish the world. This position is in Cargill’s agricultural supply chain business, where we seamlessly connect farming customers with food, feed and industry.
JOB LOCATION: preferably Amsterdam (Netherlands) or alternatively in one of Cargill locations in Europe.
JOB PURPOSE AND IMPACT
Do you love work in a future-driven, hardworking and engaged team? We are looking for a Business Intelligence Specialist for Process, Digital and Marketing responsible for finding, collecting and analyzing quantitative and qualitative data from internal and external data sources (processes, automations, digital products) to generate knowledge and value for the organization, including business process decision and support at the strategic, tactical, and operational levels. You will also conduct studies from which high-level trends are drawn and referred to marketing and market research for strategy development. You will be integral part of our process, data, technology and digital team to successfully transform our grain and oilseeds business in EMEA region.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
Consults with users or decision makers in the Process, Data, Marketing and Digital Team to identify data sources, required data elements, or data validation standards to then design, build and test data visualization
Own the collaboration with business, data and development teams to design business intelligence solutions to facilitate data gathering, storage, and retrieval.
Lead the analysis of data to produce dashboards, metrics, or insights and identify trends or anomalies.
Support the marketing research and development team to design, execute and interpret customer studies to ensure that data collected is at the core of the brand strategies and goals.
Use standard or advanced ad hoc queries or reports to extract data from disparate databases or data sources.
Independently handle complex issues with minimal supervision, while escalating only the most complex issues to appropriate staff.
Other duties as assigned

Qualifications

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent experience
Comprehensive knowledge of business intelligence theories and concepts
Minimum of four years of related work experience
Fluent (both in verbal and writing) in English language.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Hands-on experience in using Business Intelligence and data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI.
Good knowledge of data structures and data preparation tools
Experience in customer insights gathering and behavioral analytics
Advanced knowledge of data and relational databases
Advanced statistical knowledge and technical experience
Solid project management skills and abilities
Advanced social and communication skills
Ability to deftly and effectively collaborate with remote teams to accomplish business goals

OUR OFFER
In return for your expertise and commitment, we will provide a fast paced stimulating international environment, which will stretch your abilities and channel your talents. We also offer competitive salary and benefits combined with outstanding career development opportunities in one of the largest and most solid private companies in the world.
Interested? Then make sure to send us your CV and cover letter in English today.
Follow us on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/cargill
Cargill is committed to being an inclusive employer. Click here to find out more https://careers.cargill.com/diversity/

Meet Sancho Latumahina Director- Sales, Netherlands, and hear him talk about his career journey, our growing business in the Netherlands, and the kind of talent he is looking to be a part of his winning team.

The role:

Strategic mindset, anticipating on market chances and customer needs

Close the opportunities

reating Co-sell campaigns

What you should really know about us.:

Strip away everything. Strip away our brand, strip away our buildings, strip away our offices. What are we left with? Our people. This is what makes SoftwareONE successful.

Patrick Winter, Founder.
What we expect from our employees:

Job Title
EMEA tax lead
Job Description
In this role, you have the opportunity to
Philips Domestic Appliances business is a global leader with EUR 2.3 billion sales in very successful home products, kitchen appliances, coffee and garment care.

By joining Philips Domestic Appliances as EMEA Tax Lead you will be responsible for taxes in EMEA. You will operate in the playfield between tax areas, business, markets, finance, supply chain management, IT and external partners. This role requires not only international tax knowledge but also good understanding of business needs, operational processes and external developments.

You are responsible for:
 Ensuring co-ordination of timely and accurate submission of tax returns of all entities in the region.
 Managing tax (corporate tax, VAT, customs) audits, ensuring favorable outcomes that protect both the past and future positions of the organization. Reviewing the monthly, quarterly and yearly tax provisions, tax cash flows and fiscal post calculations, including proper assessment of uncertain tax positions of all the entities. Assisting with transfer pricing matters and providing guidance on intercompany transactions. Identifying tax planning opportunities in the region and formulating efficient tax strategies. The above involves working closely together with colleague tax managers, tax functional specialist as well as external advisors in EMEA.

You are part of:

You will be part of the Philips Domestic Appliances Group Tax team located in the Netherlands, consisting of approximately 7 tax colleagues in the direct tax, indirect tax and tax accounting area. Furthermore, there will be supporting offices located in the major countries in the rest of the world. You will report to the Tax Leader.
To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience: Bachelor’s degree in tax Law/Accounting
 At least 8 years’ relevant international experience in accounting firms and/or MNCs
 Exposure to internal tax laws and systems, preferably both for direct and indirect taxes (including VAT and trade and customs) Hands on experience dealing with tax authorities during audits Excellent communication, business partnering and project management skills.
 Team player with ability to work as individual contributor as well as with people across functions, culture and from all levels within the organizations.

In return, we offer you

A meaningful career, with new challenges in our dynamic organization, working in an encouraging multinational and multicultural environment. We are happy to provide you with this opportunity to work with new technologies. You will be surrounded by passionate and committed, colleagues who share your ambition to create outstanding customer experiences. Your work will be ambitious and full of opportunities for growth. Variety and challenge will be part of your daily routines.

Why should you join Domestic Appliances?

Philips’ Domestic Appliances business is a global leader with EUR 2.3 billion in sales in 2019 in kitchen appliances, coffee, garment care and home care appliances, with successful products such as the Airfryer, Perfect Care Steam Generators, Automatic Coffee Machines with LatteGo and SpeedPro Max Aqua vacuum cleaner, and many more that are used by millions of people every day across the world.

In January 2020, Philips announced that it would be considering new ownership options for Domestic Appliances, as it is not a strategic fit for the company’s future as a health technology leader, and committed to finding the right home for the business to ensure that it is set up for continued success serving customers, leveraging the Philips brand and driving growth across the markets that it serves.

In its 128-year history as a leading innovator, Philips has had to reinvent itself a number of times to remain competitive. This has involved several high-profile divestments, resulting in the company’s successful track record in managing complex change of this scale. Such transformations offer unique opportunities for employees to ‘make their mark’ and gain expertise in a specific and dynamic environment - those who can deliver results while navigating and contributing to changes will gain unique skills and perspective that will prove valuable for the rest of their careers.

AMD Business Development Manager
From developing brand new accounts to driving expansion across existing accounts, our Direct Sales team transforms opportunity into action every day. Whether focusing on a geographical area, product line, industry, channel or market segment, their goal is the same: to develop relationships with the end-users of the organization and generate meaningful sales. They are the direct line between our ground-breaking portfolio of product solutions and the desks of satisfied customers.
Join us as an AMD Business Development Manager on our HPC & AI team in Amsterdam to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact.
What you’ll achieve
As an AMD Business Development Manager, you are expected to drive combined Dell / AMD business in EMEA and to grow AMD business related to all Data Centric Workloads, with primary focus on HPC & AI. This will be achieved whilst applying a two thronged approach:
Velocity Business (Opportunities <200K$ in revenue for Dell): Focal areas include sales enablement & training, channel programs, bundles and external messaging.
Large Bids (Opportunities >200K$ in revenue for Dell): Focal areas include nurturing & tracking large opportunities and ensuring a winning strategy is applied.
You will:
Planning & reporting: develop a plan to exceed quarterly goals for the defined countries, with specific emphasis on driving business growth in HPC, AI and Private Space
Drive business: demonstrate ownership and leadership of the assigned business
Increase the knowledge and skill level of all Sales resources: ensure that all relevant Sales executives are trained and confident to present the Dell EMC – AMD story to customers and articulate the value proposition
Leading the front: accompany sales teams on customer visits, show by example how to present AMD based Dell products and overcome objections
Take the first step towards your dream career
Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role:
Essential Requirements
Experience in technology sales, best related to this field
Detailed knowledge of High-Performance Computing and CPU / GPU products
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent
Experience in roles as technical expert (typically sales engineer, field engineer or implementation specialist) is a strong plus.
Ability to understand each customer’s problems, compile appropriate resolutions, and present them effectively
Desirable Requirements
Ability to lead, motivate and influence others to achieve results, create and execute a business plan
Excellent communications skills – written, verbal, presentational and as spokesperson
Here’s our story; now tell us yours
Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress.
What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life - while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more.
We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today.
You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 here.

Job Title
