Job description

G-Star strives to be the most hardcore denim brand in the world.

To achieve this, we are looking for hardcore thinkers and do-ers, who dare to create the future of premium and purposeful denim with us.

We are looking for people with big dreams, while keeping their feet on the ground. Those who are not afraid to push the limits, because we believe there are no limits in what denim can do.
Are you up for the challenge?
Are you the perfect fit for our team?
Are you a bit of a rebellious spirit?
Then we would love to hear from you!

Tasks and Responsibilities

Would you like to combine your expertise of paid search with your passion for denim? Then you might be our new Lead Paid Search!
As G-Stars’ new Lead Paid Search you become part of the Paid Search Team, which is part of the bigger Global Digital Marketing Team. This team consists of an enthusiastic and experienced group of digital specialists (for example: PPC, Paid Social, Display, SEO and Affiliate). You will lead two paid search specialists. In the Digital Marketing Team we have big ambitions and lots of motivation to have maximum impact on the growth of G-Star Raw. And we have lots of fun as well!

The Digital Marketing Team is responsible for creating the global digital marketing strategy for G-Star RAW and ensure a flawless execution. We do this in close collaboration with the different regional marketing teams, the E-commerce team, our inhouse creative team and our data teams. Because you’ll work together with colleagues and stakeholders from the whole organization, managing multiple international stakeholders comes natural to you.
As Lead Paid Search you work on developing an overall strategic vision and direction for the Paid Search channel and executing upon this strategy, delivering through others with a view to meet our ambitious growth targets.

By doing so, you have a significant impact on the growth of G-Star! In addition, this role involves significant stakeholder management across various departments.
This role is a unique opportunity for someone who is looking for the next step in their career and who likes working in a fast paced, international environment.
As our Lead Paid Search, you:

Will set up the paid search full funnel strategy covering the different tactics like Search Branded, Search Non Branded and Shopping. Also you will create the roadmap (including a test and learn agenda) and determine weekly priorities.Will develop and maintain the blueprint for our campaign setup (including naming conventions, feed structure) that will be used for global rollout.Lead two paid search specialists.Provide thought leadership, strategic insight, and clear communication (written and verbal) to team members on the strategyDecide how to best spend our annual paid search budget, and be accountable to deliver the ambitious revenue target for the paid search channelManage and partner with internal (like our E-commerce director, ) and external stakeholders (like Google and Bing) to share insights on performance, trends and opportunitiesBuild and optimize campaigns in the paid search channel (Google Ads, Google Shopping, Bing, Yahoo).Analyze results and optimize your campaigns based on set KPI’sLeverage channel insights to support the overall digital marketing resultsSupport local initiatives and tests, in collaboration with local marketing teamsTest the latest advertising possibilities (alpha’s beta’s) and ensure G-Star is an early adopter.

Profile

What you bring to the table:

A Bachelor’s or Master’s degreeA minimum of 5 years hands-on experience managing paid search campaigns, including Google Shopping Campaigns, and experience in working with large budgets across multiple countriesYou are tech savvy and have experience with paid search tooling, data feed management and scripts.Excellent communicator and experience with working for numerous stakeholdersDeep understanding of Google Ads and Google AnalyticsExperience in leading/ managing others is a plusIt’s a plus if you have agency experience – you have either worked at or with an digital marketing agencyYou have great written and verbal communication skills in English. An additional language (German, French) is a plusRelevant experience in Fashion and/or Retail industry

G-Star Skill Set:

Strong analytical, planning and problem-solving skillsYou have a hands-on mentalityYou are a team player with excellent communication skills,You are organized, detailed-oriented and able to manage multiple projects at one timeYou are able to learn quickly and enjoy working in a fast-paced environment. You know how to set priorities and turn challenges into a solution.You have an intrinsic curiosity to stay up to date on the latest digital marketing and PPC developmentsYou obviously are a denim lover

What does G-Star bring to the table:

Beyond a competitive salary, working at G-Star brings many other perks and exciting opportunities: an awesome and diverse team that collaborates to change the game; a work environment that offers room for fun, inspiration and innovation; a clothing budget; a healthy, fresh and delicious lunch and even discounts in various fitness clubs and last but not least, a discount on a new bicycle.

What will happen next:

We will thoroughly review your application.We have an international community at G-Star, so please apply in English.

Job Title: Global Operations Change Lead - Content Agency
Job Description:
It wasn’t so long ago that booking a trip so see the Eiffel Tower, stroll down New York’s iconic Madison Avenue or feel the sand between our toes on Copacabana Beach was simply a matter of a few taps on our smartphone.

In fact, that’s what we do at Booking.com. We make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when the world is ready to travel once more.

Across our offices worldwide, we continue to innovate. To solve for some of the most complex challenges in travel and technology, and to plan for the exciting developments that lie ahead. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening up new career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission.

We are united in the belief that our very human desire to explore the planet’s beauty and discover more about other people and cultures will endure. The world is waiting for us. Together, we will be ready.

Change Lead:

As ‘Global Change Lead - Content Agency’, you will lead a team of Global Implementation Specialists and ensure effective implementation, monitoring and evaluation of change efforts in the Content Agency. You will report to the 'Global Operations Change & Development Manager'.

You will bring solid Change Management skills, competent and effective communication style, strong project management skills, to manage multiple changes at the same time across Content Agency Operations.

In your role, you will partner with senior level change owners and help build and execute our strategy that allows our operations to understand and drive changes.

What you'll do:

Lead, coach and manage a team of Global Implementation Specialists within Agency Operations Change & Development team
Build and co-own the roadmap of various Change and development projects along with the Change and Development Manager
Be accountable for executing the strategic roadmap for Change efforts across the Agency
Accountable for up-skilling the Implementation Specialists as Organizational Change Managers.
Apply change management principles, methodologies and tools to judge scale and scope of implementations and organize accordingly
Foresee ‘Change resistance’ and plan ahead of time to manage expectations
Create and implement change management strategies and plans that maximize employee adoption of change and minimize resistance;
Closely monitor all stages of implementation process and create feedback loops
Provide education and communication as required to support the effective implementation
Build and distribute implementation packages to support integration of change into daily business operations
Create roll-out alignment among many stakeholders both centrally and regionally
Establish working relationships with other Implementation specialists across the business for a standardized approach towards managing and evaluating various change projects
Represent ‘Change and Development team’ in Regional Team Leader meetings and other platforms as necessary
Maintain ‘Change and Development’ dashboard and keep the team updated of progress on various projects
Create communication plans for various Change and Development Initiatives

Who you are and what you have done:

5-8 years experience in either Organizational Change Management, Project management or Implementation management in an Operational environment
Preference to Six Sigma Black Belt and or PMP certification
Strong preference for candidates certified in Change Management and / or Project Management from an Accredited Institution
Excellent influencer with the ability to identify and lead stakeholder groups
Expert organizational, interpersonal, communication and networking skills
Self-starter with the ability to work independently,
Strong attention to detail
Ability to operate in a fast paced and dynamic environment
Good Coaching skills
Excellent presentation skills

As we aim to rapidly grow our Cyber Security, Forensics & Privacy practice, we are looking for experienced consultants who are passionate about how strategy and technology can improve the role of cyber security, privacy and data protection in our digital world.
This team works on creating a more security society for major International and local organisations. Together with 150 professionals in the Netherlands you could work on leading and cutting edge projects covering the whole scope of Cyber Security from; From Ethical Hacking to Threat Detection and Forensic Research both preventing and solving cybercrime. Also covering Privacy, Compliance, Policy & Governance to Security Architecture and implementation, to Identity and Access Management.
If you want to deep dive into the possibilities of a Technology career at PwC take a look here: Technology_careers_PwC_Netherlands
Are you the next leader of our offensive security team? Do you have red team experience, are you a specialist on offensive security and do you want to inspire and lead our strong team? Then come and join us!
Responsibilities
You will have a number of responsibilities and we promise that no day as (Sr.) Red team manager will be the same. This is because your focus will still be on maintaining and leading the relationships with our clients, but you will also coach and lead the current red team members on their performances. Your responsibilities will consist out of the following tasks:
Operate and deliver red team operations at clients;
Innovate and keep developing the approach to align with relevant TTP's and trends;
Coach team members in the offensive security team;
Lead client discussions, sales and delivery of advanced security testing.
In summary, in this role you will drive, deliver and further develop our red team operations portfolio. You will translate TTP's into new approaches, tools & content. For our clients you will be a trusted adviser for helping our clients defend against advanced motivated attackers. You will lead client discussions, presentations, sales opportunities regarding advanced security testing. All in all, you will be managing all main red team operation assignments. Last but not least: For your co-workers, you will share knowledge and will coach them to the next level.
Requirements
You are an experienced professional, working in this specific domain for over 5 years. Working in a red team does not contain any secrets for you, and your current colleagues often come to you when they encounter a problem. Preferably, you have experience as a manager already or have experience with leading teams in a project management environment.

Furthermore, you have these skills/ capabilities:
Deep understanding of attacker's tools, tactics and procedures (TTP);
Apply and customize TTP's to leverage at clients;
Thorough understanding of detection, monitoring and IOC's ;
Out of the box thinker, able to come up with new solutions when others fail (eg: "try harder" attitude).
We prefer that you have a working background on an academic level (BSc or MSc). In your CV and motivation letter you will need to demonstrate that you mastered the above mentioned skills. We care more about your actual experience than your study background. However, the following backgrounds are usual suspects:
Computer science;
Security and network engineering;
Cyber security;
Software engineering .
What do we offer?
Multiple training possibilities that contribute to your personal development.
A Suitable salary and extensive labor conditions such as a ‘well-being-budget’. This is a personal budget of €600,- which you may spend on your own health such as: Mindfulness, sports, lifestyle coaching, wellness but also technical gadgets such as a second screen for you home office.
A monthly reimbursement for your internet at home.
A lease car or car allowance.
A laptop or Mac (sometimes both depending on the role) and Iphone.
30 holidays per year.
(Virtual) events with colleagues.

Interested? Apply now!

As our Loyalty Director, you play a key part in the strategy and execution of the global loyalty programs across all our brands.

As our Loyalty Director, you will define, shape and lead the global loyalty strategy for Ahold Delhaize. You are responsible for successfully connecting all our brands to a next-generation loyalty framework. In more detail: most of our global brands have a loyalty program in place. However, it is important to adjust these programs to the evolving customer expectations and challenging offers from competitors.
You are an inspiring and entrepreneurial thought leader in the field of loyalty strategies. You are able to manage and mobilize various cross-functional stakeholders as well as growing and maturing our loyalty initiatives across our global brands.

As Loyalty Director,you will make an impact at Ahold Delhaize by:
defining and driving loyalty strategies that improve our competitive positioning and increase our market share and share of wallet.
realizing personalization strategies to deliver consistent and relevant offers to loyal customers.
looking a few years ahead to determine the impact of the loyalty program and implementing changes by anticipating on fast changing customer needs and technology.
having a data-driven approach to loyalty and standardizing performance measurement methodologies.
leading and coaching our global Loyalty team and the loyalty expert community on the development of loyalty capabilities.

As Loyalty Director, you will be working at Ahold Delhaize. Approximately 370,000 employees worldwide serve over 50 million customers a week. Strong brands that offer a great deal of knowledge, experience, and impact.

a laptop and phone.

regular fun events, and delectable samplings with free products.

At Ahold Delhaize, you’ll be working for one of the biggest retailers in the world. You are bursting with ambition to keep up with us. And specifically for this vacancy as a Loyalty Director, you are a thought leader and you have advanced loyalty skills. You supplement these skills with:

a relevant master's degree or PhD.
at least 13 years of experience working in a (global) retail environment or other relevant industry, defining and leading the most advanced loyalty program strategies across various regions and brands. Native experience within Europe is considered a plus.
demonstrable experience with data analytics, strategic data insights, performance measurement, loyalty solutions, reward models, personalization, onboarding and retention of loyalty members.
experience leading loyalty teams through strategic directions.
experience working in a consultative fashion with different regions and brands.
the ability to be a real inspirational leader who can positively influence stakeholders.
superior multi-tasking, networking, time management and interpersonal skills.

Apply now.

You co-create, refine and continuously update the strategic framework for accelerating and generating monetization income based on our data & insights portfolio. You are responsible for developing and executing the long-term plan that will grow the value of our internal assets and mature our data insights capability across all our local brands. In more detail: as our entrepreneurial expert in retail data & insights monetization, you will use your expertise, social skills and your data skills to explore possibilities, accelerate existing data & insights propositions, and to maximize profitability and effectiveness while minimizing risk and opportunity costs. You will enforce and support all our local retail media & monetization teams in their near-term and long-term strategies for utilizing best-in-class solutions to accelerate our data & insights monetization goals and hit our brand monetization revenue targets

As Data & Insights Retail Media Manager,you will make an impact at Ahold Delhaize by:
leading Data & Insights Monetization Brand teams through their strategic approach and set out clear goals.
leading innovative, cross-regional projects or small programs for data & insights monetization. You have the ability to let business ideas grow from start to maturity and effectively manage all stages of the product lifecycle.
ensuring that the Data & Insights and Marketing & Media Monetization teams achieve their revenue targets by identifying and delivering innovative ideas and sales propositions.
focusing on mentoring local brands in data & insights monetization and on strategic business topics that need attention.
developing strong partnerships with local retail monetization teams, external third party services and technology vendors.
What do we offer?
As Data & Insights Retail Media Manager, you will be working at Ahold Delhaize. Approximately 370,000 employees worldwide serve over 50 million customers a week. On a somewhat smaller scale, you will be working with 1,500 colleagues in Zaandam, the Netherlands. By working together to improve every day and through innovation, we reinforce our role as a leader in retail and e-commerce. This is also how we build on trusted local brands. Strong brands that offer a great deal of knowledge, experience, and impact.
You will find your new workplace at our bustling head office, next to Zaandam train station. More specifically, on the 8th floor of the Global Support Office (GSO) in the Digital Engagement department. This department is responsible for digital marketing, personalization, loyalty and monetization at Ahold Delhaize and across all our brands. However, due to COVID-19, we currently still work from home as much as possible.
Everything you do with your colleagues is directly visible in our stores and for people at home. Curious who you will be working with? You will be part of the Monetization team and you report to the Monetization Director. And together with your colleagues are responsible for growing the monetization income for Ahold Delhaize through mainly marketing & media, and data & insights. The team fuels and supports our great local brands, drives revenue, increases engagement and enlarges efficiency that is needed to grow a thriving omni-channel business. To continuously identify, develop and grow our monetized propositions you will work hand-in-hand with local Brand Monetization teams and several internal departments such as Global and European expert teams in IT, Security, Data & Analytics, Legal, Communications and Finance, but also external parties such as advertisers, agencies and solution partners.
What we offer.
Here at Ahold Delhaize, we aim to grow. This is only possible if you grow along with us. That’s why we help you take your career and personal development in the direction you want to go. As we work together to build on our brand as well as your career, you can count on (based on 40 hours per week):

a gross monthly salary of up to €6000,-
flexible working hours and the option to work from home.
an excellent pension plan with an employee contribution of 6.2%.
reimbursement for travel expenses to and from Zaandam.
twenty vacation days.
a personal budget for you to decide whether to spend it on extra vacation days, discounts or a payout.
a bonus on top of your salary.
attractive discounts on various insurance policies.
a laptop and phone.
a 10%-discount on your groceries at our Albert Heijn stores up to €300 per year.
regular fun events, and delectable samplings with free products.
Requirements
At Ahold Delhaize, you’ll be working for one of the biggest retailers in the world. You are bursting with ambition to keep up with us. And specifically for this vacancy as a Data & Retail Media Manager, you are a thought leader on data & insights monetization and you have advanced analytical, data and monetization skills. You supplement these skills with:
a master's or MBA degree in a relevant field such as data, analytics or marketing.
between 8 and 10 years of work experience in data and insights, retail and/or monetization, or any other relevant service within a (global) retail environment. Experience within Europe is considered a plus.
demonstrated hands-on experience with retail and media-related data and transforming data into valuable insights.
experience with program management, strategic data & insights specific tooling and dashboarding, data & insights monetization solutions and implementation within a large-scale, complex organization.
knowledge about latest developments in monetization eco-systems, particularly within the retail domain.
up-to-date knowledge about data & insights monetization trends and best practices.
go-to-market expertise coupled with knowledge of deploying data-driven decision making internally and externally to significantly grow product categories.

Apply now.
Seeing is believing. This is true in our stores, as well as in our head office in Zaandam. It could be your new workplace, where you, as Data & Insights Retail Media Manager, have influence over the most renowned retail markets in the Netherlands. Apply now!

In addition, we would like to ask you not to send a standard motivation letter, but to formulate an answer to the following questions:
Why would you like to work for Ahold Delhaize, and particularly in this position?
Why do you think you will be successful in this position? Please avoid words which are already in the vacancy text, make it personal.
Please indicate one of your strengths and one skill you wish to improve or develop.
How do Data & Insights Monetization help us capitalize on the changes in consumer behavior & habits that have been accelerated by COVID?
Want to know more before you apply for our role at Ahold Delhaize? Denise Birksteiner, Talent Acquisition Specialist Digital, is happy to tell you everything about this vacancy via denise.birksteiner@ah.nl

Job Title: International Trainee - Digital Transformation within Business Control
Job Description:
Now you can shape the path towards fossil free living. We’re searching for 20 talented individuals to join us on our journey towards fossil free living. Individuals that challenge the way we think, lead us down new paths and contribute to solving the biggest challenge of humankind – climate change. Is this you?
Become one of our 20 International Trainees at Vattenfall. Each of the trainee positions is unique, linked to a department within a specific business area and a working location. This means that each position has its own specific responsibilities, challenges and matching profile.

Next to your personal development in this unique position you will be enjoying one year of all we have to offer. Your trainee year will be filled with meet-ups with your international trainee team with likeminded individuals. You will be meeting up virtually to work on assignments and live during four seminar weeks where you will be visiting our power plants and growing your superpowers with a variety of trainings.

Your role as an International Trainee – Digital Transformation within Business Control BA Heat
You will support the international BA Heat Business Control team in providing financial and non-financial business insights to steer and further improve our business operations and to develop our strategic direction. One key element is to define and implement our contribution to become fossil free within one generation. In this role we also need to challenge our traditional ways of working, tools and systems we are using. You will drive the transition to a more modern financial steering and controlling environment.
Your daily activities:
Getting familiar with BA Business Control core tasks
Support running and executing digital initiatives and initiating new potentials
Developing the strategic digital roadmap for Business Control BA Heat
Maintaining overview of existing financial processes, tools and systems
Being member and support existing System Development networks
BA Heat aims to grow by delighting its customers and being a preferred partner to cities/stakeholders, providing efficient, low CO2-emitting solutions to the energy transformation. We want to grow both in heating on-grid and off-grid and as a provider of flexibility and stability to the power grids. We are operating district heating and power production assets in Sweden, Germany and the Netherlands. In addition we are currently entering into the UK heat market.
Who are you?
Whether you want a climate smarter career as an energy specialist, visionary manager or inspirational project lead in the energy sector, we offer you these possibilities within the Trainee Programme.
As an International Trainee – Digital Transformation within Business Control BA Heat you recognize yourself in the following:

You have recently graduated with a master’s degree in Business Informatics, Data Science, Computer Science Engineering, Business Administration or similar
You have an affinity for business finance and controlling processes whilst also being passionate about IT, tools and systems
You enjoy digitalization and are intrigued by the value creation of big data
You are talented in structuring complex tasks into manageable bits and pieces
You are familiar with PowerBI, platforms and business intelligence from work or study experience

You are our ideal trainee if you are a recent graduate with an academic degree or you graduate before September 2021. You are fluent in English. Skills in another language of Vattenfall’s countries of operation can be a merit. You are willing to relocate for possible assignments throughout the organization. And of course, you identify yourself with our principles: active, open, positive and safe.
Location
You will be working in the department Business Control BA Heat (TC-V) and the position is located in Berlin (Germany), Amsterdam (The Netherlands) or Stockholm (Sweden).

What we offer you
Vattenfall International Trainee Programme is the kickstart of your career within Vattenfall. You will have the opportunity to develop your professional and personal skills over the course of a year. In the Trainee Programme you will take part in international workshops and site visits during the seminar weeks. You will have the opportunity to work abroad and get a good overview of our entire organization. Each position comes with a competitive salary and an excellent remuneration package. Read more about the elements of the Vattenfall International Trainee Programme here or check the FAQ page.

Our Organization
At Vattenfall you can free your superpowers! We are one of the European market leaders in the generation of renewable energy and are primarily active in Scandinavia, Germany, Denmark, UK and the Netherlands. We take our responsibility seriously and together we are making the change towards fossil freedom. Our goal is to enable a fossil-free living within one generation. We are a dynamic company with an international focus and a social face at the heart of society. Diversity and inclusion is in everything we do, read more about D&I within Vattenfall.
Application process
We welcome your application in English, including resume and cover letter via the application button on this page. Last day to apply is February 21st 2021. Selection period starts in February, followed by online tests and interviews in March. An assessment is also part of the recruitment process and will take place in April. The recruitment process will be finalized around the end of April. The last step will be a pre-employment screening. Starting date of the Vattenfall International Trainee Programme will be September 1st 2021.

Due to COVID-19 all steps of the recruitment process will take place virtual. At Vattenfall we are committed to acting responsibly in response to the challenges posed by COVID-19 and we are taking all necessary measures to protect employees and job applicants. For more questions about COVID-19, please visit our generic FAQ page.

We look forward to your application! If you have any questions regarding the Trainee Programme in general or the specific trainee position, please check our: FAQ page. Is your question not answered, please contact your responsible recruiter Anica Zerfuss via +49 40 79022 2141.

Since Vattenfall is a part of the Swedish critical infrastructure, many of our services are security classed. If this position is security classed the final candidates might be subjected to a security vetting process, according to the Swedish legislation.

As we aim to grow our Cybersecurity, Forensics & Privacy (CF&P) practice, we are looking for experienced consultants who are passionate about digital identity to help our clients doing business in a digital world while protecting privacy and data. In the Netherlands we have a dedicated Identity & Access Management (IAM) team of specialists as part of CF&P. We work on creating a more secure society for major international and local organizations. Together with the 160 professionals as part of CF&P in the Netherlands we work on leading and cutting edge projects covering the whole scope of Cybersecurity. For more information see: www.pwc.nl/nl/carriere/technology-careers.html
Responsibilities
You will work with your direct colleagues to architect and design Identity & Access Management processes and models, guiding in the realization of solutions around Identity Governance and Administration (IGA), Privileged Access management (PAM), Consumer Identity Management (CIAM) and Data Access Governance and Lifecycle management tailored to meet individual client needs in all stages.
Requirements
You demonstrate thorough knowledge and/or a proven record of success in the following areas:
You can navigate easily around role models, authorization matrices, ‘joiner/mover/leaver’ life cycles and target operating models.
You are familiar with the IAM open standards and reference architectures.
You are very familiar with a broad set of IAM, CIAM, IGA and PAM solutions, familiar with the typical systems these are integrated with from a business and architecture perspective.
You can lead workshops and design sessions and can balance technical with business goals during these sessions.
You are very skilled in creating PowerPoint presentations and deliverables by using Excel and Word.
You are growing your leadership and communication skills to lead engineers and technical client staff through challenges of IAM programs.
You have excellent written and oral communication skills in English and preferably also in Dutch.
What will you do:
Supporting our customers in architecting, designing, building and implementing Access management roles, operating models and processes in the area of CIAM, IDM, LCM, IGA, DAG, PAM, PIM, PUM of complex Identity Access Management solutions.
Managing these projects from a PM(O) perspective.
Managing the business implementation of these projects.
Helping the customer in training their staff and changing their business models.
Train and coach junior colleagues on these area's.
Leading workshops and delivering presentations (PowerPoint) to initiate these projects.
What do we offer
We offer you the unique opportunity to become part of dedicated Digital Identity team in the Netherlands working as part of the Dutch Cybersecurity, Forensics & Privacy practice as well as part of the European Identity Practice with Amsterdam hosting the Center of Excellence for Identity & Access management. You can enter opportunities to work both on international - as well as clients based in the Netherlands. This way you will develop a strong network. We pay a lot of attention to your personal development by means of both on the job, as well as various soft-skill trainings.
When you start working at PwC, you can count on diverse clients, inspiring colleagues and attractive employment terms with attention for your growth and work-life balance.
Besides this we specifically offer:
Multiple training possibilities that contribute to your personal development.
A Suitable salary and extensive labor conditions such as a ‘well-being-budget’. This is a personal budget of €600,- which you may spend on your own health such as: Mindfulness, sports, lifestyle coaching, wellness but also technical gadgets such as a second screen for you home office.
A monthly reimbursement for your internet at home.
A lease car or car allowance.
A laptop or Mac (sometimes both depending on the role) and Iphone.
32 holidays per year.
(Virtual) events with colleagues.

Interested? Apply now!
If you are interested in this position, please apply by uploading your resume and cover letter. May you have relevant questions about this position, please contact Keesjan Bongaertz, Talent Acquisition CF&P via keesjan.bongaertz@pwc.com
We don’t accept applications via mail due to GDPR
Inclusion and Diversity are Top of Mind at PwC!

Relationship Support Manager
Amsterdam
As a Barclays Relationship Manager within the International Corporate Bank, you will be responsible for managing a portfolio of Financial institution customers to maximise sustainable income and identifying business opportunities for Barclays Bank International products and services. You will be organised and empathetic with customers with the aim to develop the portfolio whilst working with various teams and stakeholders in order to ensure delivery of the team's performance and vision.

Barclays is one of the world's largest and most respected financial institutions, with 329 years of success, quality and innovation behind us. We offer careers that provide endless opportunity – helping millions of individuals and businesses thrive, and creating financial and digital solutions that the world now takes for granted.

CBI Regulated Role
This role is deemed as a Controlled Function role under the Central Bank of Ireland Fitness and Probity Regulations and may require the role holder to hold mandatory regulatory qualifications or the minimum qualifications to meet internal company benchmarks.

What will you be doing?Acting as first point of contact for clients and providing cover in the Relationship Director’s absenceCoordinating introductions to and from other areas of the Barclays Group where appropriate and monitoring outcomeAssisting with development of, and revisions to the Client Relationship PlanWorking with Relationship Directors to identify potential new customers and maintain database of potential customers.Coordinating the execution of transactions and implementation of products, including liaising with product specialists, internal support functions and other relevant advisors

What we’re looking for?Previous experience in a Banking/Financial Services role as well as client service and communicationKnowledge of services offered by the Corporate Bank, other areas of Barclays and those frequently used by Global Corporates, Global NBFI and Dutch NBFI customersProven Planning and Organisational skills gained within a Financial Services environmentWritten and verbal fluency in both Dutch and English languages

Skills that will help you in the role:Previous experience gained within a global Corporate Bank

Where will you be working?
You will be based in the Barclays Amsterdam office which is the Investment Bank Head Office in the Netherlands. The office has good access to transport links and is easily accessible by car and the Amsterdam RAI.

It is the policy of Barclays to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, national origin, alienage or citizenship status, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by law.

Dynamic working gives everyone at Barclays the opportunity to integrate professional and personal lives, if you have a need for flexibility then please discuss this with the hiring manager.

#LI-HS1

About the team

Miro is building an open developer platform to support new use cases, extend the reach of Miro online, and integrate with 3rd party systems. Based in Amsterdam, the Platform team is a highly strategic new initiative that will empower developers to create engaging and powerful visual collaboration applications and experiences using Miro technology.

About the Role

As Director of Developer Relations, you will build a global Developer Relations team, to drive the growth and adoption of the Miro Developer Platform through developer advocacy and support.

What you'll do
Build, manage, and coach a distributed team of developer advocates and developer support specialists worldwide
Nurture the growth of a healthy, respectful, and supportive developer community.
Consolidate insights from developers about their needs, and advocate on their behalf within the Platform team
Work closely with the Partnerships team to deliver high touch support to Miro's strategic partner network
Scale developer support from working closely with launch partners, to engaging with a large global community
Manage the development and delivery of best practices, guidelines, and code samples, to support the development of high quality integrations
Devise and execute a developer content and outreach strategy for engaging and educating developers
Act as an ambassador for Miro in the developer community
What you'll need
5+ years experience working in, or partnering with, an established and effective Developer Relations team
2+ years experience building and managing teams of software engineers and programme managers
Experience supporting the growth of a successful public platform
Familiarity with current trends in software development, including popular frameworks and toolchains
You get a kick out of understanding the technical capabilities of a platform and communicating the potential to developers
Experience building and engaging with developer communities at scale, including through events and online content
You have strong verbal and written communication skills, can empathize with technical audiences, and are comfortable with public speaking
What's in it for you
Stock Option Grant
Medical Insurance coverage
Allowance to facilitate remote working during WFH period
Weekly remote team activities to keep the spirits high
Opportunity to work for a truly global multicultural team
Lunch, snacks and drinks provided when back in the office
About Miro

Miro is an online collaborative whiteboard platform that enables distributed teams to work effectively together, from running brainstorming sessions and workshops to planning projects, from designing new products and services to facilitating agile ceremonies. With around 10 million users and counting, Miro is trusted by Dell, Cisco, Salesforce, PWC, EY, Deloitte and many more global companies of all sizes.

At Miro, we are a team of dreamers. We look for individuals who dream big, work hard and above all stay humble. Collaboration is at the heart of what we do and through our work together we hope to create a supportive, welcoming, and innovative environment. We strive to play as a team to win the world and create a better version of ourselves everyday. If this sounds like something that excites you, we want to hear from you!

Check out our career page for all our open roles or hop onto this Miro board to learn more about us!

Job Title: Business Development Director Travel, Transportation & Hospitaliy
Job Description:
One of the biggest consultancy firms worldwide is growing rapidly in Amsterdam. Their sales team is looking for a driven Business Development Director to develop your own domain within travel, transportation and hospitality. Here the sky is the limit.
About the client
Our client is one of the biggest consultancy firms in the world. Trusted partner of Dutch businesses since 1992, empowering major national brands to prosper in the digital environment of today. Their mission is to help customers with providing innovative, best-in-class consulting, IT solutions and services. From back-end IT integration till innovation - strategy assignments for their clients
Our client presence is today the largest in Europe, and they just established the first European innovation centre in Amsterdam. This innovation centre will function as a digital transformation accelerator for Europe dedicated to supporting the Dutch and European industry ecosystem -large corporations, academia, investors, incubators, SME’s and start-ups-in their digital transformation journey.
They have been ranked number one for Customer Satisfaction in both Europe and the Netherlands as per survey conducted by WhitelaneResearch.
About the function
As a Business Development Director you’ll become part of a passionate team of seven sales managers. Current client base is diverse, including clients in travel, transportation and hospitality. It's your task to take the lead for this and build your own domain. You are closely involved with the client, in any case until the signing, and then you hand over the assignment to an internal specialist.
A great career move for someone who now works at a system integrator and wants to think bigger and start on interesting momentum at this growing consulting party where the sky is the limit. Combined with experience at a corporate in a relevant sector is very welcome.
Responsibilities:
Business Development for identified logos in the TTH Sector
Build client contacts, create value messaging, plan and execute sales encounters
Work with internal teams in building right value proposition to customers
Arrange for meetings with key stakeholders in client/prospect organizations
Lead Generation & Opportunity creation at client/prospect organizations
Lead Tender process and ensure alignment with internal TCS Organization
Responding to (European) tenders all within the set deadlines.
Co-ordinating with relevant service / product / business knowledge required to prepare a winning bid, whilst taking ownership of the end-to-end bid process
Win, Stabilize & Grow new client relationships
Interact with key advisors, analysts, technology & business partners for improved market visibility
Main criteria
A Masters or HBO Degree
>10 years of Business Development experience with TTH Sector in The Netherlands
You preferably combine experience at a system integrator with experience at a corporate within the TTH sector.
You bring a network in travel, transportation, aviation, leisure, hospitality or related sectors.
Fluent in both Dutch and English, verbally and in writing
You have Industry knowledge of TTH Sector.
You have strong knowledge of ICT & BPO Services, Next Gen Digital Services, IT Sourcing and Business development.
You have excellent communication skills
Reason for the vacancy
Our consultancy client is currently ready for a big growth phase here in Europe. The momentum is actually at their side now.
The procedure
After an interview at Badenoch + Clark, three interviews will follow at the client’s office.
Contact
Do you have an strong manufacturing background, experience within consultancy and do you recognize yourself in the vision of this client? Mail your resume and short motivation to Tim Bleijie (tim.bleijie@badenochandclark.nl). Or apply via our website.

Job Title: Senior Digital Sales- Poultry, EMEA & APAC
Job Description:
Senior Digital Sales- Poultry, EMEA & APAC-SCH03778

Description

Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 155,000 employees who are committed to safe, responsible and sustainable ways to nourish the world. This position is in Cargill’s animal nutrition and health business, where we improve lives through better nutrition. Our team researches, innovates and creates solutions that deliver healthy results for our customers.
JOB PURPOSE AND IMPACT
The Senior Digital Sales Representative for Poultry EMEA & APAC is responsible for developing and executing Digital Solutions’ commercial vision and achieve short- and medium-term goals for the customer account(s) that will drive significant business/financial impact and will maximize opportunities for the customer and within defined area of scope (i.e. Portfolio of Products/Services, Customer Segments, Industry Segment, Major Sales Practice Area/Category, etc.).
This role will focus on commercializing the Digital Solutions’ portfolio across the EMEA and APAC regions in close collaboration with local nutrition sales teams. Digital formulation and farm management tools may be bundled with Cargill’s feed offering but could potentially also be sold as a stand-alone offering. As such, we seek a seasoned professional that is able to work independently, knows the poultry industry well, has excellent client relationship skills and is able to deliver.
Location: The Netherlands is a primary location. The role is open for candidates based in remote locations in the Region Europe.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
Develop and execute the sales planning process for complex accounts for multiple value propositions and solutions as part of the account plan while meeting personal sales targets
Develop and structure complex sales proposals that represent maximum value optimization to customer and business.
Coordinate use of resources (e. g., technical, advertising) to provide value-added services to accounts.
Develop strong client relationships that provide significant input to planning product, price and service strategies.
Work with local commercial teams to motivate, align on goals and build actions plans to achieve results; coach junior specialists on all aspects of sales/account management and customer service.
Analyze competitor capabilities along with comparisons to business’s capabilities to determine gaps and to position account offerings against competitive options.
Independently handle complex issues with minimal supervision, while escalating only the most complex issues to appropriate staff.
Other duties as assigned.
Qualifications

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree in any relevant business discipline.
Minimum of four years of related work experience in poultry nutrition industry.
Fluent in English
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree in animal nutrition or science. Master`s degree will be a plus.
5+ years of business experience in value added sales solution in poultry nutrition industry.
Proven performance that demonstrates high accountability, strong initiative, with a sense-of-urgency and an entrepreneurial approach.
Solid interpersonal skills; being an effective listener, verbal, and written communication.
Experience with go-to-market, including sales
Strong entrepreneurial spirit; skilled in market assessment, strategy development and annual business planning.
Fluent in other relevant European or Asian languages (e.g. French, Polish, Dutch, Vietnamese, Thai, etc.)
Ability to travel up to 50% within EMEA and APAC (post Covid-19).
OUR OFFER
In return for your expertise and commitment, we will provide a fast paced stimulating international environment, which will stretch your abilities and channel your talents. We also offer competitive salary and benefits combined with outstanding career development opportunities in one of the largest and most solid private companies in the world.

Interested? Then make sure to send us your CV and cover letter in English today.
Follow us on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/cargill
Cargill is committed to being an inclusive employer. Click here to find out more https://careers.cargill.com/diversity/

Job Title: Organon Sr. Specialist, Package Engineer Europe External Partners
Job Description:
Did you always want to work in a company where your work can have a real impact on people’s lives? Are you ready to Invent, Impact, Inspire? We would like to meet you!
We have an exciting new job opportunity at our location in Haarlem and are looking to hire a:
Organon Sr. Specialist, Package Engineer Europe External Partners
The Packaging Technology department is responsible for the design, development and improvements to packaging components and packaging equipment. This includes packaging/packaging equipment used at both internal sites and external partners.
The Packaging engineer leverages experience gained on scientific, technical, business issues, to lead packaging project teams and advise technical staff to solve complex packaging problems. The ability to apply these in a fast-paced Technical Operations environment to resolve issues and meet customer needs in a compliant manner are at the core of this position
The incumbent generates and analyzes scientific data, reports the resulting information, and captures and disseminates knowledge in standard format for current and future use. The position requires advanced knowledge, skills and abilities to create and optimize business, technical, and compliance processes. Effective leadership of, or collaboration with, high-impact, complex cross-functional and cross-divisional teams and initiatives is common. Key interfaces include Global Procurement, sites, Quality Ops, CMC Regulatory Affairs, and suppliers.
Some key areas of responsibility include:
Support of complex global and site changes to primary, secondary and tertiary packaging materials/ components.
Qualification of changes to distribution and thermal transport/ storage systems and methods for bulk and finished drug products.
Leading initiatives in Proactive Packaging Analytics and Robustness, problem-solving and continuous improvement.
Leading the development and execution of related strategic plans for Risk Assessments. /
Qualification of functional aspects of container closure systems, such as Child Resistance and Senior Friendly packaging.
Technical lead for internal site-to-site Packaging Technical transfers, validations, Change Controls and process improvements.
Stewardship of Global Packaging Technical Operations' Rapid Response business process for managing unplanned work. Liaising with Subject Matter Experts and responsible functions to triage in-coming requests, develop solutions, and respond to business partners in a timely manner.
Problem-solving, including the technical aspects of fact-finding, Root Cause Investigations, and development of robust preventive actions within internal network and at suppliers.
Participating in periodic Business Review Meetings with suppliers of packaging materials and components.
Your profile
Technical or Engineering Bachelor’s or Master’s degree;
At least 5-8 years of engineering experience, preferably in a manufacturing environment;
Experience with packaging components and the packaging process is a must as the role will conduct technical transfers and work closely with external partners
Good prioritizing skills and being able to make a right decision also in case of (time) pressure;
Strong focus on safety, quality/ compliance and clients;
Innovative abilities, strong drive to improve;
Teamplayer;
Strong oral and written communication skills in both Dutch and English.
What we offer
We welcome you to a truly global, dynamic and challenging environment with great opportunities for personal development. Our benefits are very competitive, and the summary below will give you an idea of what you can expect.
Competitive salary and a 3% year-end bonus;
35,5 days of leave;
Attractive collective health care insurance package with considerable reduction rates;
Solid Pension Plan;
Incentive Plan (bonus);
Travel allowance for commuting;
Numerous training, coaching and e-learning modules for long term job opportunities and development.
For questions about this vacancy, please send an email including the vacancy number and job title to the following email address: RecruitmentNL@MSD.com
Who we are …
We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.
We are driven by our purpose to develop and deliver innovative products that save and improve lives. With 69,000 employees operating in more than 140 countries, we offer state of the art laboratories, plants and offices that are designed to Inspire our employees as we learn, develop and grow in our careers. We are proud of our 125 years of service to humanity and continue to be one of the world’s biggest investors in Research & Development.
What we look for …
In a world of rapid innovation, we seek brave Inventors who want to make an Impact in all aspects of our business, enabling breakthroughs that will affect generations to come. We encourage you to bring your disruptive thinking, collaborative spirit and diverse perspective to our organization. Together we will continue Inventing For Life, Impacting Lives while Inspiring Your Career Growth.
INVENT.
IMPACT.
INSPIRE.
We are proud to be a company that embraces the value of bringing diverse, talented, and committed people together. The fastest way to breakthrough innovation is when diverse ideas come together in an inclusive environment. We encourage our colleagues to respectfully challenge one another’s thinking and approach problems collectively for the common good. We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace.

Job Title: Inside Sales Account Manager - Medium Business Public
Job Description:
Inside Sales Account Manager – Medium Business Public
Dell Technologies portfolio of emerging technologies is enough to get your pulse racing. But our customers are our heartbeat and deserve human interaction that is special and unique to their technological needs. Our Inside Sales Account Manager team is the driving force behind our high-level customer interaction. Our team is responsible for selling ground-breaking products by building relationships with customers using both the telephone and email as communication methods. Our Inside Sales Account Manager team ensures every customer interaction is exceptional and tailored to meet the customer.
Join us as an Account Manager on our Inside Sales team in Amsterdam to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact.
What you’ll achieve
As an Inside Sales Account Manager, you will be responsible for selling Dell’s products and services while focusing on developing new accounts and expanding existing accounts. You will support the field sales leader while working effectively in a team environment towards goals.
You will:
Maintain good business relationships with customers and act as a go-to person for them
Building relationships with both existing and new customers
Achieve targets by positioning Dell's complete range of solutions
Outbound and inbound communication with internal and external customers
Work closely with all stakeholders in the sales process (e.g. outside sales, partners, specialists ...) to acquire new opportunities
Take the first step towards your dream career
Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role:
Essential Requirements
Bachelor's degree or higher
Service - and Customer-focused
Results-oriented team player
Communication, presentation and problem-solving skills
Fluency in Dutch plus a good level of spoken and written English
Desirable Requirements
Interest in IT and Trends
Here’s our story; now tell us yours
Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress. What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life - while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more.
We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today.
You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 here.
Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Dell encourages applicants of all ages. Read the full Employment Opportunity Policy

Do you have a passion for healthcare and patient safety? Can you lead people to be the best that they can? The Safety Operations team at IQVIA is a cornerstone to how we support our clients and patients in pushing healthcare forward. This Associate Manager role will provide comprehensive safety services across the lifecycle of pharmaceutical compounds and medical devices, from first in human clinical trials through to post-approval, marketed product, and regulatory safety requirements.
Using your scientific knowledge of pharmacovigilance, safety, and your ability to manage a team you’ll be responsible for delivering industry leading services under the guidance of expert team. You’ll be given the opportunity to contribute to Global initiatives working closely in collaboration with Senior Management supporting the achievement of local and global deliverables and metrics.
Minimum Required Education and Experience:
Bachelors Degree in a Life Science is required.
Minimum of 2 years of prior relevant experience in Lifecycle safety (Pharmacovigilance, CEVA, Medical Information, Safety Publishing, Risk Management etc).
Prior line management experience is preferable.
Fluency in English language skill.
Responsibilities
Implement and support operational decisions as determined and instructed by senior management. May contribute and assist in global initiatives e.g. Change Management
Manage Safety staff responsible for delivering services in Safety Operations under the guidance of senior management.
Assist in the implementation for measuring and improving employee engagement in local and/or global actions. Maintain open and regular communication with direct reports to ensure a supportive working environment.
Supervise Safety Operations staff in accordance with organization’s policies and applicable regulations. Responsibilities include planning, assigning, directing work performance appraisal, and professional development guidance
People Management responsibilities.
Support the management on project resource assignments, staff hiring and staff terminations in collaborations with operations specialist managers.
Assists with staff training, professional and career development.
Work closely with operations managers to address problem areas, work scheduling for current and projected projects, and projected peak workloads.
Monitor, assess and report utilization of staff.
Ensure direct reports are cross trained on Safety service offering as applicable
Monitor and develop training plans
Instruct and lead direct reports in efficient management of project budgets through effective timesheet reporting.
Manage and support in project resource allocation.
Required Knowledge, skills, and abilities:
Life sciences and/or health knowledge with analytical skills.
Prior line management experience is preferable but an eagerness to manage a group of people is required.
Excellent knowledge of medical terminology.
Excellent written and verbal skills in English.
Excellent attention to detail and accuracy maintaining consistently high-quality standards.
Excellent organisational and time management skills.
In depth knowledge and understanding of applicable global, regional, local clinical research regulatory requirements.
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with co-workers, managers, and clients.
Ability to work effectively on multiple projects simultaneously, organize own workload and effectively manage competing priorities.
Join Us
Making a positive impact on human health takes insight, curiosity, and intellectual courage. It takes brave minds, pushing the boundaries to transform healthcare. Regardless of your role, you will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and ultimately improve outcomes for patients. Forge a career with greater purpose, make an impact, and never stop learning.

#LI-remote
#C1920
At IQVIA, we believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. The advanced analytics, technology solutions and contract research services we provide to the life sciences industry are made possible by our 67,000+ employees around the world who apply their insight, curiosity and intellectual courage every step of the way. Learn more at jobs.iqvia.com.

Job Title: Senior Quality Specialist EMEA - Distribution & Logistics
Job Description:
For the location Haarlem we are looking for a fulltime
Senior Quality Specialist EMEA - Distribution & Logistics
Alternative work locations are Oss, Brussels, Prague and Budapest.
Welcome in our team
Our Manufacturing & Supply Division is dedicated to being the most trusted supplier of bio-pharmaceuticals worldwide. Our facilities, along with our external contractors, suppliers, and partners, create a reliable global manufacturing network that’s devoted to delivering a high quality, reliable supply to customers and patients on time, every time.
Our Quality Assurance group ensures every single material inside our products is manufactured, processed, tested, packaged, stored and distributed aligned with our incredibly high standards of quality and meets all regulatory requirements. Partnering across our internal manufacturing facilities, external contract manufacturers and suppliers we create an interdependent global manufacturing network dedicated to deliver a compliant, reliable supply to customers and patients on time, every time, across the globe.
The Distribution & Logistics (D&L) Quality EMEA consists of 3 senior specialist and is managed by the Associate Director D&L Quality EMEA
The position
Reporting into the Associate Director D&L Quality EMEA, you will ensure that all products are handled and transported in accordance with all applicable company and regulatory requirements to meet both internal and external customer demands, the Product License, GDPs and contractual obligations.
You will ensure the quality performance of the regional / global D&L transportation partners through direct quality oversight, support and technical advice. This includes overseeing activities such as Partner Selection and GDP Due Diligence, establishing Quality Agreements and ensuring permanent audit readiness. You will work in close cooperation with Quality and Supply Chain network to ensure quality performance of the D&L transportation partners is consistent across the globe, providing support to build effective quality systems at the partner and supporting continuous improvement activities.
Responsibilities
Report to the D&L Quality EMEA lead, for general advice and instruction concerning Quality Operations. Receives guidance, management, and directions when necessary. Keep the D&L Quality EMEA Lead informed on the status of operations and when challenges, opportunities and/or issues arise.
Directly work with an experienced team of Quality professionals in both the internal and the external network to ensure the compliant and reliable supply of our products to our patients. Perform the responsibility of the Quality point of contact for the transportation partner and act as a liaison for contact and communications between the partner and internal personnel.
Work with Global/ Regional Logistics and any External Partner to ensure that effective and robust Quality Systems and Quality management are in place. Ensure on-site guidance is available in the preparation of metrics, procedures and guidelines where warranted. Ensure proactive support in training and coaching to initiate quality improvements within Operations and Quality.
Assure the development and maintenance of a Quality Agreement with the transportation partners.
Establish process for monitoring and trending of lane performance based on transportation modes, product type, capabilities.
Participate in quality due diligence assessments for pre-approval considerations of new transportation partners within his/her area. Ensure support to the partner in remediation of due diligence and/or pre-contract audit gaps. Support CAPA development with partner in support of GDP audits. Ensure audit follow-up to oversee that corrective actions are implemented in a timely manner where warranted.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Chemistry, Pharmacy, Biology, Microbiology, Logistics, Supply Chain Management or Engineering;
At least 4 years of experience in Quality Systems or Quality Assurance or a QA role within Quality Control including solid knowledge of global GMP/GDP and regulatory requirements;
Excellent problem solving skills, based on science, facts, data and understanding of the regulatory requirements in complex and evolving environments; must be able to apply risk management principles;
Ability to influence management of complex operations, protecting company image and reputation with patients, medical stakeholders and regulatory agencies;
Strong demonstrated interpersonal, communication, negotiation, persuasion and leadership skills in dealing with a broad variety of cultures on non-routine matters in stressful situations. Able to handle organisational complexity and ambiguity;
Exemplary people/team collaboration experience, including speaking candidly, and motivating teams;
Demonstrate values Ethics & Integrity, Courage, Deliver Customer Value, Make Sound Business Decisions and Shape Strategy;
Excellent oral and written communication skills in English.
Willingness to travel (10-15%).
For questions about this vacancy
Please send an email including the vacancy number and job title to the following email address: RecruitmentNL@MSD.com.
You can send your application via our website.
What we offer
We welcome you to a truly global, dynamic and challenging environment with great opportunities for personal development. Our benefits are very competitive and the summary below will give you an idea of what you can expect.
Competitive salary and a 3% year-end bonus;
35,5 days of leave;
Attractive collective health care insurance package with considerable reduction rates;
Solid Pension Plan;
Incentive Plan;
Travel allowance for commuting;
Free in-house sport facilities in Haarlem
Numerous training, coaching and e-learning modules for long term job opportunities and development.
Who we are …
We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.
What we look for …
In a world of rapid innovation, we seek brave Inventors who want to make an Impact in all aspects of our business, enabling breakthroughs that will affect generations to come. We encourage you to bring your disruptive thinking, collaborative spirit and diverse perspective to our organization. Together we will continue Inventing For Life, Impacting Lives while Inspiring Your Career Growth.
Invent. Impact. Inspire.
We are proud to be a company that embraces the value of bringing diverse, talented, and committed people together. The fastest way to breakthrough innovation is when diverse ideas come together in an inclusive environment. We encourage our colleagues to respectfully challenge one another’s thinking and approach problems collectively. We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace.

Are you super-skilled and motivated, and are you looking to join a young, dynamic company specializing in the development and production of patented fender systems for maritime transport?
Then we are looking for you.

Since its start in 2012, Fender Innovations has gained an excellent reputation for developing and producing super strong, lightweight fender systems of the highest quality. Fender Innovations has seen tremendous growth ever since and built up a large and diverse international customer base, ranging from superyacht manufacturers to the largest shipbuilders in the world, often with specialist and specific requests. Our fender systems are seamless and tailor-made, do not absorb any water, and can withstand temperatures from minus 30 to 130 degrees Celsius.

Our company has two large, innovative five-axis CNC milling machines. These allow us to produce fenders up to a maximum length of 18.5 metres in one piece. We can create almost any shape, size and dimension, and we relish a challenge. Our fender systems are used on a wide range of vessels, including lifeboats, fast crew suppliers, superyacht tenders, RIBs, patrol boats, interceptors, water taxis, amphibious craft, firefighting vessels and various kinds of workboats. We produce fenders for both new and existing vessels. Our fenders are used in over 28 countries worldwide.

Apart from developing and producing fender systems, we also install them and carry out any maintenance and repair work required. Our energetic and efficient service department was set up for this purpose.

We are looking for a passionate, critical and driven colleague who is very good with his/her hands to join our team in the coating booth.

Job description:

As a coating booth operative, you and your colleagues apply the coating to the produced fenders. This is done using the latest equipment in hot-spraying technology. You maintain the machinery in the technical spaces and sometimes assist the workshop staff during the production of fender systems. You may also be asked to apply fender coating on site.

Your duties include
Applying coating to produced fenders
Maintaining the machinery in the technical spaces
Producing marine fender systems
Requirements:
Technical insight
Being very good with your hands
Experience in engineering or coating is preferred
Great precision
Holding at least a category B driving licence
Good command of spoken and written Dutch and/or English.
Living within 40 km of the workshop
No 9-to-5 mentality

As a coating booth operative, you need to be flexible, accurate, a team player and have good problem-solving skills. You also need to be hard-working, proactive, motivating, service-minded, and have good social and communication skills.

We offer:
A friendly working environment
In-house training in fender building or coating
An enthusiastic team of colleagues
Career opportunities within the company, which is constantly evolving
Varied work possible at various locations
Salary in accordance with the collective agreement for light engineering/industry ("CAO kleinmetaal/nijverheid")
Professional development opportunities
Employment of 38 hours per week

If you are the person we are looking for, please email your covering letter and CV to:

Sylvia Ruizendaal
Chief Operations Officer

Tel. +31 6 23251756
sr@fenderinnovations.nl
