Are you an experienced supply chain coordinator and do you want to make a difference to people’s life?
For our location Haarlem we are looking for a
Specialist Demand Management & Fulfillment
for the Core team
Welcome in our team
Our Supply Chain team ensures inventory is consistently available to meet customer demand. We coordinate all aspects of supply through supply planning, sourcing, making, inventory management, packaging and delivery. We partner across the Marketing, Finance and Manufacturing organizations to build a robust demand and supply plan and ensure we get products to the right customer, at the place, at the right time.
International Services is part of the EMEA Supply Chain Hub, managing Fulfilment and Demand Management in the sub-regions, Europe, B2B, Middle East and Africa.
The position
Reporting to the Associate Director or Manager Demand Management & Fulfillment, the DM&F Specialist is primarily responsible to monitor and enable compliant, continuous and timely supply to internal and external customers. In addition, the DM&F Specialist is responsible for certain tasks that are typically beyond market/customer.
The DM&F Specialist builds and maintains relationships with the assigned customers and with the relevant internal stakeholders such as Site Planning, Site Logistics, E2E Planning, Global Logistics, Finance and Quality.
The DM&F Specialist acts as primary contact for the customer. He/she takes care of forecast and order management, coordinates supply of product and related services and looks after inventory management. This is all done with the objective to reach maximum customer satisfaction, at optimal cost, ensuring the best possible supply chain performance in compliance with established guidelines and procedures.
In addition, the DM&F Specialist, based on solid SCM process and system expertise, plays a role in activities that go beyond market/customer level, such as supply constraint resolution, data analysis, continuous improvement, projects and some training and coaching.
Main responsibilities
Primary activities include, but are not necessarily limited to:
Acting as primary contact of internal customer(s) or external B2B customer(s) in regards of demand from and supply to this/these customer(s) and ensure adequate communication with them.
Ensuring timely receipt and correct processing of forecast & orders from customers.
Coordinating regular supply-related activities to enable compliant and timely supply and detecting and mitigating supply risk and identifying and resolving supply issues for your accounts.
Monitoring inventory levels.
Taking care of and improving standard reporting (e.g. metrics regarding demand, supply, master data and inventory)
Acting as subject matter expert in own area, participating in Community of Practice.
Contributing to continuous improvement of own tasks, for own accounts and/or for department.
Regularly, actively contributing to projects and initiatives. Leading projects of relatively low complexity and size.
Training and coaching of other DM&F (Associate) Specialists.
Qualifications
Preferably a Bachelor’s degree or proven equivalent work experience in a related business area (Supply Chain, Customer Service, Project Management, Logistics, Planning, Procurement or equivalent)
At least 5 years of experience in supply chain in the pharmaceutical industry
Solid analytical skills for independent problem solving of relatively straightforward issues and more complex problems with support.
Proactive, taking initiative and speaking up regarding own market/account management and regarding how own area operates.
Communication fluency in English, both verbal and in writing, at all levels. Presentation skills for smaller groups predominantly in own area.
Advanced understanding of DM&F systems and process such as COMET and Rapid Response.; basic understanding of processes and systems in adjacent areas.
Solid understanding of working in a GxP environment.
Stakeholder management, teamwork and collaboration: Adequate skills, applied at various levels and across functional areas.
Leadership Behaviors: Good understanding of these behaviors and ability to apply them for own market/accounts and in own team (and occasionally also to adjacent areas). Strong customer focus.
Ways of Working: Good and developing understanding of WoW mindsets and behaviors, ability to demonstrated some of them regularly.
Diversity and Inclusion: Good understanding of and ability to apply our inclusive behaviors.
Business and Finance acumen: Understand impact of own area's activities within SCM and impact on adjacent functional groups. Good understanding of financial supply chains and product cost.
Attention to details and accuracy, while keeping an eye on the bigger picture.

Ekata provides global identity verification via enterprise-grade APIs and a SaaS solution. Our product suite is powered by Ekata Identity Engine, the first and only cross-border identity engine of its kind. It uses complex machine learning algorithms across the five consumer attributes of email, phone, name, physical address, and IP to derive unique data links and features from billions of real-time transactions within our customer network and the globally sourced data of our graph. Businesses around the world including Alipay, Stripe, Airbnb, and Microsoft leverage our solutions to approve more good transactions, reduce friction, and find fraud.

Bunge (NYSE: BG) is a world leader in sourcing, processing and supplying oilseed and grain products and ingredients. Founded in 1818, Bunge’s expansive network feeds and fuels a growing world, creating sustainable products and opportunities for more than 70,000 farmers and the consumers they serve across the globe. The company is headquartered in St. Louis, Missouri and has 25,000 employees worldwide who stand behind more than 350 port terminals, oilseed processing plants, grain facilities, and food and ingredient production and packaging facilities around the world.

Come join our newly created Talent Acquisition Center of Expertise and play a vital role in bringing the right Talent to Bunge across Europe!
We’re a passionate Talent Acquisition team managing the recruitment across the broader Europe region, working closely together with our colleagues across the Globe. We are looking for a Talent Acquisition team member to join our team in the Netherlands (Zaandam). Are you an experienced recruiter across professions in the broadest sense of the word, such as Sales, Finance, Engineering, Innovation, Technology, you name it... and used to recruit across the border? Then this role will trigger your senses! As a leading company in Agri trading and plant-based food solutions we are well known in our market and have wonderful roles to offer at all levels.

In this role you are responsible for managing the full life cycle of the Talent Acquisition process, from role specification through the employment offer and onboarding in the region. You make sure that you have enough candidates in the pipeline to ensure successful processes and you are able to develop long-term trusted relationships with talents in our market, ensuring a hospitable candidate journey and experience. Active sourcing and guiding of candidates, along with great internal stakeholder management and working together as a team with your Hiring Managers and HR Business Partners are an important part of your daily mission.

Next to succesfully hiring the right talent, you are up to date with the latest tools and bring knowledge about new recruitment technologies. In order to make sure candidate can find us as a preferred Employer in our industry, You will play an active role in employer branding and other projects to optimize our Talent Acquisition CoE’s processes and activities.

What you bring to the role
Enthusiasm, passion for our profession and a keen interest in our industry are key. You have a BSc level of education and brings at least 4-8 years of relevant experience. You have excellent verbal and written communication skills in Dutch and English, and if you bring an extra language, that would be great! You act comfortable across all levels in an organisation (complex matrix) and across countries and cultures and have a keen understanding of the differences between the variety of roles.

Other desired skills:
Hands-on experience with full-cycle recruiting using various sourcing and interview techniques and evaluation methods (Predictive Index is beneficial)Sourcing/headhunting skillsKnowledge of social media, CV databases and professional networks (Linkedin recruiter seat is required).Convincing and positive personalityOrganizational skills and sensitivity competencesProactive, hands-on, service and results drivenATS experience (preferably SuccessFactors)

What we offer
A key role in an organization with colleagues around the world, who are dedicated to improving the global Agri-Food value chain, one day at a time. Together, we bring food from where it’s produced to where it’s needed. We do this in an informal culture where an entrepreneurial mindset is valued. Being a global company with a constant need for innovation, a broad variety of challenges and development opportunities can support your long term career at Bunge. We value and stimulate development through training, education and experience and offer effective/accredited tools and resources to support you in your journey.
If this description reflects your profile or ambition, we’re looking forward to see your application and motivation in English by hitting apply!

As an Infrastructure Vulnerability Specialist you will work as a member of the vulnerability management team responsible for reducing Booking.com’s attack surface.

Vulnerability Management being under Security Operations umbrella, The Security Operations track covers a range of security disciplines from vulnerability management, access control, alert and response management through to measurement and reporting of the organisation's security posture. As a member of this team you will participate in the defence of one of the world's leading e-commerce organisations and have the opportunity to learn and develop skills in a truly world leading security practice.

B.responsible

Support identification of vulnerabilities by enhancing vulnerability identification at process and technology level.
Own and manage infrastructure vulnerability scanning process and tools and align with vulnerability identification KPIs.
Support identification, triaging, assignment and remediation of vulnerabilities ensuring that vulnerability management lifecycle is followed.
Timely respond to security threats by collaboration with other security teams and provide effective remediation solution complemented by compensatory controls.
Perform validation of moderately to highly complex security reports.
Provide data driven insights into improvement opportunities for infrastructure vulnerability management process.
Prepare reports for technical teams, compliance deliverables and executive management highlighting current status of infrastructure from vulnerability management perspective.
Work with engineering teams for effective patch management by providing highly customised reports and vulnerability metrics.
Provide support for infrastructure penetration testing.
Drive the remediation process to ensure vulnerable assets are patched or remediated within agreed SLAs
Proactively research new methods, tools, and strategies to effectively identify vulnerabilities

B.skilled

5+ years working in security practices
Advanced level of understanding regarding systems hardening , security configuration baselines at both technical and procedural level
Advanced level of understanding of infrastructure vulnerability scanning tools e.g network, cloud, container and image scanning solutions
Demonstrate a strong interest and understanding of cloud security concepts.
Experience with implementing a cloud-based container vulnerability scanning tool
Experience with Docker and Kubernetes environment with good understanding of container and image vulnerability remediation processes
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills in order to share knowledge and to communicate effectively with different stakeholders (IT and business partners)
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience
Relevant industry certification i.e SANS
Excellent communication skills, good analytical and negotiation skills, close attention to detail required.
Demonstrated adaptability to change, customer focus, continuous learning, and problem solving required

B.offered

Living and working in Amsterdam, one of the most cosmopolitan cities in Europe
Contributing to a high scale, complex, world renowned product and seeing real-time impact of your work on millions of travellers worldwide
Working in a fast-paced and performance driven culture
Opportunity to utilize technical expertise, leadership capabilities and entrepreneurial spirit
Promote and drive impactful and innovative engineering solutions
Technical, behavioural and interpersonal competence advancement via on-the-job opportunities, experimental projects, hackathons, conferences and active community participation
Competitive compensation and benefits package and some great added perks of working in the home city of Booking.com

Het restaurant Bridges richt zich voornamelijk op gerechten met vis en biedt een verrassend, internationaal à la carte menu en Chef’s menu. Chef de Cuisine Raoul Meuwese omschrijft zijn gerechten als “klassieke Franse creaties, met internationale invloeden en een moderne twist”.

This is Adyen

We took an unobvious approach to starting a payments company, building a platform from scratch. Today, we're the payments platform of choice for the world's brightest companies. Our unobvious approach is a product of our diverse perspectives. This diversity, of backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives, is essential in helping us maintain our momentum. Our business challenges are unique, we need as many different voices as possible to join us in solving them - voices like yours. So no matter where you're from, who you love, or what you believe in, we welcome you to be your true self at Adyen.

Technical Account Specialist - German Speaker

You will operate as a first interface with Adyen's merchants across the globe. The cool thing is that you're directly working with the (technical) teams of our amazing merchant base. Changes you make for them have direct impact on their ability to take payments and further grow their – business. In order to do this, you will be working closely with multiple different teams, such as Sales, Account Management and Product Development.

Your team is extremely merchant-focused, highly motivated and thrives on shared success. You will be part of an international team with diverse backgrounds and skill sets. With Adyen being a 24/7 business we operate throughout time zones using a follow the sun principal. The extensive payments knowledge of the team is the most valuable aspect both to our merchants as our internal teams.

What you'll do

You are responsible for the merchants' full lifecycle (integration, expansion and operational excellence).
Be an internal product advocate, track product processes and contribute to the platform feeding back feedback and issues you get back from merchants.
Advising merchants regarding the best implementation practices and also address specific merchants' issues.
Be a key source of knowledge on the Adyen platform and APIs, the underlying technologies, and industry-standard integration methods and best practices.
Work on internal projects that will help scale the international support team within Adyen.
Who you are:
You are innovative, have strong problem-solving capabilities and able to adapt to new processes and procedures quickly, while dealing with many varied technical support requests and challenges.
You are self-driven, flexible, and have the ability to maintain high levels of productivity with minimal supervision.
You've had previous exposure to environments rich in uncertainty and you show a resulting track record of successfully dealing with ambiguity.
You make quick informed decisions under pressure and prioritize appropriately based on urgency, necessity and both internal and external requests.
You have affinity with internet technologies and knowledge of technical processes (think SQL / HTML / JavaScript / PHP / Java / Scripting).
You have native, bilingual or full professional proficiency (written and verbal) in English and German.

Who we are

Adyen is the payments platform of choice for the world's leading companies, delivering frictionless payments across online, mobile and in-store channels. It is the only provider of a modern end-to-end infrastructure, connecting directly to Visa, Mastercard, and consumers' globally preferred payment methods. With offices around the world, Adyen serves nine of the 10 largest U.S. internet companies and many worldwide retailers. Customers include Facebook, Uber, L'Oreal, Evernote, Cathay Pacific and Spotify.

We offer a competitive salary, knowledge sharing internal events, exchange program to other offices and great career opportunities. Become part of an international work environment and take your career to the next level!

Are you in?

If you’re passionate about what you do and can demonstrate your knowledge and skills, we'd love to hear from you!
We are always searching for talent. Let us help you boost your career!
Are you also getting tired of the idea that security or privacy are something special that belongs to a separate department? That policies and guidelines are just blindly pushed into organizations without investing in enabling teams? That these quality attributes are often unnecessarily slowing down teams?

What’s in it for you?

Our core value is “people first” and this is incorporated in the way we work as well as in the way we reward our staff. Here, investing in knowledge, and sharing it, is highly valued and promoted. In addition to a generous, personal, “no questions asked” training budget, you can attend biweekly knowledge sharing sessions and six hackathons a year. Plus, Xebia is an expert in all things Agile and DevOps related, so knowledge sharing is not restricted to your (team) expertise alone; you can get firsthand experience on related topics whenever you need it. Attend training, events, free lunches, knowledge exchange days, company trips abroad, flexible hours, a generous training budget, and much more—these are just a few of the extra benefits that Xebia is famous for.

Job Title: Organon – Senior Pharmacovigilance & Regulatory Affairs Specialist
Job Description:
We have an exciting opportunity for a
Senior Pharmacovigilance & Regulatory Affairs Specialist based in Haarlem
Job Description
As a Senior Pharmacovigilance (PV) and Regulatory Affairs (RA) Specialist you will be responsible for all PV and RA requirements and overseeing PV activities for the entire product portfolio as applicable. You will collaborate with colleagues to ensure compliance with local laws and regulationswhich may include but are not limited to: review and provide input for local PV and RA agreements, local due diligence activities, participation in audits and inspections and related readiness activities, review of local initiatives for compliance with PV requirements streamline and improve processes, training, communication of safety issues, developing product registration plans and strategies. You will report directly to the PV and RA Country Lead.
Main responsibilities but not limited to;
Develop local product registration plans and keep oversight of the local ongoing maintenance activities.
Build and maintain the departments infrastructure to ensure compliance to Global Pharmacovigilance and Regulatory Affairs procedures and country regulations.
Strategise (annually) and execute local literature review in close cooperation with medical department
Ensure compliance to all Pharmacovigilance obligations deriving from local agreements with Business Partners and Vendors
Responsible for execution of local PV and RA processes and activities in alignment with PV and RA systems and their associated Quality Management System, following department SOPs, company Policies and Procedures and country legislation
Plan and Lead submission of new Marketing Authorization Applications to local Health Authorities, maintenance of authorized products through timely submission of post-market regulatory dossiers, including but not limited to variations, renewal applications and supplemental marketing authorizations in accordance with local regulations and global standards
Provides support for Patient Support Programs (PSP) and/or Market Research vendor(s) related activities, as applicable
Files, stores and archives safety-related and regulatory data and documentation in accordance with department and company policies and local requirements.
Acts in full compliance with global and local SOPs and reports any deviations or compliance concerns immediately and assists in preparing necessary corrective actions and preventative actions (CAPAs) locally for non-compliance issues.
Supports local PV audits and inspections including readiness activities and supports other audits/inspections including the development of CAPAs in response to findings/observations.
Supports training of the local company staff, distributors, vendors, business partners including training documentation.
Backing up colleagues and adjusting time schedule in such that there is no cap in adverse event reporting
Your profile
Health, life science, or medical science degree or equivalent by education
Minimum of 3-5 years of industry experience in pharmacovigilance and regulatory affairs
Must have a general knowledge of both PV/RA regulations within his/her assigned country and be an expert in PV & RA processes/activities.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to influence decision making.
Good time management skills
Fluent in English and Dutch (written and spoken)

We have an exciting opportunity for a
CRM/IT Infrastructure Specialist


based in Haarlem or in Brussels
Job Description
The CRM/IT/Digital Infrastructure Specialist is responsible for the day-to-day CRM system management. Main responsibilities are to enable accurate up to date customer interactions to be shared and utilised by all departments and optimise on-going engagement with customers. Furthermore, this role is responsible for the on-going development and implementation of the CRM roadmap to ensure our cluster maximise existing and new CRM system functions, enabling a customer focussed approach and a 360° view of the customer. Additional responsibility for CRM training of users and customer-facing employees providing guidance and driving CRM optimisation. Collaborates with a variety of local and global functions within our company and with external partners.

Main responsibilities but not limited to;
Reporting to the Commercial Operations & Digital AD, the CRM/IT/Digital Infrastructure Specialist will:
Develop and deliver on the CRM vision and roadmap, focussing on CRM initiatives to drive customer centricity
Work in collaboration with regional and global Veeva Centres of Excellence to ensure Benelux cluster alignment with our CRM/Veeva strategy and implementation
Provide support to the business to ensure all CRM initiatives are implemented effectively/efficiently to achieve objectives
As first point of contact for end-users, lead the day-to-day management, maintenance and optimisation of the value of CRM/Veeva system and content, including use of Veeva modules, maintenance of customer data and standard or ad hoc reporting
Ensure all technical and process requirements and structure changes are implemented and up to date within the CRM system
Work in collaboration with Digital Operations colleagues, Digital Consumer Activation Manager and BCM’s to support the capture and analysis of Multi-Channel interactions and respond to the changing environment by providing the latest technologies available
Liaise with suppliers of relevant systems and provide feedback to the cross-functional teams in order to keep track of digital evolutions and stay in tune with customer and CRM requirements
Deliver training and engagement plan to ensure all users can effectively use the system
Manage CRM Digital and Data Processing to support analytics, tracking of KPI’s and reporting
Build strong relationships with internal stakeholders to maintain understanding of business priorities and customer requirements, including specifics for each Benelux cluster market, and customer updates focussed on evolving target audiences
Understand CRM compliance with Data Protection and Privacy Laws (GDPR) and act in accordance with these when conducting CRM activities
Understand our Benelux product and service portfolio and stay abreast of current strategic priorities that may need to be supported within the CRM system
Understand the broader health landscape and customer environment, ensure capture of relevant customers and their details in the CRM system.
 Your profile
Bachelor or master’s degree or equivalence through experience
3 - 5 years of relevant experience within CRM environment
Strong oral and written communication skills in Dutch English, and preferably French
Good interpersonal and project management skills
Good communication and presentation skills
Good numeracy and analytical skills
Highly advanced Microsoft experience and MS Excel skills
Wide ranging knowledge and understanding of CRM applications including relational databases and master data management (knowledge of Veeva CRM is considered a plus)
Comfortable working both independently and in a cross-functional team
Ability to take responsibility and ownership of problems, ensuring escalation as appropriate
Ability to work effectively with customer facing teams to support training and query resolution

Talent Acquisition Specialist
Panda International - A job with a purpose!
There are only a few sectors that are currently in the same spotlight as the Life Sciences Sector is. Panda International offers you an opportunity to make an impact on both your own career and the lives of billions of people. Quite a statement, right?!
Panda International works with both biotech companies that are currently working non-stop in the race against time to deliver the COVID-19 vaccine, the global pharmaceutical & medical device companies, and growth companies that are working on the greatest innovations within the market!
“Human Capital” is the biggest challenge in the world's fastest growing industry, and this is where you make a difference: you help recruit recruiters who place professionals at the pharmaceutical, biotechnology or medical device companies to help them at every stage of the process and to help them achieve their goals! We expect to double in size in the next 12 months, so if you want to make an impact, now is the time!
Panda International is the Life Science Recruitment specialist in the Benelux but is also growing strongly in other European countries. The USA is also in sight! You will work in a fast-growing, ambitious organization in which your development and growth are central.
A company in which you are responsible for your own market, in which clear goals are set and you have the flexibility to achieve them through our flexible working hours and you choose whether you work (partly) from the office or from home.
Your Role
As a Talent Acquisition Specialist, you make a difference by attracting top talent - you enable yourself to look beyond just a resume but finding the right 'attitude' and 'mindset' determines the long-term success of Panda International. You do a combination of headhunting, marketing and networking.
In short, you are an entrepreneur within an organization!
Going through the entire recruitment cycle: a mix of - warm – headhunting passive candidates and networking to identify the best candidates.
Fulfil recruitment needs by recruiting top talent for open positions within Panda International.
Developing and building the employer brand within Panda International and you are a Brand Ambassador.
Think strategically with the organization.
Supporting the Social Media channels.
Visiting and organizing (online)events.
Requirements?
You have a bachelor's or master's degree.
You are self-motivated with a "can-do" attitude.
You have at least 6 to 12 months of experience in recruitment or sales.
You have an entrepreneurial mindset.
You are communicative.
You strive to excel.
Why Panda?
Concrete career plan within the Panda Academy.
Tailor-made Training & Development program.
Flexible working hours: you decide what time you start and if you don't want to come to the office every day, this is also an option!
Unlimited bonus scheme.
The top performers work remotely in Bali for 1 month a year (once this is possible).
Monthly incentives.
A job where you are encouraged to get the best out of yourself.
Fantastic office in the centre of Amsterdam.
Paid Gym, Blinkist & Headspace
Shares in the business for our top performers.

Ready to live the Legend as Sommelier?

Are you an ambitious sommelier with extensive experience in fine-dining? Do you have broad knowledge in the field of wine and food pairing? Do you convey your passion for wines in an energetic way? We are looking for you!
MBO level 4 degree in hospitality management
In possession of WSET 3
3 years of work experience as sommelier
You master the English and Dutch language
We want you and you - want us.

As a sommelier you are the specialist in the field of wine and food pairing in our fine dining restaurant Bridges. You give appropriate and extensive wine advice to our guests . You know how to get the best out of the exclusive dishes by combining flavors of wine and food. In addition, you inspire your guests with your passion and knowledge of wine. You will share impressive stories about (inter) national wines. You dare to make a personal connection with flair.

You work with your colleagues in a professional and warm manner. You possess a personal and approachable way of providing service.

Besides the service, you keep an eye on the stocks and the wine assortment. You compose the wine list in consultation with your manager, the Maître. You will be the contact person for the suppliers.

And Bridges? Bridges is a unique restaurant with a dynamic atmosphere. The restaurant serves breakfast in the morning, lunch in the afternoon and dinner.

What makes us stand out? Let's sum it up for you.
We offer a personalized bonus plan on top of a competitive salary, travel cost arrangements and 25 holiday days a year.
With ALL Heartists Card you receive worldwide discounts on overnight stays and more.
A Breakroom where you can play Table Tennis or Table Football in your break.
A discount of 50% in selected restaurants and bars in Amsterdam.
Personal development – we will support you to improve, learn and grow.
Be Balanced - you want to be fit and healthy? Don’t worry, we are on the same page. Our Be Balanced Team will help you find a healthy work-life balance.
One in all - our people are the core of our business. You give us your initiative, drive and energy we give you a job you’ll love.

Would you like to know more about our hotel? Sofitel Legend The Grand Amsterdam offers five-star luxury in a unique setting. Being part of Accor, a French hotel chain, enables us to combine the historical flair of the building with modern design, and luxurious service. For further details, feel free to check out our website and follow us on Instagram or Facebook.

Don't miss this chance! Hit apply, make sure to upload your CV & motivational letter before January 4 2021.

Take that first step towards a new career opportunity.

Questions? Just ask our Talent & Culture department, telephone number: 020-5553191 / email: Nicolien.Kamp@sofitel.com

Sofitel Legend The Grand Amsterdam biedt vijfsterren de-luxe in een unieke Amsterdamse, historische ambiance, voorzien van Franse elegantie en grandeur. Het internationale hotel is onderdeel van de Accor Hospitality Nederland Groep. Gevestigd in het voormalige stadhuis van Amsterdam biedt The Grand 177 kamers, waarvan 52 suites. The Grand beschikt tevens over 19 MagnifiqueMeeting zalen, een urban spa een Garden Bistro Oriole en restaurant Bridges. The Grand is het best te kwalificeren als een chique hotel met een uitnodigende en vriendelijke, ongedwongen uitstraling. De sfeer tussen gasten en personeel als ook tussen personeel onderling bestempelt deze uitstraling volledig. Onze ambassadeurs weten dan ook de juiste mix te vinden tussen hoffelijkheid, enthousiasme en binding met onze gast.

Sofitel en de Franse elegantie in hotels over de hele wereld
Sofitel is de enige Franse luxe hotelketen met een aanwezigheid op 5 continenten, in meer dan 50 landen. Sofitel biedt eigentijdse hotels en resorts voor gasten die schoonheid, kwaliteit en excellentie verwachten en waarderen. Of het nu hartje Parijs, New York, Bangkok of ergens verscholen in de binnenlanden van Brazilië of Polynesië is, elke Sofitel locatie biedt een authentieke ervaring van het Franse ‘Art de Vivre’.

Cognizant's delivery model infused with a distinct culture of high customer happiness. We consistently deliver positive relationships, cost reductions, and business results.
Be one of our change-makers and join the success story: we are looking for a
Executive Sales Coach / Trainer – (D/F/M)
Location: Europe

The Opportunity
It takes a lot to succeed in today's dynamic market, and Cognizant is a proven leader in the industry. We love big ideas and even bigger dreams. We stand out because we put human experiences at the core. We help our customers by envisioning and building innovative solutions. We do everything with a passion for our partners, our communities, and our organization. It is the same defining attribute that we seeking in our people.
Join us as an Executive Sales Coach and take on the challenge of training commercial, individual seller and sales leadership roles within Cognizant Europe. The sales training programs will cover sales process, selling skills, portfolio acumen and use of the Cognizant Way to Sell tool, frameworks and processes.
In addition, this role also provides coaching assistance on large transactions to include: facilitating win strategy sessions, competitive analysis, internal opportunity review preparation sessions, and orals coaching.
Your Key Result Areas:
Be responsible for training all Cognizant Sales New Joiners, from mid-level Business Development Manager up to Client Partners and Executive Sales Leaders
Acquire and teach deep knowledge of the entire sales process, selling skills and the Cognizant Way To Sell tool
Provide assistance for large deals by supporting strategy sessions, competitive analysis and sales pitch training
Connect with all Cognizant locations spread over Europe in order to plan and execute on-site sales training

University degree
Extensive experience in sales coaching and service sales
You are skilled in training executive sales specialists
You are familiar with complex organisational structures and matrix organized companies
Open to regular extensive travelling all over Europe

Open, ‘can do’ team spirit

Drive your own career
Market conform benefits

Job Title: Organon – Supply Management & Senior Customer Services Specialist
Job Description:
We have an exciting opportunity for a
Supply Management & Customer Services Senior Specialist
based in Haarlem or in Brussels
Job Description
The Supply Management & Customer Services Senior Specialist is responsible for the day-to-day demand planning process so that accurate forecasting of supply is carried out in accordance with our clusters needs. Support the end-to-end planning process through planning customer demand of total Benelux brand portfolio and service items

Assure accuracy of data and highlight necessary corrective transactions
Apply statistical forecasting models, plan for events and lifecycle adjustments
Support scenario planning exercises, tenders and product launch preparations
Support reporting, financial forecasting process and help implement pricing strategy
Work cross-functionally and lead and prepare local Sales & Operations Planning meetings with relevant stakeholders
Ensure our Benelux team is aware of compliance and process requirements as needed
Work closely with distributors, third-party logistics, wholesalers and direct customers in Benelux to optimize inventory management, shipping and reporting

Company Description

Our Mission
At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission:
Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life.
We have the vision of a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. These aren’t easy goals to accomplish – but we’re not here for easy. We’re here for better. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity and our organisation as we are.

Job Description

Your Career
We are looking for a Sr HR Tech & Reporting Specialist to join our EMEA People Operations Team and be part of our growth trajectory. As a People Team, we are responsible for fostering an amazing workplace and culture that empowers everyone to do their best work. You will work closely with different teams and support different initiatives of the business with special focus on HR operations related data analysis, reporting and systems related projects. We believe in the importance of supporting our employees throughout their employee journey with Palo Alto Networks. Especially in today's world of changing demands and needs, we are looking for a new colleague who understands the value of employee focused and tailored technology solutions.

Your Impact
Collect, compile and analyse a variety of employee information and reports to gather meaningful insights. Present these findings and offer recommendations to leadership.
Make data based recommendations regarding policies, system enhancement and employee & business initiatives to improve current processes, the organizational set up and culture and to maintain compliance with data privacy regulations and best practices.
Assess current system utilization; identify and recommend improvements such as people team, stakeholder and employee training, customization, and enhancements to maximize value and efficiency of Workday and Service Now.
Identify and utilise functions such as automated queries, filters, macros, and reports.
Drive planning, modifying, and customization of Workday and Service Now (other systems), establishing test design in close collaboration with stakeholders and HRIS and guide new application testing.
Prepare training material, guides, and documentation to provide user training and hands-on support.
Maintain knowledge of trends and developments for data analysis & system set ups.
Ensure system compliance with data security and privacy requirements.
Oversee and support multiple and concurrent ad hoc requests, projects, or other duties as assigned
Being part of the HR Operations team, contribute to the decrease in backlog of employee inquiries to both identify process opportunities and to ensure quick resolution for employees
Drive the optimisation and improvement of operational processes and systems
Work closely with HR Operations Manager to provide the business with insights based on inquiry volume
Partner with other HR teams to coordinate workflow, processes, and communication with key stakeholders; ensure seamless hand-off of processes and deliverables and establish best practices
Act as thought partner and expert problem solver for stakeholders within the People team utilising your conceptual approach, project management skills and expertise with systems, reporting tools and data.
Collaborate with People Business Partners and other HR functions to deliver end-to-end business projects from operational perspective
Build strong relationships with People Business Partners and Centres of Excellence (COEs) to execute the delivery of cyclical HR processes
Completes all other HR data & transaction requests as needed
Maintain and protect confidential data with great discretion

Qualifications

Your Experience
BA/BS degree or equivalent and 8+ years of progressive experience with HR Operations, HR Business systems and HR reporting in a technology organization or technology-related business, preferably with a multinational company (MNC)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Thorough understanding of all areas of information systems and systems design with special focus on Workday and ServiceNow and proven track record of successfully implemented projects.
Experience in analyzing organizational needs and suggesting process set ups by utilising your expertise in data analysis, reporting and a strong business acumen.
Ability to set priorities, stay focused, and manage time in a fast-paced, developing environment
Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to establish strong relationships at all levels and across functions within the EMEA and global organization
Ability to demonstrate integrity and maintain confidentiality
High level of accuracy and excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to manage multiple priorities in a global, dynamic environment. Must be able to operate with limited direction
Ability to address immediate needs while maintaining a view to long term goals and the organization’s vision and objectives with a continuous improvement mindset
Commitment to continuous learning and study of your craft
Ability to self-direct work and comfortable dealing with ambiguity
Additional Information

Your Team
Our People team at Palo Alto Networks works throughout the organization to enable...you guessed it, people. Every team within the organization has a huge impact on our mission statement. We’re one team – driven to one mission statement. Each piece matters, and within the people team, you are focused on enabling our teams to resolve the world’s most aggressive cybersecurity risks.

Our Commitment
We’re trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together.
We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com.
Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics.

Dutch law degree with approximately 4-7 years of working experience at a law firm or in-house
in-depth knowledge of and experience with privacy law
experience with IT and contracting is highly desirable
fluent in Dutch and English
strategic and pragmatic advisor, able to translate legal challenges into actionable advice
ambitious and eager to learn
Key responsibilities
You are part of our Privacy practice and will provide strategic advice on privacy and cybersecurity matters to our Firm’s global clients. We offer realistic, high quality, bespoke solutions. Multinationals seek our expertise because of our pragmatic approach to complex issues, and our strong international reach. We stand by our clients when they build their global privacy framework, or face cross-border security incidents or enforcement actions.
Our team covers a broad range of sectors and works closely together with other specialists within Dentons globally. The young and ambitious team consists of eight professionals who are passionate about what they do, enjoy asking investigative questions and providing strategic yet pragmatic advice to our clients. You will have the opportunity to develop yourself, identify opportunities and follow up on your own initiatives.
Benefits
the opportunity to join a growing global practice, working on cutting-edge international privacy and cybersecurity matters for our global clients
joining a young, diverse and eager team
career advancement opportunities and the possibility to further specialize as a privacy expert
a progressive, innovative and challenging work environment
working at the Amsterdam office of the world’s largest law firm

Why Dentons is different
The legal profession is changing rapidly and Dentons is leading the way in advancing change for the benefit of clients. We are driven to challenge the status quo, delivering consistent and uncompromising quality and value to our clients in new and innovative ways. With over 17,000 individuals in more than 179 offices the opportunity is huge. Dentons continues to receive external awards and recognition, including for our continued international expansion over the last 12 months; for ground-breaking innovation through the development of Nextlaw Labs and Nextlaw Regional Referral Network; and for success in advising clients across multiple regions. Dentons is also a leader on the Acritas Regional Elite Brand Index and a BTI Client Service 30 Award winner.
Diversity & Inclusion
Dentons is committed to providing equal opportunities for all. Essential to our success as a global law firm is our ability to attract and retain the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds. We want a work environment where everyone can reach their potential and we have an inclusive culture that respects individual differences. We undertake and support a number of internal and external initiatives aimed at increasing diversity within the profession and we encourage all our partners and staff to get involved.

Templeton and Partners:

You'll work directly with regional business leadership to understand their business and needs, focusing on Key HR processes, implementing and /or customizing HR Polices and Programs, talent management, leadership development and facilitating alignment of HR initiatives through partnership with the entire European HR group. You will translate business needs into the right HR interventions, drive and embed EU wide or Global HR processes and standards in the business. Act as an advisor to regional management and key stakeholders on full spectrum of HR (how to engage and enable employees to perform), excluding HR payroll and administrative matters

Drive and execute regional HR initiatives
Be employees 'confidant' supporting employees in the region to ensure their well-being and address any concerns

Translate local employment market trends into advice and actions

Provide day to day performance management guidance to line management (coaching, counseling, career development, disciplinary actions)
Coach leadership on people management skills and responsibilities, challenge them and act as their sounding board
Develop and propose regional policies and practices, fitting overall HR strategy
Drives regional acquisitions, reorganizations and restructuring, opening/closing of offices
Gives Compensation guidance in the region; Understands local pay market. Support EU wide Benchmark projects
Lead cross country relocations process: partner with COEs to assist international employees with expatriate assignments and related global mobility items
Advise leaders and line management on the more complex individual HR related topics such as terminations, onboarding, health and safety, performance, relocation, integrity, compliance, disciplinary, talents, promotions, long term illness case-guidance
Understand or research local benefits, contracts with vendors, negotiating costs and signing contracts
Partner closely with all HR functions to leverage specialists on business needs (Talent Acquisition, L&D, SSC and other HR Business Partners)
Drive Employee Engagement through management involvement (improve working relationships, morale, decrease retention...); Supports regional action planning following employee surveys
Drive and facilitate CHR culture. Draft and issues regional HR communications

8 years of relevant HR experience
Bachelor/Master degree
Demonstrated consulting skills
In depth knowledge of labor laws and experience with legal processes
Strong communication skills and experience in building relationships with peers and senior leaders
Strategic orientation, influencing skills and business and cultural savvy

Manage multiple conflicting priorities

About C.H. Robinson

From the produce you buy, to the water you drink, C.H. Robinson delivers products to people all around the globe. We are one of the world’s largest 3rd party logistic providers. Join our diverse team to innovate, solve problems, have fun and thrive.

Job Title: Senior Financial Account Manager : Real Estate – Fund Services
Job Description:
Would you like to have a challenging international career where your skills are of great contribution to clients?

Would you like to work in a professional, hands-on, independent and informal environment? For our rapidly

expanding office in Amsterdam we are currently looking for a qualified & enthusiastic:

Then you are the SENIOR FINANCIAL ACCOUNT MANAGER- REAL ESTATE we are looking for!
What you will do?


The SFAM is part of the Fund Services team and will work closely with Financial and Legal Account Managers and

Fund Specialists in order to continuously exceed our clients’ expectations. The Senior Financial Account Manager

will be responsible for managing the financial activities concerning a portfolio of predominantly Real Estate clients

and will oversee a wide range of administrative and financial responsibilities of our growing portfolio of Real Estate

SPVs. The SFAM is expected to continuously develop both personally as well as professionally and deliver added

value to our Fund Services discipline and contribute to the further growth of our office.


Other responsibilities are:
Managing a client portfolio and be the first point of contact towards clients, client’s accountants and
(tax) advisers regarding all financial and tax responsibilities;
Client Relationship Management by maintaining senior relationships with client’s operational staff
and participating in and support preparation of client meetings;
Administration of real estate vehicles including but not limited to preparation and review of monthly
and quarterly reports, including analysis on variances, cash flows and working capital reports;
Responsible for closing of accounts including reviewing accounts prepared by the property managers
before completion of SPV level closing;
Preparation of VAT and CIT fillings in collaboration with external advisers;
Preparation and review of statutory annual financial statements (Dutch GAAP/ IFRS);
Managing local audit process and resolving audit queries to ensure that audits are completed on time
and within budget;

Management of bank accounts and execution of client payments;
Maintaining an organized planning of work to ensure timely and accurate filing of administrative
records;

Mentor, train and motivate Junior & Medior Financial Account Managers and act as sounding board;
Hold client SPV directorship mandates and pro-active participate in board meetings (i.e. presentation
and clarification of annual accounts);

Perform miscellaneous finance and administrative tasks appropriate to the role and business
requirements; and

Actively sharing financial and accounting knowledge (cross border: Curaçao and Bulgaria).

Where will you be working?


Working at Trustmoore means working in a dynamic company with great colleagues and an international

environment. At Trustmoore, we score as a team and our colleagues are on top of their game. Trustmoore is a

boutique-style corporate service provider with four lines of business Fund Services, Structured Finance & Capital

Markets, Multi Family Office Services and Corporate Expansion Services. We pride ourselves of working with

well-known law offices, notaries, tax advisors and banks. We want to excel in what we do, nothing more, nothing

less. Word of mouth marketing is the best form of advertisement for us.


You will be working in one of the most beautiful areas of Amsterdam. Our office is easily accessible by both

private and public transport. You will receive a competitive salary, holiday allowance, 25 vacation days and

international career opportunities in our other offices. You can also benefit and participate in:

TM Academy with soft skills, knowledge and leadership development trainings;
Regular BBQ, social and sport events with your colleagues;
Our annual ski trip;
Interaction with more than 50 international colleagues in Amsterdam and more than 170 colleagues
worldwide;

How do you fit in the team?

As a Senior Financial Account Manager, you need to manage ad-hoc activities, next to your intensive client contact

and daily work. In this position, you need to prioritize what is important, have a hands-on and independent work

mentality and be able to deal with stress. A helicopter view is required, since you are responsible for all financial

related processes, requirements and deadlines of your client companies. You are proactive, know what you are

capable of, possess good communication skills and not afraid of asking questions.


Other relevant qualifications for this profile:
§ Bachelor or master’s degree in Business Administration, Accounting or an equivalent;

§ A minimum of 7 years relevant work experience of which at least 3 years in the Real Estate industry;

§ Interest in Real Estate Fund structures;

§ Knowledge of generally accepted accounting principles (Dutch GAAP/ IFRS);

§ Outstanding organizational, analytical and leadership skills;

§ Excellent interpersonal and communication skills;

§ Self-motivated and aptitude in decision-making and problem-solving;

§ Fluent in English (both orally and in writing);

§ Able to work independently and as a part of a team; and

§ Experience with Real Estate Accounting software preferred.

Do you recognize yourself in this profile? We can’t wait to meet you!

If you have any questions about the position or about Trustmoore, please contact Pauline Wolf (email:

pauline.wolf@trustmoore.com).


About us


We make success possible. Success for our clients by providing high-quality services, however also success for

our colleagues by providing you with personal and professional growth opportunities to help you reach your full

potential. Just as we help our clients reach their goals.

The foundation of our success is delivering true value through long term relations. That applies to our clients and

colleagues. We’re in it for the long run, that creates value for us and for you.

This results in a very personal and informal company culture with a healthy work-life balance.

We are proud of that and we call it being professional in a non-corporate way.


By sending in your personal details for this job application, you give your consent that those details will be saved in our

database for application purposes. After the termination of your application procedure, we will delete your details from our

database. Obviously, we will treat your details with care, with confidentiality and we will not share those with third parties.

Ref R-88910
Location Amsterdam, North Holland
Senior Finance Manager (Insurance EU), Amsterdam
About Assurant:
Assurant is one of the leading providers of automotive warranty and mobile device protection in Europe and serves over 11 million customers. Its businesses develop, underwrite, market and administer specialty insurance including mobile phone insurance, gadget insurance and extended service contracts through collaborative relationships with mobile network operators, dealerships, retail banks, electronic goods and household appliance manufacturers and retailers. As a partner, we provide solutions which assist our corporate clients to support their customer engagement, growth and loyalty aspirations.
Assurant Inc. (AIZ) is a Fortune 500 company, listed on the New York Stock Exchange. Its 15,000 employees serve over 300 million customers globally. Assurant supports diversity in the workplace and is a strong believer of the strategic value of inclusion.
About you:
You’ll be working with a team of very like-minded colleagues; you’ll be a decision maker, problem solver and innovator. Most importantly you’ll be at the start of an ambitious growth period for Assurant across our European businesses. You might be from a large organisation but are looking for the next challenge. A hands on approach and attitude is essential as you will be working in a small Finance team within a growing European organisation.
Role specifics:
The purpose of the Senior Finance Manager role is to support the financial & regulatory governance and reporting in the (EU) business and oversee the intra-group outsourcing relationships for the Netherlands based General and Life insurance entities.
The role reports into the Amsterdam based CFO and is part of a small team of Amsterdam based colleagues that work together with large shared service centres in the UK and the US. Besides legal entity driven responsibilities the role will also be engaged in regional commercial activities (business partnering for regional heads).
Other responsibilities include, but are not limited to;
Ensure accurate and timely reporting (UK GAAP, Dutch GAAP, Solvency 2) for the Dutch entities, either by direct involvement or by guiding colleagues in shared service centers.
Provide Dutch (and EU) financial and regulatory (Solvency 2) knowledge and/or act as liaison to external Dutch specialists including regulators, auditors and tax authorities, for shared service center colleagues.
Establish, develop and enforce and adequate internal administrative organization and system of internal control.
Challenge Actuarial and Underwriting functions and ensure alignment of these functions with Finance & Tax.
Support asset management activity and investment guidelines.
Proactively participate in continuous process improvements.
Support the Budget & Control cycle from a location and regional perspective.
The ideal candidate will have the following skills, knowledge and expertise;
The role works together with European and US shared service teams daily and requires fluent English. It will be a benefit to speak another language such as Italian, French, Spanish or German but this is not a requirement.
The role needs to accomplish a wide variety of objectives but is part of a larger organization with competing priorities. This requires cultural versatility and adequate stakeholder management.
Can combine a top down view with the ability to understand detail and achieve short-term goals and long-term objectives in parallel.
Inquisitive and challenging to drive business performance.
Very hands-on in initial phase and moving to oversight as the role progresses.
Experienced in Solvency 2. Has implemented or reported in more than one organization (either in business or in Big 4).
Familiar with Non-Life and Life & Health. Actuarial knowledge is desirable.
Experienced in the use of MS Office products, especially Microsoft Excel.
Has track record of delivery and career development within insurance businesses.
Relevant accountancy qualification. HBO/WO level.
Minimum 10 years post qualification experience.
Will consider candidates that do not speak Dutch but have a matching skillset.
This role is to be based in the Amsterdam office.
The call to action:
At Assurant, we’re very big on supporting you to be the best you can be. If you’d like to talk about our opportunities within Finance, apply today via the application link:
If you have any questions about the role or would like further details, please e-mail helen.kennedy@assurant.com. We look forward to your application.

Outpost24 is a leading cyber assessment company focused on enabling its customers to achieve maximum value from their evolving technology investments. By leveraging our full stack security insights to reduce attack surface for any architecture, Outpost24 customers continuously improve their security posture with the least effort.





Position:


We are looking to expand our team of highly skilled hackers! Are you a Guru on Hack the box, top earner on your bounty hunting platform of choice, greatest hardware hacker and #BadgeLife collector ever made, the next best social engineer or none of the above but just highly motivated to break stuff? Sounds like you will fit just right in!
We are currently looking for many new talents to join our team all of over the EU region, so if you feel this role is for you or any of the other roles we have available on our career page don’t hesitate to apply. We look forward speaking with you.
Position
You will become part of Outpost24’s Ghost Labs team: Outpost24’s ethical hacking team, technically rooted and the core of Outpost24’s hacking activities. We perform all penetration tests, conduct security research, and contribute to the security community through responsible disclosure and proof-of-concepts. Do you think that you’ve got what it takes, and would you like to join the Ghosts? Read on!
As Security Specialist in the Ghost Labs OffSec team, you are key in delivering our Offensive security and Red teaming services. Your daily activities involve:
Performing traditional web, network, mobile and API penetration tests and writing a technical report that links your findings to the relevant (business) impact for the customer.
Executing and managing smaller and larger Adversarial attack simulation assessments, from remote digital footprint assessment to full on-site Red team engagements that can run from weeks to months. Including, but not limited to phishing, physical pentests and network exploitation.
Working on scoping requests from customers, planning larger assessments and assisting with quality assurance of team deliverables.
Perform research projects on subjects that match your personal interests.
Continuous knowledge sharing to the team and mentoring/coaching your peers to allow them to learn and grow individually and as a team.
Work on the strategic growth of the team in close collaboration with the Head of OffSec and continuously improving internal processes where you see opportunities for improvement.

Requirements:


Passionate for technology and security, with a proven track-record and a focus on certain areas (e.g. Adversarial emulation, endpoint protection, malware development, web application exploitation) and knowledge of industry standards and methodologies such as CREST/CBEST, TIBER, Mitre (pre-)ATT&CK and OSSTMM.
At least five years of relevant professional IT Security experience, for example in the function of Security researcher, principal security consultant, Jr. Manager Security).
Completed relevant University (of applied sciences) degree, or experience that exceeds that. Honestly, we care equally for the CVEs you discovered than a paper degree, either will do.
At least two applicable professional certifications (e.g. OSEE, CCSAM, eCXD, eCRE, eMAPT, eCPTX)
A true team player and self-claimed computer nerd.
Programming/scripting and network engineering skills.
Professional English communications skills, where ‘detail’ and ‘quality’ come naturally, and you don’t mind writing a report and presenting the results to either technical staff or C-level executives.
Willingness to travel, given normal circumstances.
Located in either Amsterdam – NL, Brussels – BE, Karlskrona – SE, Plymouth – UK, or anywhere else within the EU/UK but remote working from home. We would love to have you around in our key-offices, so living in the vicinity of one of our offices is a benefit.

As Security Specialist, we expect you to be a self-propelled rocket with deep technical knowledge on offensive security topics and a drive to share your knowledge and help others. Overall, you are a passionate omnipotent hacker that knows how to translate technical issues into business language. You can apply your technical skills independently, but you are also a true team player. We expect a strong drive to excel in what you like best, whether it is bypassing anti-virus, picking locks, phishing people, or breaking web applications. By having a team of people that do what they are passionate about, we believe to add the most value to our customers and find the coolest things while doing so.

Other information:


In return for your efforts we provide you with a great team, flexibility in planning your working hours, training throughout your career, fun team-events, a buddy to help you achieve your personal goals and of course a competitive salary.

Like what you see and want to know more? Apply now!
As part of the recruitment process you must be able to pass a background check in order to qualify for this position.
Outpost24’s values – Knowledge, Innovation and Team – define our corporate culture and our commitment to customers. They influence every aspect of our business and guide us in our ambition to provide maximum value for our customers. By being at the forefront of cyber security through knowledge sharing, training and research, providing innovative and state of the art solutions as well as creating a collaborative environment with customers and partners, we can continue to be an attractive company that strives for the highest potential and to ensure customer success.

Are you super-skilled and motivated, do you have technical insight, and are you looking to join a young, dynamic company specializing in the development and production of patented fender systems for maritime transport?

Then we are looking for you.

Since its start in 2012, Fender Innovations has gained an excellent reputation for developing and producing super strong, lightweight fender systems of the highest quality. Fender Innovations has seen tremendous growth ever since and built up a large and diverse international customer base, ranging from superyacht manufacturers to the largest shipbuilders in the world, often with specialist and specific requests. Our fender systems are seamless and tailor-made, do not absorb any water, and can withstand temperatures from minus 30 to 130 degrees Celsius.

Our company has two large, innovative five-axis CNC milling machines. These allow us to produce fenders up to a maximum length of 18.5 metres in one piece. We can create almost any shape, size and dimension, and we relish a challenge. Our fender systems are used on a wide range of vessels, including lifeboats, fast crew suppliers, superyacht tenders, RIBs, patrol boats, interceptors, water taxis, amphibious craft, firefighting vessels and various kinds of workboats. We produce fenders for both new and existing vessels. Our fenders are used in over 28 countries worldwide.

Apart from developing and producing fender systems, we also install them and carry out any maintenance and repair work required. Our energetic and efficient service department was set up for this purpose.

We are looking for an enthusiastic, accurate and driven general operative who is very good with his/her hands to join our workshop team.

Job description

As a general operative, you work on the shop floor to produce templates and fender systems. You carry out interim checks on the produced fenders.
You can read working drawings and interpret these correctly. You may also be asked to mount or dismount fenders on site. This is done in the Netherlands and abroad.

Your duties include
Producing templates and marine fender systems
Carrying out interim checks on the produced fenders systems
Mounting and dismounting marine fenders on site
Requirements:
Senior vocational education in shipbuilding, mechanical engineering, construction or similar demonstrable experience
Experience in marine engineering is preferred
Correctly reading/interpreting working drawings on the shop floor
Great precision and dimensional accuracy
Holding at least a category B driving licence, preferably also category E
Good command of spoken and written Dutch and/or English.
Living within 40 km of the workshop
No 9-to-5 mentality

As a general operative, you need to be flexible, critical, a team player and have very good problem-solving skills. You also need to be hard-working, capable of working under pressure, proactive, commercially aware, responsible, motivating, service-minded, and have good social and communication skills.

We offer:
A friendly working environment
In-house training in fender building
An enthusiastic team of colleagues
Career opportunities within the company, which is constantly evolving
Varied work possible at various locations
Salary in accordance with the collective agreement for light engineering/industry ("CAO kleinmetaal/nijverheid")
Professional development opportunities
Employment of 38 hours per week


If you are the person we are looking for, please email your covering letter and CV to:

Sylvia Ruizendaal
Chief Officer Operations
sr@fenderinnovations.nl

Job Details
Role: Customer Success Manager EMEA - Salesforce.org (German OR Spanish OR Swedish speaker)

Locations: Amsterdam, Berlin, Paris, Munich, Frankfurt, Düsseldorf, Dublin, Stockholm, Helsinki, Copenhagen


Salesforce.org, the social impact centre of Salesforce, is seeking a talented Portfolio Success Manager to join our EMEA team. The Portfolio Success Manager will be responsible for driving adoption and success across Salesforce.org customers in the nonprofit and education sectors. This role requires strong consulting and advising ability, nonprofit/higher education domain experience, and exceptional relationship development skills.


YOUR IMPACT/Responsibilities:
Proactively help customers achieve the maximum possible value they can with Salesforce, ensuring that they utilize all of their licenses and achieve their business objectives while minimizing attrition risk, identifying new growth opportunities, and collaborating with Sales/Renewal teams to ensure full renewal and continued success
Help customers map their vision and strategies to Salesforce capabilities across all of our Clouds (Nonprofit, Education, Sales, Service, Experience, Analytics, Marketing, Platform)
Develop a comprehensive understanding of common objectives and typical business challenges faced by customers in order to appropriately recommend Salesforce features, solutions and resources, that address their needs with associated business benefits
Listen and coach customers on how to establish and drive change management programs that address the people, process, and technology components of digital transformation
Identify risks to the customer achieving their stated business goals and work with the account team to build a risk mitigation plan or escalate as needed
Prescribe the right Cloud Services Resources (Premier Success, Accelerators/Specialists, Advisory Services and more) to be successful in addressing issues related to functional/technical requirements, architecture, design and enablement etc
Curate learning paths to ensure customers are aware of and leveraging all available self-service Salesforce Success Resources such as knowledge articles in Help & Training portal, user groups in the Power of Us Hub and Trailblazer Communities, and registering for events and webinars that foster community, peer-to-peer learning, adoption and innovation
Serve as a customer advocate in driving industry best practices and informing the evolution of Salesforce product and platform functionality, courses, and administrative services integral to the customer's success
Assist with development and execution of scaled customer success programs to drive engagement and adoption; such as delivering 1:Many webinar presentations or facilitating roundtable discussions
Estimated 40% customer-facing virtual engagements; due to COVID (post-COVID may include up to to 20% travel)
Organize Quarterly Success Reviews (QSRs) with Regional Vice Presidents (RVPs) to review portfolio activity and determine areas of opportunity
Cross-collaborate with teams and individuals in: Sales, Solution Engineers, Marketing, Industry Solutions, Technical Support, Independent Software Vendors (ISVs) and System Integrators (SI) Partners, and Customer Success counterparts in our AMER and APAC regions, in an effort to drive holistic customer support
Create reports to track and monitor customer engagements, customers who may be at-risk or unengaged, and take initiative on outreach efforts, across a portfolio that could span anywhere between 100-500 accounts.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS/Experience or Skills Required:
BA/BS degree
Minimum 4 years relevant work experience
Advanced language skills in German and English are highly preferred
Experience in nonprofit and/or education industry verticals
Executive-level communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to prioritize, multi-task, and perform effectively under pressure
Strong knowledge of business processes (Sales, Marketing, Service, Support), business applications, streamlining and automation practices
Expertise facilitating customer meetings and presenting to an executive level audience in a concise, inspirational and convincing manner
Collaborative and consultative work style, ability to thrive in a high-velocity, highly-dynamic work environment
Deep understanding of customer success principles, approaches and best practice considerations for vision and strategy development, business value, change management, adoption, and governance frameworks
Experience with maintaining trust during complex or escalated customer situations, with ability to navigate organization challenges and gain executive level buy-in.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Advanced language skills in Spanish OR Swedish AND English are preferred
Programs or Project Management skills are an asset
Knowledge of Salesforce.com product and platform features, capabilities, and best use
Highly beneficial to have any Salesforce.com product certifications prior to joining. It is expected that you will gain the following certifications as part of the role requirement and onboarding process in the first 6 months: Salesforce Certified Administrator , Nonprofit Cloud Consultant Certification , and one other Salesforce Cloud certification
Proficient with tools such as Zoom, Google Product Suite (Hangouts/Meet, Calendar, Slides, Sheets, Sites), Slack
‘Lifelong learner’ attitude, with ability to stay at pace with industry innovation and volume of product enablement information.

ABOUT SALESFORCE

Founded in 1999, Salesforce is the global leader in Customer Relationship Management (CRM). Companies of every size and industry are using Salesforce to transform their businesses, across sales, service, marketing, commerce, and more by connecting with customers in a whole new way. We harness technologies that can revolutionize companies, careers, and, hopefully, our world.


Salesforce is built on a set of four core values: Trust, Customer Success, Innovation, and Equality. By making technology more accessible, we're helping create a future with greater opportunity and equality for all. This has taken our company to great heights, including being named one of the FORTUNE "100 Best Companies to Work For®" 2020 — 12 years in a row.

Having an impact now instead of later. Doing something that’s so much bigger than themselves, an industry, and their company.


We believe everyone can be a Trailblazer. Join Salesforce and discover a future of new opportunities.
