Elevate your risk knowledge and experience!

This year we celebrated our 25th year anniversary. In these 25 years we have become a thought leader in financial risk management. With a strong focus on innovation and entrepreneurship, we aim to deliver high quality consulting services and exceed expectations. That is why we build successful teams with the brightest specialists in our niche market.

We believe that our business’ growth can only be sustainable when our people love the work they do and when it’s balanced with their personal lives. Does this vision match your ambitions? Join us as a Manager Financial Risk Management!

Your role

As a Zanders Risk Manager you will join our ‘Financial Institutions’ team, a team of 60 Financial Risk Management Consultants. Most of the consultants (95%) have a quantitative background. Freedom, fun and flexibility play an important role in this team. The colleagues could be described as self-starters who are eager to push their boundaries and constantly challenge themselves.

Together with the team, you will focus on financial risk related projects for banks, insurers and asset managers. You are able to support the Chief Risk Officer and his/her team from risk strategy to implementation. This requires a broad perspective and an entrepreneurial spirit. You advise our clients surrounding developing, designing and performing the quantification of risks.

An average week has four working days on-site at the client and one working day at the office in Bussum. On Friday it is time to catch up with your Zanders colleagues and join knowledge and training sessions. We believe that deveoping our people by investing in them and by sharing knowledge and experiences is our differentiator and key to success.

Responsibilities
Capture the needs, concerns and perspectives of the client and translate these into workable forward thinking solutions.
Advise clients surrounding the development of statistical techniques, financial risk related complexities and technology advancements
Advise our clients about their financial risk governance and policies
Identify the financial risks and advice how to measure and manage these
Translate (new) rules and regulations into business processes
Take project responsibility on the client’s site and coach the team around you
Identify and create business opportunities for existing and/or potential clients
Contribute to the coaching and mentoring of less experienced colleagues
Skills to be successful
Master’s degree in Econometrics or a similar quantitative study
Minimum of 5 years working experience in the financial risk management field
Experience with advising on a broad range of quantitative risk aspects
Broad knowledge of experience in risk management within the financial sector
Aspiration to work in a dynamic niche consultancy
Pro-active and entrepreneurial spirit, with a focus on team work
Fluent in English and Dutch
Open to travel, mainly within the Netherlands
We offer in return

We offer an ambitious, international and fun working environment. We find a healthy work-life balance very important and offer the flexibility needed to combine a career as a consultant with a busy personal life.

We have ambitious growth targets for the coming years and are looking for people that want to help us achieve these goals. Whether you want to develop new products, clients or expertise areas, there is ample room for your initiatives and ambitions. In addition we offer the following:

Opportunity to establish yourself as a subject matter expert in your chosen field
Work alongside a variety of clients and consultants to build new skills quickly
Inspiring and international work environment
About us

We are a leading international consultancy firm focused on Treasury Management, Risk Management and Corporate Finance. From our offices in the Netherlands, Belgium, United Kingdom, Switzerland, Nordics, United States and Japan our 190 consultants service corporates, financial institutions, public sector entities and NGO’s.

We believe that developing our people by investing in them and by sharing knowledge and experiences is our differentiator and key to success. That is why we create an inspiring work environment and foster our open, family atmosphere in which freedom, fun and flexibility play an important role. It is also why we aim to make our next project even more exciting and challenging.

By applying for a role at Zanders, you give us approval to use and retain your personal details. Taking into account Zanders’ nature of enterprise, you are expected to behave to a high moral standard. A Pre-Employment Screening (PES) by a third party is part of the application process.

The job in short

Lead the User Research Team across the organisation - and around the globe.

Are you looking to head up a team of specialist Researchers in a 'scale-up' culture where you can make a big impact? This is a senior position within Backbase with room to grow.

Our small, but perfectly formed team of User Researchers is set to increase by over 250% next year so we are looking for someone who can lead.

Meet the job

There's no such thing as a standard working day at Backbase. On any given week you can expect to work with a huge variety of people at all levels, across the world.

Of course, your team will be your first priority. We've already covered a lot of ground establishing a smart, motivated team, so you'll be identifying and recommending personal development goals and providing coaching and guidance to help support their careers. We also like to have fun and strongly believe in a work-life balance, so an understanding of team culture and wellbeing is part of the Backbase DNA.

Backbase is constantly evolving and 2021 will be no exception. Alongside an ambitious product roadmap, we are significantly growing the User Research team so you'll be working with the Product Directors, Recruitment and Senior Management to build out a team based on priorities.

Alongside team leadership, here are some areas you will lead:

Own the User Research competency across the organisation.
Understand, clarify and communicate the business value of User Research to the product process in quantitative and commercial terms.
Act as an ambassador; working to educate different audiences with information and storytelling.
Work with the Product Directors, Principal Designers and team to create and agree research plans, review progress and make recommendations.
Consult our banking customers on the benefits and value User Research including strategic assistance to plan user testing and optimization experiences during implementation.
Support the organisation across R&D, Sales, Consulting Services, SaaS and Senior Management on User Research.
Work with Design Leadership across the organisation to align principles and support the UX Guild community.
Collaborate closely with the researchers to review and improve definitions of research quality, improvements to processes and deliverables.
Own the continuous improvement of processes, tools and methodologies.
Develop complementary areas of analytics and optimisation for our managed services with the senior managers.

We have a great, creative culture in the Design team with over 50 Designers and Researchers working across the organisation. We are looking for someone who will be a great addition to this team, bringing creativity, passion and experience.

If you're looking to make an impact - this is the role for you.

Proactive, with a natural enthusiasm for sharing the benefits of User Research to a wide range of team members and stakeholders.
A natural curiosity in the 'how and why' people use banking and financial apps.
Either a seasoned leader who has relevant experience, or someone with the right background looking to take on a more senior challenge.
Practical experience with qualitative and quantitative research methods and the ability to articulate and visualize the results.
Proven management capability and capacity to strike a balance between short term, tactical efforts and long term, strategic efforts.
More than 8 years professional experience in the domain of UX, with at least 5 years specialising in User Research.

BS degree in Social Sciences, HCI, Cognitive Psychology or similar areas (Master's degree a plus).
Ability to travel when required.

We have an exciting opportunity based in Haarlem for a
Regional Cost Accounting Specialist

Job Description
Our Finance team brings together our financial perspectives into our overall strategic and tactical decision making. We use state-of-the-art techniques for financial analysis, planning, accounting, reporting and performance evaluation. This allows the organization to continue advancing medical innovation and improve lives.
Welcome in our team
This position is part of the COSI matrix organization, which performs end to end activities from actual occurrence of a financial result till consolidation level in HQ. Main tasks will be maintaining, reviewing, reporting and analyzing of sales, inventory, intercompany profit, production and product cost data in supporting the monthly accounting close and management cycles for one or multiple branches.
This position is part of the COSI NL Inventory team supporting all regions globally. The team is responsible for accurately performing accounting activities in relationship to our Inventory in Human Heath & Vaccines, with a main focus on IQV (Inventory of Questionable Value) & Discards. And informing business partners of actual Inventory results from an End-to-End perspective. Hereby the financial results are provided with integrity and treated with sensitivity. Further, the COSI organization is continuously looking for synergies and process changes with business partners to optimize and improve systems & processes in line with our internal policies and procedures but also external, US GAAP & IFRS.
Support Functions
Our Support Functions deliver services and makes recommendations about ways to enhance our workplace and the experience of working at our organization. Our Support Functions include HR, Finance, Information Technology, Legal, Procurement, Administration, Facilities and Security.

Main responsibilities but not limited to;
Complete the monthly close functions with respect to IQV which ensures inventory reserves are recorded in an accurate and timely manner within the close deadlines.
Responsible for performing accounting activities for IQV, from and in line with US GAAP and according to our internal reporting design from End-to-End perspective. Ensure IQV inventory reserves are created and maintained, both routine and ad hoc.
Review of accounting of Discards and accurate reporting within our internal reporting design for the controlled regions and budgets
Responsible for alignment of Discard’s P&L accounts with the relevant FSA (Financial Sharing Area) metrics on Country and Divisional level.
Monitor discards levels and generate appropriate actions with our division stakeholders to avoid inventory risks and discards within Comet SAP (or other standardized systems).
Ensuring that appropriate and adequate internal controls are in place in accordance with corporate procedures – including liaising with internal- and external audit teams. Acting as a first point of contact for external and internal auditors in relation to IQV & Discard.
Participate in regional Governance meeting and provide pro-active feedback to stakeholders.
Maintaining and reporting performance metrics and perform ad-hoc consolidation analysis to support business decisions.
Maintaining and reconciling inventory account balances related to COSI processes between the General Ledger and SAP to ensure alignment for your region(s).
Participate/manage IQV disputes process and work closely with other finance and SCM teams for timely resolution of disputes.
Participate in special and ad hoc projects to support management analysis and provide ad-hoc quality support to business partners and business development projects.
Openly share and mentor experience with peers to broaden knowledge and increase efficiency.
Back-up of other senior specialists or specialists as needed.
Identifies opportunities and drives system and process improvements for process bottlenecks within COSI Inventory activities. This to maintain, harmonize, and ensure global standardization of processes.
Your profile
BSc or MSc degree, accounting/finance background preferred.
Minimum of 3-5 years of relevant experience in finance.
Knowledge and experience with Lean Six Sigma (minimum Yellow/ Green belt).
Previous practical experience of preparing accounts in accordance with US GAAP.
Good SAP knowledge, advanced Excel knowledge.
Fluency in written and spoken English.
Able to explain complex financial concepts to non-financial stakeholders.
Able to see the wider picture and how decisions could affect the site, region and entities.
Able to work under pressure and meet deadlines, whilst delivering high-quality work.
Intercultural experience and enjoys working in a multi-cultural organization.
Willingness to take on responsibility, goal-orientated, and capable of making decisions.
Initiative, adaptive, open to change, customer-orientated.
Organized with excellent analytical skills.
Flexible in work hours, willingness to work in shifts, and willingness to travel.

You can send your application including motivation letter in English via our website.

In fast changing markets, customers worldwide rely on Thales. Thales is a business where brilliant people from all over the world come together to share ideas and inspire each other. In aerospace, transportation, defence, security and space, our architects design innovative solutions that make our tomorrow's possible.
Legal Counsel/Contract Manager
based in Huizen
The Legal & Contracts team of Thales in the Netherlands consists of about 20 people based in Hengelo and Huizen: legal counsel, contract managers and trade compliance professionals. Dedicated to their jobs and the organization.
We work in the office as well as from home. Many of us frequently travel all over the world. We established ‘self organizing’ teams which caters for continuous learning and improving, and much responsibility to each individual in the team.
The Legal & Contracts team deals with complex legal issues. Main part of the activities exists of assisting the capture team with the drafting, negotiation and closure of (international) contracts and the subsequent execution of those contracts in the project team. Contracts in an often culturally and politically challenging environment.

About the job
Your activities will focus on the capturing and the subsequent execution of sales contracts. This means that you’re involved from the drafting and negotiation until the closing of a contract when all obligations from Thales’ and the customer have been fulfilled.
As our counterparties are all over the world, travelling will be part of the job.
Above, you may be the specialist within the team on certain legal topics, such as for example intellectual property, GDPR, purchasing, compliance or environmental regulations.
You’ll plan and organize your activities yourself. Often driven by the customer’s time schedule, which may change on a daily basis. Being flexible and able to continuously monitor and adapt your priorities is therefore of utmost importance. Within the Thales organization our colleagues in the sales and projects departments will be the ones to team with.
About you
You have a Master Degree in law and look forward to a second or third step in your career. You’ve experience in a law firm or as a legal counsel, contracting specialist, in a multinational company. You avail of up-to-date legal knowledge. You have an interest to work in an international and challenging environment where you, besides the legal aspects, will need to also understand the technical, financial and commercial aspects of a contract .
Furthermore, you have a strong and independent personality, are solution-focused, excellent in team work, able to manage different stakeholders and can set priorities. You are client-focused, have outstanding negotiating skills and good command of, both oral and written, Dutch and English. A Dutch passport is a prerequisite due to contracts with the Dutch Government that are ‘Dutch eyes only’.
What's in it for you
Become part of a great team in a high tech, innovative international organization
(International) opportunities for growth in tech-, management- and commercial roles
Attention for personal development and own initiative
40 leave days per year, travel expenses and a flexible benefits à la carte package with options like purchase/sale of leave hours, internet costs, bicycle plan, company fitness, trade union contribution or relocation costs

Job Title: Sr Director or Dir Scientific Due Diligence (Abs, AAVs, RNAs, Neuro, Neuro-Pharmacology), (code NL 260620)
Job Description:
Job Description
Sr Director or Dir Scientific Due Diligence (Abs, AAVs, RNAs, Neuro, Neuro-Pharmacology)

This role is for a highly networked Director or Senior Director with a proven experience of Drug Discovery & Research and Partnering in the field of Neurology and that primarily will scout with external institutions include external assets / programs and align these with the company strategic vision for development and overall portfolio direction including incorporation of new IP acquisition and strategic / Research alliances for existing and new modalities, so gene and cell therapies including AAVs.

Relocation: My client will hire you locally during Covid if necessary and offers post-Covid full relocation and digital hiring process in between.

About My Client
My client is a successful, expanding Biotech organization with a proven portfolio of small and large molecules and are currently preparing NDA/BLA/MAA for the next generation of products. This role will be part of the core team which brings new assets into translational medicines by identifying, screening, and reviewing BD&L as the Scientific Lead:-

The organization has stated their objective to rapidly discover, develop and commercialize new drugs including those for new modalities in rare diseases, neurology, immunology and hematology, including RNAs and Viral Vectors.
Also my client is HQ’d in Europe meaning you will have better visibility and find it easier to engage and collaborate with your peers and the senior stakeholders (no late night calls to the USA).
The senior leadership team has given the green light and backing to make a significant investment into new modalities, especially rAAVs which means that in 2021 will see their first Ph. I studies in this area.
Why I find this role highly exciting is you will be part of the core team which pioneers the Viral Vector platform de novo! Also you will be working with an expert team, some developed within the company, some joined recently, all are highly educated and experienced mostly to Ph.D. level and have a great deal of Biotech expertise to share and learn with each other from.
You will be able to build a long-term career in this Biotech organization, the core leadership team have examples of both steady job promotion and skills progression.
In the meantime, working from your current location is allowed and my client has committed to do the hiring interviews and the On-Boarding process remotely to minimize risks.
Note this role is supported by legal and financial experts, you will provide the networking and scientific input to bring Discovery and Research opportunities into perspective, and will support handover in some cases to translation meds. It is not a role for an investment or financial BD&L analyst!

You Skills & The Role:

This team impacts directly on the pipeline development interacting with the R&D platform internally and externally, with Biotech and Academia, scouting for novel programs following the company interests in order to increase and progress the internal pipeline by delivering new assets.

The successful candidate will screen the Research and Discovery space for Neurology, contributing to bringing in new opportunities for areas such as Neuro-degeneration and Neuro-inflammation, taking the necessary steps to develop these alliances and partnerships which will yield assets for scientific review and potential clinical development.

As an experienced Neuro Discovery Lead, or, maybe you have already moved into Industry in a similar role, it is likely you will have a PhD and a background as a Neuro-Pharmacologist or Neurologist Discovery and / or Research leader, with a solid network built over time with connections in Industry and in Academia.

You will search, evaluate and assess results of in-vivo or in-vitro experiments and provide recommendation for innovative assets based on scientific review, as well as provide support and conducting some parts of the negotiations, always establishing a basis for go / no go on Research programs and handling early stages of collaborations with your partnered institutions and internal stakeholders.

Package & Benefits

This role can be an upper Director or Senior Director and the salaries match the grade. The role comes with a high end stock plan and bonus scheme. The company will wait or hire you locally if Covid reoccurs.

The role is based in Brussels and my client will provide a temporary high quality apartment with disturbance allowances included, a very competitive base salary, car with petrol card for European coverage, 48 days off a year, tax ruling if applicable (for non-Belgium citizens) and private schooling if your children do not speak French or Dutch.

To Apply!

To apply for this role, please press the red “Apply for position” button, or contact Javier Monfort or Matt Greig on +44 (0)207 801 3385 or +44 (0)207 801 3386 in full confidence to receive more details on this role or to hear about other available opportunities.

We provide a high level of service because we believe this matters. Our people place individuals at the Specialist, Expert, Regional and Global Head levels, so if you want some advice on when or how to make your next step, or to understand what that next step might look like, let’s collaborate and explore these ideas with each other. ADV Talent Partners only advertise around 30% of our active roles, so for us to really help you, please Register or call us. We provide permanent and contract roles in the following areas, across the USA, Europe and Asia Pacific. General switchboard number +44 (0)207 801 3380.

GDPR & Data Protection: Your information is safeguarded for GDPR, and you will have the right to edit, amend or delete and ’’be forgotten’’ at any time after your initial registration.

Job Title: Animal Health COSI Senior Financial Analyst

Job Description:
Are you a sales or recruitment professional looking for a fresh challenge? We are seeking multiple Dutch-speaking Recruitment Consultants to join our highly lucrative business based in our new office in Amsterdam.

Frank Recruitment Group is a leading niche IT recruitment consultancy operating nine specialist brands in over 50 countries. Our incredible global growth has led to the development of new opportunities for Dutch-speaking recruitment consultants to join our new team in Amsterdam.

What does a Recruitment Consultant do:

Business development to build and establish new professional relationships
Selling and negotiation on multiple levels
Head-hunting and candidate resourcing
Complete management of the recruitment process

What do we look for in a Recruitment Consultant:

Complete fluency in Dutch (native and non-native speakers welcome)
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent (any discipline)
A proven track record of success in a direct sales or recruitment environment
Motivated, with a strong work ethic
Excellent communication skills, professionalism, and a willingness to learn

What do we offer Recruitment Consultants:

Industry-leading OTE
Uncapped commission
Full training and career progression plan
Monthly company social events and fine dining experiences
VIP hospitality treatment at cultural events
5* national and global incentive trips and vacations
Quarterly global sales competition days
Weekly late start/early finish incentives
Weekly dress-down days

Where will you work?
You’ll be working in our recently opened office in Amsterdam. Here’s the address:

Frank Recruitment Group, 6th Floor, Strawinskylaan 3101, 1077 ZX, Amsterdam

Frank Recruitment Group is an equal opportunities employer that values a diverse workforce and the contribution each individual makes. We are committed to promoting equality and diversity and creating an inclusive environment for all.

The future of mobility is electric. In this transition towards sustainable transportation, electric vehicles play an important role in merging the mobility and the energy landscapes.


As Senior Sales Engineer you will become our technical sales expert when it comes to our Everon Platform: a next-generation global, scalable and multi-tenant eMobility cloud platform which enables businesses to manage and operate EV-charging infrastructure. In this dynamic, fast-paced work environment, you will be combining technical and sales knowledge and applying this in a new industry where everything still has to be built and where standards are still to be set. We are paving the way to enable a seamless EV charging experience worldwide, and you will be an instrumental part of it.


This is an incredibly exciting time to join our organisation as a Sales Engineer. We are going public by the end of March, with views to aggressively accelerate our growth in the industry, which we look to you to help realize. The value of our software platform is enormous and plays a highly strategic role in the overall value of our organisation. The bigger our organisation gets, the greater positive impact we will have on the environment by reducing carbon emissions in the air through enabling electric transportation.


As part of a small Sales Engineering team, you will bridge the gap between technical understanding of our platform features and presenting a commercial offering to our future and existing customers. In doing so you will build relationships with other sales colleagues and with the product, development and professional services teams. You will be given the freedom and trust to organize your day to execute your activities in the best possible way. In addition there will be opportunities to run side projects to improve the sales cycle overall. As we continue to grow, we expect you to support the onboarding of new team members, acting as a mentor. In doing so we will provide you the opportunity to grow your career with us whether that is technically or through leadership.


Responsibilities include:

Become an expert of our platform and services, with regular training to keep your knowledge up to date
Capture customers/prospects requirements regarding all aspects of Everon
Investigate and find the best fitted solutions for our prospects/customers requests
Coordinate the internal research and negotiation with prospects/customers on technical solutions and possible alternatives
Prepare and deliver clear and convincing demos and solutions presentations to prospects/customers (improving them along the way)
Optimize speed and efficiency of technical assessments performed on new opportunities
Perform regular alignment with sales & customer success teams on new opportunities, prospects/customers requests and strategy
Perform regular alignment with product and services teams on capabilities and specific solutions that can be offered
Contribute to scaling the team by documenting findings and solutions and by regularly sharing knowledge and providing feedback


Experience we're looking for:

Completed Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Electronics or a similar field
At least 4+ years professional experience working in a technical (pre)sales position or similar (i.e. Technical Product Owner, Technical Consultant)
Experience working with cloud platforms (google cloud is advantageous)
Good understanding of API design
Some experience with selling Software as a Service (SaaS) or even Platform as a Service (PaaS)
Strong (English) communication and presentation skills
Comfortable with communicating technical information to a non-technical audience
Comfortable interacting with all levels of internal and external customers in varying regions and timezones
You have a lot of self-drive to proactively find solutions when solutions don't exist
You are analytical and are able to summarize complex topics in a simple manner


Our offer to you:

In addition to collaborating with a dynamic group of top industry and subject matter experts, we will provide you a competitive salary (with relocation assistance / visa support if applicable) and the following benefits: option to work from home partially, high-end laptop + related equipment, contribution to private pension fund, discounted health insurance, 25 days holiday (unpaid leave possible) and home-office travel compensation.
Our well-connected modern offices (Rotterdam City Centre – with a fantastic view of the Erasmus bridge; Amsterdam Oud-Zuid in a super sustainable building) always have free fruit and great coffee available. We will actively encourage your growth in the business and will support you (mentoring, training budgets) to realize your goals whilst you make your mark on this evolving industry.


About us:

We're building a team of problem solvers and makers. People with a proactive attitude and the drive to change the future of mobility. From developers to designers, managers and specialists; our office welcomes professionals from different backgrounds and values diversity as a strength. We currently have over 140 people working with us from 33 different nationalities. Together we make a global platform, powered by data-driven services.


Are you ready to join our mission? Build a platform, cut emissions, change the future.

Prologis is the global leader in logistics real estate. We own, manage and develop high-quality properties in the world’s most vibrant centers of commerce, approximately 72 million square meters in 19 countries. Some of the world’s largest brands (e.g., Amazon, BMW, DHL, FedEx, Pepsi) turn to us because they know an efficient supply chain will make their businesses run better, and a strategic relationship with Prologis will create competitive advantage. As the top ranked U.S. company and sixth overall among the Global 100 Most Sustainable Corporations in the World, we take our global footprint seriously.
Job Title:
Tax & Compliance Manager
Company:
Prologis
The Prologis organization in Europe is structured with a vast number of legal entities; there are over 850 legal entities across multiple jurisdictions and countries including ~500 entities for UK & NE. The corporate purpose of these entities is various but together they are all established to serve our one business purpose, i.e. owning and leasing of warehouse facilities. Most of these entities are obliged to file statutory accounts, corporate income tax returns, and other local filings like net worth tax, withholding tax, etc. These European filings are referred to as ‘compliance’.
Prologis is looking to appoint a Compliance Manager who will ensure delivery based in the European Headquarters in Amsterdam, The Netherlands. The manager will show a continuous focus on process improvements and their execution together with the internal stakeholders and 3rd party service providers. This role reports directly into the Compliance Manager UK & Northern Europe.
What’s needed in order to do that:
Coordinate and organize the Statutory Accounts and CIT return compliance activities
Manage, coordinate, and review output from third-party providers to ensure accurate filing of annual accounts, corporate income tax and other local filings
Provide legal documentation, reviewed accounting schedules and other relevant information to enable the finalization of the compliance work
Manage the local statutory audits with the Amsterdam and Local audit teams
Function as local compliance (GAAP and Tax) specialist and provide guidance to the accountants in various accounting teams
Ensure alignment with internal and external policies and regulations and timely reporting
Coordinate with external and internal parties, such as the Legal, Tax and Treasury departments, to ensure all deadlines are met and cross-functional activities such as re-financing and corporate simplifications are effectively performed
Ensure that all statutory adjustments are provided to the general ledger accountants for posting in the accounting system
Review tax calculation packages
Review and approve tax assessments, prepayments, and final payments in conjunction with filed CIT returns
Tell us if you’re ready.
Education on at least Bachelor level in accounting, additional tax expertise is an advantage
A minimum of 5+ year work experience in financial accounting at an international environment with management experience
Fluent in English (spoken and written), other languages (e.g. German, Dutch, French) are an advantage
Strong Excel skills are a must and affinity with data analytics and automating processes is a plus
Excellent leadership, interpersonal, communication, analytical and problem-solving skills:
Influencing skills: ability to build a strong and positive relationship with your colleagues resulting in buy-in and effective collaboration
Cultural sensitivity: ability to work in a multi-cultural and matrix-structured environment, act and respond appropriately in a diverse environment, properly handle confidential information and work in a constructive way with other staff groups
Proactive behavior: ability to proactively support the business
Hands-on mentality: ability to manage ad hoc requests proactively and practically from the business
Collaborate to optimize performance/impact
Ability to inspire confidence in your work colleagues
Self-development: ability to continuously develop yourself to become more effective, reflect on your own behavior and take time to receive/give feedback from/to your manager, team, peers, and other relevant stakeholder
#LI-LMP
People First
Each of us working at Prologis plays an essential role in the enduring success of our company. We value people who are decisive, courageous and adaptable. While we are one company, locations and departments operate with autonomy and accountability. Individuals take the initiative here.
When you join Prologis, you work shoulder to shoulder with some of the top talent in the industry to do the best work of your career. Every employee belongs. Every employee contributes. Employees advance their careers here.
As a successful global enterprise, Prologis has never lost sight of what matters most, our strong belief that our people are the most important part of our business. And because of that, we provide a generous total rewards package and take a lot of time to focus on quality management and leadership development. People come first here.
Employment Type:
Full time
Location:
Amsterdam, Netherlands

Job Title: Two Assistant Professors in Entrepreneurship & Innovation
Job Description:
Publicatiedatum 19 januari 2021

Sluitingsdatum 20 februari 2021

Opleidingsniveau Gepromoveerd

Functieomvang 38 hours per week

Salarisindicatie €4,139 to €5,127 gross per month

Vacaturenummer 21-029

The University of Amsterdam, Amsterdam Business School (ABS) invites applications for tenure track faculty positions in our section Entrepreneurship & Innovation. We have two vacancies, one with emphasis on innovation in relation to the creative industries, and one with emphasis on innovation management in relation to entrepreneurship.
You will be a member of a successful group with a both ambitious and supportive culture, and with ample opportunity for personal development in an attractive international work environment. We aim for outstanding research and world-class teaching in university Bachelor, Master and executive programmes.
We are hiring to accommodate the growing national and international demand for our education. Our teaching is research-based and relevance, responsibility and an international focus are key. We foster our excellent relations with a vibrant business community in the Amsterdam region and globally.
What are you going to do?
 The core tasks of an Assistant Professor are in teaching and research. In the tenure track appointment, 50% of the time will be for research, while the teaching load will maximally take up the other 50% of time. Teaching will be at the graduate (MSc), the undergraduate (BSc) level or in the executive program. Research is aimed at international top journals, especially in the fields of entrepreneurship and innovation management.
The intended starting date will be 1 September 2021 for the first position and around or before 1 January 2022 for the second, depending on the candidate's availability and the section's planning.
What do we require?
We are looking for two Assistant Professors in Entrepreneurship & Innovation, the first one (1) with emphasis on creative industries & innovation, and the second (2) with emphasis on innovation management and entrepreneurship, especially in connection to each other.
Candidates should have or be close to (the thesis should be approved by the time the contract starts) obtaining a PhD in Management Science or a closely related discipline, and their research should concern the fields of creative industries management, entrepreneurship and/or innovation management. They will be evaluated on their potential for and/or record of excellence in teaching and research. Given developments in the section’s and school’s research we have a slight preference for candidates interested in applying computer science-powered tools of data analysis – but we are not excluding candidates with other methodological interests.
Our offer
The selected candidate will be offered a six-year tenure track position as Assistant Professor. Upon meeting the criteria for tenure, a permanent contract as Associate Professor will be offered.
The gross monthly salary during the first three years will be, depending on experience, between €4,139 and €5,127 (salary scale 11) based on 38 hours per week (+ 16.3% holiday and end-year payments). After a positive evaluation the maximum becomes €5,826 (salary scale 12). This is based on 38 hours per week and in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities, regulating employment conditions at Dutch universities. A substantial reduction in income tax (equal to 30% of taxable salary) may apply to non-Dutch candidates. The UvA offers a very attractive pension scheme.
Would you like to know more about working at the University of Amsterdam? Take a look here.
About the faculty Economics and Business, the Amsterdam Business School and the section Entrepreneurship & Innovation
Education and Research at UvA Economics and Business (EB) provides academic courses for more than 7,000 students in Economics, Business, Actuarial Science, Econometrics, and a variety of courses in the Executive Master’s programs. The Faculty also conducts research programs in many specialist areas and employs about 400 people. The EB has an internationally acclaimed profile and is located in the heart of Amsterdam. EB consists of the Amsterdam Business School (ABS) and the Amsterdam School of Economics (ASE)
The Amsterdam Business School (ABS) is located in the heart of Amsterdam, the cultural and business capital of the Netherlands, which offers a cosmopolitan living environment with excellent connections to the rest of the world. Within UvA, ABS offers executive, graduate and undergraduate programs in accounting, finance, management, marketing and strategy. ABS is triple-crown accredited (AACBS, AMBA, EQUIS).
The Entrepreneurship & Innovation section at Amsterdam Business School is an interdisciplinary group of currently 15 faculty members with expertise in a broad tange of topics and research methods.
The research of the Entrepreneurship & Innovation section focuses on themes such as: entrepreneurship, careers & networks; marketing signals for innovative products; (digital) service innovation & growth; entrepreneurship & innovation in creative industries. Faculty members publish in international peer-reviewed journals including Organization Science; Journal of Business Venturing; Journal of Management Studies; Strategic Entrepreneurship Journal; Journal of Management; and Entrepreneurship Theory & Practice.
Further information
For further information, please contact:
dr J.J. Ebbers
or
prof. N.M. Wijnberg
Job application
The UvA is an equal-opportunity employer. We prioritise diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for everyone. We value a spirit of enquiry and perseverance, provide the space to keep asking questions, and promote a culture of curiosity and creativity.
Please apply using the link below, quoting the vacancy number 21-029 in the subject line. We cannot process applications that are not submitted via this link.
Applicants should provide their CV, two research papers (published or working papers), information about their teaching experiences, and a cover letter describing their research and teaching interests.
The closing date is 20 February 2021.
Shortlisted candidates may be asked to present their (research) work at a job seminar and to provide 2 reference letters.
No agencies please
 #LI-DNP

FOURKIND, PART OF THOUGHTWORKS

As a Hands-On Advisory with a value first - mindset, we build trailblazing solutions combining expertise in strategic business design, software architecture, engineering, data science and machine learning. We're fortunate to work with forward-thinking clients who aren't afraid of challenging the status quo, having served over 60 ambitious organisations in a dozen different countries from our offices in Helsinki and Amsterdam.

We are now part of ThoughtWorks – the global leading software consultancy with an aim to create a positive impact on the world through technology. Our community of technologists thinks disruptively to deliver pragmatic solutions for our clients' most complex challenges. We are curious minds who come together as collaborative and inclusive teams to push boundaries, free to be ourselves and make our mark in tech.

WHAT PROBLEM WOULD YOU LIKE TO SOLVE?

We want to do our part in building a better-functioning world by solving problems others claim unsolvable. Matching the toughest challenges with unexpected combinations of diverse, top-of-their-class skills is what gets us there. We encourage you to explore the unknown and inspire you to create never-before seen-solutions to real-world problems of your interest.

We've done anything from saving our client 0,5M€ in the first month of using our optimization solution to revolutionizing cash management with real time cloud-based interfaces to creating the world's first AI-whiskey and automating massive real-time data collection around a ML powered dynamic pricing solution. What's next?

WHY YOU SHOULD APPLY

Come thrive in an impact driven environment and a group of bright minded, diverse talent in a culture that celebrates tackling problems others claim unsolvable. When it comes to providing a superb employee experience our competitive edge is the ability to provide complex problem solving in world-class cases yet retain the freedom of choice on what you work on and how you create results. Initiative over bureaucracy, results over process and performance over hype – that's us.

As part of the global leading software consultancy ThoughtWorks, you'll have access to building globally impactful solutions around digital transformation, enterprise modernization, data and customer experience with colleagues in 48 offices around the world. Come explore a variety of career opportunities within Fourkind and ThoughtWorks and surround yourself with a culture that embraces diversity & inclusion.

WHAT YOU'LL DO
Work with various business units and stakeholders to answer key strategic questions and identify a way forward.
Develop core ML algorithms (optimization, nlp, generative models, recommendations, reinforcement learning, predictive maintenance, etc).
Produce production quality code and architecture.
Work intensely with cloud platforms like AWS, Azure and GCP.
Operate databases, real-time data streaming and data processing.
Work with scalable API development and data visualization.
Ultimately add value and make an impact.
WHO YOU ARE
Generalist mindset with specialist level skills in creating ML models and production quality code.
Programming experience with expertise in Python frameworks (sklearn, scipy, numpy, pandas, etc).
Experience developing cloud-based infrastructure/applications and supporting technologies, including AWS, Terraform, and Docker.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Qlikview, Looker, etc.
Proficiency in using query languages such as SQL, Hive or Pig, or even graph database specific methods
Experience creating testing automation frameworks to ensure data ingestion and model quality while delivering solutions.
HOW TO APPLY

Follow the steps below and send us your application and CV (in English).

CANDIDATE PRIVACY

Here at Fourkind, we take your privacy seriously. We only process your personal data for recruiting purposes. You can read more about candidate privacy in our Privacy Notice.

What are you going to do?
For an international and highly specialised company within the field of Medical Devices we seek an experienced Senior Quality Assurance Officer. The company is market leader and produces Medical Devices, specifically non-invasive medical treatment systems, for example treatment of cellulite. They are rapidly expanding and have headquarters in the USA and UK and are looking to expand their product to the European market. Amsterdam will be the epicentre for product distribution throughout Europe.

For this expansion we are looking for a Senior QA Specialist who is able to operate autonomously and will be the responsible person for a wide range of QA related tasks. Because of the fast-growing nature you will be in charge of implementing the quality standards (ISO 13485) from start to finish and you will supervise the entire process.
Moreover, you will monitor these set quality guidelines, coordinate and optimize these procedures. As an experienced professional you will be able to apply your knowledge and improve all internal processes regarding ISO 13485 and/or MDR (Medical Device Regulation) as the driving force for activities related to these guidelines. Furthermore, you will be involved in reviewing and approving quality documents, SOPs, CAPA's and audits.

Because they are growing fast there is a good scope for career development and manage other Quality Assurance personnel.
What are we looking for in Senior QA Officer Medical Devices (ISO 13485)?
For this position we are looking for the following profile:
Bachelor's degree or Master's degree in Pharmaceutical Sciences, Biomedical Science or related
At least 5 years of experience within Quality Assurance / QA.
Experience with Medical Devices, ISO 13485 or MDR
Good knowledge of CAPA's, audits and document review.
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Excellent organizational skills
Wat kun je verwachten van het bedrijf?
The company is growing rapidly and is looking for experienced personell. They offer ample opportunity for growth within this role and within the company.
What do they offer Senior QA Officer Medical Devices (ISO 13485)?
Salary: up to €6500,- per month depending on experience level
The salary level is highly competative, with good benefits
Permanent contract
32-40 hours per week

Over Science@Work
Bij Science@Work komen mensen en wetenschap samen. Onze Talent Acquisition Experts zijn allen een gesprekpartner op niveau met een afgeronde laboratorium en science opleiding. Wij brengen talent en werkgevers samen voor vaste – en tijdelijke banen in geheel Nederland.
Als gespecialiseerde divisie van een Nederlandse recruitment organisatie met 7 kantoren in de Benelux, hebben wij een groot bereik en nog grotere branche kennis.
Science@Work staat gelijk aan kwaliteit en kennis. Waarin Science@Work zich verder onderscheidt zijn de nieuwste recruitment technologieën, bevlogen recruiters en aandacht voor mens en milieu. Zo werken wij sneller, efficiënter én groener.
Science@Work werkt voor MLO, HLO en WO professionals in de life sciences, farmacie, voedingsmiddelen, biotechnologie en (petro)chemie in geheel Nederland. Wij bieden vaste en tijdelijke laboratorium en science banen binnen de microbiologie, chemie, analytische chemie, biochemie, sales, quality assurance, medical devices en biomedische laboratorium technologie.

We are looking for versatile logistics experienced employees for several clients in and around the Schiphol / Amsterdam area. You will be a part of our logistics flex pool!You will work at different locations every week, which means an enormously varied and dynamic job. One day you are in the warehouse in the import department and you take care of the proper handling of incoming air freight shipments, you are in the export warehouse rebuilding air freight shipments the next day. You may also work in the mail department, as an order picker, in the port as a forklift driver or as an all-round logistics employee.In short, a hugely varied position for people who have an affinity with logistics and do not like to sit still!Tasks and activities- Accept and check cargo for missing and / or damage, the- Identifying special cargo (dangerous goods);- Loading / unloading of trucks:- Demolition of air freight plates;- Locate and move cargo;- Building, netting and sealing air freight plates;- Pick orders;- Stickers;- Forklift work;- Checking freight & documents.Company ProfileAs mentioned earlier, you will be widely deployed at various clients as part of our flex pool. Our clients are therefore various large logistics parties in and around the Schiphol region. For example, one day you work for a large air freight handler, the next day at a Parcel company, a logistics service provider or a supply chain specialist. So you will not work at one but several leading companies in logistics.Job requirements- You have an MBO working and thinking level;- You have at least 2 years of experience as a logistics employee;- You are in possession of a valid forklift truck certificate and EPT;- You master both the Dutch and English language in word and writing;- You are available full-time in 3 shifts;- Flexible in use;- You are in possession of your own transport;- You have not been in contact with the police or the judiciary regarding screening civil aviation employees.OfferA challenging job where you can learn a lot within various large companies in logistics. Plenty of growth opportunities and room for personal development in the form of training and courses, for example. A competitive salary and interesting bonuses for certain services. Furthermore, an excellent secondary employment conditions package including travel allowance. In addition, a nice step in your career in logistics.InterestedIs Schiphol the place-to-be for you and do you want to work within our flex pool in logistics? We would like to get in touch with you to schedule an intake interview with you. Send us a short motivation and we will contact you as soon as possible. If you have any questions, do not hesitate to contact us!Soort dienstverband: FulltimeSalaris: €1.800,00 - €2.300,00 per maandAanvullende betalingen:Overuren uitbetaaldArbeidsvoorwaarden:ReiskostenvergoedingWerkschema:Flexibel werkroosterErvaring:Relevant logistics: 1 jaar (Aanbevolen)Licentie en/of certificaat:Forklift (Aanbevolen)

The Leaseweb Product Management Team is looking for an experienced and talented Product Manager Cloud Storage to join our Product Management team. Do you know the IT, cloud and hosting market like the back of your hand? Are you passionate about technology and keen to develop and implement your own vision? Are you looking to join a fast moving, innovative company within the cloud and hosting industry? Get in touch.

What is the role about?

The Product Manager Cloud Storage will be in charge of developing and executing the commercial product strategy for our Cloud Storage products. You will help us grow Leaseweb's business through a combination of using your product expertise, insight into market competition, and top-notch communication skills. You will develop a deep knowledge of our current offerings, map out the market, and identify the gaps. In close collaboration with sales, marketing, product owners and scrum teams, you will ensure that the right features are developed, launched, and maintained over the course of their lifecycle.

Part of your responsibility will be to build and grow partnerships with technology partners, vendors, as well as multiple internal technology and support teams in order to build the next generation of cloud hosting products. As well as manage the ongoing lifecycle of current offerings. You will also guide product positioning and messaging, and drive the strategic direction of product portfolios.

Key responsibilities:

Responsible for the product category strategy and development execution
Maintain and optimize the overall value stream of the product by defining the commercial terms (pricing strategy and commercials), enabling the sales channel and facilitating deals.
Interact with both current and potential customers to develop a deep understanding of their needs
Translate technology into relevant value propositions for customers and partners
Responsible for a clear and competitive portfolio of services
Ensuring that the right infrastructure (make, buy, or partner) for the delivery of products is in place and optimized during their life-cycle
Leading the go-to-market for the various functional organizations (e.g. channels, sales, legal, marketing, customer care), needed to make the proposition successfully
Deliver the sales tooling and training to enable sales to be successful
Act as thought leader for customers through online and live engagement and to industry analysts, helping to position Leaseweb globally

Who are you?

Our ideal candidate will have:

5+ years as a Product Manager or equivalent
Knowledge of the Cloud, ISP or hosting industry, with a demonstrable technical understanding of Cloud and Cloud Storage products is required
Work experience in the IT and/or telecommunications market
Strong commercial drive (profitability, pricing, targets)
Outstanding communication skills, excellent command of English
Capability to work well with sales as well as technical specialists
Analytical mindset
Thrives in a dynamic, entrepreneurial environment
Bachelor's Degree in Engineering or Marketing required
Strong motivational skills
Collaborative by nature with an open and engaging style

What we offer

Competitive salary
Annual company bonus
Defined contribution pension plan and collective health care plan
25 days of paid time-off
Free lunch
Free parking
VISA sponsorship when you are not living in the Netherlands.
The possibility to develop yourself and build up your career
Team fun events, including a full two-day hackathon every quarter
Ping-pong, game consoles, chilling area, monthly happy hours and other fun events
The chance to leave your mark in a company that grows quickly but still manages to keep a pioneer spirit.

Interested?

For more information, please contact Tabea Hensel, Talent Acquisition Specialist via: t.hensel@global.leaseweb.com.

We are Signify, the new company name of Philips Lighting.
We’re the world leader in lighting for professionals, consumers and for the Internet of Things. Our passion for sustainability makes us one of the top 10 greenest companies in the world.
See #SignifyLife through the eyes of our employees!
Are you the enthusiastic, talented intern we’re looking for?
Join a world-renowned company and skyrocket your career with the experience you will gain!
This internship gives you the opportunity to work in a professional and highly international environmental. You will be engaged in various projects such as training events and regular research activities performed to help other departments in Signify.
The team:
Group Accounting and Reporting (GA&R) is the team in Signify with the responsibility for the preparation and analysis of consolidated information. The team serves as an oversight body, helping our organization in aligning business and financial reporting requirements. As such, the team works closely together with the Markets, Business Groups, group functions and our R2R team to deliver quality internal and external financial reporting.
The GA&R team is an inspired and international team of accounting experts who collaborate to deliver quality financial reporting efficiently and effectively. We provide the foundation for Signify financial integrity and transparency.
What you will do:
Preparing and analyzing consolidated financial statements that are used for internal (Monthly) and external purposes (Quarterly/Half-yearly/Annually);
Being the authority on the Signify Accounting Principles and external reporting matters, i.e. Finance Reference Toolset (incl. new IFRS) and Financial Codebook;
Pro-actively carry out reviews on the consolidated financial information ensuring that transactions are reported consistently with the applicable accounting standards (oversight); and
Providing support to Markets, BGs and group functions on the appropriate accounting treatment for transactions.
What you will need to be:
A motivated student who is currently studying towards a master’s in accounting (basic training in IFRS is part of your education).
We expect from you also to have:
Fluency in oral and written English.
Some experience in previous internships regarding the same field (preferred but not required);
Excellent knowledge in windows applications, and most important well-developed power point skills; and
Team player mindset with ability to work under pressure.

We’re committed to the continuous development of our employees and using our learning to shape the future of light and create a sustainable future. Join the undisputed leader in the lighting industry and be part of our diverse global team.
Internship conditions:
Students on work placement or final-year study assignment are paid a work placement or final-year study assignment allowance.
A student on a work placement or final-year study assignment is paid an allowance towards rented accommodation, depending on his/her situation (this will be determined setting up the Internship contract);
A student on work placement or final-year study assignment who can prove that he/she is not entitled to a student card for public transport (OV-studentenkaart) is paid an allowance to cover the cost of travel between home and the place of work in accordance with the Conditions of Employment Guideline;
The student is entitled to paid leave on the basis of 1 day per month.
In order to be considered for this internship, you need to be an EU/EER citizen and you need to be registered as a student during the entire internship period (formal documentation of this may be requested at any time);
The contents of our regular internship assignments are not suitable for professionals (and/or MBA students) with professional work experience; and
This assignment is not suitable to do your graduation/thesis.
Non-EU students in Dutch Universities: You need to be registered as a student and your university needs to sign the Nuffic Agreement. The internship needs to be a compulsory part of your studies (receive ECTS in turn). In case of non-compulsory internship, you need to have a letter from the university in which it states that your internship contributes to your personal development, what your learning goals are and what tasks you will undertake during your internship. The letter has to be signed and stamped by your university.
Non-EU students in non-Dutch Universities: You need to be registered as a student and the internship should be a compulsory part of your studies. Also, you need to be able to get the official approval of your university for this internship (Nuffic agreement).
Please apply only if you can meet the aforementioned requirements.

Company Description

Our Mission
At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission:
Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life.
We have the vision of a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. These are not easy goals to accomplish – but we are not here for easy. We are here for better. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we are looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are.

Job Description

Your Career
As the Service Delivery Manager (SDM) for Professional Services for our DevOps teams in Warsaw, Poland you will lead a team of specialists that is spearheading the strategy to use DevOps initiatives to drive a step change in efficiency and quality in the pursuit of supporting our customers.
The SDM will manage the delivery of remote services for all customers, globally, who have purchased such services. This will include scheduling of service delivery efficiently and in a manner such that it is aligned to workload as well as ensure the highest levels of customer satisfaction. The SDM will be the primary interface to the outsourced service provider who employs the specialist staff. The SDM will be responsible to drive quality, suitability and availability of staff and work with said service provider to ensure capacity is sufficient to meet demand.
You will be responsible for leading, developing & growing this team to deliver high-quality tools, processes, and associated frameworks to enable the Professional Services organization to deliver successful and repeatable security projects for our customers. This role is highly integrated with the Service Sales Teams, Product Sales Teams, and other Service and Support teams towards building strong and trusted Customer relationships ensuring successful customer outcomes.
You will develop and lead project teams that will work to improve existing services as well as to champion new services that strengthen our client’s security posture. This is a highly engaging role that will require critical thinking, thought leadership, cross-functional collaboration, team leadership, and development.
The SDM will also be the first point of contact for customer escalations and she/he will take ownership of escalations and work with the relevant teams within Professional services and the outsourced service provider’s management to drive such escalations to resolution.
In this role, you will lead a team (initially 12) consisting of assigned personnel with specific skills and training pertaining to the delivery of a focused set of well-defined service offers. You will work closely with the outsourced staff provider to ensure capacity and quality is in line with expectations. In this role you will report directly to the senior director for professional services for global scale teams and you will ideally be based in a location within the Central European Time zone.
Your Impact
Serve as the Professional Services Leader for our DevOps and Automation team in Warsaw, Poland, ensuring service delivery meets or exceeds customer expectations.
Facilitate a customer-first approach across all Global Customer Service (GCS) teams.
Clearly, communicate customer requirements to the team to help enable Customer knowledge and build trusted relationships.
Staff the appropriately skilled resources to accomplish quarterly goals, by ensuring your teams have the appropriate strength levels and/or capacity.
Participate in Quarterly Business Reviews (QBR), representing your business performance.
Ensure that all Customer feedback about your team’s performance is clear and known, acknowledged, and responded to as required, providing high levels of Customer Satisfaction (CSAT) while meeting the Customer’s objectives.
Enable your team to identify gaps and develop corrective plans as and when needed, help them implement corrective plans to ensure customer satisfaction.
Ensure your team is actively providing status to the Customer, PS consultants leading engagements in the theater, Account Team, Partners, and Services leadership team on all major activities, projects, and critical issues.
Responsible for ensuring execution of all operational activities related to defined business goals such as backlog retirement, team utilization, forecasting revenue, reviewing and approving timesheets and expenses, budget development, and updates.
Provide input regarding the technical development of the Professional Services product offerings based on your team and Customer feedback.
Handle the daily activities of your team such as hiring,, time off, training, and performance feedback.

Qualifications

Your Experience
Demonstrated experience managing ; teams of 10 or more technical consultants, Architects, Resident Engineers and/or other related staff.
Strong high-level knowledge of network security concepts, products, and implementations, and the ability to communicate that knowledge to individuals with minimalt technical experience.
Deep understanding of modern software development frameworks and associated languages such as Python, Ansible and Terraform.
Validated leadership ability, cross-functional collaboration, and team-building capabilities.
Experience with managing the full project lifecycle from pre-sales/Statement of Work development to project closeout.
You have excellent written and verbal communication skills.
20%+ travel (post-COVID) is required to Customer sites as well as internal business meetings.
Experience building teams focused on the deployment and operation of Internet security solutions at enterprise Customers.
Industry certifications such as CISSP, PMP, and/or vendor-specific (e.g. Juniper/Cisco/Checkpoint).
Additional Information

The Team
Palo Alto Networks has brought technology to market that is reshaping the cybersecurity threat and protection landscape. Our ability to protect digital transactions is limited only by our ability to establish relationships with our potential customers and help them understand how our products and services can protect their environments. This is where our Professional Services (PS) team comes in. Our PS team members work together with our sales teams and large organizations to keep their digital information safe. Our passionate PS team members work to realize the return on investment our customers make in our products and strive to always improve our customers’ security posture.
Our Commitment
We are trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It is simple: we cannot accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together. To learn more about our dedication to inclusion and innovation, visit our Life at Palo Alto Networks page and our diversity website.
Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics.
Additionally, we are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or an accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com.
