Job Title: ETP/Power Internship - Early intern experience 2021- CR
Job Description:
Company Description

Wood Mackenzie is the global leader in data, analysis and consulting across the energy, chemicals, metals, mining, power and renewables sectors.
Founded in 1973, our success has always been underpinned by the simple principle of providing trusted research and advice that makes a difference to our customers. Today we have over 2,000 customers ranging from the largest global energy companies and financial institutions to governments as well as smaller market specialists.
Our teams are located around the world. This enables us to stay closely connected with customers and the markets and sectors we cover. Collectively this allows us to offer a compelling combination of global commodity analysis with detailed local market knowledge.
We are committed to supporting our people to grow and thrive. We value different perspectives and aspire to create an inclusive environment that encourages diversity and fosters a sense of belonging. We are committed to creating a workplace that works for you and encourage everyone to get involved in our Wellness, Diversity and Inclusion, and Community Engagement initiatives. We actively support flexible working and are happy to consider alternative work patterns, taking into account your needs and the needs of the team or division that you are looking to join.
Hear what our team has to say about working with us:
https://www.woodmac.com/careers/our-people/
We are proud to be a part of the Verisk family of companies!
At the heart of what we do is help clients manage risk. Verisk (Nasdaq: VRSK) provides data and insights to our customers in insurance, energy and the financial services markets so they can make faster and more informed decisions.
Our global team uses AI, machine learning, automation, and other emerging technologies to collect and analyze billions of records. We provide advanced decision-support to prevent credit, lending, and cyber risks. In addition, we monitor and advise companies on complex global matters such as climate change, catastrophes, and geopolitical issues.
But why we do our work is what sets us apart. It stems from a commitment to making the world better, safer and stronger.
It’s the reason Verisk is part of the UN Global Compact sustainability initiative. It’s why we made a commitment to balancing 100 percent of our carbon emissions. It’s the aim of our “returnship” program for experienced professionals rejoining the workforce after time away. And, it’s what drives our annual Innovation Day, where we identify our next first-to-market innovations to solve our customers’ problems.
At its core, Verisk uses data to minimize risk and maximize value. But far bigger, is why we do what we do.
At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We’ve been recognized by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce.

Job Description

Verisk’s Summer Internship Program is designed to provide our interns with real work experience, professional development events, and networking opportunities. We're looking for motivated individuals who embody the Verisk Way to Serve, Add Value, and Innovate.
The programme runs through the summer months. We ask that students commit to an internship of at least 8 weeks with a maximum of 14 weeks. Most interns come to us for between 10-12 weeks between June – September. This year we have internship opportunities in our Research and petrochemical divisions.
Wood Mackenzie & Greentech Media's Energy Transition team provides integrated subscription, research and advisory services that help our clients with commercial and strategic decisions that arise from the rapid transformation of the electric power industry. Combining our deep knowledge of solar, wind, storage, and grid technologies, with our global power market modelling and analysis capabilities, Wood Mackenzie can provide guidance and insight spanning supply chain, technology, costs, market issues, fundamentals outlooks, price forecasting, asset valuation, and commodity market impact issues.
The Internship
We are searching for an independent, energetic and multifaceted individuals to work with Solar Market & Wind Research Teams. We have opportunities for interns to work within a team of energy industry experts through the summer. The successful candidate will work on a project core to the ongoing research and development within the Energy Transition and Renewables Research team.
The successful candidate must have enthusiasm for the Energy business, data skills, and possess excellent interpersonal skills to maintain and improve relationships with the wider team and Wood Mackenzie's business. As a member of an open, dynamic and innovative team, the intern will carry out research on an emerging theme within the energy business. Interns will have the chance to work alongside leading Analysts and industry authorities in their field while assisting in the creation and implementation of research products to advance the maturity and competitiveness of the global renewables industry.
What will I gain?
The opportunity to consider Wood Mackenzie as a potential future employer.
You will actively contribute to a research product or to consulting engagements, enabling you to put theory into practice.
You will be encouraged to share your ideas and previous experiences with the team.
You will learn new skills which will be of value to you in your future career and current academic studies
You will be provided with excellent support and coaching to get the best out of your internship.
You will participate in learning and development activities in addition to your normal internship duties.
The Early Intern Experience is an opportunity for students to get a unique understanding of the workplace, while still early enough in their studies to allow the experience to shape their educational programs. We invite expected 2023 and 2024 graduates to apply to this paid position. During the course of 12 weeks, you will have an opportunity to join our team and collaborate on short and long term projects that contribute to business success.
Verisk WoodMackenzie are an inclusive employer and value equality and different perspectives within our teams. We welcome applications from all students.

Qualifications

You are currently studying towards an under-graduate (December 2022, spring/summer 2023 or spring/summer 2024 expected graduation date) or post-graduate degree course or MBA in an energy-related; science; engineering, analytical, Economics, Finance or business degree subject area
You are looking for a place where you can gain experience and learn from others in a collaborative, commercial and customer-centric environment.
You can work independently and as part of a team, generating ideas you want to share. The way in which you work is productive and driven, striving to be best in class.
If you are curious about the natural resources industry and want to develop an in-depth understanding of the energy sector, this is a great experience to get started.
Additional Information

Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer.
All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability.
http://www.verisk.com/careers.html
Unsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume.
Consumer Privacy Notice

Job description
Are you ready for the next step? Do you desire to develop yourself with our hotel group? Then you might be our new financial controller at our Sircle Collection Headquarters!
As financial controller of our financial hotel administrations, you are responsible for providing P&L's, managing specific sub-administrations (e.g. fixed assets, debtors/ creditors), coding, checking and analysing provided financial data. Operationally, you will manage a small team of 2 to 5 administrative staff, for whom you will set the operational priorities and work closely together. You report directly to the Regional Finance Director and are also part of the controllers team. The head office of Sircle Collection is located in the heart of Amsterdam and serves our hotels and restaurants. The financial department consists of various disciplines for which we are looking for specialists who can take Sircle Collection to the next level.
How do we achieve this?
By getting in touch with you, to get the best specialists in the industry on board.

About you

You're an energetic person with good numerical insight;
You have a hands-on mentality and are willing to assist your team operationally where necessary;
You like to be in contact with our relationships (both internal and external) and locations;
In addition, you are communicatively strong towards your team and in meetings, eager to learn and ready for a new step in your career.


Responsibilities

Maintaining the central general ledger;
Preparing periodical closures;
Training your team to stimulate their development;
Preparing management reports;
Discussing outcomes with stakeholders.
Job requirements
HBO level of work and thinking;
A minimum of 2 to 3 years of relevant work experience as a Controller or in a similar position in the hospitality industry is a knock out criteria.
You speak and write fluently Dutch and English;
Experience with SAP Business One, Accountview and Elvy an absolute advantage;
Passion for the hospitality industry is a must, experience within the hotel industry is an advantage.

About Sircle Collection

We are an independent group of creative hospitality brands founded in 2011 by award-winning industry expert Liran Wizman. In our 9 years, our Amsterdam-based company has grown to include three hotel brands across 13 locations, three restaurants, one design concept store and three landmark properties—all set in some of Europe’s most inspiring neighborhoods. Our brands include Sir Hotels, Max Brown Hotels, Park Centraal Hotels, X BANK, Seven North, The Rooftop at Sir Victor, Bar Claes, as well as the properties of the W Amsterdam, the Edition Milan and more. In everything we do, we are focused on creating singular and surprising experiences for our guests. Learn more on sirclecollection.com.
Our Company Values

We provide heartfelt service: we believe in the importance of hospitality, and we respect and nurture the communities around us.
Creativity is our backbone: each member of our company is creative, and we use that to create tailor-made, one-of-a-kind experiences.
We are ambitious: we are always looking for the new, next and different, and we believe in growing ourselves.
We are surprising: we are fluid, we don’t settle, and we embrace uncertainty.

Benefits

Primary working conditions (market conformity)


Discounts:

Hotel benefits (The Netherlands, Spain, Germany and Austria)
Discount: Employee rate (50%) and Family & Friends rate (30%)
Restaurant benefits - The Entourage Group (25%)
Sale moments at XBANK (10%)
Business Fitness Nederland (2.975 locations)


Fun (for free)

Bootcamp every Monday @ Sir Adam
Birthday & Christmas Gifts
Paid moving day


How to apply?

Please send us your CV and motivation

Network Design Engineer

Are you passionate about networking and able to design and operate global Internet networks, to establish superb internet connectivity for our hosting and cloud services around the world? Do you understand and can you help protecting our customers against the impact of malicious Internet traffic such as DDOS attacks?

The department

At Leaseweb Network we design, manage, support and procure the networks and Internet traffic of the various Leaseweb entities around the world and we support Leaseweb customers with their networking needs. To ensure an optimized end-user experience for Leaseweb's services, we have direct connectivity to >4000 Internet networks via our global Internet backbone with >50 Data Centers and Points-of-Presence in Europe, the US and Asia, as well as to all major Tier 1 Internet backbones. Under the brand FiberRing we also provide network connectivity and Internet access services among the leading data centers in and around Amsterdam. The Network Operations team currently consists of a Manager Network Operations, 5 Network Design Engineers and 8 Network Engineers.

What is the role about?

As a Network Design Engineer you design and manage complex and large infrastructures, but also regularly deal with specifically tailor-made customer network set-ups. You will take an active role in designing and ensuring the continued development of the network infrastructure and services, including associated systems and tools. This includes but is not limited to offering pre-sales support with tailored solutions for our customers, traffic engineering to optimize quality and costs and advice for management regarding strategic developments in the network arena. Of course you will also be supporting incident resolution and coaching the Network Engineers.

Who are you?

Are you a network professional and open minded and pro-active problem solver? Self-motivated with the ability to prioritize, schedule and meet deadlines?

If you are eager to understand how things work, please check the requirements below:

At least 7+ years professional experience with BGP, MPLS and Cisco IOS
At least 3+ years professional experience with 1 RIR
Work experience with peering and internet exchanges is a must
CCIE and/or JNCIE work experience
You must hold a CCNP, CCDP or CCIP certificate
Team player with excellent communication skills
Good command of written and spoken English in essential
Good command of Dutch will be an advantage

You will be joining a close-knit team where there is a strong emphasis among the members on reliance and cooperation with one another.

What we offer

Competitive salary
Annual company bonus
Defined contribution pension plan and collective health care plan
25 days of paid time-off
Free lunch
Free parking
The possibility to develop yourself and build up your career
Team fun events, including a full two-day hackathon every quarter
The chance to leave your mark in a company that grows quickly but still manages to keep a pioneer spirit

Want to apply?

Please use the link to apply. For more information, please contact Tabea Hensel, Talent Acquisition Specialist via: t.hensel@global.leaseweb.com.

Recruitment agency? Thank you for your interest, but we are sourcing all our candidates directly. We appreciate you trying anyway but please keep in mind that any unsolicited profiles you send us will be treated as direct applications.

Job Title: Senior Associate CMAAS FS Credit Risk Modelling

Job Description:
The opportunity where you will make an impact:

As our Creative Strategist & Copywriting Manager, you will be responsible for developing and executing creative digital concepts, campaigns and copywriting. You are skilled and experienced within the digital environment, understand the different channels and touchpoints and are able to craft and plan 360 creative campaigns. With your team of copywriters (currently 1 Digital Content Specialist) and in collaboration with the rest of the brand team, you will ensure creative excellence, consistency of tone of voice and effective copywriting for all channels according to brand guidelines, big idea, campaign concepts and business objectives. Your role is to create campaigns and content that deeply connects with our audience and to constantly find new ways to engage and delight our “Fit” community. You will challenge perceptions, educate and inspire our audience to turn Body&Fit into a love brand and a community that everyone wants to be a part of.
The ideal candidate is a skilled copywriter, a creative mind and a visionary strategist. You are a gifted storyteller, with the ability to concept creative ideas with brand objectives and target consumer in mind. You are incredibly creative and have an appetite for learning and thinking outside the box.

Full-time · Amsterdam, The Netherlands

Accountable for copywriting, concepting and campaign development/planning

Write/Lead development of appealing copy/campaigns that attracts, inspires and engages our consumers throughout their entire fit journey by helping them achieve their goal and ambitions through fitness and nutrition
Lead creative brainstorms to develop campaigns that will propel the Body&Fit brand among our target audience and place us as a loved brand
Outline campaigns across channels in collaboration with the different channel managers
Develop content and propositions that help educate consumers about sports nutrition, usage of products and purpose of our brand
Be a catalyst for growth by showing the power that creativity, inspirational campaigns and content can have on business success
Work closely with the design team to align visual direction and tone of voice as one consistent and strong brand direction
Develop a process and alignment for content input with nutritionists and product teams
Partner with trade and performance to develop a structured and clear way of tracking and measuring impact
Work closely with consumer research for insights
Navigate short deadlines and feasibility of ideas
Manage and develop the content team

What you will bring to Body & Fit:

A minimum of 4 to 7 years’ experience preferably in creative agencies focused on campaign development and creative copy

A skilled copywriter with strong experience in the digital space
Strong understanding of the different channels, the role they play and how to best develop the right copy specifically designed for each
Experience in working with insights to craft ideas starting from deep insights, human truths and consumer research
An individual with business acumen with understanding of business priorities and how to develop campaigns with a clear business goal
Experience in working for a global brand across multiple markets with localised content
Experience with tracking and measuring impact of copy/content/creative campaigns
Fluency in English

What we would like to offer you:

The opportunity to shape your career in our global organisation that is championing the healthy lifestyle movement!

Create your own nutrition formula with a discount on our products!


Are we the right fit for you?

Life is way too short to waste anyone’s time so there are a few things that we would like to be upfront about:

Politics, intrigue, gossip. We’re just way too busy for all that stuff!
Slow moving, corporate environment. We move pretty quickly here so we don’t have room for passengers.
Hiding in the background. If we’re to grow together we want you to step up and tell us how to do it. We need your voice!


Please note: To be eligible for this position you need to have a valid working visa / permit to work in the Netherlands.

Combine risk with technology!

This year we celebrated our 25th year anniversary. In these 25 years we have become a thought leader in financial risk management. With a strong focus on innovation and entrepreneurship, we aim to deliver high quality consulting services and exceed expectations. That is why we build successful teams with the brightest specialists in our niche market.

We believe that our business’ growth can only be sustainable when our people love the work they do and when it’s balanced with their personal lives. Does this vision match your ambitions? Join us as a Manager Financial Risk Technology!

Your role

As a Zanders Risk Manager you will join our ‘Financial Institutions’ team, a team of 60 Financial Risk Management Consultants. Most of the consultants (95%) have a quantitative background. Freedom, fun and flexibility play an important role in this team. The colleagues could be described as self-starters who are eager to push their boundaries and constantly challenge themselves.

Together with the team, you will advise financial institutions and corporates surrounding their risk technology solutions. This could include a system selection and implementation or re-defining current technology practises and processes. This requires a broad perspective and an entrepreneurial spirit.

An average week has four working days on-site at the client and one working day at the office in Bussum. On Friday it is time to catch up with your Zanders colleagues and join knowledge and training sessions. We believe that deveoping our people by investing in them and by sharing knowledge and experiences is our differentiator and key to success.

Responsibilities
Manage large scale risk technology projects
Taking a leading role in decision making and coaching of junior team members
Pro-actively researching market/product developments
Actively seeking out risk technology advancements
Identify new business/project opportunities both locally and internationally
Contribute in commercial activities such as presentations, RFP’s and events
Participating and hosting internal and external knowledge delegation sessions, such as risk management guest lectures/events and internal talent trainings
Skills to be successful
Master’s degree in Econometrics, Engineering or similar
Minimum of 5 years engagement in the financial risk management field
Knowledge of risk management technology (implementation and development)
Knowledge of risk systems as SAS, Algorithmics and/or Risk Metrics is preferred
Experience working with modeling techniques and technology developments
Quantitative mind-set with a focus on team work

Job Title: Machine Learning Manager - Machine Learning Platform - Feedback Loops
Job Description:
At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. Technology is at our core. And innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than datasets, lines of code or A/B tests. We’re the thrill of the first night in a new place. The excitement of the next morning. The friends you make. The journeys you take. The sights you see. And the food you sample. Through our products, partners and people, we can empower everyone to experience the world.

We’re looking for a Technical Manager for our Machine Learning Platform team in Amsterdam HQ who can encourage inclusion, embrace diversity, and grow the talent in their team whilst also getting their hands dirty with code.

B.RESPONSIBLE

This exciting role with us will require you to find a happy medium between being a hands-on Machine Learning Engineer and a People Manager.

From a technical perspective, you'll be building and crafting internal tools as part of our internal Machine Learning Platform team, helping dozens of teams to productionise ML solutions. You are responsible for the development and scaling of part of our platform that allows our Machine Learning Scientists to create ML models that learn how to intervene in their environment. You will work independently and will also be responsible for making technical decisions within your team.

When it comes to management, your expertise in handling people will motivate and inspire them to reach outstanding success! You should have experience in developing people. You will mentor and coach your team while working closely with a Product Manager.

Your responsibilities include:

Build a strong team within their area, by coaching and developing individual contributors
Prioritise work in collaboration with Product Managers, depending on business needs and keeping stakeholders aligned at all times.
Translate machine learning vision and strategy into planning and execution, and ensure timely delivery of their plans.
Develop innovative ML models, algorithms, and engineering approaches or identify existing ones, with the potential to impact our business. Design and execute applied research plans to understand, apply, test, evolve, and generalise these technologies into reusable frameworks.
Translate business problems into viable, reliable and robust ML and AI solutions, accounting for constraints of the production environment.
Monitor product health, performance and business impact and act accordingly when requirements are not met.
Identify underlying issues and opportunities across domains and situations that are not obviously related through application of structured thinking and logic.
Solve issues by applying methods and insights gained from a variety of disciplines, navigating a variety of environments.
Make things happen by maintaining motivation and conveying a sense of urgency, focusing on outcomes and accomplishments, while respecting the need to balance long- and short-term goals, by applying influencing techniques and decision making skills.
Drives, coaches and mentors others through evidence and clear communication, explaining advanced technical concepts in simpler terms.
Continuously evolve their craft. Keep up to date with industry and academic standard methodologies, periodically explore new technologies,
introduce them to the machine learning community and promote their application in areas where they can generate impact.
Actively contribute to Machine Learning at Booking.com through training, exploration of new technologies, interviewing,onboarding and mentoring colleagues.
Push for improvements, scaling and extending machine learning tooling and infrastructure, collaborating with central teams.

B.SKILLED

Your skills include:

Advanced knowledge and experience in areas like e.g. Recommender Systems, Online Machine Learning, Information Retrieval, Multi Armed Bandits, Causal Inference and Scaling ML models serving and training
Experience designing and executing end-to-end research and development plans and generating impact through large-scale machine learning model development. Preferably evidenced by peer-reviewed publication, patents, open sourced code or the like.
Relevant work or academic experience (MSc + 5 years of working experience, or PhD + 3 years of working experience), involved in the application of Machine Learning to business problems.
Masters degree, PhD or equivalent experience in a quantitative field (e.g. Computer Science, Mathematics, Artificial Intelligence, Physics, etc.).
Experience on multiple machine learning facets: working with large data sets, model development, statistics, experimentation, data visualization, optimization, software development.
Experience collaborating cross functionally in the development of machine learning products (e.g. Developers, UX specialists, Product Managers, etc.).
Strong working knowledge of Python, Java, Kafka, Hadoop, SQL, and Spark or similar technologies. Working experience with version control systems.
Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal.
3+ years leading an ML team of a minimum of 4 people in a fast-paced production environment.
Successfully driving technical, business and people related initiatives that improve productivity, performance and quality while communicating with stakeholders at all levels
Leading by example gaining respect through actions, not your title. Developing your team and motivating them to achieve their goals. Providing feedback timely and managing your key team performance indicators

B.OFFERED

An opportunity to contribute to a high scale, complex, world renowned product and seeing real time impact of your work on millions of travellers worldwide.
Be part of a truly international fast paced environment and performance driven culture.
Various opportunities to grow technically and personally via side projects, hackathons, conferences and your involvement in the community.
Full relocation support for you and your family (if the case) to move to Amsterdam - one of the most cosmopolitan cities in Europe. We have fine-tuned this process by successfully relocating 300+ Technology professionals to Amsterdam in the last year alone!
Headquarters located in one of the most dynamic cities in Europe: Amsterdam
Performance-based company that offers 29 vacation days, career advancement, and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential
Discount on Booking.com accommodations with the “Booking Deal” including other perks and benefits
Company-sponsored family and social activities to help our employees become integrated with each other and Dutch culture
Diverse and creative colleagues from every corner of the world
With over 70 different nationalities within the technology department alone, you will be able to absorb new skills and grow your career in a multicultural environment.
We value Diversity of all types and in an open, dynamic workplace. This has been a pillar at Booking.com since day one, and something we continue to strongly believe in and build today.
Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows everyone to thrive.

DID WE MAKE YOU CURIOUS?

This position is open to people worldwide. If you are relocating to join us, our dedicated Expat Services team will assist you with a generous relocation package and specialist advice, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Amsterdam.

Please apply via our website with your English CV. We are looking forward to hearing from you.

As a Sales Engineering Specialist, you will work closely with the sales team to support the sales team in all technical aspects of the pre-sales process. The goal of this role is to ensure a high level of technical field support during the pre-sales process. A technical background is essential for this role, you may have come from an Information Technology background and recently transitioned into sales, or you may presently be working in a technical role with exposure to the Due Diligence (pre sales) aspect of the sales cycle, and a desire to progress your career in the sales field.
You may also be a seasoned Sales Engineer with HR tech experience, the key is that you have kept your technical knowledge fresh and sharp and you can talk comfortably about more recent developments such as Machine Learning, and that you have a broad understanding of software security & privacy principals. Communication skills are key to this role as you will be at times having to explain advanced concepts to a non-technical audience, and at other times you will be selling the benefits of Fuel50’s technology to a representative of the client who may have deep technical knowledge in a specialist area.
Responsibilities Include:
General Technical Support: Liaison with Sales as our expert in all technical aspects of the pre-sales process which include areas like single sign on, integrations, security & AI
RFP Support: Collaborate with Fuel50 Sales Team to provide answers and support during RFP process
Technical Collateral: Provide input to marketing in developing collateral to secure Fuel50’s technical position in key HR Technologies such as Workday, Ultimate, SAP/SuccessFactors, CSOD etc.
Collaborate with CSO on sales analytics and reporting
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent I.T business experience - a background working in I.T prior to sales would be a huge advantage for this role or an I.T degree.
Experience with supporting sales teams with the ability to support technical conversations in the areas of integration, SSO, security and AI. You will be very comfortable with industry jargon in the technical space and have at least a good high-level understanding of the concepts involved. Note – we will consider someone from a technical background with good communication skills who wants to cross over into sales.
Ability to translate technical advantages into business benefits
Experience with preparation of Tender and Request for Proposal (RFP) documents (this will be specifically assisting with the security and technical elements of RFP’s)
Excellent organizational and time management skills - must be comfortable navigating many different client tools for collecting compliance and operational information – web portals, spreadsheets, etc.
Knowledge of AI and Machine Learning concepts and comfortable with researching and gaining a deeper understanding of this space as it evolves
Knowledge of GDPR and other relevant privacy legislations like CCPA
Knowledge of Security and Privacy – comfortable with different encryption technologies and principles of cloud-based software security
Knowledge of HR systems or prior experience as a sales engineer with HR technologies would be a huge plus

Visual / UX Designer

Are you interested in helping to evolve the digital experience for a global technology company? Are you a driven, talented and aspiring Designer looking to learn and develop your career? We would like to hear your story.

At Leaseweb our vision is to be the cloud hosting provider that really does what's right for our customers by delivering on our values and excellent customer experience. We have an amazing story to tell - and we want you to help us tell it.

We are searching for a talented all-round Designer who is passionate about digital design and developing wireframes for our websites. Someone that can design both digital: website pages, landing pages, campaign assets, newsletter & email templates, and other (print) marketing and brand assets. With a strong eye for detail, you will have the ability to work across multiple touch points and make the journey and brand story consistent for our customers.

The successful applicant understands the environment of a high-tech global B2B company, knows how to work with cross-functional teams and specifically with marketing and website development teams. You must be solution oriented, flexible, proactive and have the ability to change course quickly, think big and start small, and thrive in an entrepreneurial environment.

The Department

The marketing team is responsible for all brand & communication, product management, web, e-commerce, customer experience and demand generation activities. The team is based at our headquarters in Amsterdam and works in close cooperation with our offices in the US, UK, Germany, and Singapore.

Responsibilities

Translate ideas, proposals and customer feedback into graphic design, prototypes and/or wireframes
Design and produce inspiring marketing materials, mostly focused on our digital channels, that will contribute to brand awareness, lead generation, and sales enablement
Collaborate closely with product managers, front-end developers and other teams to create intuitive, user-friendly webpages and customer portal
Create content such as HTML banners, event visuals (both off and online), short video clips, infographics, photography, and other visual content
Develop sales enablement tools such as company (multimedia) presentations and product sheets
Work with creative and technical briefs, ensuring the delivery of assets that meet the original expectations and the brand story
Identify design problems and devise elegant solutions
Take an user-centered design approach and rapidly test and iterate your designs
Cope with changes and short deadlines in a proactive and flexible way, and independently adjust priorities to meet deadlines and attain required objectives in a fast-paced environment
Have an understanding of the wider strategy and company stakeholders, and how UX and design contribute to it

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in Interaction Design, UX Design or Interactive Media
Highly skilled (5 years+ experience) with graphic design tools
Proficient (2 years+ experience) in UX Design and/or Web Design
Proficient in the Design tools such as (Sketch, XD, Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign)
Experience in translating subject matter experts' knowledge from User Flows through to Designs
Proficient in working with deadlines and dealing with multiple projects, skilled in agile way of working
Previous experience in IT/Tech industry is a plus
Good written and spoken English skills
Passion for your design work

What we offer:

Competitive salary + annual bonus
Defined contribution pension plan and collective health care plan
25 days of paid time-off
Free lunch
Free parking
The possibility to develop yourself and build up your career
Team fun events, including a full two-day hackathon every quarter
Ping-pong, game consoles, chilling area, monthly happy hours and other fun events
The chance to leave your mark in a company that grows quickly but still manages to keep a pioneer spirit.

Want to apply?

Please use the link to apply. For more information, please contact Jana Reiss, Talent Acquisition Specialist via: j.reiss@global.leaseweb.com

DevOps Engineer

HOW TO EXPLAIN TO YOUR FRIENDS WHAT YOU DO

I am a member of the DevOps Formula 1 crew in an IT company in Antwerp. There are a lot of skills required to win a Formula 1 race: a good pilot, a strong team of engineers who build the engine, a software team to manage the engine, a pit crew, specialists who continuously monitor parameters during the race, etc. If all these team members only do their own thing, you will never drive a successful race.

Communication between team members within the team and communication between the different teams are crucial components to reach the finish line first.

DevOps is exactly the same: each team within IT communicates clearly with each other and works well together so that projects get done faster and better. As senior DevOps engineer, I am the one that monitors the overall performance and suggests improvements where needed.

WHAT YOU REALLY DO

As a DevOps you will be part of our team of developers and work on different kind of projects
You will be responsible for continuous integration, versioning and virtualization
You work both in our offices and at the customer

WHAT WE ASK OF YOU

Your experience shows a distinct expertise with continuous integration of tools like Jenkins, Hudson and/or Bamboo
You are result-driven, customer-focused and committed to deliver fully tested, user-friendly and well-functioning tools and applications
You have an excellent knowledge of configuration management tools like Puppet, Chef and/or Ansible
You have experience with multiple versioning systems like Git and Subversion
You are familiar with the use of virtualization and containerization with tools such as Docker, Vagrant and /or VMWare
Scripting with Perl, Python and/or Ruby is your ‘thing’
Knowledge of OS like Linux and Windows is a must

HOW YOU DEAL WITH THIS

You’re eager to learn new tools and technologies and you love to share your knowledge with the team.
You have excellent communication skills and you clearly formulate your thoughts. Experience with agile methodologies such as Scrum is a plus. You have a large dose of humour and you’re not afraid of some self-reflection.

WHAT WE OFFER YOU

A team of enthusiastic techies who challenge and support each other
Not only new colleagues, but new friends too
Fun, innovative projects that really matter
Development of your career: you determine the pace and direction, and we will guide you
A competitive salary as well as extra-legal benefits such as company car, laptop, cell phone, group and hospitalization insurance

Job Title: Statutory & Tax Accounting Manager, UK & Northern Europe
Job Description:
Prologis is the global leader in logistics real estate. We own, manage and develop high-quality properties in the world’s most vibrant centers of commerce, approximately 72 million square meters in 19 countries. Some of the world’s largest brands (e.g., Amazon, BMW, DHL, FedEx, Pepsi) turn to us because they know an efficient supply chain will make their businesses run better, and a strategic relationship with Prologis will create competitive advantage. As the top ranked U.S. company and sixth overall among the Global 100 Most Sustainable Corporations in the World, we take our global footprint seriously.
Job Title:
Statutory & Tax Accounting Manager, UK & Northern Europe
Company:
Prologis
Statutory & Tax Accounting Manager, UK & Northern Europe
The Prologis organization in Europe is structured with a vast number of legal entities; there are over 850 legal entities across multiple jurisdictions and countries including ~500 entities for UK & NE. The corporate purpose of these entities is various but together they are all established to serve our one business purpose, i.e. owning and leasing of warehouse facilities. Most of these entities are obliged to file statutory accounts, corporate income tax returns, and other local filings like net worth tax, withholding tax, etc. These European filings are referred to as ‘compliance’.
Prologis is looking to appoint a new Statutory & Tax Accounting Manager who will lead the UK&NE compliance team (4 direct reports) and ensure delivery based in the European Headquarters in Amsterdam, The Netherlands. The manager will also show a continuous focus on process improvements and their execution together with the internal stakeholders, the robotics team and 3rd party service providers. This role reports directly into the VP, Head of Compliance Europe.
What’s needed in order to do that:
Be a true partner to the EU compliance lead on the implementation of the compliance strategy
Lead and motivate a team of three experienced compliance managers and one compliance accountant
Coordinate and organize the Statutory Accounts and CIT return compliance activities for Northern Europe
Manage, coordinate, and review output from third-party providers to ensure accurate filing of annual accounts, corporate income tax and other local filings for UK scope
Provide legal documentation, reviewed accounting schedules and other relevant information to enable the finalization of the compliance work
Manage the local statutory audits with the Amsterdam and Local audit teams
Stay up to date on changes in law and regulations, and inform the internal organization accordingly
Coordinate with external and internal parties, such as the Legal, Tax and Treasury departments, to ensure all deadlines are met and cross-functional activities such as re-financing and corporate simplifications are effectively performed
Ensure that all statutory adjustments are provided to the general ledger accountants for posting in the accounting system
Review tax calculation packages
Review and approve tax assessments, prepayments, and final payments in conjunction with filed CIT returns
Function as local compliance (GAAP and Tax) specialist and provide guidance to the accountants in various accounting teams
Tell us if you’re ready.
Education on at least Bachelor level in accounting, additional tax expertise is an advantage
A minimum of 8+ year work experience in financial accounting at an international environment with management experience
Team Lead or managerial experience
Fluent in English (spoken and written), other languages (e.g. German, Dutch, French) are an advantage
Strong Excel skills are a must and affinity with data analytics and automating processes is a plus
Excellent leadership, interpersonal, communication, analytical and problem-solving skills
Influencing skills: ability to build a strong and positive relationship with your colleagues resulting in buy-in and effective collaboration
Cultural sensitivity: ability to work in a multi-cultural and matrix-structured environment, act and respond appropriately in a diverse environment, properly handle confidential information and work in a constructive way with other staff groups
Proactive behavior: ability to proactively support the business
Hands-on mentality: ability to manage ad hoc requests proactively and practically from the business
Collaborate to optimize performance/impact
Ability to inspire confidence in your work colleagues
Self-development: ability to continuously develop yourself to become more effective, reflect on your own behavior and take time to receive/give feedback from/to your manager, team, peers, and other relevant stakeholder
#LI-LMP
People First
Each of us working at Prologis plays an essential role in the enduring success of our company. We value people who are decisive, courageous and adaptable. While we are one company, locations and departments operate with autonomy and accountability. Individuals take the initiative here.
When you join Prologis, you work shoulder to shoulder with some of the top talent in the industry to do the best work of your career. Every employee belongs. Every employee contributes. Employees advance their careers here.
As a successful global enterprise, Prologis has never lost sight of what matters most, our strong belief that our people are the most important part of our business. And because of that, we provide a generous total rewards package and take a lot of time to focus on quality management and leadership development. People come first here.
Employment Type:
Full time
Location:
Amsterdam, Netherlands

Managing both internal and external designers this role will be a lead function when it comes to user interfaces within DBC. You and your team will work closely with Brand Design, Experience Design specialists and Product teams to drive a best-in-class user experience on web, tablet and mobile platforms.

,,If required" Responsibilities

Cognizant Technology Solutions provides strategic advice to clients on issues at the cusp of business and technology. Seasoned consultants work closely with clients’ onsite to structure their problem, gather data and design solutions and implement those. The duration of a typical client engagement varies from few weeks to years. We work across all industries. Specialists from all industries collaborate with our engagement teams to provide deeper insights into the industry.

We are looking for a Senior DevOPS Architect to design DevOps solutions for application development and application operations. You will get opportunity to upgrade your career in the Digital sphere and leverage your knowledge to shift from traditional way of Agile-DevOps to cloud native adoption.
We transform our clients to deliver the solutions using Digital way of working. Together with highly productive SAFe and/or/ Scrum @scale and/or POD based teams you will be enabling our clients in Azure DevOps, AWS Code, AWS Deploy, Google Cloud Platform, SAFe 5.0, Monitoring, Analytics etc.
You will be adding value to the client for improving productivity, quality, and time to market in a cost effective way and modernize the software delivery processes while focusing on people and technologies.

Key Responsibilities of the job:
You are a key leader and expert on DevOps practices.You will be building automation, processes, and frameworks to automate the provisioning of DevOps Platform for digitally enabling our customers.You know DevOps end-to-end with all three aspects of process, people and tools.You have strong knowledge of Agile Development, SAFe, Continuous Integration, Continuous Deployment, and Continuous Testing using Azure DevOps/ ASW Code/Deploy, Static code analysis tools like Sonarqube and comparable tools & technologies.You are able to create solution documentation and present solution to the client.You will be guiding the DevOps team for implementation, migration and support of tools & platforms.You will be enabling the development team on Azure DevOps.You also preferably have knowledge of some or all the legacy DevOps tools like JIRA, SVN, Jenkins and HP-ALMPossesses strong analytical skills; you breathe Agile way of working.You are a strong discussion partner towards management and you have excellent stakeholder management skills.You can substantiate choices well and involve stakeholders.You have led multiple DevOps transformations

Required skills & experience
15-18 years of relevant IT experience and at least 5 years in the DevOps technology domainStrong knowledge of DevOps processes like Agile Scrum, SAFe, planning, Continuous Integration, Continuous Development, Continuous Testing.Architecting DevOps SolutionsStrong knowledge and hands on experience in Azure DevOps Boards, Azure Build, Azure Release pipeline, Azure Test, Azure DashboardsHands on experience to implement and support DevOps using Azure DevOps, SonarExtensive knowledge of Public Cloud, Pipelines Microservices & Server less architectureContainer Orchestration - Kubernetes and Service MeshYou know the code and have preferably worked as a DeveloperYou are an SME (Subject Matter Expert) who consult solution architects, software engineers / architects and application engineers for guidance on their migration path.You have experience in a Cloud migration.You have worked in organizations that have been transformed from a “classic IT” Ops (Infra) and Dev (Applications) to Multi skilled DevOps.

Preferred Skills:
Knowledge of software development using some or other development language like Java, .Net, C++, SVN. GIT, JIRA, Jenkins, Terraform, AnthosKnowledge of DevOps automation using any of the script based language like Python, Shell, Perl, Terraform etc.Self-motivated, excellent communication and interpersonal client facing skills.
